Overall, the food is good but the service is slow. Despite multiple visits and positive experiences at other locations, the wait time at this particular restaurant can be excessively long. The young waitstaff is generally pleasant, but the consistent delays in receiving our orders have led us to choose alternative dining options on weekends for a quicker experience.

Body Cycle is hands down the best spin studio I've experienced. The facilities are immaculate, the bikes are top-notch, and the instructors are motivating. The online scheduling system is convenient, and the owner, Russell, is passionate and dedicated. His continuous support and positive attitude make every class exceptional.

I recently had a great experience at the family diner next to Clarion Hotel. They offer an eclectic buffet with a variety of tasty options including a large chicken leg, fried jalapeños, tamales, rolled grape leaves, and fresh melon. The Mexican choices were particularly impressive. The staff was friendly and attentive, making it a perfect place for a casual, relaxed meal. Additionally, their all-day breakfast menu is a great feature. Highly recommend for a no-fuss dining experience.

Delightful flavors and ample variety! The lamb curry and korma are our top picks. Impressive naan selection too. Ignore the unassuming exterior and venture inside for a deliciously unique experience. Definitely worth it!

The cute interior and the owner's tour of the upcoming patio/rooftop area were highlights. The cheese curds were delicious and satisfying. Appreciated the salad that came with the sandwich, although the onion, gruyere, tomato combination needed an additional element like pepper jelly. It would be great to see more menu options with fun cheeses, as there is a good variety of beer, wine, and limited cocktails available. Will definitely try one of the draft wines on the next visit.

As a long-time customer, I was extremely disappointed with my recent experience at this establishment. Despite the place being relatively empty, I was informed that they were too busy to accommodate my takeout order. This level of poor customer service and disrespect is unacceptable. Thankfully, I have found a new favorite restaurant in Kanella and will not be returning to Dmitris.

Highly recommended tour! Perfect way to explore New Orleans for first-timers. Knowledgeable guide with interesting tidbits about the city. Unexpectedly covers both French Quarter and cemetery. Convenient meeting point and bathroom break during the tour. One of the best parts of my trip!
Incredible wings, homemade bleu cheese, and a mouthwatering ribeye. Fantastic craft beer choices. A definite hidden gem worth checking out!

Los Padres National Forest offers stunning natural beauty, however, improvements are needed in maintenance. White rock area requires attention in terms of removing dead grass which affects both the rock and water. The cleanliness of the water leaves much to be desired, as it appears green and dirty. The staff should work harder to maintain the forest's aesthetic appeal and prevent it from resembling a dump, as even Cachuma lake seems to have a higher level of care and effort.

I had a party of 6 for hibachi here. Unfortunately, our waitress mixed up our sushi orders and forgot some items. The restaurant was quiet and lacked the lively hibachi experience. Our cook, Francisco, did a great job though. The service was off, the food was decent, and based on the experience, I won't revisit considering the price.

My experience with Shalimar was absolutely wonderful. They accommodated my same-day request to resize my engagement ring for a very reasonable price. Even though I made a mistake in determining the size, they were understanding and resized it back up within an hour at no charge. Their excellent customer service has earned my loyalty. Very grateful for such a great experience.
Milktooth is an incredible gem in Indianapolis, highly recommended by locals. I'm grateful for the opportunity to have experienced it.

I love this place for happy hour or dinner! The patio is great with fans to keep you cool in the StL heat. The staff is very accommodating and they even modified the menu to suit my taste. I highly recommend the Veal Milanese with mixed greens instead of pasta!
Great food overall, especially the gnocchi with marinara and baked eggplant appetizer. Though the service was slow, the deliciousness of the food makes me want to return.

This review praises the Sonoran Dog for its bun, comparing it to a cozy snuggie. It acknowledges initial skepticism but highlights the bun's warmness, softness, and fragrance, attributing its success to surpassing other Sonoran Dogs. The reviewer suggests that the hot dog or bacon could have more texture to balance the strong flavors of mustard and onions. They also express admiration for the carne asada caramelo, particularly praising the tortilla, cheese, and carne flavors. Finally, they mention that the meal is affordable and convenient as it can be purchased via a drive-thru.
Excellent breakfast spot! Fluffy and perfect waffles, and the home fries were nicely smashed and crunchy. Friendly waitstaff, will definitely return!
Excellent service and delicious food at this pricey establishment. A special thanks to Douglas for the outstanding service. The atmosphere rivals top tier restaurants nationwide.

My husband and I have had multiple wonderful experiences at this restaurant. The staff is knowledgeable and always accommodated my dietary needs as a Celiac. The wine and cocktail menus are excellent, and the food is divine. The only small downside is the lack of gluten-free desserts, but that won't stop us from returning again and again.

I highly recommend Natalie as a brow specialist at Blow Bar. She does a fantastic job on my eyebrows. Additionally, Victoria gave me the biggest volume I've ever had for my thin, straight, and lifeless hair. Although I tried another stylist, I didn't like the results as much. Victoria will be my go-to stylist from now on. The place is also beautiful and clean.

This is by far my favorite cafe in the city. Their black and white latte is the best I've ever tasted, with its perfect balance of sweetness and foam. The soups are consistently delicious, even for those who aren't typically soup fans. The spacious environment is ideal for working, with a perfect noise level and just-right music. Plus, it's always a delight seeing patrons bring their furry friends along. I'll continue to be a loyal customer for as long as possible.
Incredible combination of frozen custard and real pumpkin pie. The chunks of pie crust are an absolute delight. This treat deserves to be a nationwide sensation. Super yummy!

Upland offers great beer and food, but their pizza fell short. The margherita had a light, cracker-like crust and lacked flavor from the toppings. While it could work as an appetizer, I'll stick to their delicious burgers and tenderloins as my go-to meal at Upland.
The show was thoroughly enjoyable, providing a chill way to spend a Friday night.

This is the go-to sushi place in town when you need a quick fix. The salmon is top-notch, and we can't resist the spicy edamame, tempura, ocean salad, and cabbage salad. Friendly and quick service adds to the overall positive experience.

I was excited to try this location of Naked Tchopstix, but I was torn between giving it 3 or 4 stars. The vibe is different, more geared towards takeout, but they have a good-sized dining area too. Ordering at the counter was convenient, and I liked the customizable sushi bowl concept. However, the vegetable choices felt limited, and there was too much rice in proportion to other ingredients. The Maui roll didn't meet the same standard as the 96th street location. Despite these issues, I would still go back for the sushi bowls. The service may be slower, but it's worth it as a healthier alternative to fast food. And don't forget to try the yummy bubble tea, like the strawberry flavor!
Had an amazing lunch with an awesome beef brisket sandwich—juicy and tender. The pulled pork was equally delicious!
The best Thai food in the area! Authentic and delicious. Will return frequently.
The service was poor and the food was average. Regret choosing this place for my final dinner here.
Had an amazing dinner with my wife. Quick service, delicious homemade food, and a vast menu to choose from. Excited to come back for more!
Decent food, but poor service. Had to flag down the assistant cook for avocado and he refused to help. Disappointing experience after spending $100 on food.

I had an incredible first experience at this restaurant! It exudes a cozy, homely atmosphere, and the waiters were friendly and entertaining. The food arrived promptly, and it was absolutely phenomenal. I will definitely return to this amazing place!

Overall, I highly recommend this place for their fantastic burgers, fries, and salad. The burgers are perfectly seasoned with a subtle salt and pepper flavor. The outdoor seating creates a charming atmosphere. The staff is friendly and the location provides convenient street parking or a parking lot in the back.
The staff at this store is amazing - always helpful and friendly. The place is clean and spacious. They have everything you need and make fantastic custom breakfast bagels.

Took my vehicle for recall work a few years back. Issue resolved, but a new noise emerged. Kevin and his mechanic identified it as a separate problem and fixed it at no cost, despite my offer to pay. Exceptional service, highly recommended!

I absolutely love my local Sweet CeCe's! The product is amazing, and the selection of toppings is great - a good balance between healthy and indulgent. However, occasional lapses in service where the staff seems distracted can be a minor inconvenience. Despite that, my love for Sweet CeCe's earns them a solid 4 stars!
The Funk Zone just got better with this new addition. Amazing food options and wine tastings at the Santa Barbara Wine Collective. Don't miss their savory croissants, they're fabulous.

The Center is a fantastic place for a massage! They offer a serene and calming atmosphere, with same day appointments readily available. I have always had incredible experiences with their therapists, never leaving disappointed.

The Peppermill is a huge hotel with easy check-in and complimentary valet parking. The casino area is expansive, but be aware of false advertising when it comes to minimum bets on slot machines. Our room in the Tuscany Tower was spacious, with a great view and excellent amenities like free WiFi and a large bathroom area. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, a nice place for a comfortable stay.

We tried this deli for the first time today and were impressed. I had a delicious turkey, avocado & bacon panini and my boyfriend enjoyed his buffalo chicken wrap. The wait for food was reasonable, especially during lunch hour. The deli had a wide variety of options including salads, soup, macaroni, sandwiches, and hot food. We loved the extensive selection and will definitely return.
The biscuits are amazing and (fill in the blank) is delectable. Cocktails are top-notch. Highly recommended, although it can get a bit busy.

The food was delicious, with a menu that falls in between Outback and Bonefish. The atmosphere and decor resemble a fishing lodge, which adds to the experience. We used a Groupon and all three of our meals, as well as the calamari appetizer, were cooked perfectly. We had a great time and will definitely return.

This place is cheap and conveniently located, but the food leaves much to be desired. The desserts are good and the service was excellent, but the meat slicing station, shrimp, and Mexican station are average at best. The breakfast options, eggs in particular, are terrible. The steak and breaded items are also disappointing. Additionally, the decor is outdated. Despite giving it three chances, this place failed to impress.

Overall, I had a mixed experience at this restaurant. The location is great, being at Hotel Palomar, but one pretentious waiter left a negative impression. However, the bartender, Ben, was exceptional and made us feel welcomed and valued. The room service was also excellent, with delicious dishes like bacon wrapped dates and chocolate cake. It's a shame that one bad egg could have tainted an otherwise great experience.
Stopped by after a morning walk - amazing food, coffee, and service! Love the vibe!

Overall, the experience at this restaurant was disappointing. The wait for the food was excessively long, and the burger, despite being ordered medium rare, was overcooked. The Seafood Jumbalaya was decent, but not worth the price. There are definitely better dining options in the French Quarter. It wasn't terrible, but considering the hype surrounding this place, I expected much better.

I was thoroughly impressed with this place. The bed was comfortable, breakfast was good, and the internet was fast. Its great location and low price were definite highlights. However, be aware that staying on the top floors may result in waiting up to 15 minutes for an elevator in the morning.

This restaurant falls short in providing basic services; patrons are expected to fetch their own water, drinks, and endure a dirty outdoor seating area with uncomfortable chairs. The wait staff is minimally helpful, only delivering food after payment at the window. Comparable to New Orleans Hamburger and Seafood, with live music but lacks cleanliness. I wouldn't recommend returning.

This restaurant offers a pay-as-you-go style dining experience. The food was neither exceptional nor disappointing. The server accommodated my request for spicier salsa and pico de gallo. However, they did not inform me that only bottled drinks were available for Coke. Additional charges were applied for condiments, resulting in a higher bill for condiments than the actual food. It is advisable to inquire about extra charges when ordering.

The cafe was adorable with a surprise jazz band performing when we arrived at 8am. The breakfast sandwich was scrumptious - the rolled egg and bacon pieces were a delightful touch. It was a reasonably priced and satisfying morning meal.

This place is incredible! The duckfat french fries are a must-try. We had to wait for about 45 minutes, but the experience was worth it. Keith, the bartender, was friendly and knowledgeable. The cape may salts and tater tots were delicious starters. The Kentucky Fried Quail was stellar, but the succotash was a bit disappointing. The $24 Fois Gras burger was absolutely incredible. The duckfat fries were yummy, but not the best part of the meal. Can't wait to come back here with friends and family.

The artichoke dip was disappointing - cold and served with stale chips. Not much was done when we informed our waitress. The thin crust pizza was decent but overpriced. Our server was fine but failed to address our concerns. Previous experience during a Cardinals game was better. Will try a different place next time.

Jasmine Rice is a good, laid-back Thai restaurant recommended by Yelp. The pan-fried dumplings were decent, but not worth ordering again. The green curry fried rice with duck was fantastic, with the tastiest duck ever. The chicken pad thai was a bit sweet, so we would try a different noodle dish next time. Service was good, but others had some issues. Despite that, the overall experience was great and we would definitely return.

Courtney is an outstanding hairstylist who always knows what will look best on me. She understands my style preferences and consistently exceeds my expectations. Her talent and expertise are truly impressive. Without even specifying, she knows exactly how to enhance my look. In addition to her exceptional skills, Courtney has a wonderful personality and a wealth of knowledge. I highly recommend her to anyone who wants to look their absolute best.

I've frequented this chain location many times while living in the area. It may not be glamorous, but it gets the job done. They offer oil changes and state inspections, but be sure to go when they're not busy to avoid a wait. It's a no-frills experience, but overall decent.
I replaced 2 old 70s Lennox units with new ones and they have been running smoothly for 3 years. Great job!

I love the Brewpub for their diverse menu of nachos, pizza, and sandwiches, along with a great selection of on-site crafted beers. The slow service seems to be a result of the restaurant's laid-back pace, encouraging patrons to relax and enjoy the company of friends on the patio. The establishment is kid and dog friendly, catering well to vegetarian and vegan diets. Personally, I enjoy the half order of nachos or fish & chips. Their Pumpkin Seasonal Beer rivals some of my favorite pumpkins.

Absolutely loved this farmhouse, rustic, chic store! The staff was incredibly helpful and offered fantastic decorating tips. Prices were reasonable, and the store had an impressive selection, including items from Joanna Gaines. Finally found a great home store in SB with reasonable prices.

My brother and I stumbled upon this gem of a place while looking for a six pack. Ended up enjoying great beer, playing Nintendo 64, and connecting with friendly people. The food is tasty too. Definitely a must-visit spot in the Northeast!

I absolutely love their coconut soup - creamy and balanced with herbs. The pad thai was also delicious, with generous amounts of peanuts and perfectly cooked noodles. The chicken was tender and not dry. Very satisfied with my meal!
Great service, delicious diner food, and they serve breakfast all day. Despite being busy, the staff was friendly and welcoming. Conveniently located off the 295.

Love this place on a Saturday night! Was sad about Lucy's closure, but found this bar across the street which surprised me in a good way. Their food, especially wings and fries, is surprisingly good. Just be cautious of the wtf sauce. It can take a while to get the bartender's attention due to the crowd, but that's because the place is usually packed. Plus, you might even catch a glimpse of the Always Sunny crew if you're lucky!

We were hesitant to try the Shellfish Company due to past experiences with similar seafood places, but the positive Yelp reviews convinced us otherwise. The small restaurant requires planning and a wait, but our 20-minute wait during dinner rush was worth it. The $25 special of 3 lbs of California Rock Crab, salad, and choice of soup/chowder was a good deal. The rock crab was delicious and easy to crack, providing ample meat. The salad and chowder were satisfying, but the Shrimp Bisque was exceptional. Overall, a great value and one of our favorite meals on the trip. Ordering crab here is highly recommended.

I love Weaver's Way and disagree with previous reviews. It's not meant for convenient shopping, but as a single woman, I find it great for smaller quantities. The community is diverse, not just "tree huggers" and "earth children." They offer locally grown produce and preservative-free foods at better prices than Whole Foods. Interacting with members and contributing to the community is enjoyable. The membership fee and work hours aren't prohibitive for singles. If you value Weaver Way's values, it's the perfect place to shop. Otherwise, stick to chain stores or pay the visitors' fee occasionally.

The food at this place is not impressive, but it seems popular among others. I only go because my husband enjoys it, but I would prefer a different BBQ spot. It may vary depending on your choice of dish.

The TV shows priced at $4.99 with commercials is disappointing, indicating a lack of class and cheap money-making tactics for a hotel charging over $150 per night. Additionally, the absence of a complimentary breakfast and the presence of an expensive buffet is surprising, as even the most affordable hotels in California offer this amenity.

Conveniently located near my hotel, this shop offers a great buy one get one deal. The staff is extremely friendly, and the hot wings were delicious with a generous amount of sauce. Will definitely return for their tasty pizza on my next visit!

Termini Bros' cannolis are absolutely fantastic! The freshly filled shells and phenomenal filling make for a perfect balance of sweetness. Whether you're a cannoli lover or not, you must try one from here.

We stumbled upon this incredible cafe while traveling in our RV and it was an absolute gem. The staff was amazingly friendly and the food was just like home cooking. We ended up eating here twice because everything was fresh, delicious, and felt like a homemade meal. Highly recommended. Yum!
After 3 weeks of searching, I found a hidden gem off of Magazine with an awesome staff and delicious Phở. Definitely not overrated!
We consistently enjoyed impeccable food and service during our breakfast visits. Highly recommended!
The kayaking tour at Santa Cruz Island exceeded our expectations with a great experience exploring caves. Our tour guide, Jen, was informative and helpful, making the trip wonderful.
Highly recommended! Delicious meal, reasonable price. Must try the shrimp and goat cheese crepes!

I am ashamed and remorseful for not trying this St. Louis tradition sooner. This place is amazing with a factory tour, shop, bar, and dining area. They host events with live music and the beer is fantastic, especially the Hefeweizen. The food is homegrown and delicious, with a spectacular pizza and a great bison burger. The service is excellent, and the emphasis on local food and brewery is commendable. It is a bit pricey, but worth it for the experience and quality. I will definitely be going again and you should too!
Terrible service and lack of apology for putting bacon in my plain hamburger, despite being allergic. Will not be returning.
Excellent service and top-notch car wash. I am extremely satisfied with my first visit. Thank you!

Sushi Nara is a new spot on the eastside that I highly recommend. The restaurant is clean, the staff are friendly, and the service is fast. The sushi is consistently delicious and the prices are reasonable. I especially love the freshness of the food and the wide variety of options. Definitely worth a visit for sushi lovers in the area!
The shop is fantastic with a knowledgeable and passionate owner. They offer unique tires and parts not found elsewhere.

I've been here numerous times and the food is consistently delicious. A hidden gem in Florissant, their Panang curry is the best. Although I haven't tried their sister restaurant, I can't help but always come back here for their satisfying fare.

Overall, my dining experience only deserves two stars. However, I'll add one extra star for their appealing menu and innovative design. Unfortunately, the tomato-basil soup tasted like a weak marinara and the tuna melt had an unpleasant, sharp flavor, possibly due to overpowering lemon zest. Next time, I'll opt for dishes featuring cured Italian meats like mortadella and prosciutto, as well as their enticing baked goods, with the Nutella bruschetta being a standout option.

My spouse and I were quite let down by our visit; the veggie pizza lacked flavor and the sub sandwich failed to impress. Disappointing tomato sauce and insufficient cheese on the pizza. The dough seemed machine-made and lacked freshness. We may give them another chance someday, but not in a hurry.

My friends and I enjoyed our visit to More Than Just Ice Cream for late night milkshakes. The coffee and chocolate milkshakes could have been thicker, but the black&white malt was the standout. I regret not trying the pumpkin pie flavor, which was amazing. Next time, I might opt for ice cream instead of milkshakes.

The birthday celebration at this restaurant exceeded our expectations in every way. The fantastic table with a view, the complimentary dishes from the chef, the beautifully decorated cake plate, and the attentive servers made it an unforgettable experience. Highly recommended for special occasions.
Great ambiance, excellent bartender, and delicious fresh burger with local ingredients. Impressive-looking dishes and cold beer. A genuine local gem, not just another chain restaurant.

Overall, this restaurant is convenient for nearby hotel guests and has good opening hours. They offer a great deal on oysters and have a seafood shop next door. The friendly server is a plus. However, the food quality is mediocre with poorly cleaned oysters and strange-tasting turtle soup. Some dishes, like boiled shrimp, were consistently overcooked. The restaurant has a pleasant ambiance but lacks comfort. The bathroom needs improvement. I may visit again if staying in the area or for a quick seafood pickup. 3 stars.

This restaurant is a complete disaster. The server had no idea what she was doing and seemed completely lost. We had to constantly ask for basic things like setups and water refills. To top it off, they completely messed up our order and served us eggplant parmesan instead of chicken, complete with a fish bone. The only redeeming quality was the good drinks. Overall, I would strongly advise against dining here.

TDS left me unimpressed. The restaurant lacks any charm or ambiance, with bare minimum decor and no menu boards. The use of stainless steel prep tables as dining tables felt cold and unwelcoming. The absence of identification on the staff further added to the lackluster experience. Although the food was reasonably priced and mostly delicious, the fact that they charged for extra salsa was a major disappointment. We ordered a salsa trio and when my brother requested more salsa for his tacos, he was informed that he would have to purchase the trio again. This seemed unreasonable considering we had spent over $40 on various items. Overall, despite the decent food, I wouldn't consider returning due to the uninspiring atmosphere and the inability to get extra salsa for tacos.

Angela Clifton Photography has exceeded our expectations in every way. We've worked with them 3 times now, and every single picture captured has been outstanding. The photos are not only beautiful but also reflect the fun and enjoyable experience we had during the sessions. Considering the amazing quality, their pricing is more than reasonable. We are absolutely thrilled with our pictures and they will always hold a special place in our hearts.

Had a great experience dining outdoors with delicious food at a sidewalk table! The prices were a bit high, but worth it. For a quieter atmosphere, I recommend trying Side Street in the French Quarter.

The courthouse is ancient, showcasing remarkable art. The spiral staircase is amusing, while granting a panoramic city view on the 5th level. The clock room is an unexpected delight, exposing intricate mechanical gears. Remember to book ahead for access. Allocate 2 to 3 hours—it's truly worthwhile.
Ann was incredibly helpful and positive during my first visit. She went above and beyond to ensure that I had an amazing experience. Thanks to her, I am now a regular customer. Thanks, girlie!

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. The combination dinner of pad Thai and coconut soup was delicious. The restaurant had a charming Thai decor and the staff provided excellent service. It's a great alternative in a town with limited food options. I might just make this my regular spot in Carp.

This place was a delightful, relaxing experience. The artist's fun and eclectic performance, including a country version of "Let It Go," was truly memorable. It will certainly be on my list of stops when I return.

The newly renovated Smoothie King Center exceeds expectations with its updated facilities and a wide array of food and drink options. The quality of the food has vastly improved, and the drink selection now includes full service bars and unique options like spiked lemonade. The venue now feels luxurious and upscale, and overall it's a definite upgrade.

Chipotle's steak is my go-to remedy for an upset stomach. Avoiding peak lunch hours, I opt for a peaceful visit between 2 and 4 pm. Regardless of the crowd, their service remains friendly and efficient.

I was pleasantly surprised by this Indian restaurant. The ambience is great with white table linens, and the food was amazing. The chicken 65 was delicious and the hot sour soup was flavorful. The waitress (Angel) was friendly and attentive. I highly recommend this place for authentic Indian cuisine.
The wait was worth it! Reserved seats saved us the hassle and the show was amazing. Talented musicians with great personalities in an intimate setting. A must-do in NOLA!

I had a great experience at Keystone Discount Tire! As a new customer without an appointment, they took my car in for a PA State & Emissions inspection while I waited. The technician was kind enough to let me see a minor issue with my tires that can be fixed with an alignment. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and didn't try to upsell me. My car was fully inspected and stickered in less than an hour. I highly recommend signing up for their mailing list for coupons!
I'm thrilled with the professional and excellent service! My son's phone was fixed in less than half an hour, even after he dropped it. Wow!

Terrible service and management at Cracker Barrel. Our orders were all messed up and the waiter responded with anger and cursing. The manager only offered free drinks as compensation for the chaos. The food was cold, nasty, and barely touched. Waited over an hour. Will never dine in a Cracker Barrel again after this experience.

I have visited many dog friendly hotels, but this one exceeded my expectations. Located in the heart of the city, I was pleasantly surprised by the warm reception and exceptional service provided. The staff immediately put me at ease and even offered a welcome kit for my dog, including dog dishes, a mat, and treats. The guests at the hotel were also very friendly and took the time to compliment and pet my dog. The room on the top floor was great, and even the car attendants greeted my dog by name. I was so impressed with the service that I extended my stay. Thank you, Loews, for showing me that a hotel can truly be dog friendly, even for a large dog like mine.

The food can be excellent at times but lacks consistency. There seems to be varying quality depending on who is in the kitchen. It's frustrating that the experience is only great half of the time. Ugh.

I visited this location twice and had an extremely disappointing experience both times. The first visit was mediocre while the second visit was unbelievably bad. I ordered ribs and had to send them back because they were unevenly cooked, with one half warm and the other half refrigerator cold. Despite sending it back twice, the issue was not resolved until the third try. The manager apologized but didn't offer any compensation. I normally don't expect freebies, but receiving an insincere apology after three attempts to get my meal cooked properly really angered me. I won't be returning to this place.

I personally found the ramen at Cheu underwhelming due to the thick noodles and overly salty broth. However, the service was excellent, and they had a good variety of beers. While my friend enjoyed it and has been multiple times, I regret not being a bigger fan. Nonetheless, I encourage others to give it a try as my opinion might be an outlier.

Federal Doughnuts at the ballpark is a delicious addition, serving up both doughnuts and fried chicken. And for those with dietary restrictions, the new gluten-free concession near 136 offers a variety of tasty options including pizza, cheesesteaks, brownies, and cookies. A satisfying treat for everyone at the game!

The new Red Kings restaurant in Chinatown exceeded expectations with its flavorful, spicy Szechuan cuisine. The takeout experience was fantastic, with generous portions and perfect spice levels in the Dan Dan Noodles and Pork in Garlic Sauce. The sweet, earthy, and fresh flavors were delightful. Excited to explore more dishes and return for a sit-down dinner. Additionally, the karaoke rooms upstairs and BYOB option make it even more appealing.
This Chick-fil-A is consistently efficient and provides exceptional service despite its high volume. Impressive speed and quality make it one of my favorite spots!
Best place for salads! Fast service and consistently fresh veggies. I always stop by for lunch when in town.

We had an excellent experience on the Oak Alley and Laura Plantation tour. Our driver was knowledgeable and provided great insights during the drive. The schedule was well-balanced, allowing us sufficient free time to explore the properties before and after the tour. The flexibility in drop-off locations made it convenient for us to continue our day in the French Quarter. Overall, a highly recommended tour.
Highly recommend this place for brunch! The food is delicious, especially the grits with scallions and sour cream. Just remember to bring a sweater as it can get quite chilly in the room.
This place is a must-visit for the best hot dogs and chili dogs. I can't get enough of them and constantly come back for more. Absolutely delicious!

Great live music venue with the best local beer in town. The concept is a step up from Fig Mountain. Topa is the preferred choice. The added bonus of ordering amazing food from the Nook Restaurant and being able to walk to Lama Dog makes it even better. Love it!

Excellent customer service! They were incredibly accommodating, even picking us up outside their usual area. When we realized there was an overcharge on our bill, they quickly refunded the extra ticket. The tour itself was amazing. Our tour guide was funny, and we had a blast seeing alligators, turtles, and birds. Holding a baby alligator was a unique experience, and the boat ride back was thrilling. Highly recommended!

Westfall replaced our roof in April and we are extremely satisfied. From the quality of the new roof to their exceptional communication and follow-up, we couldn't have made a better choice. Highly recommend this company!

This vegan fast food joint offers delicious food at reasonable prices, with a friendly staff. Although not the best for dine-in, it matches their fast food concept. While the buffalo bella is highly promoted, I recommend trying their tasty Cheesesteak. And don't miss out on their fantastic sweet potato fries—highly recommended.
The ramen is decent, but not outstanding. Service is average. It's a convenient spot for a quick bite, but I wouldn't choose it over other options. I've been here twice and will likely visit again.
Highly recommend this place with its satisfying menu and trendy, clean atmosphere! Get there before 9 am to beat the crowd and enjoy the deliciousness without a long wait. Totally worth it!

The brisket sandwich with two sides and a drink for $9.99 was a great deal. The barbecue was delicious and the sides, including potato casserole, creamed spinach, baked beans, and green beans, were wonderful. Affordable and satisfying!
The food and service were amazing, but the lack of vegetarian/vegan options was disappointing. Can't wait to come back!
Great food with terrible customer service. Experienced two different older waitresses in three visits, who were not pleasant to deal with. However, the owner was lovely.
I discovered this breakfast spot thanks to a local's recommendation. They were right. No line, amazing food, and I'll definitely be going back when I'm in the south.

Extremely disappointed with the unreliable and unprofessional service from this car detailing company. Despite confirming our appointment, they failed to keep their word and left us waiting for hours without any explanation or apology. Terrible experience overall.

This office provided exceptional service during my move, going above and beyond to take care of me. The staff members are trustworthy and highly skilled. I had various complications, and they handled them flawlessly. I can't praise them enough and would recommend this office to anyone, even my own mother!

The Saint had a lovely lobby, cool bar and restaurant, and friendly staff. However, our experience was ruined by a large roach in our room, small spiders, dead bugs, a broken TV, and missing bulbs in a lamp. The staff moved us to another room but could only fix the issues the next morning. We decided to leave and booked another hotel. The manager apologized and refunded our money, but we won't be returning.
The Green Project is a great resource for affordable doors and a responsible destination for donating leftover building supplies.

Terrible experience. Rude bouncer with unnecessary attitude. The establishment overcharges, assuming Broadway location excuses their mistreatment of patrons. Not a tourist, I live here and will never return or recommend.
Stopped in for lunch with my girlfriend and were impressed by the spotless environment. The food was outstanding and reasonably priced. Can't wait for our next visit!

This place used to be good, but now it's disappointing. The artichoke was poorly prepared, the Greek salad lacked flavor and was overdressed, and the grilled yellowtail was overcooked and of low quality. Despite the nice setting and good service, the subpar food makes it not worth visiting. They really need to improve their food quality.

Milktooth is a popular brunch spot in Indy with a great breakfast cocktail selection and unique twists on traditional brunch dishes. Despite the wait, the experience is worth it. The menu is ever-changing, but the Dutch pancakes and raclette grilled cheese are exceptional. Don't forget to try the michelada, and if weather permits, sit outside.

The bar and staff are amazing, offering great service. However, the room upgrade for our honeymoon did not match our expectations. The bathroom had rust and stains, while the rest of the room was comparable to a Hilton. Despite these issues, I still rate it 4 stars due to the exceptional staff. The valet parking was expensive, so we chose to park a few streets away. Overall, I recommend this hotel if you want to be in the lively downtown area of St. Louis, with numerous bars and restaurants to explore on a Friday night.

The beginning class was absolutely fantastic! The perfect pace and simple moves managed to challenge me in unexpected ways, making me discover new muscles. I even broke a sweat! The studio is clean, and I appreciate the added bonus of being able to buy Beyond Organic food items there. Overall, I felt amazing after each class!

Lobster Haven exceeded our expectations with its authentic New England seafood. Great service, fast and friendly, with a huge selection of favorites. A must-visit place for those craving genuine flavors, and they even offer live lobster and fresh seafood to take home and cook yourself.
This place is fabulous! The best happy hour with a fresh menu and delicious drinks. Wish I could visit every day!

Men's clubs is a top-notch barbershop where the skills of all the barbers ensure fresh haircuts. I've been a loyal customer for 3 years without any issues, except for one incident that was promptly resolved by Tim's honesty and professionalism.
We are regulars here, and always enjoy the fresh food and excellent service. Highly recommended for sushi and hibachi lovers!

Chickie's and Pete's is the perfect place to enjoy sports and indulge. The food is not the best, but the crab fries and mussels red are delicious. The atmosphere is great for game days and they have convenient sinks to clean up afterwards. It's a Philadelphia institution and worth experiencing at least once. Just be aware that during major sporting events, it can get crowded and rowdy with drunk people.
Prompt and professional service on a Saturday. They made the simple mirror fix easy for me. Used them in Charlotte before and they were great then too.

Union Station St. Louis is a good choice for dining. I enjoyed the Ponchartrain with its delicious mushroom and cream sauce. The shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake were decent appetizers, although not exceptional. The drinks and service were satisfactory. Dining on the outdoor patio was a great option due to the pleasant weather, but the interior also seemed comfortable and less casual.

I stopped by for a drink yesterday and the atmosphere is exceptional, receiving an A+ from me. The remodel's attention to detail is outstanding, giving a Harry Potter-like ambiance. Background music is played at a low volume, perfect for conversation. Michael and Peggy, the bartenders, were friendly and fascinating to talk to. Although I didn't try the food, the prices for meat/cheese trays are better compared to other places in the area. I highly recommend checking this place out!

Maple Street Patisserie is the bomb.com! Never disappointed. Best blueberry muffin ever. Delicious breakfast and lunch. Grab a king cake during Mardi Gras. Ziggy, the owner, is the man. Can't beat this place :)
The Bourbon Black and Bleu burger was delicious and cooked to perfection. However, the lengthy wait time for our food, despite our large party, resulted in a rating of 3 stars.

Katie's is our go-to place for out-of-town guests. The variety of deliciously prepared food is unmatched, and the prices are reasonable. Whether you choose the grilled oysters, shrimp and grits, Cuban sandwich, pizza, or soup and salad, you'll be pleased with your meal. The daily specials highlight fresh, local seasonal offerings. The service staff is friendly and welcoming. Just make sure to arrive before church lets out on Sundays to avoid a wait, but you can enjoy bottomless mimosas while waiting.

After attending the Zurich Classic golf tournament, I stumbled upon Creole Creamery. The interior is charming and cozy, perfect for a break from the warm and humid weather. The extensive selection of flavors is impressive, and I opted for the delicious cookie monster ice cream on a cone. It was just the right amount of sweetness. Highly recommend checking out Creole Creamery!

I absolutely adore this place! I've been a loyal customer for years. It's a funky spot with a lively atmosphere, playing loud dance music that adds to the youthful vibe. Although I wouldn't risk trying the escargot for safety reasons, their extensive selection of Saki, fantastic rolls, and generous servings of rice and sashimi are definitely worth it. This is the perfect place to indulge in Saki and enjoy a great meal!

We love everything we've tried here, especially the Backyard Bowl. The portion sizes are satisfying, even with the kids' size or splitting a large. Good quality ingredients at a reasonable price. Can get busy, but worth the wait.

The service was average, with an interesting twist as the person was new. The food presentation was good, but the gumbo lacked rice or enough potato salad. The Sprite was flat, but it wasn't necessary for me.
Good pancake place, can be disorganized during rush hours. Pancakes are delicious but overly sweet. Affordable prices and serves breakfast all day. Nothing too unique or exceptional.
Fantastic finds and exceptional staff! Absolutely loved our experience and will definitely return for more!!

This place holds a special place in my heart since I was a kid. The staff has become like family, providing friendly and prompt service. Yoli and Frank are incredible. The food is mind-blowing, especially their shredded beef burro and cheese crisp. It's as authentic as it gets.

Dine-in experience: 2 stars. Service and venue disappointed. 
Take-out potential: 3 stars. Decent food, but lacking.
Lamb kebab: Plain, only meat. Okay taste.
The best Middle Eastern restaurant in this area! Great and consistent food, always makes my tummy happy!
Potito's has the BEST cannoli in the city, far superior to Termini's and Isgro's. I highly recommend their cannoli over any other place. Trust me, it's worth it.

El Limon is an exceptional, authentic and affordable Mexican eatery in Pennsylvania. The menu offers a wide variety of delicious dishes, including sopes, tostadas, enchiladas, fajitas, burritos, and fish tacos. The waitstaff is friendly and attentive, and the standout features are their homemade tamales and complimentary margaritas. It's a must-visit restaurant for a memorable Mexican feast with the whole family. Ole!

I'm giving this new joint 4 stars because they have some kinks to work out, but they have the potential to be 5-star material. Despite some errors due to being new, they are willing to make corrections and accommodations. The food is really good overall, except the pizza which is greasy and might not use 100% mozzarella. However, the Quaker, fries, onion rings, spanakopita, baklava, and signature salad are all delicious. The turkey Greek burger is one of the best I've had, though it had a few discrepancies from the menu. If they maintain their high quality standard, I'll definitely be returning.

Planet Fitness gets four stars for its 24-hour availability and affordable price. However, it lacks motivation and caters more to big women rather than bodybuilders. The gym offers great amenities like tanning beds, massage chairs, and a sculpt machine for an additional fee. The staff is polite and helpful, but there are restrictions on bringing friends. Overall, a good value for the money.

I was extremely disappointed with my experience. The restaurant claimed to be open until 5 PM on their website, but when we arrived at 2:15 PM on a Saturday, we were told that the kitchen had already closed. This lack of attention to important details like their operating hours raises concerns about their overall quality and attention to other important aspects.
These guys are excellent - reliable, efficient, and guarantee their work. Highly recommended!
Highly recommended! Friendly servers, amazing food, and always leaving satisfied with a full stomach. Eat here minimum twice a week.

I found Carrow's Restaurant to be a truly delightful place, with its beautiful redwood beams and fascia. The food was fantastic, especially the tri-tip salad and tri-tip/chicken combo. The sides like fresh corn salad and potato salad were perfect. Dessert options like lemon meringue and apple pie were delicious, with reasonable prices. We've already recommended it to others and can't wait to go back. Well done!

Rebecca was an amazing nanny for our first-born daughter and an invaluable source of knowledge and support during my second pregnancy. Her honest and truthful nature, coupled with her passion for being a doula, makes her a fantastic addition to any support team.

I had a great experience with Orange Tint and Tune. Their car pick up service was convenient, and Carlos provided excellent customer care by going over tint options and adjusting to my preferences. The pleasant receptionist and follow-up call from the owner, Dustin, were nice touches. Deserves 5 stars.

I stayed at this hotel for three nights on business and had a pleasant experience. Despite being close to the airport, there was minimal noise disturbance. The standard TownePlace Suite rooms were well-equipped with essential amenities. The location of the hotel is quiet, surrounded by other hotels and office buildings. It's conveniently located about a 20-minute drive from downtown and the university area, and only 5-10 minutes away from Pima Air Museum. While there aren't many restaurants nearby, there are fast food options and a delightful sandwich place called Baggins within walking distance. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast included standard continental options with a few hot dishes, and they also hosted a reception on weekday evenings. My only complaint is that the food and drink at the reception go quickly, so arriving early is recommended if you plan to have it as dinner. Although the area had food, there were very few soft drinks left (no diet) when I arrived 45 minutes after it started. It would be beneficial if they continuously restocked the area. However, overall, the rooms were nice, beds were comfortable, and the area felt safe.

We got diverted to Tampa and decided to make the drive to Orlando. Yelp recommended this local gem and we were not disappointed. The wood-smoked steaks were amazing, with a smoky flavor that is hard to find elsewhere. Sides and wine selection were great too. The service from Lisa was excellent. Definitely coming back on future trips to Tampa!

The owner's exceptional response to my previous review left a strong impression. After a great conversation, I revisited Saladworks twice, experiencing significantly improved service. The new summer salads are simply delightful. Recommended!

This deli is hands down the best in the US! The menu is packed with incredible options, making it difficult to choose. The Muffalata is gigantic and delicious, perfect for sharing with a group. Also, the Saturday and Thursday live music nights add a fantastic touch. Don't miss out on the always tasty daily specials, and the variety of sides, including scrumptious chili, potato salad, and a wide selection of chips. Don't wait another minute, go to this deli now!
Highly recommend the Saguaro National Park tour with Park Ranger Carolyn. Her enthusiasm, knowledge, and passion for studying the saguaro were exceptional. A must-do stop on our cross country trip.

This place offers a wide range of flavors, from familiar to unique options. Their lemon pepper wings and New Orleans flavors like yaka mein and noonie bird are top-notch. The watermelon drink is incredible, although the location could be better. Still, they are putting effort into giving back to the community. It's safe during the day, but I wouldn't recommend coming alone at night. Overall, definitely worth a visit, you might even run into Skip.

Tom Jones has made some improvements since my last visit. The odd ATM machine is no longer there, but there are now ATM's at the front entrance. The blue ribbon breakfast is still a great deal at $3.79, including a variety of items. The atmosphere is nostalgic with the orange booths and payphone. Service is fast and efficient with friendly waitresses. With my daughter loving this place, I am bumping up my rating from 4 to 5 stars.

Dr. Ferrel is nothing short of a hero. As an amateur athlete, I first met him after a severe injury during a softball game. Despite my financial constraints as a single mom and teacher, Dr. Ferrel went above and beyond to provide treatment. When I initially sought a second opinion, I was told it would be months before I could play again. However, I reached out to Dr. Ferrel, who not only kept his promise but also healed me within weeks. Time and again, he has delivered remarkable results. Thanks to Dr. Ferrel, I am forever grateful and consider him my hero.
The shows are always a blast! The atmosphere is entertaining and laid-back. Great food, great price. Highly recommended for a fun and enjoyable time.
In-N-Out is simply irresistible. The crave for their mouthwatering burgers and indulgent animal style is undeniable. 4 patties all the way, my friends.

Cindy's is outstanding with authentic food and great service. Freshly made dishes stand apart from others, and the staff adds to the genuine Mexican experience. Highly recommended for anyone who appreciates tasty Mexican cuisine.

I had high hopes for Trust Me BBQ, but the service and food left much to be desired. The lack of interaction and incorrect order made me feel like I was at a vending machine. The BBQ sauce was great and the macaroni salad was interesting, but the chicken was dry and the mac & cheese was not fresh. The collard greens lacked flavor. I'll be sticking with Down to the Bone BBQ from now on.
Great find! The pa nang chicken was outstanding, especially at one star spicy. Quick service too. Will definitely come back!

This place is a hidden gem for Cinco de Mayo enthusiasts. With a diverse menu combining flavors from various cuisines, they create unique and tantalizing recipes. Despite not being specifically Mexican, they excel at margaritas and tequila. The newly opened wine bar next door is perfect for overflow and specialty bottles. The on the rocks margaritas and house-made sangria are outstanding. A must-visit destination!

This small donut bakery in Hermitage's oldest shopping center offers a delectable variety of treats, including unique options like bacon-topped donuts and doughssants, a delightful fusion of donuts and croissants. With affordable prices, such as $1.99 for a doughssant, it's worth a visit just for this one-of-a-kind pastry. The sweet donuts also make excellent gifts for teachers, and the bakery serves coffee as well.
We've had a fantastic time at all the events we've attended, from concerts to basketball games. The food options were also impressive, featuring delicious local favorites.
The food was excellent! We loved the three appetizers and five entrees we tried - they were all a hit. Reasonable prices and good service. I would definitely go back again and again.
The service declined significantly, prompting us to switch to another establishment. Slow and neglectful service was the primary issue.

This chicken and rice plate was a major disappointment. Despite specifically requesting no sauce, the dish arrived drenched in oil, completely contradicting what I was promised. The excessive amount of oil made it unappetizing and far from healthy. The restaurant's claim to promote a healthy image is simply a joke. Overall, a horrible experience.

I had a great experience purchasing a washer and dryer from Sears. Despite the negative reviews, I had no issues at all. The selection was excellent, the salespeople were knowledgeable, and the delivery was on time. The level of service exceeded my expectations, with the staff going above and beyond to give me the best price within my budget. They even checked for additional discounts. I received honest feedback and all my questions were answered. Highly recommend Sears!
The food is excellent, service is fast, and the staff is incredibly friendly. Always a pleasant experience ordering here.
Finally had the chance to try them and was absolutely blown away by their remodel. The mushroom cheese steak was simply sensational.

The espresso is top-notch, making it my go-to spot for an Americano. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed. Worth noting, there are no power outlets, but WiFi is available. Clean and well-maintained facilities overall.

Overall, the experience at this restaurant was underwhelming. The website lacked clear menu descriptions and prices, and the table placecard was more informative. The bar-like atmosphere wasn't an issue, but the temperature difference between the roast beef and roast pork sandwiches was disappointing. The sandwiches were also lacking in meat, compensating with excessive gravy that made the bread soggy. Opting for the "wet meat" option would have been a better choice to maintain the sandwich's integrity.

Great takeout experience from Village Whiskey! Despite the pricy Whiskey Burger at $26, it's absolutely worth it if you enjoy a greasier burger. It's super tender with awesome bacon, and a generous portion size. Highly recommend if you don't mind the price. The Duck Fat fries are also rich and delicious.

Recently, I decided to spend $80 on food for my family and it was definitely worth it. The food was served hot, and the orange chicken was one of the best I've tasted in a while. From now on, this will be our go-to place for Asian food!

I found this laundromat to be safe, clean, and well-equipped with friendly staff. The laundry and dryer worked efficiently, allowing me to complete several oversize loads in just under 2 hours. The facility has security cameras, amenities like flat screen T.V's and wi-fi, and a pleasant atmosphere. Overall, a wonderful place to do laundry. Thank you, LAUNDROMAT!

The prices are high, and we decided to split a plate, which annoyed the server. The food was good but not worth the price. The garlic bread was amazing though. Probably wouldn't eat there again with so much competition in St Louis.

Stopped by the Haven during the Seahawks/Saints game and it was packed for a reason - the Haven burger I had was fantastic. Despite the bustling crowd, I'll be returning, perhaps for a less busy lunch on a Tuesday.

I've only tried their vermicelli bowls, but they are reasonably priced, a good size, and consistently prepared. Located conveniently for Alberta Ave residents, my orders have always been ready within 15 minutes, even during busy times like Friday nights.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. The Chicken Marsala was thin, tough, and dry, while the pasta was undercooked and clumped together. Both dishes lacked flavor. The lasagne had a thin layer of pasta and lacked taste as well. Additionally, the staff cleared my friend's plate while she was away and had to bring her a new meal in a doggie bag. On the positive side, the atmosphere was great with live music, and I enjoyed dancing with my husband. However, the food was overpriced for its poor quality.

This place is a hidden gem with a fantastic location and ample street parking. The BYOB policy adds to the charm. I have visited twice and every dish I tried was enjoyable, especially the chaats, beef short ribs, lamb vindaloo, beet salad, breads/pickles, and chai. The chocolate cake was a crowd pleaser and can be shared. Conveniently, there is a corner bar that offers takeout beer. Needless to say, I will definitely be returning.
This restaurant is my absolute favorite! The ceviche is pure perfection. The atmosphere exudes fun and the service, led by Alex, is top-notch - friendly, attentive, and thoughtful.
I absolutely love this store! The fresh salad bar and a wide range of ethnic food options make it a must-visit. N-JOY!

Excellent Mediterranean chicken shawarma: flavorful and generous portions of chicken in the pita. The food was prepared and ready to go upon arrival, providing good service. Will definitely revisit when in the area again.
I highly recommend this place to both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. The food is delicious, the space is pleasant, and the staff is very welcoming.

Although it took some time to be attended to, the service eventually met expectations. The gumbo was exceptional, and I highly enjoyed the chicken and waffles. The staff was friendly, and the location on Bourbon Street provided great opportunities for people watching.

Earl at the airport offers a decent selection of sandwiches, including turkey, tuna, and Hawaiian. I opted for the roast beef sandwich and it did not disappoint. The sliced beef was cooked perfectly and paired well with cheddar cheese and a delicious horseradish sauce. The sandwich is best enjoyed without lettuce or tomatoes. Conveniently located near the security station and Delta SkyClub, it's easy to grab and enjoy at the gate or onboard.

This place is incredible! The food was outstanding, especially the cheese curds with red pepper jelly. The fish tacos and beer brat were both delicious and came in generous portions. The service was top-notch, with an attentive and knowledgeable server who made us feel welcome. The manager even checked in with us and mentioned their great deals on game days and brunch on weekends. The staff bid us farewell and gave us a sweet parting gift. I can't wait to come back!

I had a great experience at this restaurant! The burger was delicious and made me rethink ordering burgers when eating out. The beer selection was decent and the staff made me feel welcomed. The food was prepared as ordered and served quickly. The atmosphere was nice and the restrooms were clean. Overall, I left very happy with my visit.

The hotel is too big, expensive, and far from Downtown. The meals are overpriced and there are limited options nearby. Getting the car from valet and going to restaurants off the property is time-consuming. However, the property itself is gorgeous, and the room was spacious and well-equipped. There was an issue with the billing and the check-out process was a nightmare. Despite potential future conferences, the reviewer is not looking forward to returning.

I had a mostly enjoyable experience at Ava. The Ricotta cheese & toasted bread appetizer had great flavor, but the bread to cheese ratio was off. Both pizzas, sausage and potato with rosemary, were tasty, though they seemed to forget the Rosemary on ours. The grouper w/Israeli couscous entree was scrumptious. The zeppoles for dessert were amazing, but the cherry tart was not my personal favorite, although others at my table enjoyed it. I'll be returning to try their homemade pastas next time as they looked great.

First time eating here and it was a fantastic experience. The restaurant is very clean with friendly staff. The sushi was incredibly fresh and reasonably priced. The service was impeccable. Will definitely be returning in the future.

This place is simply the best. The name says it all. If you're not a fan of chicken, then this isn't the place for you. Their chicken is exceptional! Also, make sure to try their delicious fried corn on the cob. It's amazing!

Unfortunately, the food at this place is really below average. It was similar to a Waffle House experience. Despite the positive reviews, the pancakes tasted like frozen processed ones and the "homemade" maple syrup was watery and artificially flavored. The hash browns were greasy and lacking in taste, while the bacon was overcooked and hard to chew. It was clear that the food had been sitting for a while. Overall, the lack of inspiration in the dishes was disappointing. This restaurant seems to rely on an outdated reputation and there are definitely better options available in Nashville.

Overall, the dining experience at this place was excellent. We opted for the budget-friendly prix fixe menu for lunch. My wife thoroughly enjoyed the prime rib po'boy with tomato fennel soup, while I relished the seafood jamabalaya and seafood gumbo - both of which were outstanding, surpassing any I've tasted before. The upscale interpretation of the po'boy, with gruyere and horseradish sauce, was a standout.

I highly recommend Pure Design for large events. Their staff was professional, offered unique and beautiful arrangements within my budget, and created a gorgeous space that our guests raved about. I was also able to take home/give away the arrangements, which lasted several days after the event.

My husband and I, being older, thoroughly enjoyed our time at this Par-Tee. The friendly server made us feel welcome and was knowledgeable about the drinks. The beer and liquor selection impressed us, and we were pleasantly surprised by the small but excellent bar food menu. The pork belly sliders were a standout, and we highly recommend them. We hope they add more delicious tapas in the future. The staff was engaging and we will definitely be returning.

Average food with high prices and disappointing portion sizes. The bison burger was the only highlight, but it was overpriced and ruined with unnecessary toppings. Overall, not worth the money and won't be returning.

The service provided by our server, LaToya, was excellent. However, the black bean burger was dry, and the sweet potato fries were good. Unfortunately, the handling of an arrest in the restaurant was disturbing and poorly managed, causing discomfort to customers and staff. The managers were unavailable and did not address the situation. This lack of care for customers and staff is unacceptable.

The sliders at this place are fantastic! Perfect size allows you to try more than one, and the fried chicken slider, BLT slider, monte cristo, and Cuban were all delicious. Now it's time to get some donuts to go!

We recently visited this restaurant for the third time since its reopening. They have daily specials, offering a plate with ice-tea and soup at a reasonable price of $7.95. Today's special included Carne Asada with rice n beans, a fried fish plate, and 2 chicken enchiladas with rice n beans, all accompanied by tea n soup. We both opted for the Carne Asada plate, and they kindly let me substitute my rice n beans for a salad. The steak was enjoyable, and overall, the food was good. Additionally, the service was attentive.

Love this little shop for its inviting aroma, extensive spice selection, and knowledgeable staff. Their products last a long time and taste fresher than alternatives. Prices are reasonable, making it worth the investment.

Steve and his partner are absolutely amazing! Their offer to demo a variety of racquets is unbeatable. The prices are fantastic and there is an extensive selection to choose from. If you're a player, this is the place to be!

Despite the higher-than-expected crowd, the staff at Chick-fil-A in Reno was amazing. Despite waiting in line for 8 minutes, we got our food within 5 minutes of finding a table. The restaurant ran smoothly despite the large number of people. Although one sandwich was messed up, the issue was promptly resolved. The staff was attentive, going around to ask for refills and feedback on the food. Overall, we're glad to have a Chick-fil-A in Reno, as they maintained their high standards even on opening day.
experience overall and would definitely recommend it to others.

Beck's is a bit expensive for the portion sizes, but their gator gumbo is absolutely amazing. Savory, perfectly spiced, and not too spicy or salty. The gator is chopped up and served in sausage form in the gumbo. However, the pasta, specifically the chicken alfredo, was dry and not worth ordering again. Overall, go for the gator gumbo and skip the pasta.

Despite being initially concerned by the reviews, my experience was excellent. There was a minimal wait time, and the staff was welcoming and helpful from the moment I entered the lobby to interacting with the office staff.
Unfortunately, The Taint failed to live up to its hype. The apathetic atmosphere and unsavory crowd in the Garden District left me unimpressed. Not my scene.

Just discovered a new Chick-fil-A location in Bloomingdale and had a great experience! Despite a busy parking lot, the staff efficiently managed the drive-thru lanes. Every employee I interacted with was friendly and welcoming. The food was tasty, although the fries could have been cooked longer. Overall, a good addition to the area. Welcome to Bloomingdale, Chick-fil-A!

I found this cute spot on Germantown Ave and they didn't disappoint when it came to satisfying my sweet tooth. They had a wide selection of cookies and bars, and I was intrigued by their "cake scrapple" cups filled with different flavors of cakes and icings. I chose the Red Velvet with cream cheese frosting, along with an M&M cookie. The cookie was soft, chewy, and had a nice texture from the hard candies. The cake was also delicious and moist. Overall, a delightful experience.

This place has seen many improvements, creating a much more comfortable environment now. The only minor downside is the chairs, which could be more comfortable for watching a whole football game. Overall, significant improvements have been made and it's a much better place now.
Good food, but slow service. They need more staff at the counter to take orders.

I visited this place early on, but was disappointed with only one flavor option, which was not enjoyable. Additionally, everything was costly, and our meal for three left us unsatisfied. The sauce did not resemble Cajun style but rather a combination of buffet sauces with fish sauce. Overall, I rate them a solid three since there are better dining options available.

We had a fantastic time on this Ybor walking tour with great food stops! Our knowledgeable guide, Raymond, made it an informative and enjoyable experience. The tour lasted about 3 hours, but we went over because we got sidetracked and chatted a lot. We learned fascinating details about the history, culture, and people of Ybor. The food tastings were delicious, especially the Cuban sandwich at Stone Soup Company. Whether you're a visitor or a long-time resident, I highly recommend this fun adventure. Plus, we walked over 5000 steps, which helps offset the calories from all the delicious food!

Franzone's never disappoints with their delicious sweet spiral plain pies. I highly recommend trying their white pizza with onions too - a delightful surprise! It's the same great quality I remember from the Bridgeport location I grew up with.

Avoid this clinic at all costs. They misdiagnosed my daughter's severe sore throat as a fungal infection and prescribed medication that made it worse. Despite being the only patients, the staff was robotic and unfriendly. We were rushed out the door and not allowed to ask questions. Overall, a very unfriendly experience. It's better to have a primary care physician than rely on these clinics.
The chicken sandwich was absolutely amazing, making it a fantastic choice for the surrounding industrial atmosphere.

Setting up the appointment online was effortless and hassle-free. Our guided 2-hour side by side ride with Matt was fantastic. He was incredibly knowledgeable and made the experience even more enjoyable. We were treated to breathtaking views throughout the ride. Overall, we had a great time with superb service.

The bar offers a great happy hour from 4-7 every day with $3 wine and drafts, $5 pizza, and $4.50 appetizers. The to-go dinners and lunches are reasonably priced and served quickly. The staff is incredibly friendly.
Terrible experience - found hair in both appetizer and friend's noodles. Waiter was good, but no effort made to rectify the situation. Won't return.

ITV is a dream-like dining experience with a beautiful ambiance and attentive staff. The three-dollar beef fat biscuit was the standout dish that impressed me the most. The menu features delectable options like Foie with Apricot Miso, Pork Cheeks, and trout pumpernickel soldiers. The cocktails, especially the ouroboros, were exceptional. The bar menu also offers unique cold-smoked items. I highly recommend this terrific place and regret not writing this review sooner. Head to East Passyunk for some of the best this city has to offer!
I adore this place! Exceptional hours, spotlessly clean, incredibly relaxing.

Buckingham Pizza delivers the best pizza in town, especially their plain and speciality pizzas like the cool ranch. Stick with their pizzas and maybe some sides, as their entrees like the chicken piccata are just good.

Cafe Beignet has the best iced latte and beignet we've tried, along with live music that adds to the great atmosphere. Compared to Cafe du Monde, we prefer Cafe Beignet for its superior quality and service. Plus, the lack of long lines is a bonus.

Captain Bill's offers a fun and relaxed atmosphere with a great view of the water. The menu caters to a diverse range of tastes and even accommodates ingredient substitutions. The food is served hot, fresh, and exactly as requested. The wait service is excellent and the wait time is minimal. We left the restaurant satisfied and looking forward to our next visit. Highly recommended for a pleasant dining experience.

The sushi at this restaurant is excellent, with the peanut avocado roll being a standout. The Volcano roll was also amazing. The service was friendly and the overall experience was great. Despite the distance, I will definitely be returning. Highly recommended if you're in Valrico.
This Cuban restaurant is decent but average. It's convenient for me to grab lunch at, and their daily specials are worth trying as they are always freshly made.
The 6 oz pepperloin meal pleased my husband, though the shrimp kabob meal was disappointing with only 4 overcooked and small shrimp. Nevertheless, service was good and the restaurant was not busy.

I had a rushed experience but the wait was worth it. The locals were welcoming and patient with newcomers. The smell upon entering was appetizing and the pastrami sandwich was the best I've ever had. The interior was filled with captivating bottle cap decor. The service was exceptional, as they knew exactly what the customers wanted.

Heather's new shop is a dream come true. She is an amazing color wizard, always crafting looks with flair and creativity. The shop has a relaxed and comfortable vibe. I trust Heather and her staff completely, and I love recommending her to friends and family. Plus, the shop's location in the heart of E. Passyunk is perfect. Don't forget to ask Heather for cactus houseplant tips or chat about vintage bikes when you visit!

Sally's offers a great variety of hair supplies, making it my go-to store for experimenting. The staff is friendly and products are usually well-stocked. However, I wish they had more knowledge about their products and the store appeared bigger, brighter, and cleaner. Overall, I'm satisfied with Sally's.

I have been going to the same hair stylist in Austin for seven years, but when I couldn't visit him, I decided to try Rodney Mitchell's Salon. Despite not seeing my preferred stylist, Allison did an amazing job with my haircut. She was friendly, not too chatty, and understood exactly what I wanted. The discount for first-time visitors and referrals is a great perk too. I can't wait to go back!

Great location, spacious, and friendly baristas. However, the constant and loud music ruins the coffee shop experience. Also, tea drinkers will be disappointed with the ungainly filters used. Gluten free options and tasty Italian sodas are a plus. Overall, would love to stay longer but the music drives me out within 10 minutes.

Spice n Grill in St. Louis offers the best Indian food with perfectly spiced beef nihari, palak paneer, and naan. The dishes were adequately spicy and crave-worthy. Despite limited seating, the friendly owner makes up for it. If you're in the mood for delicious take-out, I highly recommend this restaurant.

Overall, the reviewer had mixed feelings about the boba place. They were disappointed that the boba didn't have the same feel as in California and found some flavors to be lacking in real fruit taste. However, if one doesn't mind powdered flavors, the place could be enjoyable. The reviewer recommends trying boba and grass jelly. It's a good place for hanging out and doing activities. The reviewer feels that it could be better but acknowledges their own pickiness.

I've been ordering from Silver Mine's for 4-5 years now, but they have gotten progressively worse. They charge for additions to your soup or chili but don't include them in the order. They also forget free sides like bread. Delivery takes at least an hour, unlike Jimmy Johns. With better options available, this business is in trouble. Service is worse than if kindergarteners ran it. Embarrassing and a waste of space. Will never order from here again.

I recently had a great experience at this bike shop. Brought my damaged bike in for a quick fix on the front basket and a safety check. They not only repaired the basket and gear shifter for free, but they also had it ready in less than 30 minutes. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming. So glad I found this shop.
The store is like Disneyland for adults - I love it! Prices may be a bit high, but I still enjoy going just to look around.

Pag's in Doylestown offers an underrated cheeseburger that is simply fantastic. Despite a less appealing menu, the cheeseburger was one of the best I've had in a while, comparable to a quality Big Mac. The patty wasn't too thick, and the bun perfectly complemented the burger without overpowering it. The sauce used was absolutely delicious. Although not very kid friendly in the wine bar section, the ambiance is great and the staff was friendly and accommodating. I will definitely be returning to Pag's when I'm in the mood for a good burger.

Fantastic food, excellent service! My boyfriend and I frequent this place for lunch/dinner every two weeks. Reasonable prices and mouthwatering dishes like Indian Pancake, Hainanese Chicken, and Curry Chicken. Weekends can get busy, but waiting is never an issue for us. Highly recommended, we never tire of it!

The service at this highly-rated diner in a tourist area was disappointing, with slow service and unfriendly waitresses. The presence of trash on the outside deck, which could potentially end up in the ocean, was a major concern. The food was good, but the lack of responsibility and poor service means I won't be returning.

I recently tried their pre fixe meal for $22 and loved the combination of flavors on my plate. The chicken was moist and the vegetables were tasty, although slightly greasy. Overall, it was a great dining experience. 

Their take out/delivery service is also a favorite of mine. I appreciate how they package their food in reusable plastic containers, avoiding excessive waste. The food may not be exceptional, but it is consistently enjoyable. Although the prices are a bit high, the contemporary restaurant atmosphere, excellent service, and dependable food make it a reliable choice.
This Chinese place offers typical dishes and a familiar menu. However, it stands out with its great lunch specials, and the convenience of food being ready for pickup is a definite plus.

Finally got to try this place last night. Eclectic menu for foodies. The onion tart and veal meatballs with polenta were delicious. The red gravy tasted homemade. The citrus short ribs with fat noodles and brussel sprouts were amazing, couldn't finish it all. Small and crowded, but a great friendly atmosphere. Will definitely be back to try more interesting dishes.

We had a fantastic dining experience at Angelina's, a small Italian restaurant in South Philly. After being unable to get into the oldest Italian restaurant, we stumbled upon Angelina's and immediately felt at home. The eggplant and roasted pepper appetizer was delicious and the Veal Osso Bocca, Carbonara, and lasagna were absolutely amazing. We can't wait to go back!
The food and view were exceptional, especially the lobster mac and cheese.
Superb ice cream store with delicious and generously portioned servings. Pleasingly unique flavors set it apart. A must-visit spot that sets the bar high for others to follow.

The food is average, but the drink specials are great. Unfortunately, the place is rarely crowded and lacks atmosphere. Last time I went on a Friday night at 10 pm, there were only three other parties at the bar. Additionally, they announced last call just 5 minutes after ordering our first drink, which was disappointing. As a result, we have decided to remove it from our list of options for evening drinks.
When it's late and you're craving munchies, this is the perfect place to order from.

Value City may not live up to its name as a cheap value retailer. The store offers furniture prices comparable to Rothman but with Ashley Furniture quality. However, the selection for entertainment centers and TV stands is limited and overpriced. Their "Clearance" section is disappointing, with minimal discounts. Sectionals are expensive for unfamiliar brands, and staff prioritizes chatting over customer service. The dining sets are average and overpriced, available elsewhere for less. A 5% military discount fails to make a significant impact. On the positive side, they do have a few modern pieces. Overall, it's better to shop around or wait for a holiday sale for better deals on low to mediocre quality furniture.

I highly recommend Franzone's. The owner is always present, incredibly friendly, and genuinely invested in the quality of the food. Their sweet sauce isn't my personal preference, but they also serve a decent cheesesteak, fries, and more.
