The exceptional experience I have every time I visit pushes their rating up to a solid 4 out of 5 for me.

Bab Cafe is a must-visit Asian restaurant in Reno, offering incredible flavor and a sauce bar to mix things up. The friendly and knowledgeable staff make ordering a breeze. The Jeyuk Top-Bab (spicy pork) is a must-try dish with unbeatable taste. The included miso soup and convenient downtown location add to the great value. Whether taking away, dining in, or getting it delivered, Bab Cafe is a fantastic culinary experience.

If you're not a seafood fan, this place will change your mind. The $15 lunch special, a seafood stew with oyster meat, crab claws, shrimp, and redfish, was absolutely amazing. Even though I wasn't hungry, I devoured the whole thing without thinking. The spice, consistency, and tenderness of the meat were perfect. Definitely worth a visit.

Biscuit Love is totally worth the wait, despite the heat! I enjoyed the Vegan grits with a biscuit on the side, and it was amazing. Even my three sisters loved their choices. The service was excellent, considering the wait was 45 minutes. The line moved quickly, and our food arrived promptly. Biscuit Love has their process perfected! Thanks for a delicious breakfast!

Ichicoro Ane gets it right with its perfect combination of ambiance, food choices, and whiskey selection. The servers have been helpful and pleasant, making the experience even better. The katsu is a must-try for those seeking a filling dish, while the bao buns are perfect for a lighter option. The portion sizes vary, so be sure to ask your server. The cocktail selection is excellent, especially the Japanese Old Fashioned, although slightly pricey. Exploring the menu little by little is a delightful experience, best enjoyed in a group setting that reminds me of Japanese pubs.
This bakery is amazing! Their breakfast sandwiches, coffee, and donuts are top-notch. My friend and I always look forward to our weekend mornings here.

I highly recommend this place for its extensive whiskey/bourbon selection that caters to all preferences. The burger with fried egg was absolutely delicious and probably one of the best I've ever had. Don't miss out on the must-try duck fries. The atmosphere is cute, but seating arrangements for larger parties can be a bit awkward, hindering conversations. Nonetheless, it's a nice place to visit and we definitely plan on going back.

The pub offers a delightful English ambiance, creating a cozy atmosphere. The skillful bartenders take pride in crafting great drinks. However, be prepared for high prices, as a standard mixed drink costs $7. Additionally, bear in mind that seating is limited.

Cozy atmosphere with tasty drinks served in pretty glasses, reminiscent of grandmother's china cabinet. Limited drink choices mainly featuring ginger, lime, and honey combinations. Bacon wrapped dates were overly sweet, difficult to enjoy. Noise level escalated as more people entered, surprising considering the fabric in the room. Friendly servers, although second drink not offered when glass was taken away.
This place consistently exceeds expectations, providing a wonderful experience year after year. Hayrides, pumpkin picking, and an array of activities never disappoint.

Received poor service when inquiring about warranty work for my 2015 $110K AMG. Was informed that I would have to pay for a loaner car since I didn't buy the vehicle from their dealership. Will not be returning.

This place is like a mini Whole Foods with a salad bar, fresh fruits, and a juice bar. It's a fantastic little grocery store and the only one of its kind in the city. They even have a parking lot. Conveniently located just a few blocks away from clothing stores, it's great for a quick walk.

I adore this place. Wonderful outdoor ambiance, unbeatable unique wine selection, and incredible live music even on a weekday. Satisfying experience with exquisite cheeses and artistic menu. Beautiful ambiance for all senses.
I highly recommend this place for smog tests on cars due to their excellent service and cheerful staff.
This place is outstanding with an excellent selection of gluten-free and vegan options. The salad, pizza, and root beer were simply perfect.
We had an amazing experience at this clean and inviting restaurant! All six of us enjoyed delicious burgers and left thoroughly satisfied. Don't miss out on their must-try sweet potato tots.

This establishment is a great choice for a relaxed dining experience. The food is good but not exceptional, scoring a solid 7.8 out of 10. The lighting is perfect, and the noise level is pleasantly low, making for a comfortable ambiance (10 out of 10 for both). The environment is nice and tidy, earning an 8.5 rating. Moreover, the staff is friendly and attentive, with a rating of 9 out of 10.

I highly recommend this convenience store deli for its delicious sandwiches and beautiful waterfront seating. Despite the lack of restaurant ambiance and drink service, I am extremely satisfied with the quality of food. Hands down, this deli beats the more popular breakfast place nearby in terms of taste. 4 stars!

My second experience here was even better than the first. Despite some initial kinks during the grand opening, this time they had multiple beer bottle openers and improved the portion size of the garlic noodle. Although certain tables still seemed drafty, we were seated at a better table and it didn't bother me. The food was amazing as always, and I'm already excited for my next visit. Even on a Saturday evening at 5pm, we had no trouble getting seated. I'm so glad to have these guys in our local neighborhood. Highly recommended!

I used to love Skyline Chili but unfortunately, the Clearwater location is not up to par. Poor service, slow food service, and frequently out of ingredients or equipment issues. The cheese coney hot dogs are still delicious though. Hoping they improve soon.

The eyebrow waxing here is fantastic, but the lack of availability and slow response time for appointments bring my rating down to 2 stars. I recommend booking weeks in advance if you want to be seen. Ultimately, I've switched to another place despite the higher cost, as it offers more flexibility and availability.
The taco's, nacho's, atmosphere, and margarita's at this place are amazing! Plus, they have a triple special day on Wednesdays. Perfect spot for some delicious Mexican food and drinks.

The rental service had insufficient staff, resulting in long wait times and a delay in car preparation. The car was not properly cleaned and the customer was charged an expensive underage fee despite being close to the required age. They recommend choosing a different rental company like Hertz to avoid such issues. The fuel option was also misleading, with prices after tax being similar to those outside, and the return location address provided was incorrect, causing further inconvenience.

Thank you, Yelp reviewers! Todd and Roberta did an outstanding job at my house. My carpet and couch look amazing, with all the pet accident spots gone. The fresh smell without any chemicals or wetness is impressive. Additionally, they were incredibly friendly and offered valuable home care advice. Definitely worth every penny and highly recommended for future services!
I absolutely love this place! The sips mocha is my favorite, and the staff is always friendly. The drive-thru option is a lifesaver with kids, and their cakes are simply amazing.

Chateau La Vin has been my favorite for years, and it's amazing to see how it has evolved from a wine store to a fantastic wine bar. With an extensive wine selection, cheese and crackers, and even the option to order from local restaurants, it offers a delightful experience. The owner's knowledge and willingness to share make the visit even more enjoyable. They also cater to beer drinkers with a nice variety. Outdoor seating is available too. Overall, Chateau La Vin is a fantastic place to visit.

The Hollander Hotel provided an unforgettable experience for our wedding. The charming property, beautiful lobby decor, and spacious Tap Room created the perfect atmosphere. The rooms were clean and cozy, with great prices and a convenient shuttle. The brunch was delicious and reasonably priced, with friendly staff and a lovely patio. Most importantly, the management and team at the Hollander were exceptional, treating us like family and ensuring every guest had a wonderful experience. Highly recommended!

I had the gyro platter for lunch and it was disappointing. The dish was dry, uninspired, and not at all like a deconstructed gyro. The included vegetables resembled poop, both in appearance and taste. Fairmount has better lunch options that don't serve unappetizing dishes.
I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this place. The atmosphere was pleasant, and it was a treat to have the brewery on-site. The drinks were great, and the waiter was both knowledgeable and kind.

Highly recommended New Orleans restaurant with amazing ambience, fantastic service, and must-try signature dishes like BBQ shrimp and bread pudding. Fried green tomato appetizer is a perfect start to a memorable dining experience.
This store has an amazing variety of products and exceptional customer service. It's a shame they don't have a branch in Ft. McMurray.

This tanning salon's customer service was extremely disappointing, as they attempted to deceive and take advantage of customers. Despite the online coupon offering unlimited tanning for $15, they claimed it was only for students without any mention on the coupon itself. They also falsely stated that the coupon had expired, even though it was still available on Yelp and their website. Furthermore, they refused to honor another discounted coupon available for purchase on Yelp. The conflicting information provided by staff members and lack of consistency between locations was frustrating. Overall, it is advisable to avoid this place.

Impressive place! Incredible food, efficient chipotle-style line ordering, and top-notch Indian cuisine. The staff were extremely helpful, especially for someone new to Indian food. Can't wait to go back!

El Sabor Poblano on Federal is an unassuming Mexican place that is worth a visit. They offer delicious fish tacos with generous portions of flakey fish, and their chorizo tacos are crispy and gristle-free. The staff is accommodating and the prices are reasonable.

I finally visited this spot I've always wanted to go to. Despite the ongoing police investigation regarding a recent burglary, the bartender provided excellent service and my pint of dark ale was cold and refreshing. The wings were also delicious. I appreciated the friendly owners whom I met at a local festival and will definitely be a regular patron. This non-franchised establishment has a great atmosphere and I highly recommend it to fellow Yelpers.

Found this place on Yelp and the reviews were spot on. The sandwiches are delicious, and despite the wait in line, the fast and friendly service made it worth it. We ordered four different sandwiches, filled up our sodas, and in no time, our food was delivered to our table. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

Great theater recliners, but beware of limited aisle space. Enjoyable lounge experience with a delightful bartender. Drinking in the theater is a bonus. However, concessions were disappointing with slow service and burnt popcorn. Consider eating beforehand and sticking to the bar next time.
This hotel is top-notch! Immaculate, friendly staff, impressive pool, and a stunning entrance. Already counting down the days until my return next year.
I visited this place when it first opened and was highly disappointed with the quality and taste of the food. I have no desire to return and I strongly advise against dining here.

Visited on a quiet Sunday afternoon. Limited food options, but average beer selection. None of the styles stood out. Unfortunate staff conflict was audible and dampened the experience. Although it had a cool location, better alternatives nearby might be preferred.
I was disappointed with Tony Luke's at terminal F. The Philly Cheese Steak didn't resemble the picture and the meat tasted unpleasant, like dog food. Not worth the $10.
I absolutely love this hidden gem in Creve Couer! The 9-hole course is both enjoyable and affordable. The staff is extremely helpful as well.
First time visit. Slow service, poor attitude from employees. Good food.
The food at this dive bar is consistently delicious, however, the service is lacking.

The museum offers an incredible collection for free, with beautiful exhibits that include African and Modern Art. The outdoor sculpture garden and gift shop were also impressive. Highly recommended, but remember no photography in the Modern Art section!

The restaurant's size may give the impression that it's great for groups, but my experience with 9 people on a Saturday morning was a long and exhausting wait for a table. They don't accept reservations, and we were too small to be accommodated in a meeting room. The manager offered to fill coffee cups while we waited, but it would have been better if they just refilled the pot for everyone waiting. The food, however, was good. The 1/2 and 1/2 combos are a great option, and I enjoyed my turkey Reuben and salad, although I was charged extra for sauerkraut which was not plentiful. My friend had the sunrise chile rellenos and I would consider ordering it if I returned with a smaller group.
The Shop is an exceptional space with meticulous attention to detail and unparalleled services. It offers ample options for private meetings and productive work.
Had a delightful anniversary dinner here! The food was melt-in-your-mouth amazing and the customer service was top-notch. Will definitely return!

The Terrace Lounge falls short as a cocktail venue. The cocktail was weak and watery, and the liquor selection throughout Peppermill is disappointing. The service is inconsistent with overwhelmed bartenders and no designated bar areas. The atmosphere is affected by the presence of typical casino gamblers, some of whom are inconsiderate smokers. Cin Cin is a better choice with excellent cocktails and no machines at the bar. Peppermill should improve by removing the machines, training staff, and offering independent liquors.

5-star review: 

Can't say enough good things about the awesome service at this place! Shoutout to Amanda, the resident comedian, who made our experience even more enjoyable. The staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. The food is delicious and the beer is served icy cold. Highly recommend!
This is my go-to nail shop in the city. The peaceful ambiance is perfect, and the staff is always friendly and efficient. Plus, at just $25.00 for a pedicure in the South, it's unbeatable!

I had a fantastic breakfast at this NJ diner! The egg sandwich was delicious, especially with the top-notch hamburger roll and generous cheese. The home fries were sauteed with peppers and onions and had great flavor. The pancakes were fluffy, although the syrup could've been better. The server was friendly and attentive, and the coffee was surprisingly good. I can't wait to return!

The server was excellent, very attentive and friendly. The maple wings were delicious. However, the paid performance by the "piano guys" was highly inappropriate and offensive, crossing all limits of decency. It completely ruined the experience and we left immediately. Moreover, for the price paid, we only heard a fraction of one song.

I prefer the new Han Dynasty branch over the one in Olde City due to the exceptional service and attentive staff. Although the specialties differ between locations, the food is satisfactory, although not as spicy as the other branch. The layout and atmosphere are more appealing, and they offer smaller lunch portions at a discounted price, making it a great option for lunch alone or in a small group.

Carisma Restaurante is our go-to spot for its excellent food and great service. The owner, Jose, ensures everyone is satisfied and the dishes, including paellas, salmon, and filet mignon, are cooked to perfection. The family's cafe in front offers equally delicious baked goods and coffees. Carisma is a must-try for those seeking more than just the usual tacos and burritos. Highly recommended!

Hidden gem serving delicious Senegalese and West African cuisine, including a tasty Thiboudienne without tomato sauce and a flavorful Jollof Rice. Cozy atmosphere with a few hightop tables or takeout option available. Friendly service.

Tried the falafel wrap again today after a previous average experience. Disappointingly, very little flavor except for excessive saltiness. The falafels and pita were lacking in taste, and even the tzatziki sauce couldn't salvage it. The sauce resembled a tasteless glue rather than the flavorful one expected. The only redeeming aspect was the fresh diced cucumber and tomato, but sadly overshadowed by the unsatisfying white sauce that shouldn't be called tzatziki :(

This place strikes the perfect balance between upscale and casual. Whether you're dressed to the nines with your Gucci bag or rocking your comfy yoga pants, you can enjoy a selection of decadent cocktails.

Our group of 6 decided to try something different and gave this place a shot. Very happy with our decision. The special was a massive amount of food for two people and it was a great sampling of all their options. The chicken, steak, and rice/beans were amazing. The egg was easy enough to push away and the yuca wasn't bad. The plantains were delicious. Didn't try the salad, but overall, a must-visit if you're up for trying something new.

The lunch today was absolutely amazing. The pulled pork and smokehouse bowl were accompanied by incredibly delicious sides of sweet potato casserole and red beans and rice. The red beans and rice had a nice kick to it, while the sweet potato casserole was absolutely yummy. The meat was perfectly smoky, juicy, and there was plenty of it. This place is definitely a must-visit.
Incredible results! My neglected car underwent the executive detailing and now it looks brand new.

We visited from Colorado to potentially buy a second home and had a great experience. Jen at the front desk was incredibly kind and helpful, speaking highly of the club and its amenities. We also met Joe, the general manager, who was terrific. Though smaller than other lifetimes, the club offers top-notch service. The bathrooms are fantastic and fully stocked with toiletries, and the location next to the mall is excellent. Highly recommend.

Tried the pulled pork, green beans, Mac n cheese, and cornbread. Mediocre barbecue with a dry pork but decent smoky flavor. The sweet/syrupy original bbq sauce was okay. Might return, but would prefer a better option closer to home.

We made the mistake of visiting on a Lenten Friday and experienced a long wait. The blackened alligator was greasy, but the raw oysters were fresh. The lack of communication about the oysters being only raw was disappointing. The entrees took a while to arrive, and the roast beef was salty while the tuna and shrimp kabob was bland. The seafood boil seemed like a better option. Overall, the place is okay considering the price.

I only gave this place one star for their horrible customer service. They advertised a 50% off discount for students, but when I arrived with my ID, they told me it was only valid on certain days. Despite making an appointment and being assured of the discount, they refused to honor it. The owner, John Jay, also refused to rectify the situation and treated me patronizingly. I left upset and wasted 45 minutes of my time. If you value good customer service, I suggest skipping this place for your next haircut.

This Chinese restaurant is the go-to spot for amazing food and a perfect choice for sharing a variety of mouthwatering spicy dishes with a big group. Consistently delivering top-notch quality, I have never encountered a disappointing dish here. It's a guaranteed crowd-pleaser that lives up to its well-deserved reputation.

The Bricks of Ybor in Tampa is a must-visit restaurant with phenomenal meat sandwiches. The pulled pork on Hawaiian sweet bread is one of the best meals I've had. The owner, Brian, made us feel welcome and comped us a drink. The diverse crowd speaks to the menu and pleasant environment. Despite the crowds, the service remained excellent. I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back on my next visit to Tampa.
Highly recommended! The crepes and pancakes were amazing, and even the grits stood out. Well worth the wait!

My sister-in-law and I visited this restaurant on 8/28/15 and it was a disappointing experience. Despite requesting multiple times, the hostess spoke too quietly for us to hear over the background music. We were seated in a booth with a never-ending Larry King vitamin commercial on the TV, which was not enjoyable. Our waitress introduced herself and a trainee, but they were absent for the rest of the meal and we were unsure who was responsible for our table. The food took a long time to arrive, considering the restaurant was not busy. The blue cheese burger had an overwhelming amount of blue cheese and could have been better with less. The fries and onion sticks were tasty though. No one came to check if we were satisfied or needed anything and it took two requests and waiting time to get a carry-out box. Additionally, another family had been waiting for their food since before we arrived, which was concerning. Overall, I do not plan on returning to this restaurant in the future.

The food at this place was decently good, but way too expensive. The guacamole and Mojito were the highlights, while the peach pork medallions lacked flavor. The corn cakes with Barbacoa were pretty good though. The atmosphere was inviting and had a hip feel. However, the parking situation was annoying with limited spaces and no valet service. Ended up parking three blocks away and sweating in the summer heat to get to the entrance.

Overall, my experience at Rusty Pelican was good. However, the initial interaction with the hostess was disappointing. We had called ahead, made a reservation, and requested a window seat overlooking the water. The hostess initially tried to seat us away from the window and seemed annoyed when we asked about it. She eventually accommodated our request, but it left a sour taste. Thankfully, Liz, our server, provided excellent service, and the drinks, food, and wait staff were all top-notch. However, the hostess's behavior was a letdown.

The wine at this winery is average, but the location on the pier is fantastic. The staff is friendly and accommodating. However, the wine club is expensive and offers limited benefits. Visit for the beautiful setting and tasting, but skip the wine club.

I had a negative experience with a cheap haircut in NY, resulting in a disastrous outcome. However, for my job interviews, I decided to try Domenick's and was pleasantly surprised. Robert did a fantastic job and the whole experience was worth $35. It was a bit expensive for me, but considering the final result, I felt human again. I'm not sure what the usual price range is in Philly, though. Overall, I would rate it a 4.

I am extremely disappointed with the service received at Monro Muffler. They underfilled our engine with oil, causing damage, and their insurance company was unhelpful. The service associate, Joe, was rude and unprofessional, leaving my wife in tears. We were loyal customers, but this experience has lost them a lifelong customer. I will not be returning and will look elsewhere for future car services and purchases.

Beautiful Clean Shop: The shop is clean and well-maintained, creating a pleasant atmosphere. The display of homemade breakfast tarts and chicken pot pies is impressive. The sweets are not only visually appealing but delicious as well. While some items may be slightly pricey considering their small sizes, the quality justifies the cost. It is a great place for locals and worth a visit, even for those coming from the center city. The counter staff is friendly and engaging. I will definitely return and highly recommend it.

Overall, the pancakes at this place were decent but a bit dry. It's recommended to arrive before 8:30am to avoid a long wait. My friends tried different flavors and they were all okay. Personally, I don't understand the hype around this place. If the line is short, it's an alright option for a regular breakfast. However, if the line is long, I highly suggest going to Fido down the street for amazing coffee and breakfast food.

The service advisors at this Honda dealer are extremely poor, especially since the departure of Kelly and her team. However, the convenience of getting an oil change before reaching another Honda dealer is a potential advantage.

This hidden gem serves the best soon-dubu in the city! The cozy atmosphere and warm, welcoming feel make it feel like you're dining in a Korean home. The soft tofu stew is incredibly flavorful and can be customized to your liking, with options for beef, seafood, mushroom, or just plain. The extra hot with hot temperature is a must-try for spice lovers. The dol-sot rice adds a delightful crispy touch. Even if you're not a tofu fan, they offer delicious Korean BBQ meats and other soup/stew options. I can't help but salivate just thinking about it! Absolutely love this place!

This motel offers great value for the price. It is clean, comfortable, and well-managed. The breakfast buffet is average, but reasonable considering the rate. However, the pool is a disappointment as it is too small for laps. On a positive note, the lobby area is spacious and comfortable. If you are seeking a moderately priced, clean, and comfortable place to sleep, this motel will meet your needs effectively.

I expressed frustration regarding the lack of contact information for the owner and the state of cleanliness and maintenance of the columbarium. Despite my request for improvements, the person I dealt with did not acknowledge the need for action or display any empathy.

This deli offers fast, delicious, and attentive service. The vegetarian breakfast sandwiches are a must-try, especially the veggie sausage with havarti on an everything bagel. The menu has options for everyone, including chicken cheesesteak hoagie and chicken salad on a croissant. The food tastes fresh and is priced reasonably. The staff is helpful and accommodating. Moreover, the deli has a great snack selection, including amazing chocolate bars, a variety of chips, and addictive hi-chew candies in every flavor. Highly recommend!

Delicious brunch with amazing options like the 3 meat hash, turkey sandwich, and bagel/salmon. Friendly and accommodating staff. Prices were a bit high but definitely worth it. Will return when in the area.

Located at the far end of Terminal E at Tampa International, this hidden gem is one of the airport's new restaurants with a local vibe. Despite limited seating, it's a great place to catch a game on their TVs away from the TSA area. The food is reasonably priced, with appetizers ranging from $5 to $10 and most sandwiches priced at $12. Although I didn't try the food, it looked amazing. Drinks are tasty and reasonably priced, like the 22oz Jai Alai for $8.50. You can't take alcoholic beverages into the terminal, but the staff is attentive and friendly. This will be my go-to spot when waiting for a Delta flight.
The depot burger and shishito peppers are incredibly delicious. The food, atmosphere, and drinks are all perfect.

The store's quality and selection have significantly declined in recent years. The produce is not fresh and overpriced, while organic foods are more expensive than Whole Foods. Additionally, the store's organization and customer service have worsened, with aisles roped off and difficulty reaching the register. I faced frustration from staff while trying to purchase soup. Overall, a disappointing experience and I will be switching to Wegmans for my shopping needs.

This hidden gem in a strip mall exceeded all expectations. The modern and romantic atmosphere sets the perfect stage for an amazing dining experience. The food, particularly the Fois gras, was exceptional. The prix fixe menu with three courses allowed me to fully indulge in the delicious offerings. While the short ribs were great, I'm excited to try something new on my next visit. The desserts, especially the caramel tart, were simply heavenly. I can't wait to return to this incredible restaurant!

I had a terrible group dining experience at this restaurant. Despite having a reservation, the service was extremely slow and inattentive. It took forever for them to bring our wine and even longer for our food. They forgot about the birthday celebration and only brought out a couple of cookies with a candle. The food was mediocre, with only a few dishes standing out. The atmosphere was nice, but the overall service was horrendous. This restaurant doesn't live up to the hype it receives.
This place offers delicious food at an affordable price. The steak was tender and the shrimp were perfectly cooked. I would definitely return in the future.

We chose Tako based on positive Yelp reviews but were disappointed with the lack of service and slow delivery of appetizers. The edamame was overcooked and the spring roll seemed frozen and unappetizing. However, the sushi itself was good, although not outstanding. Considering the slow service and underwhelming appetizers, I would not order them again if I were to return.
The catfish, chicken, gumbo, and mac & cheese at this recommended local place are simply irresistible. The lunch buffet offered piping hot and fresh dishes. Definitely worth trying!

See's Candies is a California-based bakery that has a temporary store in Tampa, Florida, at the International Plaza Mall. They offer soft and tasty chocolates, and you can try samples before buying. Their assortment of chocolates, including flavors like nut, mint, toffee, milk, white, and dark chocolate, are all delicious. They also offer the option of mail ordering through their website. It's a guilty pleasure that's worth a visit if you're in the area.

R2L offers a classy and incredible dining experience on the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place. Despite not having a window-facing table, we still enjoyed stunning views of the sunset and city skyline. The menu for Center City Restaurant Week provided multiple choices for each course. I loved the crispy peas/ham/garlic risotto balls as an appetizer and the Butcher's Filet as the main course, although it was quite heavy. The milk chocolate + hazelnut pudding was a dazzling and delicious dessert. The waiter's attentiveness and the overall ambiance added to the wonderful experience.

Becca is an exceptional bartender, with an impressive happy hour featuring land shark beer. Although the food menu is limited, the bar service is exceptional. We sincerely hope to see their business flourish and attract more local patrons.

First visit to this location was a disappointment. Didn't receive change or receipt, despite asking for it. No spoon for chili and old cheese on burger indicated lack of attention to detail. Burger tasted alright, but overall experience made me reluctant to return.

This family restaurant offers great prices for their family style menu. The pot roast we ordered was just as tasty as dining in, even as takeout. The packaging was done well, keeping our food warm throughout the 30-minute car ride. The portion size was sufficient for a family of four. Lastly, the green beans were amazing! Overall, while it may not have any unique elements, I highly recommend this good and affordable family restaurant.
Ordered a Caramel Frappe at the drive-thru, regretted it. Waited 30 minutes with just 2 cars ahead.

This place is amazing! The pizza cookies are a must-try and came hot, soft, and crazy delicious. We tried the Peanut butter and Oreo flavors, both were perfection. Being open until 3am is a brilliant move. The only downside is the prices, but when craving a fresh baked cookie pizza late at night, it's totally worth it.

The best restaurant in Philadelphia with excellent food, attentive service, and a delightful dessert. The tahini and bread are addictive, the organic beef shishkabob is superb, and the purslane salad is dream-worthy. The chicken dish with black eyed peas, green peas, and fantastic rice is beyond words. The pistachio creme brulee is pure heaven. Despite the time constraints, the service was impeccable. This is a must-visit restaurant in Philly. Kudos to the chef!
The service was disappointing - frozen pizza and skunked beer. Need I say more?

Avoid this place at all costs! Our entire family fell ill after eating here and the frozen yogurt, while visually appealing, was incredibly disappointing in terms of taste. Absolutely not worth a second visit or recommending to anyone.

This place is a hidden gem for authentic, delicious Indian street food. I've tried a variety of dishes here and each one, from bhel puri to pav bhaji, vada pav to deconstructed samosa, aloo tikki to dabeli, and even kulfi, was incredibly well-prepared. Wish I had discovered it earlier.
The Saint: A memorable experience, but not for the faint of heart. Unwanted advances, drunk patrons, and questionable atmosphere. The outdoor seating is a saving grace.
The food is amazing and fresh, especially the Wonton Soup that my kids love. They clearly put time and effort into cooking it.

The food was excellent, but the hospitality was very disappointing. Despite the restaurant still being open for another 45 minutes, they refused to let us dine in and only offered takeout. This was especially frustrating as we had pregnant women and a child with us, and explained that we had a long drive ahead. We had to go back home and make everyone eat there. I'm extremely disappointed with their treatment of customers and will not be returning. It's hard to forgive them for denying dining to pregnant women.

This place exceeded our expectations! The steak is unmatched by any other steak house I've visited. The staff, including the hostess Mallory, our waiter Max, and the busboy, work together flawlessly, ensuring a seamless dining experience. We were thoroughly impressed and will definitely return. Love this place!

I highly recommend this service! Dr. Dinh was kind and attentive, addressing all my concerns during the exam. The wide selection of frames was a plus, and the receptionist was extremely helpful and patient. Overall, a great experience and I will definitely return for my yearly exam.
Terrible pizza, slow and rude delivery, incorrect change with only coins. Avoid this place at all costs!

I tried the Sonoran hot dog at this highly recommended place during my visit. While it wasn't my personal preference due to its complexity, I have to admit it was good. However, the standout for me was the fantastic guacamole. The taco combo with chicken and carne asada was delicious, but the cabeza option was disappointing. I loved the convenience of BK's salsa bar and the efficient service with quick food delivery. Do note that it gets crowded during lunchtime on weekdays.

The restaurant had open tables, despite us being told window tables were all reserved. Food was good, with filet and salmon options. However, we were not informed about the $75 recommended wine, only that it was the last bottle available.

This Indian restaurant is the best I've ever been to! The food is incredibly fresh and delicious, particularly the palak paneer and biryani. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the overall ambiance is clean and welcoming.
The smoothies here are the best in the world, and their fresh bread is amazing. The staff is extremely knowledgeable.

My recent visit to Bell Meade in Nashville left me thoroughly impressed. Even though I couldn't find the specific bourbon I was looking for, the experience was fantastic. The tasting bar was delightful, and Max's conversation made my visit even more enjoyable. I managed to grab a bottle of Tennessee whiskey cream that I can't find anywhere else. With a five-star rating, I'll definitely be returning to Bell Meade on my next trip to Nashville.

This place is a gem for fresh seafood lovers. The food is delicious, especially the local crab special. The fried platter of shrimp, oysters, calamari, and scallops is also worth trying. The view is stunning, but be prepared to wait for a table. The waitress was helpful and friendly. Parking may be a bit challenging, but overall, it's a great spot for a seafood feast.

I strongly advise against choosing this option. The manager and wait staff displayed incredibly rude and unprofessional behavior. The food was mediocre at best, and the prices for drinks were exorbitant. Save yourself the disappointment and go elsewhere.

Despite it being my first experience with Nola food, I'm afraid my visit to this restaurant had a rough start. Our waitress seemed overwhelmed and made mistakes with our orders, including forgetting my drink and mixing up my friend's plate. The shrimp po'boy that I ordered was disappointing, with minimal lettuce and sauce accompanied by weak and soggy fries. Although other reviews indicate that this might have been an off-day for them, I sadly will not be returning and have to give a lackluster review.

This place is in desperate need of an update. It feels unsafe and definitely not suitable for kids. The service is average and everything looks worn out. The comedy club lacks any cheer or excitement, resembling a dingy banquet room. On the upside, the parking is convenient and the location is good. The owners should seriously consider investing in a renovation.

I had a great stay at the Orange St location. The apartment was spacious and had everything I needed. The only downside was that I couldn't open the windows for fresh air. The place was quiet and perfect for studying. I would definitely stay here again.

I have been a loyal customer at this restaurant for 15 years due to its amazing location and great service. However, I am disappointed with the inconsistent quality of the steak and feel it's unfair to blame the server. Despite this, I am still willing to pay a higher price for a good quality steak.

I had a terrible experience with this dealership. I made a mistake by purchasing a vehicle out of my budget, and when I tried to contact the salesman to explain, he ignored me. Finally, when I went in person, they informed me that my loan had been funded and the title had been changed, meaning I would have to sell the car back as used. I would lose a significant amount of money. Later, the bank called to say the loan had not been funded and would not approve it. The dealership has been unresponsive to my numerous messages, even after contacting an attorney. Avoid this dealership at all costs, they will lie to your face.

Desi Village in KOP may lack ambiance, but the delicious food makes up for it. Despite the tired decor and the unattractive strip mall location, the dishes such as Keema Naan, Samosas, Saag Paneer, and Lamb Biryani are perfectly seasoned, not greasy, and just the right level of spicy. Their attentiveness to special dietary requests, such as allergies, is commendable. Although it would be nice if they upgraded their surroundings, the food remains the highlight, making a return visit a must.

LA Smokehouse is absolutely amazing! After being let down by another barbecue place, we stumbled upon this gem in Mid City. The friendly staff explained everything and the food blew us away. The pulled pork was perfection, not overly sauced. The mac and cheese were incredible, and the grits had a unique smoky flavor. The owner made sure we were happy and the atmosphere was casual and comfortable. We'll definitely be coming back for more of this delicious food. LA Smokehouse is now on our BBQ favorites list!

Iris has earned its spot at the top of my favorites list in New Orleans. From the excellent food and drinks, to the impeccable service and inviting atmosphere, every aspect of this restaurant surpassed my expectations. Despite not knowing the exact number of guests, Iris went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. The layout allowed for easy movement, and the music selection was enjoyable without disrupting conversation. Our waiter was attentive and anticipated our needs perfectly. The limited lunch drink menu did not disappoint, and the food was creatively arranged and delicious. I appreciated the European-sized portions and the use of locally sourced ingredients. Opting for the prix fixe menu offered great value, and I will definitely be returning regardless of the group size.

Great atmosphere and decor with super friendly staff. Lunch special of Pad Thai with chicken was flavorful and portion size was good. Chicken satay for dinner was a bit disappointing with only two small skewers, but flavor and peanut dipping sauce were excellent. Panang Curry had a good portion size and came with a side of rice. Disappointed that they don't have Pad See Ew, but still willing to try other menu options. Overall, great customer service and I look forward to returning soon!

Petra Restaurant near our home offers delicious Middle Eastern cuisine. We randomly decided to try it with my family and were pleasantly surprised. The Friday and Saturday special rice with lamb is especially delicious, reminiscent of Indian fried rice. The other menu items are also very good. Despite the location, the inside of the restaurant is nice and the service is good too.
I had an amazing birthday experience at The Pearl! Impeccable food, wine, and service, and the staff were so accommodating even after closing time.

I stopped by Albertsons because I wanted some snacks. The store was clean, well-stocked with wide aisles and a good selection of bakery items, flowers, and regular groceries. What impressed me was that they had some locally made snacks like California Kettle Corn and Taco Works. I found the chips I wanted that other stores don't always carry and grabbed a Diet Coke at the checkout. The parking lot was convenient and the staff was friendly and helpful. Thank you, Albertsons!
The recent change in ownership resulted in a disappointing experience with both the food and service. It's a shame as I used to love this place.

Dr. Gloudemans is a fantastic doctor who is knowledgeable, friendly, and up-to-date with the latest research. She strongly supports vaccinations, which is a major plus. She takes a proactive approach to health concerns, suggesting follow-ups if necessary. However, there have been some billing issues that caused frustration, but they were resolved after a phone call.

I attended a meeting at the Homebuilders Association of New Orleans and had a great experience. The food was delicious, particularly the corn and crab soup and the grits and grillades. The portions were a bit small, but the taste made up for it. The mimosa was also good. The price was around $10, which is reasonable. I didn't get to test the Wi-Fi, but based on the ambiance and quality of food, I would definitely go back.

The Frist's cafe is not my regular choice for lunch, but on occasional dreary days, I indulge in their Cobb Salad. Perfect for gluten-free diners, I recommend adding an extra egg for a protein boost. With affordable prices and quick service, it attracts museum visitors and local employees. However, be wary of Senior Mondays and weekend lunchtimes, as it tends to get busy around 11:30-noon.

Ghini's serves incredibly delicious food, especially for French breakfast lovers. The eggs provencale, with basted eggs, hot house tomato, and fragrant herbs, are a unique and tasty choice. Don't forget to try the baguette toast and add the affordable hashbrowns. The crepes, both sweet and savory, are also delightful, with the spinach and Swiss being a personal favorite. Highly recommended.

I highly recommend this unique spot! The graffiti-style art on the walls, delicious food options, and special hummus flavors make it stand out. The prices are good, and the portion size is great. I thoroughly enjoyed the Greek steak pita with guac hummus. I will definitely be returning!

Prep & Pastry is a must-visit brunch spot in town. The trick of adding your name to the waitlist before arriving is a game-changer. The food, especially the breakfast sandwich, is consistently excellent, including their sweets. Their iced tea is top-notch. The staff is incredibly friendly. Highly recommended.

The Fringe festival in Edmonton offers a fantastic variety of performances, street performers, and musicians. The venue and play options are diverse, and there is a convenient online schedule for show times and ticket purchasing. The addition of food and artisan vendors adds to the overall experience. Don't miss the delicious gourmet mini donut truck hidden behind the farmers market. Even without watching a play, it's enjoyable to explore the street performances and shop at the vendors. The location is excellent.

I used to love this place, but it has really gone downhill. The customer service was disappointing, with an unhelpful server who didn't even offer a tea to go. The food was okay, but not enough to make up for the poor treatment. The deteriorating benches with tape on them also looked tacky. Sadly, this is no longer my favorite lunch spot and I won't be returning.

Prompt communication is definitely a plus. However, we decided to go with a different plumber for the current job due to their higher quote compared to others we interviewed. Despite this, we may reconsider them for future projects as they appear to be reliable, and quality often comes with a higher price.
Absolutely delicious Mexican food in Florida! I fell in love with it from my first bite and have been returning ever since!
Real Thai food with the option to make it spicy. Soups are a standout, while curries have great flavor but can be runny. Veggie eggrolls are okay, might be better with meat filling.

Jump on the School Bus was the perfect choice for our winery and brewery tour and wedding transportation. Darin and Sierra were flexible and accommodating, making last minute adjustments as needed. Their attention to detail and quality, including a visit to one of the wineries, exceeded our expectations. Our driver was knowledgeable and provided great suggestions. Highly recommended for any wine and beer tour or wedding transportation needs!

Bailey's Range is a must-visit spot for out-of-town guests. The burgers are incredible and the boozy shakes are unmatched. The horchata shake is a dream! The location is perfect, close to downtown attractions. The burger selection is extensive, offering unique combinations like mac n cheese patties. The honest waitstaff is a refreshing touch. The burger showdown is a fun event. The only drawback is occasional overcooking of requested burger temperatures. Overall, highly recommended with a 4/5 rating.
This breakfast sandwich on a biscuit is absolutely amazing—possibly the best ever! So delicious!

I had a terrible experience at the university location of Silver Mine. The staff made mistakes with my order, the food was cold, and the employee was rude. I will never be returning to this place again. Goodbye Silver Mine!

I had a fabulous experience at this salon! Grace did an amazing job on my difficult hair, which is super long and thick. The atmosphere was great - modern, clean, and no snobbiness. Pricing was totally reasonable. Highly recommend!

The food at this cozy Sunday Buffet was delicious - from the fried chicken to the greens, smothered steak, corn, and cabbage. It felt like eating at your grandmother's house. Despite not being a fancy restaurant, the fair price and local recommendations made it worth any wait. This place truly exceeded my expectations.

I recently ordered a Passion Passport and absolutely loved it! The combination of passion fruit juice blend, bananas, pineapple mango juice blend, papaya juice blend, and raw cane sugar was simply delicious and refreshingly satisfying. The name itself truly captures its delectable essence.

We had a fantastic private tour with Carrie today. Despite the rain and less crowded park, her enthusiasm and extensive knowledge about the Civil War were truly captivating. The Battle of Franklin is undoubtedly deserving of its own remarkable memorial.

I highly recommend this automotive service. They offer the best prices in town and the level of customer service is outstanding. From the first phone call, I was treated wonderfully and they addressed all my concerns. They managed to fit me in that same day when I had a cracked windshield, and not only did they fix it efficiently, but also vacuumed, wiped down the inside of my car, and washed the windows. The waiting area is cozy and they even offer complimentary tea, water, and candies. Unlike my previous experience with fast glass, they treated me with respect and made me feel valued. I will definitely be returning to this place for any future automotive needs.

Reviewer is extremely upset about discovering an unexpected $220 overdraft fee and being put on hold for 45 minutes when calling TD Bank for assistance. The representative was helpful but failed to mention the long wait. Learned that TD Bank's new policy charges overdraft fees instead of declining transactions with insufficient funds. The reviewer expresses frustration and plans to switch banks. Also mentions rebellious behavior toward the bank's cameras while making a deposit.

Great 3-night stay at Four Points in November. Smooth check-in, competitive room rate with free breakfast included. Convenient location close to the airport with other hotels nearby. Friendly and helpful staff, comfortable room, and hassle-free parking. Peaceful nights.

Located conveniently near Union Station Metro, this hotel is a great value on weekends. Prices skyrocket during the week due to business travelers. The room was clean, the bed was luxuriously comfortable with plenty of pillows. The spacious bathroom had a bathtub and an abundant supply of white towels. Deducted one star due to the poor coffee machine in the room and the thin door that allowed noise from the hallway. However, the main lobby is impressive and definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

The Mexican food here is exceptional. The fried fish taco is amazing, and everything else is just as good. My only regret is not getting their red sauce and birria to-go. Note that there is no air conditioning, but the food makes up for it.

Endurance House is a game-changer for runners. Their vast shoe selection, friendly staff, and personalized assistance in finding the perfect pair to enhance your stride and prevent injuries sets them apart. I'll definitely be a returning customer, knowing I'll get a great price and top-notch shoes every time.

HipCity offers a super lunch option for both meat-eaters and vegetarians. Their buffalo bella and crispy hipcity ranch sandwiches are amazing alternatives, and the green lemonade is a great pairing. The staff is friendly and efficient, but the small space can get congested and confusing during peak times. Overall, the food is great.
This place falsely advertised a 10PM closing time but denied service at 8:30PM. Unlocked doors and covered kitchen equipment were perplexing. Ridiculously early closure.
No contest, this place has the best Chinese food in town. Owners are incredibly pleasant, and their complimentary wontons make waiting for takeout so enjoyable.

Rosemary's Grill is my favorite restaurant. The menu offers a wide variety of delicious Classic American and Turkish cuisine. The kebabs are particularly amazing, especially the Adana kebab. The portion sizes are generous and the staff treats you like part of their family. The quality of the food and service is exceptional. This place is truly our favorite spot and we highly recommend it.
The staff is extremely friendly and the environment is pleasant. Surprisingly, there were not many people both times I visited. However, the $3.50 margaritas after 4 on Tuesdays are delicious.
I would not recommend this place, even if it's the only option at 2am. The basic general tso's did not meet my expectations. I suggest trying East Cuisine instead.

The food at this place is good, with the blueberry lasagna and chocolate confection being superb. However, the waiter had a pretentious and haughty attitude, which almost made me give this place a higher rating.

The flavors at this ice cream shop are a pleasant surprise. I tried various flavors including Bananas Foster, Pear Champagne Sorbet, Blueberry Fig Sorbet, and Cassis sorbet. While all flavors were good, the Cassis started off subtly and grew in flavor with each bite. It's definitely worth returning with friends to enjoy this delightful frozen treat.

Best pizza ever, hands down! The people running the place, especially the former hockey player and his adorable but tough wife, are hilarious. They make their own sausage and mozzarella, and their attention to detail is unmatched. Don't even think about mispronouncing Ricotta! Every pizza on the menu is fabulous, and even the crusts are worth savoring. Try dipping them in olive oil or their delicious vinaigrette for an extra treat.
The sales staff was friendly and Mike was extremely helpful. He took us for a ride in one of the Razors, which was a great experience. It made us consider getting one ourselves.

This place is a gem! Good food, great service, and their zucchini muffins are a must-try! I can't resist taking some home with me. Prices are affordable and the frozen yogurt bar with unlimited toppings is fantastic. Highly recommended for a delightful experience. Yum yum!

The all-you-can-eat experience was disappointing due to long wait times and poor service. The rolls had undisclosed extras, including an unpleasant surprise of sweet mustard sauce. However, once the orders were placed, they were prepared relatively quickly.

The restaurant had a beautiful ambiance and was spotless. Everyone in our group loved their meals. Although my dish arrived late, the fried green tomatoes were superb and the accompanying sauce was delicious. The chicken salad, fried bologna sandwich, and cheeseburger were also top-notch. Don't miss out on the peach cobbler dessert, especially with a side of ice cream - it won't disappoint!
The food is enjoyable; however, the cafe's uncleanliness is a major downfall. Unlikely to revisit until cleanliness is improved.
We loved this place! Delicious food, generous portions, and the chicken parm was absolutely scrumptious. Can't wait to return and explore more of their menu!

Overall, this burger joint is decent. The bacon cheeseburger was impressive, with perfectly cooked bacon and a nicely toasted bun. The fries and chocolate shake were also enjoyable. However, I found the burger lacking juiciness and the portion size for the price was disappointing. Additionally, leaving the place smelling like burger grease was not ideal.

After reading good Yelp reviews, I tried this place out. It was empty and the food was average. Disappointed, I ended up going to Charlie's across the street. The bustling atmosphere and amazing redtop pizza made me regret not going there first. This place is decent for a sit-down meal but for great pizza, go to Charlie's.

This Whole Foods location is a gem. The variety of natural cosmetics and handmade soaps in the personal care section is unmatched. The produce, seafood, and cheese are also top-notch. The deli offers a delightful selection of soup, salad, and sushi to-go boxes. And don't forget to try the lavender soda for a truly calming experience.
The Mediterranean chicken quesadillas are absolutely amazing with an awesome sauce! Highly recommend to Greek food lovers.

Incredible place! Spacious, modern, and impeccably clean. Will, Amanda, and Sal are amazing. Always there to help, especially for a newbie like me. Wide variety of juices, mods, and atty's to try. Totally in love with this spot!

Great tasting breakfast options, tried nearly everything and this place is definitely the spot for breakfast. Only gripe is that the monte cisto is overpriced for what it is, not worth it unless they lower the price by $5. Everything else tastes great, especially the Jebbs open face and huevos rancheros. Coffee is addictive. No reservations, arrive early or 30 minutes before you're hungry. Enjoy.

Had a terrible experience at this place. Called ahead to request a deboned duck, but the girl answering the phone had trouble understanding my order. Ended up receiving a whole duck with stuffing I did not ask for. When I called to complain, they offered no compensation, only a trade-in option. Disappointed with the terrible customer service overshadowing the food.

I highly recommend visiting the preserve! The hikes are enjoyable with abundant wildlife, and the paths are well-marked. The birds of prey aviary is impressive and the learning center is both educational and comfortable. The staff and volunteers are friendly and helpful. Don't miss the chance to see the birds up close with the handlers in the mid afternoon.

This diner in North Wilmington is average at best. The food is ordinary and there is nothing remarkable about the place. It served as a decent choice after swim meets, but there are no standout qualities to mention.

We thoroughly enjoyed the food, service, and decor at this restaurant! Upon our arrival, the manager greeted us warmly with a huge smile. Our server, Christina, was delightful. The beer selection was impressive, and we particularly loved the chicken rabe sandwich on tasty focaccia bread. The pepperoni pizza was superb, perfectly cooked to our "well done" preference. We plan on returning, although our only concern is the absence of a children's menu for our picky 7-year-old.

I regularly visit student salons for haircuts and styling, including the Aveda Institute. The results can vary due to different stylists, but overall, the experience has been positive. Keep in mind that the cuts can take longer compared to professionals, usually around 2 hours. The basic cut includes a wash, cut, and blowdry style, with the stylists checking in with their teachers for guidance. The stylists at Aveda have been professional and dedicated, and the prices are affordable.
Great food, friendly staff. Fast service and generous portions. Highly recommend sitting outside for a good dining experience.
The food and service were excellent. The menu offers a great variety of options. I highly recommend trying the Monte Cristo crepes, they were absolutely amazing. I'll definitely be returning.

This hidden gem on Bourbon St. is a great alternative to Cafe du Monde. The beignets were delicious, if not better, and the best part was no line! It's a calm oasis in the morning, although the lack of live music was a downside. The full breakfast options like the crawfish omelet and Cajun hashbrowns were decent but, let's be honest, the beignets steal the show.

Mixx offers a vast menu and affordable prices, making it a perfect option for those seeking fast and budget-friendly sushi. The quality may not be the city's finest, but if you're in a hurry, it's a great choice.

Extremely unprofessional and disrespectful. Initially received reasonable quotes from a friendly staff member for a battery and brakes. However, when I called to schedule an appointment, a rude individual named Mike or Nick denied the previously offered price, blaming me instead. Upon requesting to speak to someone else, he abruptly ended the call. I strongly advise against contacting this establishment. Will opt for Walmart instead.

I would strongly advise against choosing this place for any type of service or purchase. The lack of a dedicated customer service department is a major flaw. They rely on their sales team to handle customer inquiries, resulting in frustrating experiences where calls go unanswered or are directed to voicemail. Even leaving a voicemail for the manager proved futile, as they did not bother to return the call. 

During the car purchase process, I encountered several issues. Promised adjustments, such as removing tint on the rear window, were not fulfilled. Furthermore, the sales manager initially miscalculated the price, but I had to insist on sticking to the agreed-upon amount. These troubles persisted when attempts were made to remove the tint, necessitating multiple visits and a significant amount of time. 

Moreover, the service department proved equally unhelpful. When I sought guidance regarding a warranty claim for a leaky trunk, the lack of knowledge and assistance from the staff was disheartening. Given the poor overall service experience, I cannot trust them to properly address my concerns. 

In summary, having a dedicated customer service department is crucial for resolving complaints in a professional and timely manner. Relying solely on the sales team for customer service is not a viable approach. The salesperson tried their best, but the lack of support from management and other departments leaves a negative impression overall.

I highly recommend this restaurant as the owners are incredibly kind and welcoming. The food is scrumptious, with the bacon pizza being my absolute favorite. It's wonderful that they have a play room for children, ensuring an enjoyable wait for our meal.
This Asian restaurant is a must-visit! The fried rice is absolutely amazing and the prices are great. Highly recommended as one of the best in town.

Harry's Blue Bell is a small, tucked away spot that seems to be popular among locals. The inside is nice but small, with limited tables. The service was average. The beer selection is great and the prices are reasonable. The food menu, however, is limited to basic bar food. The bbq pulled pork was good, but the sauce was too sweet. The chicken and honey mustard wrap was fresh but nothing special. The fries were hot and crispy, and the kale slaw was fantastic but in a small portion. Overall, it was a decent meal, but not worth going out of the way for. A solid 3 stars.

Kajuns addressed the smoke issue with smoke eaters, making the air breathable for those sensitive to cigarette smoke. Headaches are no longer a problem, and it's hard to notice smoking while inside. Clothes may still smell like smoke after leaving, but overall, Kajuns staff is dedicated to improving customer experiences. Thank you, Kajuns!

I was introduced to Brio's by my foodie friends at work, and I absolutely love it! From the complimentary bread and chips to the bruschetta, pasta, and salads, everything is delicious. The restaurant itself is beautiful, and the service is top-notch.
Extremely disappointed with this Tucson establishment. Food was cold and service was shockingly rude. Although they seem to have a promising concept, their execution falls short.
Gennaro's never disappoints. Thin crust, sweet tomato sauce, and fresh mozzarella make every bite delightful. The meatballs are also superb. Adorable vintage decor adds to the charm. Love it here!

Stopped by on a Monday evening and found a lively atmosphere with friendly service. The bar had a good selection, though I can't speak for the drinks. However, the standout here is the food. The Pear Gorgonzola Melt was a plateful of deliciousness. Perfect spot for a tasty sandwich at a reasonable price (~$10) and watching sports.

The restaurant had a pleasant atmosphere with friendly service and reasonable prices. However, the food was rather bland, not terrible but unremarkable. After a long drive, it satisfied our hunger, but our overall experience was middling and we probably won't return.
Great spot for a drink with friendly staff. However, cleanliness concerns may deter me from dining there.

This Greek-owned pancake house is a fantastic alternative to larger pancake chains. They offer delicious breakfast options like freedom toast and freedom fries. Every New Year's Day, we visit this place around 2 pm and they always accommodate our group of 12-15 people. The service is fast and friendly, and the owner ensures everything runs smoothly. In my opinion, the food is even better than the chains, and I think the secret ingredient is love.

Unfortunately, my recent visit to Fresh was disappointing. The service and product quality were below their usual standard, and the prices were exorbitant. The staff didn't greet me upon entering, even though I understand that my group took up most of the space. Moreover, the Vienna Latte I ordered was not only one of the worst espresso drinks I've ever had, but it was also ridiculously expensive. This experience has definitely put me off from ordering anything from Fresh again, which is a shame because I've always praised their products in the past.

Overall, the service for our large group was adequate but not exceptional. One member received their food late, and the closeout process could use improvement. Adding a tip for the large group made the bill easy. 
I ordered the lamb kebab plate with rice and babaghanoush. The rice was well-cooked and aromatic, while the babaghanoush was delicious with extra olive oil. The presentation of the dish was pleasant. Unfortunately, the meat was dry and lacked sufficient marinade. This area needs improvement.
I've visited this restaurant before, and previous experiences were better, particularly during Ramadan when they offer an attractive and diverse buffet. The Ramadan buffet starts at 8:30, but it's best to arrive early due to high customer demand.
I highly recommend this place for bird enthusiasts. Friendly staff and a great spot to visit on a Sunday morning.

I had a pleasant dining experience at this old club turned restaurant. The food, particularly the sashimi plate and burger and fries, was delicious. However, the service was disappointing. I had to fetch my own plates, sauce bowls, and napkins, and they forgot to bring a glass for my son until I requested it. Despite this, the dinner was enjoyable, and I would consider returning if the service improved.

Cuenelli's Peruvian Style Rotisserie Chicken offers a flavorful and tender chicken that is marinated and seasoned to perfection. The smoky element from the charcoal oven adds a unique touch. The chicken is served with delicious dipping sauces, and the sides, such as cilantro rice and spicy pinto beans, complement the meal well. The maduros, or sweet plantains, are a must-try with their caramelized exterior and soft interior. Refreshing drinks like Inca cola and chicha limena complete the experience. This chicken is made with love and will redefine your perception of rotisserie chicken.

I recently treated myself to a birthday meal at this place and it was amazing. The plain burger I ordered was perfectly cooked and seasoned, and despite feeling a little odd eating it with a knife and fork, it was worth it. The salad was decent with just the right amount of dressing. The bartender/waiter was attentive and made delicious sazeracs to complement my meal. I'll definitely be back to try their fancier burger options.

I visited this place during lunchtime on a Monday and sat at the bar. The service was prompt and efficient. Opted for the carne asada taco lunch special and was pleasantly surprised by its above-average quality. Extremely satisfied with my experience here.
I highly recommend these guys! Tony was incredibly helpful and fixed my flat tire for less than his initial estimate. Thank you!
I had a fantastic experience with my hairdresser who was attentive to my preferences and made sure that I was satisfied throughout the entire haircut. Highly recommended!

The sweet and sour chicken and chicken chow mein were both excellent, with particularly delicious chicken cuts in the chow mein. I've also tried the sushi a few times and thoroughly enjoyed it. While a bit pricey, the food is undeniably great.

In summary, the reviewer had a negative experience with Comcast. Despite being a loyal customer for 14 years, their bill was consistently high and attempts to lower it were unsuccessful until they decided to cancel. The reviewer switched to Verizon and found better service and overall satisfaction. They express a strong dislike for Comcast and their perceived lack of concern for customer satisfaction.

B's Diner is a hidden gem, filled with charming antiques and a friendly staff. The community support they provide makes them deserving of your patronage. If you're seeking an affordable and flavorful meal in a laid-back atmosphere, this is the place for you. While I haven't tried it yet, the Elk sausage and perogie poutine comes highly recommended. Enjoy the lively people-watching experience, from bar staff to hipsters and musicians.

Food has drastically declined in quality at this restaurant over the past year. The buffet offerings are overwhelmingly salty, the pulled turkey is tough, and the fish tastes like meat tenderizer. Vegetables are overcooked and have a putty-like texture. The only somewhat enjoyable dishes were the corn pudding and mashed potatoes. Desserts are mediocre, resembling store-bought quality. On a positive note, the service was good, with prompt drink refills and plate removal.
Horrible service, slow and unprofessional staff, disappointing food. Definitely avoid this place.

Fellini's Cafe in Newtown Square is a romantic BYOB with big portions at decent prices. Although there were some hiccups in service and minor issues with the food, overall it was delicious and the manager's gesture of allowing an expired gift card was appreciated. I will continue visiting this restaurant as they do most things well and it's affordable.

The Catbird Seat was underwhelming with a large, awkward entrance and strange seating arrangement. The drinks were average to bad, the crowd was stuffy, and the food was forgettable. The only highlight was the tenderloin, but overall, the experience was overpriced and disappointing.

I visited Stitch-It in June 2013 and they did an excellent job on my dress. Despite the tight turnaround, they were able to accommodate me and the results far exceeded my expectations. I would definitely use them again.

This place is absolutely amazing! The staff is incredible - from their exceptional work to their wonderful personalities. Jenne made me feel so comfortable during my first Brazilian and provided a fantastic blow-out. Plus, their sense of humor had me laughing throughout my visit. I'm eagerly looking forward to returning!

If you're in New Jersey, particularly in Camden, Santana's is a must-visit for breakfast and pastries. Their coffee surpasses Starbucks, Dunkin' Donuts, and other well-known chains. The pastries are exceptional and rival those in Boricua, Puerto Rico. As a neighboring business in Pennsauken, we make it a daily stop.

This place offers delicious food at a reasonable price. The escargot could have been more traditional, but still enjoyable. For an extra $50, you can dine with the ghost of the former owner who died on the second floor. The experience takes place at a solitary table in a cold, dungeon-like room.

The best burger joint in Philly! Modest place with great food. Customizable menu, perfectly cooked burgers, and delicious hand-cut fries. Don't forget to download the SPOT app for rewards and free fries.

I highly recommend these guys for getting replacement keys made for your car! My mechanic referred me to them and they definitely lived up to the recommendation. They took good care of me and were very thorough in their job. They made a test copy of my key before cutting on the blanks, which I really appreciated. They also checked that both keys worked in all doors and the trunk before giving them to me. Great attitude and attention to detail. Save yourself some money and go to these guys instead of the dealership!

This salon is a stunning gem! Impeccably clean, organized, and with a delightful and knowledgeable staff. Owner Doug, a true standout with an impressive resume, offers regular training to keep his staff up-to-date. I trust this place implicitly with my hair. Highly recommended for both locals and visitors alike.

Bab Cafe is a delightful addition to Reno's restaurant scene, offering a diverse menu and efficient service. The Dak-Galbi Bibim-bab, accompanied by fresh vegetables and delicious sauces, was incredibly satisfying. The potstickers were a definite highlight. The only downside is the challenging downtown parking situation.
Mr. B's is a must-visit brunch spot in New Orleans. The Brandy Milk Punch is amazing and the shrimp and grits are to die for. Don't miss out on the fresh bread and butter too. Highly recommended!

I highly recommend this salon based on their professional and clean environment. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about their services and prices. I had a great experience getting my armpits waxed, with Despina being a skilled specialist who made the process relatively painless. The hard wax used was effective on my stubborn, thick hair. The price was also reasonable at $16. I have already scheduled my next appointment and may come in sooner for a bikini wax. Overall, the service was excellent with a great atmosphere. Trustworthy salon!
Gus, the falafel nazi, lives up to his reputation and more. Delicious chicken cooked over coal, perfectly cooked falafel, and fresh ingredients. Generous portions and worth the wait!
SRS is an exceptional management company. Highly accommodating and responsive to specific requests. Highly recommended.

Fresco serves wonderful fresh and tasty pizza at reasonable prices. The restaurant was clean and inviting, and the young owner's passion for quality food is evident. The meat-special pizza was crispy, tender, and loaded with toppings. Highly recommend!

Overall, our experience at this restaurant was positive. The place was clean and nicely decorated, and the service was excellent and friendly. The food was good, especially for the parents, but it was too spicy for the kids and grandparents. The dim lighting made it difficult for the grandparents to read the menu. However, the veggie wings, cactus, and sweet potato burritos were delicious. The guacamole was also tasty, although the spicy chips were a bit overwhelming. One great thing about the restaurant was that they offered pitchers of margaritas, which was perfect for our large group.

I was pleasantly surprised by Zaxby's as a self-proclaimed fast-food skeptic. The service was exceptional and the staff's enthusiasm was refreshing. The chicken finger sandwiches were juicy, although the greasy Texas toast was a minor setback. The sauce variety was good, but lacked some traditional Buffalo flavors. Despite these small flaws, the meal was enjoyable, and the affordable prices were a bonus. Zaxby's puts a unique southern spin on chicken fingers and I'm a fan.

The baked goodies from this kitchen are simply outstanding. Each treat is filled with immense flavor and has the perfect texture. The delicate and decorative detailing is absolutely phenomenal, reflecting the time and love put into each piece. The signature flavors are all fantastic, and I particularly adore the classic cream cheese frosting. If you're seeking cakes, cupcakes, pies, cookies, or anything sweet, do yourself a favor and indulge in Sugar Coated. Treat yourself and your loved ones to this incredible experience!

Despite the unique location and appealing brand and products, the service at this specific store is extremely disappointing. The wait times are unbearable, assistance is lacking, and getting a gift wrapped during Christmas is a frustrating ordeal. Even after leaving my items at the store for gift wrapping, they were not touched when I returned after nearly two hours. The staff completely disregarded my time constraints, causing me to miss a gift-giving opportunity. Today's poor experience has led me to decide that I will no longer shop at this location. I will cancel my card, switch to online shopping, and avoid visiting the store whenever possible. It's truly unfortunate.
The staff includes friendly and helpful ladies, although one may be unfriendly if provoked. It becomes evident quickly. Just a heads up.

"Hendricks in St. Louis is a must-try for barbecue lovers. The meats, sauces, and sides surpass other barbecue places. The onion rings are huge and the coleslaw is delicious and finely shredded. The service is friendly and efficient. Although it takes a while to get the meal, the unique decor is worth exploring during the wait."

We had a great experience at this restaurant with a good variety of food for a late night dinner with kids. The person who served us was friendly and helpful. Our waiter, Eric, went above and beyond with outstanding service, making our dining experience memorable. The staff at the grill house station showed thoughtfulness and accommodated our allergy request without hesitation. We wish there was a similar restaurant near us in upper PA.

This coffee spot didn't meet my expectations. No menu and a lack of coffee options made me hesitant. I ordered an iced tea but received hot tea with a cup of ice. The artsy crowd was interesting for people-watching, but not conducive to studying due to the loud atmosphere. Despite friendly servers and regular table cleaning, it wasn't a standout experience that would make me a regular customer.

I highly recommend visiting Milk and Honey! Shoutout to Kyle, who was an amazing and chill waiter. He deserves a raise for his excellent service. The honey hot sauce he recommended was the best I've had in ages. The biscuits were heavenly, even though I stole one from my friend. Definitely come here and ask for Kyle. I miss him and hope to be reunited soon.

Went to this Philadelphia pub before a show in the University City area. Convenient location near the train station and Drexel University with street parking available nearby. Service was satisfactory for dinner. Mac and cheese appetizer had a nice crunchy topping, but taste was average. Cheesesteak egg rolls were decent, although lacking in meat. Accompanied by ketchup and a flavorful mustard with horseradish. The chicken pot pie had ample vegetables and all white meat, but not a lot of chicken. Crust was mostly flaky, but one section seemed undercooked. Desserts were generous in size. Bread pudding was average and served with vanilla ice cream. Brownie was dry and lacked flavor, but may be subjective to personal taste.

I attended a bachelorette party here on a Saturday night in April. Arrive early to avoid the long line. The cover band is amazing, and there were many other celebratory groups. Signature cocktails are good but expensive. Ideal for bachelorette parties or birthdays, but crowded on regular nights.

The best fall off the bone BBQ I've ever had! Pulled pork had a perfect smoky flavor, and the mac and cheese was creamy and delicious. Fast and friendly service. The walnut brownie and ice cream dessert was delightful. A great find!

I had a disappointing experience at Copabanana during restaurant week. The outdoor seating was disturbed by noisy kids playing football, even after we moved. The food was subpar, with overcooked steak and stale mashed potatoes. The only positive was the friendly waitress, but even she couldn't salvage the experience. I won't be returning. 1 star for the waitress.
The shrimp and grits at this place are unbeatable, and the fresh juices complement the meal perfectly. Even after two visits in two years, my fiance still believes it's the best he's ever had.
