Finally! A gem in Nashville for tapas! The staff is friendly and the open kitchen adds to the ambiance. The food is absolutely delicious. Can't wait to return and explore more of their menu.
Awesome seafood, no fuss, and the sourdough bread was delicious! The cherry on top was the fantastic 80s music playing in the background.

Dr. Curtis Dechant provides exceptional care with a friendly attitude, creating a positive patient-doctor relationship. The office is comfortable and equipped with the latest technology, making eye appointments more pleasant. The eyeglass frame selection and accommodating staff are also noteworthy.
Overall, the place is cute with great food and a fantastic pear cider beer. The service was excellent, the ambiance was delightful, and the prices were reasonable.

Seasons is a delightful little restaurant primarily known for its delicious desserts. However, they also offer modernized versions of traditional classics as main courses. The shaved ice at Seasons is unique and their variety of boba tea is excellent. The store is conveniently located with ample parking and a clean, modern, and kid-friendly atmosphere. The service is always friendly, fast, and efficient. While I cannot personally vouch for the food, my boyfriend raves about the quail and our friends love the chicken wings. Overall, I highly recommend visiting Seasons for a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience.
The place is cute for meeting friends, but overpriced. Personally, I prefer my own homemade coffee. Adorable concept, but products and prices need improvement.

This place is simply amazing! With 75 cent oysters that I couldn't resist, I indulged in 2 dozen before moving on to their delicious cheesy grits. Truly a great spot for dining, especially during happy hour.

Highly recommend this place! Love the organic, fresh, and delicious food. Variety of options and love that they support local farmers and fishermen. Carly's breakfast is a favorite with avocado, sourdough toast, fried egg, and sweet potatoes. Sooo good!

The burgers at this place are delicious and flavorful, especially the El Mariachi. The portion size might be small, but the taste makes up for it. I highly recommend trying the salted caramel ice cream, it has a great homemade style. Don't forget to add the rooster sauce for an extra kick!

I had an amazing experience at this place! The sushi was surprisingly delicious and the bill was unbelievably low. For just $13, I devoured a plate full of sushi. The staff was not only friendly, but also seemed to enjoy their work. I had a great time and will definitely be returning soon.

This place is terrible. The hoagies are greasy and made me nauseous. The buffalo chicken sandwich was covered in too much blue cheese and greasy sauce, which was disgusting. All the food is overly greasy and over seasoned, they need to use fresher ingredients. The desserts are bland and not worth the money. The sodas are usually expired and flat. Overall, I hate everything about this place.

Despite paying for a non-smoking room, we were disappointed to find a smell and ashtrays in the room. The slow-draining shower and lumpy pillows were also uncomfortable, resulting in a migraine. On a positive note, the room was clean and the staff was friendly. However, the promised free WiFi didn't connect.
The pharmacy staff was unfriendly and provided inconsistent information about prescription wait times. Not recommended if you're in a hurry; consider going to Walmart next door instead.

I love the seitan dishes at El Camino, like the wings and nachos. However, the service can be extremely slow. They once took so long to bring out my nachos that they gave them to me for free. The fried pickles, on the other hand, were disappointing. The coating was too grainy and the taste didn't appeal to me. Despite these drawbacks, the delicious seitan and decent margaritas keep me returning to El Camino.

I highly recommend B13 for tattoos. I've had two done there and both turned out amazing. The owner was able to accommodate a group of us on short notice with an impressive design. Amanda's work is particularly outstanding, although the entire team is fantastic.
Went on a busy Friday night with a 20 min wait. Service was hit and miss, though the server tried their best. Food was okay, but not impressive. Unlikely to return, it just didn't stand out.

I highly recommend Twisted Twig for all your floral needs. Jen provides excellent service, is very friendly, and creates amazing arrangements. She worked within my budget and delivered exactly what I wanted for my wedding. I was pleasantly surprised by her attention to detail and the extra touches she added to make everything perfect. You will not be disappointed working with Jen at Twisted Twig.

Overall, the restaurant had some great dishes like the seaweed salad, shiomay, and sashimi which were fresh and delicious. However, the service was lacking as our waiter was unfriendly and made assumptions about our order. While the banzai roll was unique and tasty, the salad dressing tasted more like carrot purée. One star was deducted due to the subpar service.

I recently discovered this hidden gem for brunch and was blown away. Despite living so close, I had never heard of it before. The honeybee crepe and almond croissant were absolutely delicious, leaving nothing for leftovers. The seating area is cozy, but it's best to arrive early if you're with a group. Perfect for smaller groups and I will definitely be returning.
Best location ever! Donuts are made to order, and after 5pm they are always super hot and incredibly tasty. Even the next day, they remain delicious.
Highly recommended! This place is adorable and sustainable. The staff is amazing, and the food and coffee are extraordinary.

Horrible food quality and overpriced, coupled with a frustrating two-hour delivery time and rude customer service over the phone. Regrettable choice to order from this establishment, definitely won't be repeating the experience.
I absolutely love Evan! He is the best guy ever and the reason I come to OMALLZ.
Disappointing experience - tasteless burger, soggy bun, and overly salty fries. Overpriced for the quality. Won't return.

I was pleasantly surprised to discover a Taiwanese restaurant in Reno, conveniently located near all of the hotels. The boba tea was solid, and they offer authentic Taiwanese food choices if you know what to order.

This restaurant is a complete disappointment and not worth your money. Despite dining here twice, we've had such terrible experiences that corporate had to refund us. It's clear that this place is clueless and you will only be ripped off.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Despite my initial hesitation as a vegetarian, they offer a delicious veggie burger and a great variety of local microbrews. Don't miss out on their homemade ice cream! I'll definitely be returning when I'm in St. Louis again.

Zaika is a hidden gem for Indian food lovers. The fresh ingredients and attention to detail in their dishes set them apart from other Indo-Pak places. The Paneer is silky and flavorful, and even their vegetarian options are so delicious that you won't miss the meat. The appetizers are well-spiced and reminiscent of homemade meals. The naan is perfectly cooked, though it lacks the faint sweetness it's known for. The extensive menu makes ordering easy, and their catering services are highly praised. Overall, Zaika offers a delightful dining experience, and their Ras Malai dessert is a must-try.

This bustling restaurant exceeded our expectations with its special coffee, attentive service, accommodating for dietary restrictions, and delectable dishes. The presentation and pricing were both satisfactory. We highly recommend this restaurant.

I highly recommend this place! The staff is incredibly friendly and great with kids. The food, especially the hash browns, is amazing. You can also try their delicious tomatoes and grits on the side. Best of all, it's budget-friendly.

The gelato at this place is delicious, but the service is extremely poor. During my recent visit with a friend from out of town, we encountered unprofessional behavior from the night staff, which made my friend feel uncomfortable. Even the young manager did not improve the situation. The service used to be great here, but something appears to have gone wrong recently.

Fantastic location for outdoor activities like hiking, biking, and running with well-maintained paths, stunning views, and shady spots. However, the only drawback is people not adhering to the dogs on leash rule, with at least 6 off-leash dogs encountered. It's crucial to follow the rules; otherwise, they might ban dogs altogether.

I highly recommend this place! The crab cake appetizer was delicious with a refreshing dill sauce. The chicken tenders were generous in portion and satisfying. The service was fine, although it can get busy at times. The prices were unbelievably reasonable. The ambiance is nice and overall, it's a lovely option for great food at a reasonable price.

Outstanding service, delicious food & friendly staff. Constant promotions keep us coming back. Incredible fish quality & well-proportioned rolls allow for diverse selection. Our go-to sushi spot in town!

My boyfriend and I tried Jesse's for the first time and had a great experience. Despite being busy, we were seated quickly by the window. The server, Nikki, was prompt and knowledgeable. The appetizers and soups were tasty, although the crab stuffed mushrooms were small. The Caesar salads were good and the pacing of the meal was perfect. The steaks were cooked perfectly, but there weren't enough sautéed mushrooms. Overall, Nikki's service was fantastic and we definitely plan to return.
The staff was friendly, the selection was good, and the prices were fair.

I had a disappointing experience at The Praline Connection in New Orleans. The BBQ Oysters were served in a soup cup with a bland "BBQ sauce" and had a gooey texture. The garlic bread tasted stale and frozen, and the appetizers were cold and appeared microwaved. The Chicken wings were undercooked, cold, and had an unpleasant sauce. The rest of our party also found their entrees unsatisfactory. The only positives were the great service and the clean, pleasant ambiance. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

This McDonald's location near my home is terrible. The food is consistently bad, cold, or incorrect. The service is slow, and many employees do not speak English, making communication difficult. I recommend avoiding this location unless you have plenty of time and can speak Spanish.

The breakfast was outstanding, conveniently located near our hotel. The crepes with fruit were delicious and definitely worth ordering again. However, the tea had a slight taste of fennel seed, which could be a hit or miss for some.

Attended a Yelp Elite event at Holy Mole and had an amazing time! The food was incredible, especially the specially crafted cocktail. The staff was attentive and friendly. Can't wait to come back for a full meal!

My experience at Dinardo's was unpleasant and disappointing. The interior was run down and unclean, and the food quality did not match the high prices. The server made snarky comments, which added to the unwelcome atmosphere. The mussels were small and the sauce was unimpressive, while other dishes were bland and salty. I would recommend trying seafood elsewhere, as there are better options available. I am surprised that this place is still in business.
Starbucks is a great guilty pleasure with friendly baristas, delicious drinks, and tasty pastries. The drive-thru line is long, but going in to order is quicker. Highly recommended!
We absolutely loved this diner! Charming decor, delicious food, especially the cheese steak which surpassed Geno's. The server was fantastic.

JB Dawson's exceeded expectations, with a friendly hostess, attentive servers, and delicious food. The twisted shrimp appetizer was better than a popular competitor's version. The Four Cheese Mac & Cheese and fish tacos were both tasty, and the asparagus was perfectly cooked. The only drawback was the limited craft beer menu, but the waiter kindly offered a suitable alternative. Overall, a great experience, though I may bring my own craft beer next time.

Stopped here for lunch on the way to the airport and was pleasantly surprised. The Greek salad was hands down the best I've ever had, with fresh ingredients and perfect dressing. The vegetarian plate was equally delicious, with flavorful pan-fried vegetables and a satisfying portion size. Great value for money.
I highly recommend this local pho shop with a loyal clientele. The food is great, the staff is very nice, and the ingredients are fresh. Stop in and try their delicious dishes! 5 stars.
The food is amazing, and the atmosphere is great. The carne asada tacos take me back home.
Disappointing service overshadowed the amazing beer selection. Will not be returning. Instead, try Brickside Grill for great beer, delicious food, and friendly staff.

This Mexican restaurant on Main Street is average in terms of food and drinks. The pulled pork tacos and burrito were decent but nothing exceptional. It has a college-like atmosphere, so consider that before visiting.

Delicious Designs and Leigh Anne exceeded all expectations for my last-minute wedding cake request. The simple two-tier lemon cake was beautifully made and surpassed my imagination. Leigh Anne even accommodated my daughter's vegan preference with delicious chocolate cupcakes. The cake was not only perfect but also incredibly tasty. Highly recommend Leigh Anne for any bakery needs in Reno!

I have been a customer at this nail salon for years, but recent experiences have been disappointing. When my regular technician left, I tried a new technician, Angela, but the gel polish she applied started chipping within a day. Despite her efforts to fix it, the problem persisted. Now my nails are in poor condition, and I don't have confidence in Angela's ability to correct the issue. Unfortunately, I will have to find a new nail salon. Overall, very upsetting and disappointing.

Terrible dining experience at Sake House! Extremely slow service and incorrect orders. Neglected my requests for water and took forever to bring my son's food. Lack of attention and poor customer service. I wasted two hours here and had to leave unsatisfied with a hungry toddler. Avoid this place, there are better options available.

The stage setup and atmosphere are impressive, with a raised stage, moving lights, good sound system, fog machine, and a spacious dance floor. Unfortunately, the food service is subpar, with poor experiences both times I visited. On my last visit, I wasn't greeted at the entrance and had to find a table myself. When I asked for a menu, I was informed that the kitchen had already closed, despite it being just 10 minutes before the stated closing time. To top it off, I watched the same staff member seat and serve other customers who arrived after me. This lack of service was frustrating and rude.

Jenna Moore is amazing! I have been trying to achieve an A-line bob for over a year with little success, until today. She listened to everything I had to say, ensured that we were on the same page, and delivered exactly what I wanted. I know my hair still needs some healing and growth, but I can actually see my desired look in the future now, thanks to Jenna. Highly, highly recommended!

Fast, fresh, with very good carne and guacamole. However, limited ability to customize taco toppings and thick tortilla chips were a letdown. The dulche de leche soft serve ice cream was amazingly delicious. However, more seating and improved table clean-ups would be beneficial.

CURED Salon is a hidden gem in Nashville with impeccable style. The upscale polish options and prompt service exceeded my expectations. The clean and sterilized tools added to the overall experience. The salon has a classic and comfortable vibe, perfect for special occasions or a relaxing day with friends. Competitive prices and convenient location make it a great addition to the neighborhood. Can't wait to return!

I have been a loyal patron of this place for years, and despite living in Colorado now, I make it a point to visit whenever I'm in Philadelphia for work. The menu offers a variety of delicious options, with generous portions and affordable prices. My personal favorite is the Indian Mee Goreng, it's so amazing that I wish I could eat it every day. Perhaps one day I'll be lucky enough to get the recipe from the manager so I can enjoy it even when I'm in CO.
Service was excellent, but the pizza did not meet my expectations. Won't be returning.

I stayed at this hotel for one week after Christmas. Unless you book adjoining rooms, you'll be disturbed by strangers’ conversations, coughs, clearing throats, fights, and dogs barking as if they are in your bed. Only managed to sleep for two out of seven nights after the hotel cleared out post New Year. The connecting doors are inadequately insulated. The staff at the hotel is exceptional, but Starwood needs to address this issue to improve guests' experience. I have stayed at many places with connecting doors and have never encountered such poor insulation. Possible poor materials used?

Overall, the sandwich I had here was disappointing. The jalapeño cheese bread lacked flavor and was dry, indicating it was likely old. The tomatoes and cucumbers were mushy and overripe. However, I must mention that the staff was friendly.
We highly recommend this movie theater/bar/restaurant. Excellent drinks, friendly service, and delicious food. Must visit!

The iced mocha and iced white chocolate mocha were both disappointing - they lacked any coffee or chocolate flavor, tasting extremely watered down. Despite requesting an extra shot, they still had no flavor. We were so dissatisfied that we had to throw them away. Extremely disappointing and not worth trying.

This place used to be excellent with a wide selection of items, reasonable prices, and helpful staff. I once returned a faulty part and got a refund without any hassle. Also returned an unnecessary purchase and received a prompt refund. While the quality has declined slightly, it is still a decent establishment.

The New Orleans gem near the bridge on Peters or Piety is a fast favorite. With a 1.25-mile path offering city views, breezes, art installations, a dog park, and a walk along the Mississippi River, it's a beautiful way to end any day in NOLA. Don't miss the chance to catch a spectacular sunset!
I contacted United Van Lines for a moving quote, but received no response after multiple attempts. Their lack of communication and professionalism was disappointing.
The sushi at this place is affordable and the specialty menu is outstanding. The Snow Mountain and Volcano sushi are both remarkable.

This place is THE BEST for gyros! The food quality is amazing, especially the chicken gyros. They offer a variety of options, including delicious burgers that my daughter adores. The perfectly seasoned steak fries are absolutely amazing - always hot and fresh. However, I personally didn't enjoy the baklava as it's made with pistachios.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place in Reno. The Taiwanese food was excellent, surpassing my expectations. Highly recommend trying the 三杯鸡, oyster omelet, and scallion pancake. I'm already craving for more dishes and will definitely miss this place when I leave.

The restaurant offers delicious and genuine food in a pleasant and tidy setting. The service provided is commendable. Although the beer options are limited, our overall first visit was fantastic, and we look forward to returning.

I had a wonderful lunch experience at this wine lounge with my fiancee and friend. The small table by the window provided a cozy and intimate atmosphere. The wine selection was impressive and varied, with great options to choose from. We enjoyed a bubbly and Italian orange soda. The "snacks" of lamb sausage, potato chips, and crab stuffed peppers were delicious. I particularly loved the mozzarella with prosciutto bacon bits sandwich, which was both flavorful and light. The service was prompt and polite. The rustic ambiance had a low to medium noise level. The only minor issue was the confusing bathroom door lock and handle. Overall, I would highly recommend this place for lunch.

Fellinis of Media is my top pick for dining out! Their extensive menu caters to all tastes, and the friendly staff goes above and beyond to meet your needs. The elegant and serene ambiance adds to the overall experience. In my view, this restaurant offers the finest Italian cuisine in town.

This place is a game changer for the neighborhood! The food is absolutely delicious, and I'm newly smitten by their southern Latin cuisine. The family who owns it is also very sweet. Exactly what the neighborhood needed!

Terrible experience at the Lehigh Acres location. The place is dirty and disorganized, with old newspapers and a dusty fake tree in the waiting area. Jenna did a horrible job on my nails, leading to two return visits in one week. She was rude and argumentative throughout the process. No hope for improvement here, would not recommend.

I had a great experience at the bar with excellent drinks and the best hummus I've ever had. However, the brunch was awful - long wait, cold food, and a hair in it. Despite the manager compensating our check, I would suggest skipping breakfast and only visiting the bar. A disappointment for a Kimpton restaurant.

I love this theater! It's always clean and the staff is friendly. However, it is lacking some necessary updates like upgraded seating and wait staff service that other theaters offer. The pricing is similar to other theaters with perks, but this one needs a complete update throughout.

I recently tried out this Thai restaurant and I would give it 4-5 stars. It was my first visit and I found the food to be delicious. The shrimp spring rolls were especially fresh and the peanut sauce was tasty. The tom yum soup was a bit too spicy for my liking, but still had a good sour flavor. The pad thai and drunken noodle dishes were also enjoyable, although the noodles in the pad thai were a bit overdone. The portions were slightly smaller than other places in the area. The owner was friendly and attentive, even coming outside to talk with me about the food. The restaurant has a cute setup in a quaint house, but it may not be ideal if it's crowded. Overall, I think it's worth a try for Thai food fans. I used a Living Social deal, which made the total bill for two people, including an appetizer, soup, and a drink, to be around $24.

Kingsway Mall is a great alternative to West Ed for shopping with its variety of stores like lululemon, Jacob, Danier, Gap, Club Monaco, and American Eagle. Unlike other malls, it is typically less crowded, making browsing easier. The food options at the mall, such as New York Fries, Orange Julius, and Booster Juice, are also plentiful. The food court is spacious with ample seating available. However, it would be even better if Kingsway had a Bay and a movie theatre. Overall, Kingsway Mall is a satisfactory and convenient shopping destination.

Indias Kitchen was a disappointing experience. The goat curry was excessively salty with an overpowering tomato flavor, and the meat was tough. The naan bread was below average, but the rice was enjoyable. Overall, a very disappointing meal.

Overall, the reviewer thought the restaurant was a little pricey but worth it. The service was initially slow, but improved once they got their menus. The food came quickly and was delicious, with the crab cake and fries being highlights. However, they had to sit in the bar area due to the time and the table was too small. The reviewer also mentioned a payment issue but was assured by the manager that it would be resolved.
I am a sushi snob and this was the worst sushi I've ever had. It was warm and the side salad was just plain iceberg lettuce. I won't be returning.

My partner and I shared the veg platter and left completely satisfied! Mouthwatering dishes, delightful and helpful staff. They assist you in making choices and are trustworthy. We're definitely returning.

I had an extremely disappointing experience at this hotel. While the atmosphere and appearance were classy, the staff was a huge letdown. Despite booking a suite for a bachelorette party, they gave us separate rooms and my friend had to beg for adjacent rooms as they had run out of suites. As a compensation, they offered free valet service. However, the next day we discovered that the valet had keyed my friend's car door while bringing it from the parking garage. This was without a doubt the worst hotel experience, and I will definitely not be returning.

I frequent this place often and it never fails to impress! Recently, my friend and I visited while traveling to Puerto Rico, and my mother-in-law had a craving for Tamales. The staff graciously provided free samples and even offered to cook and pack them for us. Exceptional place with friendly service!
Regret not reading the reviews beforehand. Long wait for mediocre food. The rowdy bar crowd made the atmosphere uncomfortable. Doubt this place will survive.

I enjoyed the experience eating here and will definitely go back. They have vegetarian options on the menu, and the veggie spring rolls were hot, crisp, and delicious. The duck and rice vermicelli soup was great, with a yummy, savory broth. However, I didn't care for the beef pho due to grisly meat and the presence of tripe, but I should have chosen a different beef cut. The regular serving size was generous, and the atmosphere was clean and quiet with an interesting 80s decor. The server was quick and attentive.

Chickie's and Pete's is a women-friendly sports bar with plenty of seating for Sunday games. The sound booth in the sky adds a nice touch of entertainment during commercials. The smoke-free environment is a plus. However, the famous crab fries didn't live up to expectations due to the congealed cheese sauce and lukewarm temperature. On the bright side, the towers of beer with taps add a fun element. Overall, Chickie's and Pete's is a great spot to enjoy a game, thanks to its spacious layout, energetic atmosphere, and attractive servers.

Pancake Pantry in Nashville is a must-visit institution. With the chance to spot country stars and enjoy a delicious breakfast, their pancakes are a definite highlight. Be prepared for a wait, but the vibrant conversations make it worth it. A truly essential Nashville experience.

Magasin Kitchen has satisfied my longing for delicious Vietnamese cuisine while Magasin Cafe undergoes renovations. The food and service here are commendable, with even the chopped garnishing surpassing its counterpart. Although the higher price tag and the ambiance of the restaurant may be discouraging, the exceptional quality of the food and service ensures my continued loyalty.

This place is my go-to. Whether it's their cumin style lamb or rabbit appetizer, everything tastes amazing. While some may question its authenticity, I've only experienced true Sichuan flavors in Chengdu. Regardless, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit.

Kmart lacks in quality and selection, particularly in electronics and movies. The store's atmosphere is unimpressive and attempts at creating a department store experience fall flat. However, they offer good deals on patio furniture during off seasons and clearance days. The pharmacy receives credit for efficient service and convenient hours. Overall, Kmart remains subpar and may appeal to a niche group of shoppers.

The Tuck Special at this Nashville establishment is worth a long drive from Texas just to savor it again. The blend of unconventional ingredients like brisket, egg, and pimento cheese creates an incredible flavor. While my husband wasn't fond of the BBQ sauce, the meat itself was quite satisfying. This place can get crowded, but with a little patience and menu research beforehand, it should be manageable.

The restaurant had a terrible odor resembling a toilet. I couldn't tolerate it and opted for takeout. Unfortunately, the server packed mine and my daughter's meals together, and she doesn't eat fish. While I ordered a spicy tuna roll, it turned out to be average at best. However, my daughter did enjoy her meal. Considering these experiences, I won't be returning to this sushi restaurant.

Overall, I absolutely love the food at this place. The portions are generous, and the menu is constantly evolving, which keeps things interesting. However, I do have a few concerns - the seating is cramped and the noise level makes conversation difficult. Additionally, the coffee could be improved to match the quality of Sabrina's. Nevertheless, I must say that the latkas are consistently perfect and the bacon stands out as the best I've had in Philly.

Yellow Subs in Reno is a must-visit! The sprouts on the sub are a game changer. The staff is friendly, down to earth, and the sub options are top-notch. I highly recommend this place to all sub and food lovers. Their tank tops and t-shirts are awesome too. I'll definitely be coming back. 5 stars for the fast service, amazing food, and lively atmosphere.

Overall, Tina, our waitress, provided satisfactory service, but the initial wait time was long. I am torn between giving 3 or 4 stars. However, the food was delicious, especially for a first-time experience. I also enjoyed the side salad.

Love this place! It's become our go-to spot. The atmosphere is always great, food is delicious, and drinks are amazing. The salsa is incredibly tasty, and don't miss out on the generously-sized salads. Perfect for chilling with friends on the outdoor seating while sipping margaritas. Highly recommend!
The service was great but the food was just okay. The soups should have been served warmer and my steak was overcooked, despite requesting it to be medium. Nevertheless, the service was excellent.

Despite its positive reviews, Nippon Tei didn't quite impress me. While the free edamame was a nice touch, the mango sake drink was overpriced and just okay. The sushi rolls were tasty, but I've had better elsewhere. The main downside was that the rolls kept falling apart, which affected both presentation and the overall experience. Although I might return in the future, I already have preferred sushi spots. The prices were average, so that won't be a factor in attracting me back. Time will tell.

I had a disappointing experience watching Star Wars Rogue One in 3D at this theater. The ticket purchase and atmosphere were good, and the food was delicious. However, the screen was extremely dark, making it difficult to see the actors' faces. Even the 3D glasses didn't help, as the shadows in the background were double. The manager was unhelpful and refused to acknowledge the issue. I won't be returning for their 3D showings.

Overpriced for average and lukewarm food, with servers who struggled with dish names and seemed in a rush to get rid of us. Questionable pricing for dishes not listed on the menu. One server didn't understand a comment about the food and ignored it. The "ropa vieja" dish was decent but came in a small portion for the price. The menu prices didn't match the poor ambiance with plastic containers and a sagging knitted item overhead.

Overall, disappointed with the restaurant. Interesting layout resembling a chicken coop, but the food was overpriced and underwhelming. Only decent value was the chicken strips and fries from the Sunday brunch menu. Seasonal salad was laughably small and lacking lettuce, yet expensive. Chicken was good, but not better than Raising Canes. Slow service and food despite a small crowd.

Wow! This place is amazing! I'm not a vegetarian or health-conscious, but I absolutely love it. Thanks to a persuasive co-worker, I tried it once and now I'm hooked. The delicious salads and friendly service keep me coming back. Even though I don't order daily, I constantly crave their food. Highly recommended!

I had a terrible experience at Regis Hair salon with stylist Angie. She completely butchered my haircut despite showing her photos of the style I wanted. Even when I pointed out her mistakes, she didn't pay attention. I ended up with a men's flattop instead. This was extremely disappointing, and I will never return to this salon again. Thanks for ruining my holiday season, Angie and Regis Hair salon.
Perfect place for a date night with delicious food, especially the sweet potato nachos and breakfast options. Can't wait to go back!

We recently dined at Convivio right after its opening and will definitely return. Despite some minor service issues and wine being out of stock, which can be expected for a new establishment, the owner's visit to our table was incredibly pleasant. The food was exceptional, particularly the tortelloni pansotti, possibly the best pasta I've had. We will certainly be regular patrons.

I stumbled upon Crabby Bill's after a long day at the beach and craving seafood. The $25 bucket of steamed seafood was decent, but not the freshest. It served as a quick snack to hold us over before our dinner reservation at Bern's Steak House.

State Street Kitchen never fails to impress with their creative and delicious dishes. The Grilled Chicken, Spinach, Swiss and Honey Mustard Sub with Jalapeno Chips added a perfect spicy crunch. Whether it's for breakfast or lunch, this local gem is my go-to spot. Don't miss out on their unique Korean-inspired home cooking - make sure you find a way to experience it for yourself and become part of their welcoming family.

This place is amazing! The food is delicious, the staff is friendly, and they have rotating specials. Everything is homemade, and what more can you ask for? Don't miss out on their chicken salad, perfect for making sandwiches at home.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant mainly due to the poor service. While the food was good, the staff member who took my order was rude and unhelpful. Despite being referred by the front desk of my hotel, I was told that the hospitality discount was only available to front desk employees. The staff member reluctantly applied the discount after some arguing. Overall, I was shocked by the lack of professionalism and will not be returning.
Always a delightful experience! Quick appointments with minimal wait time and the ladies are always sweet.

Despite good cocktails and a nice atmosphere, we were disappointed with the food. The Brussel sprouts and fries tasted like pure salt, even after replacement. The burger was just okay and the flank steak was nothing special. We won't be returning.

I absolutely love Phillies games and this stadium enhances the experience. Despite my initial 10,000th loss, the open atmosphere avoids feeling claustrophobic. The only inconvenience was sitting beneath the scoreboard. I appreciate the ability to roam around while still having a great view of the game. The wide variety of delicious food and clean facilities also contribute to a positive experience. I'm eagerly awaiting baseball season to cheer on the Phillies!

I recently had lunch at this Mexican restaurant with my boyfriend. The beans were absolutely amazing, the salsa was fresh and cilantro forward, and the chips were thick and crunchy. However, the portion size was disappointing and chips and salsa had to be purchased separately. The chunky guacamole was the highlight, but the meat in the steak tacos was low quality and lacking in flavor. Despite this, my boyfriend is willing to try it again.

Plaza Deli in La Cumbre Plaza is my go-to place for delicious and fresh sandwiches. Their bread rolls are superb – soft and not too crusty. As a long-time Santa Barbara resident, I've been visiting this spot for years and have never been disappointed. Their wide variety of sandwiches makes it challenging to choose a favorite. Don't forget to try their excellent soda selection. While Plaza Deli may not offer extravagant options, it's the perfect place for locals and visitors alike seeking a fantastic sandwich made with quality ingredients.

The Nordstrom's shoe department at this location exceeds others with its vast variety and inclusion of higher end lines. The sales professionals, particularly Erwin, demonstrated exceptional service by locating and price matching to a competitor's sale price with free shipping. Nordstrom's has definitely earned my loyalty with their remarkable customer service.

The small aquarium in Tarpon Springs is primarily geared towards kids and offers a shark feeding show as well as the opportunity to pet stingrays and feed them. Although it might not be my first choice of attractions in the area, it is decent enough, especially for young children who seem to enjoy it.
This place is the go-to spot for simple and satisfying Chinese takeout. The food is less greasy than usual and the staff is incredibly friendly.

I absolutely loved this quaint place! The ambience, food, and service were all fantastic. I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy, which was incredibly delicious. The fries and cole slaw served as perfect side dishes. It was my first visit, but certainly won't be my last!

Overall, my experience at Broussard's was good. The ambiance in the foyer and courtyard was old-school and beautiful, perfect for some touristy pictures. The service was prompt and efficient, with the waiter successfully suggesting a substitute for the Pinot Grigio I ordered. The Maytag blue cheese salad and pecan crusted drum were delicious, though I wish there was more salad. However, the dining room itself was in need of an upgrade, as the chandeliers resembled those in my grandmother's assisted living home. While it was a good experience, I don't think I'll be returning. [3 stars]

The service is excellent, the atmosphere is great, and the raw bar with Alaskan crab legs is fantastic. The burgers are everything my friends hoped for, but be prepared to splurge, as other entrees are quite pricey. The shrimp and grits with crab were not as heavenly as the waiter claimed, and the price was unreasonable. However, the drinks and appetizers are delicious, and the complimentary cool pizza appetizer and rabbit and chicken liver pate are worth trying. Stick to drinks, appetizers, and burgers for a happy dining experience.
Doan's is fantastic! Consistently great, friendly staff, and fast service. Perfect for a quick lunch!

This brick oven pizza joint keeps improving with every visit. I can't get enough of their Rotolo, a doughy delight filled with mortadella, ricotta cheese, pistachios, and oil. It's a must-order each time, priced at $5 and the size of a bun. The prosciutto pizza is incredibly flavorful, with divine dough. The service is consistently excellent, and the beer selection is commendable. Easily one of Philly's best pizza spots.
This pizza is the real deal - thick, chewy, cheesy, and just how pizza is meant to taste! It's the best I've had since moving to Indianapolis and I've finally found my new pizza home.
Extremely disappointing experience waiting 27 minutes for three teas in an empty store. Unacceptable wait time, particularly in Chinatown where efficiency is expected.

The beef sandwiches here rival the best in Chicago. However, a larger size option, sweet peppers, fries, extended hours, and year-round availability at the main location would take it to the next level.

I highly recommend Buff for a relaxing and accommodating nail salon experience. The modern and minimalist decor creates a clean and pleasant atmosphere. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate our group for 4 pedicures, even adding an extra pedicurist to the schedule. The complimentary drinks, including mimosas, wine, and champagne, are a delightful touch. The service was friendly and welcoming, and my polish lasted without chipping. The only downside is street parking only, but it shouldn't be an issue for regular customers. Overall, I will definitely be returning to Buff.
Excellent pho spot in Philly. The broth is amazing, and even the small portion (No. 51) was satisfyingly filling. Will definitely return when I'm in town.

I absolutely love this concept! The café serves an impressive range of coffees, teas, and breakfast items, while the other half offers delicious bar-style apps, salads, and sandwiches. The wide variety of beers available on tap, bottled, or in can is a major plus. This casual spot is perfect for spending hours with friends, reminiscent of the good ol' college days. And the best part? You can bring your furry friend along, as they are more than welcome here.

My husband and I reserved a Corolla-sized car online, but requested an upgrade to a Camry at Avis Rent A Car in Reno. After some discussion, we received the Camry we wanted. The staff was professional, but the rental price of $800 for five days seemed high. We had already purchased insurance for $150. The car itself was great during our vacation. However, upon dropping off the car, we found out that a weekly rate would have been just $15 more. The upgrade had cost us an extra $20 per day. I will not rent from Avis again, opting for Hertz or Dollar and making phone reservations instead. In hindsight, the extra insurance was unnecessary as my personal insurance covers everything.

Excellent customer service! Absolutely thrilled with my new car purchase. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a well-maintained used car. Andy provided exceptional assistance and made the buying process seamless.

Jungle Prada Tavern exceeded my expectations! The bartender's beer recommendation was spot-on, and their seafood dishes, from the scallops prosciutto to the del mar pizza, were outstanding. The crab-stuffed portabella with a side of crab and lobster bisque was a definite highlight. Even as a vegetarian, I thoroughly enjoyed the roasted portabella app. I've returned multiple times, bringing my seafood-loving sister along, and we both left satisfied. Don't hesitate to give this place a try - you won't be disappointed with the variety of options available!
I absolutely love this bead store in Nashville! It has an amazing selection of seed beads and glass strands. The walls are filled with an incredible variety. Highly recommended!

Had an amazing dinner experience on opening day! The atmosphere was great, staff was lovely, and the food was on point. The green tea (PHO PHREE) was so satisfying, summer rolls with spicy peanut sauce were delicious, and the pho was phenomenal. Adding this spot to my regular eating destinations in Fairmount!

Despite its outdated appearance, this place offers surprisingly delicious food that will remind you of grandma's cooking. The 1950's decor adds a charming small-town vibe, complete with ice skates on the wall and a Christmas tree in the corner. While it may not offer the best food in the world, their breakfast dishes are consistently amazing. The pancakes are fluffy and light, especially when topped with a bit of butter. The bacon is thick and tasty, albeit slightly overcooked. With reasonable prices and excellent service, this is the perfect spot for a satisfying homemade breakfast.
Disappointing experience due to limited menu, unaccommodating server, and poor service. Overpriced food for the quality. Unlikely to return unless there's a compelling reason.

This place is a must-visit! Second visit surpassed expectations. Butternut squash and goat cheese Rangoons and mushroom yakisoba were deliciously filling with amazing flavor. Coconut curry ramen was heavenly. Only complaint is the lack of bar seating without feeling in the servers' way. Worth the wait before a theater visit. Quick service ensured we made it to the show with happy tummies.

The beer at this place was good, but not amazing. The location is a bit isolated and industrial, lacking in scenery. However, they do offer a discount on beer when a train passes by. I would give it a 3.5-star rating. Despite the location, it was still popular with a loyal following on a Sunday afternoon.

I initially had a great experience at this salon with a "Mini Manicure". The nail technician did an amazing job and the polish lasted without chipping. The staff were friendly and the salon had a trendy and peaceful vibe. However, my second visit for a gel manicure was disappointing. The technician did not have the proper brush for a French manicure and used a q-tip instead, resulting in uneven lines and poorly shaped nails. The appointment took longer than expected and I was late for work. I'm conflicted about returning and may need to find another salon to fix the issues before my upcoming trip.

This hidden gem in the Marigny is a must-visit for those willing to venture off the tourist path. While not perfect, this affordable spot offers delicious food with the convenience of an all-day breakfast menu. Vegetarian and vegan options are available, although the concept of cheese in these dishes seems questionable. The French fry po'boy, mac 'n cheese sandwiches, and Saturday Blue Plate BBQ Chicken legs are outstanding. With every entree under $10 and $5 Bloody Mary's that are worth it, why complain?
The sangria is awesome, and the rotating craft beers are a great addition. The delightful combination of pizza, calzones, and drinks keep me coming back for more.

Overall, this bar and casino combo offers a decent alcohol selection and well-mixed drinks. However, the higher than average prices and limited food menu, which also made me sick, were disappointing. The poor service mentioned in other reviews was unfortunately true, as we had to repeatedly track down our server. Given the many better options in Reno, this place is not my preferred choice.

Terrible service! The staff was rude, unprofessional, and unhelpful. When I inquired about availability for Thanksgiving, they abruptly said no and rudely ended the call. I will definitely be looking for another place to take my business.

I visited this place with a gift card and was pleasantly surprised by the delicious food. I tried the sauteed stir fry over spinach while my girlfriend enjoyed the abundant pile of nachos. The menu had a nice variety of options, and the bartender during our visit was friendly. I would recommend this sports bar for those seeking a welcoming atmosphere, good food, and a chance to watch sports on TV.

Terrible experience. Soggy and cold pizza delivered after 2 hours with zero communication. Promised refund, but still charged. Terrible service, extremely rude. Avoid at all costs. Don't order from here.

The service and food at this restaurant are incredible! The black bean ravioli and bone-in steak were succulent, flavorful, and juicy. The staff, from the hostess to the chef, made us feel at home. The beautiful ambiance added to the experience. Highly recommended for groups of four or more.

Timeout Pub and Sports Bar does not live up to the hype. The interior lacks authenticity and the music choice is questionable. They have a full bar with specialty drinks, but the atmosphere needs improvement. The food is typical sports bar fare, nothing too exciting. Happy hours are available, but overall, it's not worth the visit compared to the neighboring Legends Sports Bar.
Highly recommend their onion rings - some of the best I've ever had! The Reuben sandwich was also delicious.
The cutest and friendliest coffee shop in Boise! Amazing coffee, but the staff is the real highlight. Love this place!

My hubby and I had high expectations for this place based on a friend's recommendation. We arrived at 8pm, only to find the open sign turned off. Despite seeing people inside, we were greeted with confusion and told they were closed. It was an uncomfortable experience and left us unsure if we'll ever give it another shot.
The food at this place is awesome! Fresh and delicious, especially the papaya salad and the spicy curry. The service was great, and they also offer take-out. Highly recommend!

I recently tried Music City Dental after getting new dental insurance. Dr. Spurlin and her staff are amazing! They were gentle and ensured my comfort throughout the whole visit. Despite my fear of shots, I barely felt anything when Dr. Spurlin administered one for my filling. They even offered me a pillow, blanket, and the choice to watch a movie or listen to music. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I will be returning as a permanent patient!

The beef noodles and fried rice were a bit salty and oily, but still good overall. The shrimp spring rolls were excellent, one of the best we've had. However, due to a chaotic seating arrangement and the owner's oversight, we can only give it three stars.

Burger Up has a fantastic community vibe, where I've made friends and had interesting conversations. Being within walking distance of my house is a bonus. The classic burger is delicious, made from homemade buns and ketchup with a unique taste. The bar offers a wide selection, including creative homemade drinks like the watermelon concoction I had last night. Ignore the negative reviews, they seem driven by personal grudges rather than genuine criticism. Burger Up represents Nashville's diverse community and I appreciate their efforts. If you expect a cookie-cutter experience, this may not be the right place for you.

Despite not typically enjoying Indian food, this place exceeded my expectations. Let Hassan decide your order to avoid feeling overwhelmed by the menu. Don't miss the delicious chaat and lassi combination, they perfectly complement each other.

The food at Mr. B was excellent, especially the shrimp and grits and barbecued shrimp. The appetizers were enjoyable as well. The bread pudding was slightly disappointing, being dry in a city known for it. The service was good but could have been more attentive. The location is great, although the restaurant was uncomfortably cold in July, so be prepared to wear long sleeves or bring a jacket.

Highly recommend the Steamboat Natchez trip in NOLA. Extremely informative and enjoyable, with great service from the well-organized staff. JoJo went above and beyond to reserve us a window seat. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

This business has a potentially disastrous business model if not for its dedicated clientele. During my visits to New Orleans, I have found amusement in betting on how many beers or ingredients they would be out of. The bartenders are rude and prone to swearing. It's almost comical to witness patrons requesting draft beers or mixed drinks only to be told "can't do that." Today, I observed at least five people being denied "mules" as we sat for about 30 minutes. Additionally, two out of their four taps were not even working. What a missed opportunity.

Mixed experience at Mr. B's. Good start at the bar, but downhill after transferring to the table. Ignored for 45+ minutes, had to rely on another waiter to take our order. BBQ shrimp was the highlight, but the wood plank grilled fish was overpriced and small. Rabbit dish was enjoyable. Hit and miss service ruined the overall experience.

This place is absolutely adorable with a cute and casual interior. It's clean and has a variety of delicious Vietnamese and other types of food. The banh mi and boba tea were both tasty, and the staff was friendly. The drink card for a free tenth drink and convenient hours make it even better.
Stopped at Walgreens hoping to find the new ELF Villain's collection, but this location never gets them, according to the cosmetics person. Disappointing, but I'll have to search elsewhere.
Best Italian food ever! Small, elegant restaurant with amazing entrees and tasty cheesecake. The staff was incredibly friendly. Highly recommend for a date night.

This is my go-to spot for fish tacos! The beef taco and chicken fajitas were average, but the fish tacos are amazing. The prices are affordable and two tacos fill me up. The interior and patio are awesome, and there's a Ben and Jerry's next door for dessert. Overall, a happy visit every time!
Excellent service! Replaced my dive watch battery in a jiffy at a fair price. Staff was friendly, prompt, and there were enough members to assist. Location is conveniently located.

Stopped here last week and was pleasantly surprised by the great location and peaceful atmosphere under the shade of big old trees. Despite the limited seating, the food was served quickly. My buffalo burger was outstanding and one of the best I've ever had. However, the tri-tip sandwich was disappointing, being dry and consisting only of meat on big bread. The horseradish sauce was the saving grace. Overall, I give the tri-tip a 3 and my hubby gives it a 4, while the buffalo burger deserves a definite 5++. Worth a visit for a unique atmosphere and peaceful experience not far from town.

I have frequented the Mad Mex, University City location for years and was pleased to see the new location closer to my home. Happy Hour offers great deals on Margaritas and wings, while the food is average. However, the staff could improve in chaos and crowd management for a better dining experience.

I had a great experience taking my boyfriend for a tour and beer sampling at Yuengling on a Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised by how close it was to us. Before going, make sure to check the website for tour times and read the FAQ's. We noticed some people wearing flip flops on the tour, even though closed toe shoes are insisted upon. It's worth noting that there is no production on Saturdays, so the brewery was quiet and empty. The tour itself was about 40 minutes long and started with a video about the history of Yuengling. Our guide was knowledgeable and took us through various parts of the brewery. The highlight was the tasting room, where we got to try different beers for free (tips encouraged). Unfortunately, they were out of a few beers that day. Overall, it was a great tour and I plan on revisiting with my parents.

Overall, I was really disappointed with my experience at this location of Marathon. The energetic server had a frantic energy and rushed us out of our booth, even bringing boxes for our food without asking. When we wanted to have another round of drinks with a friend, he told us we couldn't stay in the booth and had to move to the bar. It made us feel uncomfortable and we ended up leaving. Additionally, the food was not that great. Overall, not pleased with the service or the food.

We arrived for lunch at 12pm on a Friday, and despite it being not busy, service was incredibly slow. Despite being pleasant and kind, we had to complain numerous times just to get our beverages. Additionally, it took them 40 minutes to inform us that a beer we ordered was no longer available. While the food was good, the prolonged wait and slow service made it not worth it.

I stumbled upon this organic beer and burger spot and was pleasantly surprised. The menu offers both pre-made and customizable burgers, complemented by a selection of rotating beers and specials. The friendly staff and inviting atmosphere added to the overall experience. Just a heads up, burgers are served a la carte, so make sure to order sides if you'd like fries. Vegetarian options like sandwiches and salads are also available, making it a vegetarian-friendly spot.

I had mixed experiences at Earl's new American kitchen. While the food was good but not great, the service was lacking, especially with a rude bartender. Consequently, I would not personally return or recommend this place to others.
Jake's is a decent franchise with delicious burgers, but lacks in ambiance and fries. Stick to the original location for a better overall experience.

I had a disappointing experience at this shop on Broad Street. Despite needing a jump for my car right in front of their store, I was told they couldn't assist me because they couldn't leave the store. Even when I suggested that another employee could help or they could assist me later, I was met with a firm refusal. It's ironic and frustrating that a place servicing cars couldn't even offer a simple jump. The service was lacking and definitely not customer-oriented. The employee behind the counter seemed more interested in surfing the web and playing on their phone. Overall, it was a disappointing and frustrating experience.

The Pulled Pork Nachos were a delightful twist on the traditional dish, as they were served with crispy potato chips instead of the usual tortilla chips. They paired perfectly with a refreshing Beer or Bloody Mary. Delicious!

I really enjoyed my stay at this cute and conveniently located place in Santa Barbara. The room was clean and overlooked a lovely courtyard and spa. The amenities like the fireplace, refrigerator, and ample storage space were great. Wine and cheese at 5 was a nice touch. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside was a little stuffiness in the room, but it was easily remedied with open windows and a ceiling fan. Overall, a pleasant stay at a good price. Would consider staying here again.

Mirna's is a hidden gem with huge portions and affordable prices. The pasta dishes are a must-try and their specialty. Although they also serve decent fish, the pasta plates steal the show. The free hummus and pita they occasionally treat customers to is a nice touch. Just make sure to call ahead for a reservation due to limited seating. BYOB!

I generally prefer independent restaurants, but the overpriced center city Philadelphia hype didn't impress me. The restaurant was spacious compared to other places in south Philly where we usually celebrate my mother-in-law's birthday. However, the prices were surprisingly high compared to what was listed on the online menu. The food and portions were average, but the dessert stood out as unique. The coordination between the bus help and waiter was off, with the bus help asking if we were done with our plates just as the waiter was discussing desserts. As expected in Philly, the bathroom was small considering the size of the restaurant.

Platoon is amazing! Steve C is an exceptional trainer who customizes workouts based on your abilities and preferences. I started going once a week but quickly increased my attendance to 3-5 days a week. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and billing and scheduling are always hassle-free. Highly recommend!
The Tater-Tots were tasty, although nothing extraordinary. The Burger was decent. Convenient lunch option with helpful staff offering local directions.

I used to rate this place higher but based on a recent experience, I have decided to downgrade. Visited with my in-laws, one of whom is a senior, and tried to use a $5 off coupon along with the senior discount. The cashier refused to apply the coupon, claiming it was against management's rules. Disappointed in the lack of logic and poor customer experience. Management should take responsibility for this, not the cashier.

Great first visit! Ordered 4 delicious Chicago dogs through the drive-thru. Only thing missing was the poppyseed bun and celery salt. SuperGyro is the only place within 28 miles where you can get a Chicago dog. Loved the 100% beef hot dogs with neon green relish, sport peppers, onions, dill pickle tomatoes & onion. Will definitely be back to try more items on the menu.

Wawa is a beacon in a cold world. The sandwiches are great and they offer the expected convenience store snacks and drinks. Though this location isn't as friendly, it still satisfies my snacking needs.

Stopped by this bar on the way back to the hotel for a second drink after a disappointing experience elsewhere. Opted for the hand grenades without studying the menu and boy, were they worth it! At $9 each, they packed a punch and we were definitely feeling it by the end. Great atmosphere with a band playing and open air. Enjoyed singing along and had a lot of fun. Close to Jackson Square, highly recommend.

I highly recommend this location for all your shipping needs. Despite being on a busy corner, it's easy to access. Although my first visit was mediocre with an unfriendly staff member, my second visit redeemed the experience. The woman who assisted me was helpful, knowledgeable, and went above and beyond. The store is clean and efficiently packed with a variety of products. While the staff may not engage in small talk, they provide exceptional service. In summary, this location deserves 5 stars and I will continue to utilize their services.

I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken BBQ burritos at this place. The variety of ingredients made it even more enjoyable. It is a great spot for a family meal, although it would be even better if they had a play area for kids.
Stopped here for some chai and coffee. Quick service, not many people. Chai was great, forgot to buy more coffee, but no worries, we have Starbucks at home.

Overall, my experience with this young start-up company has been positive. Despite some impatience in the gun community, the owner has shown integrity and has stood by his word in my interactions with him. I met Jacob, the owner, at a gun show in Las Vegas and purchased a well-crafted Cerakoted billet lower. The machining and Cerakote job are of high quality. Furthermore, the owner has been prompt and responsive in addressing my inquiries via email.

I was very impressed with this place! The menu and food were amazing, with creative options like fruit bruschetta which was yum! The Popeye skillet and Roadhouse sw were also great. However, it was freezing inside and lacked ambiance. Some background music and better lighting would easily fix that. Customer service was good, but a bit disconnected. Nevertheless, I would definitely go back.

Amazing fill and gel pedicure! Despite being close to closing time, the staff took their time and fulfilled all my requests. The salon was clean and the staff was exceptionally friendly. Surpassed my expectations for a mall nail salon. The foot and hand massages were heavenly. I'll definitely be returning!

I had a memorable experience at this restaurant. The cashier was incredibly nice and helpful. I ordered the Devils Delight, which turned out to be a delicious burger named after the cashier. The burger was cooked perfectly and had a great combination of flavors. It was accompanied by the amazing truffle fries. The quality of food and service was excellent, although it was a bit pricey. I will definitely be coming back.

I stumbled upon this restaurant while looking for a healthy dinner option, but was initially deterred by the distance. However, I couldn't stop thinking about their Be My Bison burger and ultimately decided to give it a try. I was thrilled when my order was ready as soon as I arrived. I must say, I am absolutely in love with this place! It's a dream come true for someone like me who struggles to find healthy dining options. Thank you!

This place was awful. The service was terrible, with no acknowledgment or attention from the staff. The menu was limited and overpriced, with poorly seasoned and overly breaded food. The only positive was the good music and the food being decent, but overall, I would never recommend this place. However, their takeout could be repurposed as great dog food.
The service was good and the mesquite wings were excellent, perfect for sharing or saving some for later. However, the weak lemonade was the weakest I've ever had.

I lucked out with this taqueria in our neighborhood. Taqueria Guerrero is the best Mexican food in New Orleans. From the delicious 3-taco plate to the flavorful burrito, everything is incredibly tasty. I suggest this place every time I want to go out or get takeout.

The food was good, but the service and cleanliness were lacking. Sticky table and mix-up with orders. Great pork belly tacos and spicy beef pho, but wait for the check was long. Go for the food, not the service.

The second visit to this key shop was a charm. The first time their hours didn't suit me, but the second time proved to be very helpful. The gentleman behind the counter was pleasant and quickly cut several keys that big box stores couldn't duplicate. Overall, the experience was quick, polite, efficient, and cost-effective.
Terrible work quality, rude attitude, and disrespectful behavior. Subpar service for nails and fingers. Attempting to provide feedback only leads to confrontations and gossip in another language.

I am extremely disappointed with my experience at this salon. Despite receiving a message from the owner offering a free service to fix a previous mistake, my hair turned out poorly once again. I clearly communicated what I wanted and emphasized that I did not want any orange tones, but my hair still ended up damaged, brittle, and brassy. The service was rushed, and I felt like the owner did not care about my satisfaction. Additionally, other clients in the salon were also unhappy with their results. It is clear that this salon does not prioritize customer happiness and is more concerned with profit than quality. I will not be returning and caution others to avoid this salon.

We had our destination wedding at the Riviera Mansion and it was an incredible experience. The venue is beautiful and the pricing was reasonable. The staff, especially Breanna and Eli, were amazing to work with and attended to every detail. The layout of the mansion was perfect for our multigenerational wedding, providing something for everyone. The bartending service was exceptional, with a signature drink that was a hit among guests. Overall, a five-star experience and we highly recommend it.

Dave was an incredibly friendly and helpful food cart owner. He took the time to explain the menu, and the hot dogs were prepared quickly and tasted absolutely amazing. The pizza dog and custom creation were both outstanding, and to top it off, Dave generously added grilled jalapeños. Santa Barbara definitely needs more late-night food carts like this one!
Had a less-than-pleasant experience at Wolfgang: overcrowded, dirty floors, and poor service. However, the redeeming factor was their exceptional crisp Chardonnay.

This Wawa store is a winner! Not only did they lower gas prices significantly upon opening, but they also offer a convenient automatic start/stop digital air pump. The staff is friendly and efficient, and the store layout is well-designed. A great experience overall!
Terrible experience. Mediocre food, extremely slow service, rude servers, and lots of billing mistakes. Would not recommend.

The seafood restaurant on the edge of the pier offers a mixed dining experience. The clam chowder is excellent and worth ordering again, but the cioppino lacks flavor and variety of seafood. The crab salad sandwich is disappointing, with overpowering mayo and a lack of crab flavor. The overall atmosphere is better when seated outside, overlooking the ocean. Service is good, but expect a wait to be seated. While it's worth a visit, it's important to be selective with your order as the menu can be hit or miss.
We had a great time at this place with our family. The staff were friendly and helpful, making it a fun and enjoyable activity.

Chef Sbraga's lavender honey fried chicken at Juniper Commons is some of the best I've had in a long time. The crunchy coating and juicy inside pair perfectly with the sweet honey glaze. The biscuit is also delicious. Every dish at Juniper Commons is top-notch. Chef Sbraga knows fried chicken.

Overall, my experience at Casselli's was disappointing. The waiter's unpleasant attitude, coupled with the overdone food and disruptive opera singer, made it difficult to enjoy my visit. Although convenient parking is a plus, the opportunity cost of returning to Casselli's is too high compared to other good Italian restaurants. Furthermore, the fact that it is cash-only adds an inconvenience. I will likely not be returning.

Although the initial experience with our friendly salesman was positive, the negotiations process turned sour. We were handed off to the manager, who seemed unaccustomed to dealing with informed shoppers and resorted to dishonesty. If it wasn't for the immediate need and specific color requirement, we would have gone elsewhere. If you choose to visit this dealership, come prepared with pricing information from other dealers, but consider buying from a different dealer if given the chance.

I had a great time at this casino, conveniently located just an hour away from Orlando. Despite the typical casino atmosphere, the overpriced burgers and fries at the Hard Rock Cafe were a downside. However, I had a stroke of luck playing the Breakfast at Tiffany's slot machine, which was enjoyable as a fan of the movie.

Merrigans is the go-to place in Tucson for honest and affordable RV repairs. While their phone communication may not be the best, their expertise and collection of parts for older RVs make up for it. Patience is rewarded with quality repairs at fair prices. Additionally, they offer a free 24-hour dump station and water. Choose Merrigans for a job done right without breaking the bank.
Lisa is absolutely amazing at what she does! Catch her on TV, she's a must-watch!

This place is fantastic! The brunch is delicious, the staff is incredibly friendly, and the cocktails are top-notch. The cute and comfy design adds to the overall delightful experience. As a lesbian, having a bar like this in the neighborhood makes me incredibly happy. I can't wait to bring my mom here for Mother's Day.

I regret to say that I will not be returning to this location. Despite contacting the manager about a poorly made pizza, their response was unresponsive and they failed to address the issue. Even after providing photo evidence, there was no further communication from their end.

I highly recommend this amazing restaurant with great food and a fantastic overall experience. It's best to go with a group of about 6 people to keep costs reasonable, but if money is not an issue, go ahead and splurge! The staff is helpful and knowledgeable about their wine selection, and they even let you take home any unfinished bottles. The cheese platter has a good variety, although I wish they had more cured meats. Finding a seat can be challenging, but worth the wait. The outdoor seating is lovely, especially with live music. Make sure to order the bacon wrapped dates stuffed with chorizo and the goat cheese and mushroom dish - both are outstanding. Everything I've tried here has been great. Just relax, enjoy the food, and have a wonderful time!

Went to see my son's band Last Frontier and was incredibly impressed with the staff, food, and overall experience. The pork belly and fish nachos were amazing, and they had a fantastic selection of whisky. The sound system for the band was top notch.

This paint store is outstanding. I've been here multiple times without any issues. It's the best paint store I've ever been to, apart from big names like Home Depot or Lowes. They offer a wide range of paints and all the necessary supplies. The staff is friendly, helpful, and they even keep your paint information on file. Look out for their sales, especially the 30% off deals. I highly recommend their interior Super Paint.
Excellent experience! Delicious food, impeccable service. Enjoyed dining on the deck, witnessing a stunning dolphin display. Definitely a must-visit again!

Whole Foods is an attractive store with beautiful displays and a sense of smugness. It's ironic that they are trying to position themselves as a 'value' food store when others have been doing it for years. For affordable options, look elsewhere. However, for lunch or a quick stop, it's a great choice. The store is enormous, clean, and well-stocked. It's a welcome addition to Reno, which needs retail to support its outdoor-focused community. The proximity to the freeway makes it convenient for travelers. The produce, cheese, and bakery options are fantastic, although they can be pricey.
This place never disappoints! Fantastic service and delicious food. We're regulars for a reason - consistently amazing!

The Chopped Italian salad from Fresh was disappointing and lacking in flavor. It could benefit from more Italian ingredients such as olives, artichoke hearts, and pepperoncinis. The salami also lacked flavor. Considering the positive reviews, I may give them another chance and try their panini instead, although I generally prefer salads for summer lunches.

Tyson delivered exceptional service with a prompt and efficient turnaround. I approached him with an RV featuring a ford front end, and he promptly scheduled the repairs and completed them ahead of schedule. The necessary parts were ordered and ready the next day, allowing the team to quickly work on my vehicle. In just 3 days, my RV bumper was replaced, allowing me to hit the road again. I highly recommend Tyson's services and will only trust him with my vehicles in the future. Manny and Tyson are outstanding!
Had a great lunch at Johnny Rockets in the casino. Lyndel, our server, was amazing and attentive. Delicious food, left feeling stuffed.

This place is absolutely fantastic! Exceptional food and impeccable service. The staff is incredibly nice and generous, creating a cool atmosphere. I'm a regular customer, dining here almost every weekend. And trust me, their Cuban espresso is unbeatable!

Great pizza with a variety of fantastic options such as the California, Meatlovers, and Veggie pizzas. Owner Pete is friendly and always present. Unfortunately, the shop is temporarily closed due to fire damage from the neighboring laundry mat. Can't wait for them to reopen, as I miss their amazing lunch special and delicious pizzas. Definitely the best local pizza in Hatboro.
The Buffalo chicken cheese dip is absolutely amazing! The wait staff is friendly and the prices are reasonable.

Incredibly impressed with the pizza joint! Despite a minor system hiccup, the guy went above and beyond, making and delivering a fresh, hot pizza along with 2 complimentary brownies within 20 minutes. Fantastic customer service and delicious food. My new favorite delivery spot!

Great 21st birthday dinner with family! Food and drinks were superb but overpriced. Lobster mac and cheese was a standout. Complimentary desserts were a nice touch. Overall, enjoyable experience but pricey.

This place has great ambience for both a fun date and a beer and sports crowd. The open kitchen adds to the experience. They offer a great beer selection. The rosemary fries are a must-try and the house burger is also very good. Will definitely be returning.

Overall rating: 3 stars

The food was excellent, with generous portions and flavorful options. However, the beer was disappointing, lacking in taste and not living up to the expected hoppy flavors. It's a good choice for lunch downtown, but not recommended solely for the brews.

I highly recommend this new boutique taqueria near Rivers Edge Apartments. The head chef, nominated for a James Beard Award, has created a flavorful and diverse menu. With both indoor and outdoor seating, as well as a bar nearby, it offers a great dining experience. I've tried every taco and appetizer, all made with fresh local ingredients, and they are fantastic. The mushroom and short rib tacos are especially delicious, but I suggest trying them all. Whether for lunch or dinner, this place is a must-visit. I'll definitely be returning!

Capofitto is a hidden gem with no lines and cheaper, tastier desserts than Franklin Fountain. The gelato is to die for, especially the chocolat scurio and pera combo. Can't wait to go back and try their pizza too!

A.I. DuPont is the best family hospital on the East Coast. They excel in coordinating multiple MD visits in a single day and provide exceptional care. The renovated wing offers great caregiver accommodations and the staff is friendly and attentive. Highly recommend traveling from NY for child's care.
Highly recommend Vetri in Philly for an exquisite Chef Tasting experience with 9 delicious courses and amazing wine.

This place is a true American diner gem. With its long-standing history, it's not hard to see why it has stood the test of time. The waitresses are always courteous and the food is made from scratch, which is a rare find these days. Their fried chicken is hands down the best I've ever tasted, and it's always fresh. If you're a coffee lover, you'll be delighted to know they offer bottomless refills at a very reasonable price. And don't forget to try their delicious pie.
Terrible experience. Groupon issues and negligence led to driving with an old oil filter for 5k miles. Awful customer service and rude attitude. Find a better place.

I attended the #welldoneTBO tweet-up at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza and had a great experience. Amazing customer service, delicious menu items, and a personal favorite was the Philly Cheesesteak Pizza. The Cauliflower pizza was also a delightful vegetarian option. The carmelized onion-smothered wings were out of this world. Tasted other dishes like meatballs, ribs, and salad, all very good. Ordered a half and half pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms which was so good. If they offered liquor, I would have given them five stars. Thanks, Anthony's, for a fantastic evening. We'll definitely be back.
Exceptional service and delectable cuisine accompanied by a mesmerizing dry ice fog, elevating the dining experience to new heights.
Delicious, authentic New Orleans cuisine. Busy but got seated quickly. Opted for the a la carte and it exceeded our expectations. The highlight of our trip!

This restaurant is ideal for hosting out-of-town guests, especially for breakfast or brunch. It gets quite busy on weekends, with wait times exceeding an hour after 9:30 AM, and service can be a bit slow. However, the extensive menu and delectable food make up for the wait. Additionally, they have a fantastic bakery, coffee, and gelato counter, providing instant service or treats to enjoy while waiting.

The food is excellent, but the service was disappointing and made me feel rushed and unimportant. Shocked that the waitress withheld my change, leaving me feeling cheated. Will consider returning in the future with exact change and adjusted tip due to the experience.

The sushi at this place is solid, with Mesa rolls being my personal favorite. However, the pick-up service needs improvement as they often give inaccurate estimations, causing delays. I would rate them 4 stars if this issue was resolved.
The best burger in Philly. Fresh bread, juicy meat, friendly service, and affordable price.

This place is a great spot for wine, cheese, and outdoor music. However, the food was unremarkable, particularly the bacon-wrapped dates, brussel sprouts, and sardines that were sent back due to their unpleasant smell and taste.
The Po-Boys were excellent in taste but lacked sufficient catfish, quite skimpy. Yet, the service was very good.

I had the worst Mediterranean food experience. The hummus was drowned in an excessive amount of olive oil, and the pita bread was burnt to the point of being black. The food made me sick because of the overwhelming oil content. The manager's behavior was terrible too, offering a "favor" with a condescending tone and yelling from across the restaurant instead of talking to us. We didn't feel comfortable giving feedback due to his negative attitude. The sign claiming the "cleanest bathroom in town" was the only positive takeaway.
The bagels are great but it's disappointing they close early. Staff could be friendlier, but the tasty bagels make up for it!
