The hotel was fantastic, with a great location and friendly staff. The room was spacious and impeccably clean, with a well-stocked kitchenette. The natural light from the windows surrounding the bed was a plus. Opting out of housekeeping also gave a $5 credit at the restaurant. The pool was small, but the hot tub was always available. The bar had a decent drink selection, although they were out of mint for a mojito. The burger was okay, and the dessert was mediocre but free with the credit. The breakfast spread was nice, although the coffee was weak and often had grounds in it.
The falafel wrap was average, but slightly overpriced. The ambiance of the sitting area was unappealing, resembling a cold and unwelcoming cave. Manayunk offers better dining options.

I had a great experience at this place when I needed assistance due to a flat tire and car damage while driving cross country. Brian was very friendly, quickly assessed the situation, and fixed everything within 30 minutes. Highly recommend!

Visited this eatery with a party of 8 on Friday, July 22. Great location for exploring the Quarter afterwards. Unfortunately, only 2 out of the 8 dishes ordered were tasty - the jambalaya and file gumbo. The rest, including red beans and rice, meatloaf, Mac and cheese, shrimp po boy, and chicken wings, were bland and a waste of money. The staff was nice, but overall the food was mediocre.

Santa Barbara's seafood market offers an unbeatable freshness, rivaling the renowned Tokyo fish market. Despite lacking ambiance, the ocean view from the outdoor seating compensates for it. Delight in a wide selection of delectable shellfish, tailored to satisfy your cravings. Although you might face a wait during busy times, the experience is undoubtedly worthwhile. Use the wait to explore the nearby pier and make space for the mouthwatering feast that awaits you.

This place offers creative and tasty food, decent house wines, and well-made but small cocktails. Service has always been good, although I haven't been during peak times. The patio is a great spot for hanging out with friends.

Skyway Cafe (formerly Skyway Jacks) offers huge plates of delicious food at affordable prices. The bovine decor provides a cozy atmosphere, reminiscent of a local diner. The service is prompt and the coffee keeps flowing. Don't miss their morning breakfast deal for a satisfying start to your day. And most importantly, the banana pecan pancakes are a must-try. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.
Terrible experience! Waited over an hour for a shot, only to be told they were closing the line. Complete disappointment. Avoid this place.
Extremely disappointed with the customer service. Don't count on finding any assistance, good luck.

Fair Grinds in New Orleans is a quaint and hipster coffee shop with a beautiful outdoor seating area. The small cold brew with vanilla and gluten-free zucchini bread were delicious. The option of adding whole milk was a rare and enjoyable treat. However, the limited gluten-free offerings were disappointing. Overall, a great place to visit if in the neighborhood.
I absolutely loved this place! The sweet selection is incredible, especially the gooey butter cookies and the German chocolate cupcake. Highly recommend!

Decent frozen yogurt with ample topping choices and a variety of flavors. However, costs can escalate when weighing your cup. Limited seating inside and the staff lacks energy. Bubble tea was unimpressive.
Amazing food and worth the drive! Authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Loved the Chicken Basil and their Boba Tea is great too! Don't listen to the negative reviews, try it and judge for yourself!

CRU is a charming wine bar with a modern atmosphere. The wine flight and food options were delicious, with the Farmers Plate being a standout. I loved the cozy and quaint feel of the place and can't wait to return.

I've been a loyal customer for years, and this spot remains truly great. In my opinion, it offers one of the top 3 steaks in the city. Even after a name change, the quality has stayed consistent. For a delicious twist, I highly recommend trying their chicken cheesesteak.

Pina's in Roxborough is a highly underrated place to eat. Their stromboli and sicilian pie are both top-notch, but the sandwiches and pizza are just average. The chicken park dish is a standout, with a generous portion size and mouthwatering flavors. Overall, Pina's is a satisfying and filling dining option.

Overall, this cafe offers tasty food and a wide variety of options at their grocery section. Although slightly expensive, the quality justifies the price. I particularly enjoyed their vegan sandwich and tofu melt, accompanied by an extensive assortment of vegan desserts.

This place is amazing! They serve the best burgers in New Orleans with excellent service. The food is fresh, and they make sure you are served promptly. We tried the Gator and deer burgers, which were delicious. Personally, I loved their buffalo wings. Their drinks are also great. We left extremely satisfied and will definitely return before leaving town.

Highly recommend this restaurant! Great old school atmosphere with 3 floors. The food is amazing, especially the veal, clams casino, mussles, pasta, and homemade garlic bread. The staff is friendly and helpful. Recently tried the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce and it became my new favorite dish. A must-visit place for food lovers!

Home Wine Kitchen's "No Menu Monday" is a must-try for food enthusiasts in St. Louis. The three-course meal, priced at $30, offers delicious and customized dishes. The starters, lamb meatballs and goat cheese-stuffed peppers, were excellent. The mains, corvina fish and swordfish steak, were tasty, although the corvina was slightly too complex for my taste. Dessert, champagne gelatin and chocolate tart, was delightful. The staff was friendly and professional, and the ambiance was pleasant. Overall, a great dining experience, but I am curious to try their regular menu next time.

I went to this swanky restaurant for a special reunion dinner with friends. The food was worth the price, but my party thought it was expensive. I had the lobster bake which was delicious, although not fantastic. The Neopolitan Old Fashion was made perfectly. My friends ordered various dishes and drinks, and the bill was $170, which some of them found unexpected. The waiter was fantastic, very attentive and even surprised us with a birthday dessert. Service gets 5 stars, food gets 3 stars, ambience gets 4 stars, and price gets 2 stars. Overall, I was satisfied.

I have been going to Susanna Foo since I was 6 months old and have fond memories of the restaurant. The food is reliable but lacks excitement for me as an adult. The service, decor, and ambience are always impeccable. I hope Susanna adds new flavors or embraces her Chinese roots for a more ethnic menu. I am hopeful for a revitalization and to rekindle my love for Susanna Foo.

Spiro's is a hidden gem in California with delicious Greek food. Despite its small advertisement, the restaurant offers a delightful dining experience. The Greek lemon soup was excellent and the Moussaka was satisfying. The waiter's suggestion of Sea Bass was also tempting. Overall, the dinner was terrific and the exceptional service from Neil makes Spiro's a must-visit restaurant in the area.

As a BBQ judge, I have to say this is not barbecue in any region, be it Texas, the southeast, or KC. The brisket is more like fatty pot roast, lacking smoke flavor and with a mushy texture. My sandwich was majorly fat-filled, with meatless chunks of fat. It seems either the owner doesn't care or the staff lacks knowledge. Unfortunately, you can find much better BBQ elsewhere.

This place is an ideal spot to catch a sunset. A bit of a drive from Tampa but definitely worth it. The energetic music and lively ambiance make it enjoyable. The rocky beach means no swimming, but it doesn't matter because the view and atmosphere are incredible. Been coming here with our boys since they were babies, and it never disappoints. The food and drinks don't leave a strong impression, but that's not what we come for.

This place has been thriving since 1958 for a reason. They offer great soft serve and scooped ice cream cones, as well as delightful boats, floats, and sundaes. The prices are also affordable. Highly recommend!

I stumbled upon this Mexican restaurant while in the area and craving some authentic cuisine. The pazole was delicious and had a great combination of flavors. The lettuce was a bit disappointing, but hot sauce made it better. The taco lunch special was good too. The service was amazing and the salsa was fresh, although a bit too sweet for my liking. Don't miss out on the pineapple water, even if you don't usually like pineapples. I can't wait to come back and try their burritos. A hidden gem worth indulging in!

The restaurant has a great ambiance with attractive employees and perfect lighting. It's suitable for a blind date and the service is good and timely. However, the high prices for what you get and the kitchen's lack of accommodation bring down the rating. The serving sizes can be small for the price, and the kitchen refused to make a simple substitution. Overall, it's disappointing and leaves a negative impression.

Interesting destination with great decor, noisy atmosphere, and funky vibe. Hip servers, but rushed and inattentive service. Not safe or knowledgeable for gluten-free individuals, awful GF buns. Parking is a challenge for those with cars.

The drinks and food were excellent, especially the pulled pork and fried chicken po boy. The mac and cheese was outstanding. The prices were reasonable, and they had a great selection of draft beers. Additionally, it's a bonus that they serve food until 1am.

This restaurant offers a disappointing dining experience with slow service, a dirty environment, and mediocre, overpriced breakfast options. I strongly recommend trying other nearby options like First Watch or Pinky's instead, as they offer better quality and value. The claims of higher prices at these alternatives are unfounded. Avoid wasting your time at this deteriorated establishment.

El Arado is a decent place with reasonable prices, attentive staff, and good food. Despite a slight issue with the table, the waiter was quiet but attentive. The drinks were reasonably priced and the food was fresh, hot, and met everyone's specific requests. Overall, a good option for affordable and filling meals before a night out in Fountain Square, or even for those heading to strip clubs.

I highly recommend the Loew's hotel - it's exceptionally clean, stylish, and offers amazing service. The breakfast is fantastic, with futuristic aesthetics that impress even the kids. The rooms are spacious, and the parking is convenient. 5 stars!

I finally tried honeygrow and it's amazing! I had their Sour Cherry BBQ stir fry with chicken and it was low calorie and filling. Ordering and paying at the kiosk was convenient, and the employees were friendly and efficient. I'll definitely be returning!

The cheeseburger was superb with a perfectly cooked patty, great sauce, and a soft bun. The complimentary zucchini bread was delicious. The service was good, and they had a great selection of G+Ts. The ambience was cool, and it's conveniently located downstairs from my apartment. The only potential downside is the price, and the waitresses' attitude towards our simple order needs further assessment. However, overall, I'm excited to return.

Overall, Smokey offers a variety of dining options, beverages for a fee, a pricey hotel, free parking, various entertainment, an ATM for those concerned about self-control, and gambling for those willing to take the risk. As a non-smoker with allergies, the experience was slightly hindered. However, even as an observer, there is still enjoyment to be had.
Disappointing 4.5-star rating. So-so burgers, chain restaurant vibe. Maybe better on weekends? Won't return.

This is my absolute favorite brewery in the world! Every time we visit St. Louis, we make sure to stop by. We recently did the "Beer School" with friends and it was awesome. I highly recommend it, especially if it's your first visit. Start with the brewery tour to see the Clydesdales and learn about the brewing process—it's amazing! I can't wait to go back and try the "Brew Master" next time. Until then, cheers to Budweiser!

I arrived early for a reservation, but the hostesses ignored us and gave priority to a walk-in party. They blamed their mistake on a new employee and showed no remorse. Terrible customer service and lack of professionalism. Will not be going back.

The food was excellent, but unfortunately, they refused to honor their Yelp offer of 10% off for checking in and reviewing their business until our next visit. Despite having 4 hours left to redeem the deal, they displayed bad business practice. Great food, but left disappointed by their actions.

I have only visited this location a few times, mostly for sending packages, and I appreciate the presence of an automated machine which is lacking at my closest post office. However, the outstanding customer service we encountered during our visit to submit passport applications deserves special mention. The representative we dealt with was exceptional - efficient, friendly, and well-informed. We were in and out in no time, and she even provided me with follow-up forms and guidance regarding my name change. I hope to have more experiences like this in the future, and she should be recognized as a model for training others.

Highly recommended starting point for a health journey with vast selection of vitamins, dietary supplements, beauty products, and homeopathic items. Super helpful staff assists in finding essential items and provides suggestions. Love the rewards program and acceptance of digital coupons.

I absolutely love this shoppe! The staff is awesome, creating a great atmosphere. They offer a variety of healthy and tasty treats, including delicious croissants. The menu for breakfast and lunch is impressive, and every dish I've tried here has been nothing short of fantabulous.
I had a delightful Saturday morning at this place, enjoying a scrumptious Cranberry Orange Muffin and a Caffe Latte. The ambience was lovely, and the service was quick and efficient.
The best sushi spot with the friendliest staff! A top menu choice, making every meal exceptional!

This coffee shop is a must-visit in the city! Amazing food, fresh and delicious. Cool edgy vibe with plenty of comfy seating, both indoors and outdoors. Highly recommended, especially if you're craving good food along with your coffee.

I highly recommend this place for the best burritos in town! Great salsas, relaxed atmosphere, excellent service and price. The chicken and chorizo combo is my personal favorite, but the smoked brisket is also delicious. The medium burrito is more than enough, unless you're training for an eating event. Family-owned and full of flavor. Top recommendation for good, healthy food at a reasonable price.

This lunch menu is a real treat! The sandwiches are absolutely delicious, satisfying every taste bud. Although a bit pricey and on the smaller side, the quality makes it well worth it. Can't wait to try their steaks! Food and service both get a perfect 5/5, and the price gets a 4/5 for being a little high but great quality.

The selection is tasty and the atmosphere is preppy. The What's Up Doc omelet is a safe choice, although the size may vary. The french toasts are perfect for those with a sweet tooth. The Fancy Breakfast Sandwich with substituted bacon is a winner. Don't forget to try their great mimosas!
If you're a fan of 50's-Midcentury modern style, this store is a must-visit! While the prices may be a bit higher compared to my favorite STL stores, it's undeniably a one-of-a-kind gem.
Terrible experience. Constant construction, dirty room, and unprofessional service. Will not be returning.

The fried rice is amazing and the Pho is the best I've had in Nashville. As a Seattleite, I'm picky about Vietnamese food, but this place exceeded my expectations. Highly recommend for first-timers and Vietnamese food enthusiasts!
I walked from our condo and discovered this amazing place! Delicious sliders, donuts, and unique drinks. The atmosphere is awesome and the staff is extremely friendly. I will definitely be returning!

Casa Video is hands down the best video rental store out there. The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, but it's their exceptional selection that truly sets them apart. Whether you're after the latest releases or vintage VHS tapes, they've got you covered, all at an affordable price. I only wish there was a place like Casa Video in Chicago.

I had a satisfying and reasonably priced lunch at this sushi place. I ordered a long roll, a hand roll, a drink, and a chocolate mochi, which I absolutely loved. The total cost was just under $20 with tip. The rolls were fresh and delicious, but the mochi stole the show with its creamy and tasty flavor.

I had a quick and positive experience at this store. The staff was friendly, and the store was clean and well-stocked. However, I have concerns about its longevity, given the number of nearby closures.
Best Pizza: The perfect place for pizza lovers. Exceptional staff, refreshing cold beer, and perfectly maintained taps. Don't miss out on their incredible 5-dollar beer and slice combo.

Federal Donuts definitely lives up to its hype. As a vegetarian, I can vouch for their amazing donuts and coffee. The staff is exceptionally friendly, even during busy times. My husband is obsessed with their chicken, particularly the buttermilk ranch. It's an all-around wonderful experience.

Despite the convenient location and great bar atmosphere, this place falls short in terms of food quality. We gave it three chances, but each dish we tried was subpar, except for the overly sweet Asian shrimp. On the first visit, we attributed the issues to a new restaurant finding its footing. However, the second visit only resulted in a dry turkey patty without informing us about the lack of buns. The manager did comp that meal, but the most recent experience with fish and chips served from a box and greasy chicken salad was the final straw. We won't be returning.

Sapore offers a refreshing escape with its dark and cool interior. The reservation made seating hassle-free for our party of three. The customizable drinks were a pleasant surprise, especially the vodka martini with a blue-cheese-stuffed olive and anchovy. The Caprese salad was decent, while the Chicken Marsala was satisfying with enough leftovers. The dessert menu was excellent, with tiramisu being our choice. Would consider coming back for the martinis, appetizers, and desserts.

Despite being located in a less trendy strip mall near Cool Springs, this version of Twelve South's hipster gourmet Burger Up still delivers in terms of taste. The burgers are delicious and messy, made with fresh meat and fixings. The regular fries are satisfying, but the truffle fries are outstanding, with a non-greasy finish topped with parmesan cheese. The chocolate milkshake, although simple, is perfectly made - creamy, not too sweet, and not overly chocolatey. For those looking for an upscale burger experience that still satisfies the burger-fries-shake holy trinity, this place is a must-visit.

Terrible experience. Made an appointment to fix "check engine" light, but car wasn't even looked at until the next day. Had to wait an hour for them to give me my car due to poor parking management. No repair or maintenance needed. Won't be going back.

RH&B was once known as the go-to spot in south Jersey for BBQ and blues, attracting customers with its great atmosphere. However, since the recent sale, the decision to eliminate live music has left a void. Although the food was only decent, it is the absence of live music that makes it hard to recommend this restaurant. The only aspect that I will truly miss are the wonderful people who worked there.

This sandwich spot used to be reliable, but the last two experiences were disappointing. The cheesesteak lacked meat, and the roll was one of the worst and stale. Hopefully, it was just an off night. I'll give it another chance, but not anytime soon.

I had a disappointing experience at this property. Despite being a SPG gold member, the staff did not accommodate my request for a larger room and I had to endure significant noise issues. The hotel's service was lacking, with long waiting times at the front desk. Overall, this hotel lacks luxury and needs improvement in its service.
The food was fresh and delicious, though not extraordinary. The price was fair and the staff was very helpful and friendly.

This hotel is decent, especially for business travelers. The rooms are comfortable with essential amenities. The cafe offers a decent deal, but it's unclear what is included. The hallways could use some maintenance, but it isn't a major issue. However, room cleaning can be inconsistent, as evidenced by a previous experience of finding food in the mini fridge.

Henry's, the neighborhood coffee spot I recently discovered, unfortunately left a lackluster first impression. The atmosphere was standard with ordinary furniture, lacking uniqueness. The coffee, specifically the iced coffee, was bitter and disappointing. Hoping for a better experience with hot coffee or espresso in the future. Not off to a great start, Henry.

We were thoroughly impressed with this hotel! The staff was welcoming, offering complementary cookies and water upon arrival. The Read it and Return program allowed us to borrow books during our stay. The room was clean and well equipped with amenities. The smoking area had comfortable seating. The complimentary breakfast was substantial and varied daily. The pool and hot tub were well-maintained. The late checkout time was a bonus. The staff was genuinely interested in our feedback. We highly recommend this hotel!

Buying a car can be intimidating, but with thorough preparation and sticking to your position, you can achieve a fair deal. I visited multiple dealerships and chose Toyota of Santa Barbara because they had the vehicle I wanted. Sam Ladd, the salesman, treated me courteously and allowed me to test drive various cars. The negotiation process with Frank Flores, the sales manager, was business-like and he addressed my concerns. Overall, as long as the car performs well over time, I am satisfied with my purchase.

Amazing bar with a fantastic atmosphere. Friendly staff, including the owner, create a welcoming vibe. The diverse crowd and staff make you feel right at home. Plus, the BBQ truck parked outside is top-notch!

The staff was friendly, but the Italian food was average and served lukewarm. We visited during Christmas with a large group, attracted by the BYOB policy and absence of a fixed menu. The appetizers, including fried gnocchi and calamari, were decent. However, the main courses lacked creativity and variety, with unimpressive sauces. Even though the staff was accommodating, the lackluster food is not enticing enough for a return visit.
This Chinese place is truly one of the best and friendliest spots to satisfy your taste buds. Don't miss out on trying their mouth-watering double treasure dish.

I highly recommend Reno Vulcanizing for all your vehicle needs. The team, particularly Ken, Bruce, and the rest of the staff, have consistently provided honest, courteous, and helpful service. We have been loyal customers for years and would never consider taking our vehicles anywhere else.

City Tour: 1 Star - Not worth it, no confirmation email, payment hassle, limited visibility, only two worthwhile stops. Take the green street cars or red bus tours instead.

Plantation Tour: 5 Stars! Informative and balanced history, driver Stacie was great. Laura Plantation was amazing, Oak Alley was beautiful but focused on landowners. Buses are comfortable.

Swamp Tour: 4 Stars - No alligators due to rain, but guide was knowledgeable. Avoid booking in cold or stormy weather. Comfortable buses.

Based on this review, I would strongly advise avoiding this pizza place. The reviewer described it as the worst pizza they have ever had, with a thin crust that was not crunchy, poor quality olives, and a salad that was expensive and lacking in quality. The cheese on the salad looked powdered and came in a prepacked divider, which the reviewer considered a rip off. Although the knots were okay, the overall experience was negative. The reviewer typically prefers ordering from other pizza places like Grimaldi's, BJs, or Mellow Mushroom, or buying organic pizza from Publix or Whole Foods, which they find to be cheaper and tastier. They criticize Dominoes for being a reminder of the need for corporate chains to fall and prefer paying for quality rather than preservatives and poison. They are also planning to request a refund. This review serves as a clear warning to avoid this pizza place at all costs.
Despite the nice ambiance and friendly staff, the absence of dark beer in February was a letdown. Summer beer in winter didn't quite hit the mark.
Buddy Brew is fantastic, despite parking and occasional crowds. Friendly baristas, great food options, and carefully roasted coffee make it a must-try in Tampa. One of my absolute favorite places.
Overrated. The crust sometimes burns and it's not to our taste, but the cauliflower salad and fried dough ball dessert were delicious.

I recently used a gift certificate at this place after waiting for 6 months, and it was definitely worth the wait! It's the perfect lunch spot, and I fell in love with their mixed salad sandwich - absolutely delicious! The homemade ice cream is also incredibly tempting, and I can't wait to go back for more.

I absolutely love this Italian restaurant! The food surpassed my expectations in terms of both quality and portion size. The staff, especially Alexa, treated us incredibly well every time we picked up or dined in. Thank you for an awesome experience!

Highly recommend this spot in the Quarter for a refined drink and great service. The Manhattans with Carpano Antica Formula vermouth were the best I've ever had. The lamb meatballs were okay, but the spring rolls were excellent. Drinks were pricey but worth it for occasional nights out. Eric, the manager, was incredibly professional and friendly. We'll definitely return.

I used to frequent this place for their lunch special which was a great deal. Though my husband isn't a fan, I still enjoy going occasionally. Prices have increased recently, but it's still consistently satisfying.
Had the classic burger and fries, both delicious. Service was excellent and the Bananas Foster spiked milkshake was a must-try. Great experience overall.

I visited this location for the first time and had a frustrating experience. Despite a few open tables, the service was slow and disorganized. We waited 15 minutes for our food order to be taken and witnessed another customer receiving their food before us, despite arriving later. Our waitress was inattentive and the kitchen seemed unbothered by the delay. After 40 minutes with no food, we decided to leave and received no apology. I won't be returning to this location. Waste of time.

The bakery is AMAZING! The tres leche is just like grandma used to make, minus the liquor. The cannoli and Italian wedding cookies are delicious, and the dark chocolate florentine is an unexpected delight even for coconut haters like me. We will definitely be returning!

We ordered pizzas to take away from this place while on vacation and wanting to avoid cooking. The restaurant was located 500 meters from our accommodation. The atmosphere inside was pleasant, clean, and comfortable for dining in. The staff, particularly the friendly and attentive man who served us, was excellent. We tried various flavors including prosciutto, ham, pepperoni, onion, mushrooms, anchovies, and basil with tomato. The pizzas took around 25 to 30 minutes to be ready, and all of them were delicious. The stone-baked style, with the perfect amount of tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese, was delightful. The warmth of the service reflected the experience of dining in. Overall, I would rate this place five stars.

Had a nice time celebrating a friend's birthday at this cozy place. Not too crowded, prompt and friendly service. Burger was decent, although slightly overcooked. Overall, a good time on Paradise road.

After reading numerous positive reviews, I decided to try this place. Although the oysters were enjoyable, everything else was dry and tasteless. The cramped space and people coughing on us made it difficult to enjoy the experience. The 2 half and half baskets my boyfriend and I ordered were definitely not worth the hefty $60 price tag.

Village Whiskey has the best burger in Philadelphia, as confirmed by my visit. The bartenders are excellent and knowledgeable about their wide selection of whiskeys. The drinks are a bit pricey but delicious. The Village Burger is unbelievable with its homemade thousand island dressing, bacon, and flavorful meat. The fries are also good, especially the plain duck fat fries. Be prepared for a long wait as this place gets very busy. Overall, great drinks, delectable food, and friendly staff. I would definitely return.

Overall, I found this neighborhood sushi joint to be pretty good with attentive and speedy service. The roll menu is limited, but they are accommodating to custom requests. While the rolls were fine, they weren't exceptional. However, I have no real complaints and would definitely go back. It's a hidden gem for a quick and convenient sushi option near home.

A hidden gem in the French Quarter, Flanagan's Pub offers a refreshing alternative to the bustling bars on Bourbon St. With friendly bartenders, a diverse mix of locals and tourists, and laid-back vibes, we found ourselves returning three times in one day. The punk rock music added to the cool atmosphere.

The Daily Bread falls short in both its food quality and service. The sandwiches lack flavor and the BBQ Chicken pizza is just average. The biggest issue is the uninterested and slow service, with long wait times and a lack of urgency to assist customers. The cleanliness of the restaurant is also disappointing, with dirty tables and unaddressed trash. Overall, it's not worth returning to when there are better options like St. Louis Bread Co.

Ordered delivery through Yelp, took 45 minutes. Friendly driver. BBQ chicken pizza was delicious with toppings spread out. Mozzarella sticks were deep fried, not breaded. Two free cookies were amazing, slightly undercooked. Fair price, would order again despite the wait.

The gym is fabulous and offers a wide range of fitness opportunities considering its cost. The class schedule suits those with varying work start and end times, offering classes in the early morning and late afternoon. The trainers, especially in spin and row, are exceptional. The We-Fit class is a challenging workout even for the fit. The facility is currently clean, but we'll see if it stays that way as it is a new business. The women's locker room includes convenient amenities like a blow dryer and extra hair ties, which is greatly appreciated.

In a hurry? Bottom line: Prestigious is FANTASTIC! Clean and professional atmosphere, knowledgeable advisor, excellent communication throughout the repair process. Perfect color match and top-notch workmanship. Highly recommend for high-quality repairs.
Santa Barbara is an excellent place to eat, with quality food, exceptional customer service, and good value for money. The breakfast place is highly recommended for visitors.

I finally tried this place for lunch after years of curiosity. The layout is great with an uncrowded floor and a lunch counter facing the cooks' area. The staff was busy but not rude or frazzled, and my waitress was sweet. I ordered the fried shrimp po boy dressed and enjoyed it, but the food was average for a tourist spot in the Quarter. I might go back to try one of their burgers.

These people are exceptional. We've been with them for years, seen countless doctors, and they have never failed us. They are genuine animal lovers who always deliver outstanding service. Highly reliable, there's really nothing more to add!

Awesome family-friendly atmosphere with delicious Po boys that feature perfectly baked bread. We tried three variations and all were incredibly tasty. The Mac 'n Cheese had a delightful spicy kick, and the service was absolutely fantastic.

Absolutely amazing dining experience during my week-long trip to NOLA! Despite the wait, the Sunday Jazz Brunch and ambience kept us entertained. The staff was friendly, allowing us to take our time ordering. The food was top-notch, from the seafood gumbo to the sea bass with green beans and a delicious sauce. Dessert was a hit too. Plus, we got seated where Ronald Reagan sat on his visits! Worth every penny. Will definitely come back.

If you're visiting Indianapolis and looking for a great hotel, I highly recommend this one. The parking is convenient and the hotel features stunning urban art throughout. The check-in process was smooth and the service was outstanding. Our room was luxurious with a Keurig coffee machine, large shower, comfy robes, and a comfortable California king bed. The hotel's bar, Plat 99, offers delicious drinks and dinner, and their outdoor rooftop seating area looked amazing. The location is perfect if you're attending a Pacers game, as it's just a short walk away. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast at the Market Place downstairs. Checking out was a breeze, and the concierge was friendly and helpful. The hotel's art collection is like a modern art museum, and we spent some time exploring before leaving. Overall, we absolutely loved this hotel and will definitely stay here again when we return to Indianapolis.

The establishment has a nice setting and atmosphere with various amenities. However, the service was disappointing and disorganized. The cashier made an error by adding a beer to my to-go order and I did not receive the fish taco I had ordered. The Sonoran dog I received was soggy and not comparable to food truck options. The tacos were mediocre, lacking in flavors and presentation. The place was extremely busy and loud, potentially impacting the overall experience. They were also running out of ingredients. Overall, it was a disappointing dining experience.

Sam's is one of the better sports bars in Nashville, but compared to sports bars in other cities, it is mediocre. The service can be hit or miss, and the attire of some employees could be improved. The food is decent, but the beer selection is lacking. However, if you're looking to watch sports at a bar in Nashville, Sam's is a good option.

Excellent location, delicious food, and the staff is very friendly. Limited seating and can get crowded during busy times, but ordering online for pick-up seems like a smart option. On a nice day, enjoy HCV in Rittenhouse Square. Great for both vegetarians and meat eaters.

Terrible experience! Delayed over an hour without any notification, and their customer policy offers zero assistance or accountability. All passengers stranded at the bus stop, wasting precious time. Avoid this company at all costs!

Michael & Lucy's new family restaurant is a welcome addition to Santa Claus Lane. Despite its tough location, the Tuscany design and friendly owners make it a pleasant and inviting place to dine. The food is delicious, the prices are reasonable, and the slice and salad special is worth trying. They offer a great selection of local beers on tap and have multiple HD sports TVs for sports enthusiasts. The addition of a TV for surf videos and kids shows adds to the overall appeal. The classic Ms Pac-Man game is a hit with children. It's refreshing to see Santa Claus Lane experiencing a Renaissance. Best of luck to Michael & Lucy on their new venture!

Don't be discouraged by the shopping center location! Outstanding place with an exceptional staff. Curtis epitomizes superb service and genuinely cares about your dining enjoyment. Don't miss the scallops small plate, but overall, the entire dining experience is absolutely remarkable.

Amazing breakfast spot! Located just a short walk from the French Quarter, this place exceeded my expectations. The bananas foster was absolutely incredible. The vibrant and lively atmosphere perfectly captures the essence of New Orleans. Highly recommended!

The birthday cakes are truly amazing! However, the cupcakes and cookies upfront can occasionally be stale. Nevertheless, the staff's excellent customer service makes up for it. Overall, I highly recommend and will definitely return.

I enjoyed my experience at this new restaurant despite some slow service. The margarita and cilantro chicken enchiladas were great. The outdoor seating area was pleasant. Overall, I liked it and hope they improve their flow over time. The prices are reasonable and it's a refreshing addition to the neighborhood. Hope Loco succeeds!

I highly recommend going to this nail salon! Ever since I started seeing Nary, my nails have received so many compliments. The atmosphere is great, with friendly banter among the staff and clients. Make sure to book an appointment as they offer unique designs and jewels that other salons don't, making it popular and sometimes busy. If you want extravagant nails, be prepared to pay accordingly. Looking forward to my next visit in 2 weeks!

Highly recommended spot in Treasure Island! The char-grilled oysters are a must-try, and the staff is fantastic. The spacious outdoor seating area is perfect, plus they welcome pets! A major win, especially for someone like me from Austin.

This place offers abundant fried seafood, but comes with a surprisingly high price tag for a working class establishment. It has a typical New Orleans vibe and is suitable for a special outing with family. Unfortunately, the food falls short of expectations.

Highly recommended spot with fast and friendly service, serving tasty basic breakfast dishes. The Cajun tasso omelet was fantastic, not too spicy but just right. Fluffy and delicious hash browns. Everyone left satisfied and full. Will definitely return next time.

I had a wonderful time dining here with a group of four. The appetizers, including dumplings, wings, and specials, were all intriguing and flavorful. The noodles, while not as generous as a typical chinatown noodle house, were still interesting, fresh, and delicious. Additionally, the affordability and BYO policy make it a fantastic choice. Overall, a great addition to 10th street!
The sandwiches at this place in St. Louis are simply the best! Friendly atmosphere and crowd make it a delight to eat here every single day.

This establishment in Reno, NV is a fantastic choice for lunch or dinner. The manager, Tyler, handles his staff excellently, resulting in a great dining experience. Additionally, their pub offers an excellent variety of beers and wines.

Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by my experience at Chuck E Cheese as a childless woman. The staff was efficient and attentive, ensuring minimal wait times and providing excellent service. The variety of games available at a single token was a bonus, although it did result in frequent visits to the wallet. The birthday party area was slightly crowded, but the staff took great care of the birthday kids. While I may not visit often, it was nostalgic and heartwarming to see children enjoying themselves and reliving my own memories at Chuck E Cheese.

I loved this restaurant! The simple, fresh and organic food was a refreshing change from other places. They had a great selection of coffee and latte options, and their Sasquatch brew was delicious. The ambiance was casual, relaxed, and comfortable, adding to the overall enjoyable experience. The owners were amazing and friendly as well.
Delicious, hormone-free ice cream! Best spot in town - cash only but worth the ATM trip.

Despite facing difficulties in reaching the restaurant due to parade-related obstacles, we had a fantastic dining experience as an alternative to Rio Mar. The service was impressively professional, striking a balance between attentiveness and subtlety. Although it was disappointing that two ingredients were unavailable for their signature cocktail, we understood the circumstances being the day before Mardi Gras. The bread and butter provided were exceptional, with a crunchy exterior and a soft interior. The uniqueness of the beet salad stood out, as the greens tasted incredibly fresh. G's Choucroute was a meat lover's delight, and my crab ravioli with Meyer lemon sauce was delicately flavorful. Our dessert, bread pudding, was exactly to our liking without raisins. Overall, this was a truly memorable meal surpassing the standards set by most hotel restaurants.
Amazing find on Uber Eats! Delicious food from 51st Deli, can't wait to visit in person.

The Honey Apple grilled cheese sandwich at Meltdown is absolutely amazing! Friendly staff, cool decor, and delicious food. The service and atmosphere at The Meltdown in Montgomeryville doesn't measure up. Rude service, strange decor, and even had my sandwich thrown at me. Stick with Meltdown if you're a cheese lover!

Great combination deals for rolls and sushi, making it super affordable. Rolls are on the smaller side, so ordering the combo is recommended for a satisfying meal. Surprisingly fresh sashimi for the price. The place is small and service is slow, but it's BYO, allowing you to bring your own drinks from downstairs while waiting.

The food was good, but the service was terrible. Despite ordering orange juice for my kids, we only received it when we were almost done eating. Additionally, the fact that they only accept cash or checks was inconvenient. Overall, they need to improve their service.

My recent visit was disappointing. The food quality has declined significantly, with watery salsas and poorly chopped ingredients. Even my usual favorite dish, #15, was a letdown. There has been a noticeable change in the rice and chicken quesadilla, which is now flavorless and overloaded with cheese. I hope they prioritize quality over cost-cutting.

I highly recommend Stigma for tattoos! I got two tattoos by Eddie and he did an amazing job. The entire staff is friendly and accommodating, especially with my back issues. I also received a discount through Yelp and bought their tattoo ointment, which is soothing. Overall, great artists and great experience.
This place is a blast! With its outdoor patio playing hip hop and an indoor dance area with salsa, you can easily switch up the music and scenery whenever you feel like it.

Great decor and wait staff, but the portions were small. The fish special was delicious, but the fattoush salad was disappointing with limp lettuce and no olives. Pricey for lunch, won't be returning.
The Animal Clinic is our top choice for all our pet's needs. They genuinely care for our animals as if they were their own. The only downside is the slightly inconvenient location.

This Taco Bell was an extremely disappointing experience. The restaurant's hygiene was unacceptable, the service was terrible, and our orders were consistently incorrect. I strongly advise against visiting this location and suggest exploring other dining options instead.

I enjoyed the Neuvo-Latino-American food at this place, which has relocated and expanded. The Chips & Salsa were consistently fresh and delicious. However, as I haven't visited the new location or dined there recently, I won't provide further commentary.

I stumbled upon Player's while driving and had a fantastic experience! The staff is friendly, service is top-notch, and the atmosphere is wonderfully laid-back. I received an excellent shave and haircut at a great price. Overall, a great find!

The food at this restaurant was terrible, particularly the frogs legs which were rubbery and tasted awful. The manager's rude behavior when I attempted to return my meal was absolutely shocking. Her actions left me disgusted and she should be deeply ashamed. I have never encountered such horrible treatment from anyone.

The location is isolated with limited dining options nearby, and the building is showing its age. The room had noticeable cleanliness issues with torn wallpaper, unclean floor, and water spots in the bathroom. The hallways were eerie, reminiscent of "red rum". However, the bed was comfortable and the room, although disappointing compared to other Doubletree hotels, was functional.

This boutique hotel is beautifully designed with a unique charm that sets it apart from typical hotels like the Hilton. I had my birthday party at the restaurant and it was a wonderful experience. The service was excellent and the rooms are stunning. The only downside was a slightly loud air conditioner in our room. However, its close proximity to the vibrant Printers Alley makes it even more appealing. I would certainly choose to stay in this hotel again.

This spot is amazing! The location is fantastic and it's not overcrowded if you go early. The bartenders are awesome and they made me the most amazing Perfect Rye Manhattan on the rocks. I'm officially hooked. And the burger? Hands down, the best I've ever had. I will definitely be returning.

This breakfast place is simply outstanding! The food is excellent, and the service matches its high quality. The biscuits and gravy, extra crispy bacon, sausage links, and challah French toast made it my new favorite breakfast spot.

We were pleased with Terra's work as our wedding florist. She took the time to understand our needs and accommodate our budget. The florals were beautiful, and we loved the draping for the ceremony and reception. However, some flowers in the bouquets wilted during the day, possibly due to the heat. Overall, we were happy with Terra for our wedding.
NOLA's healthy dining spot with great to-go options! Enjoyed the delicious turkey meatballs and spaghetti for a wonderful lunch.
This take-out food in Northern Liberties is everything I desire - fresh, delicious, and surprisingly healthy. It's a rare find in this area, and the convenience is a huge bonus.

I attended an alumni event at this cozy, dimly lit venue that is beautifully decorated like an old library. The ambiance was perfect for a quiet and casual evening. The drink selection was limited to a few beers and wines, but their happy hour cocktails, including Moscow mules and old fashioneds, were outstanding. Everyone enjoyed their drinks, and we had no complaints.
The burgers are incredible, and the onion rings are a must-have.

My dining experience at this restaurant was consistently disappointing. The steak was overly salty, the fish was dry, and even my salad was frozen. The service was also terrible. I don't understand how this place manages to receive any positive reviews.
Modesto in St. Louis is a standout Spanish restaurant, even among the many excellent options in NYC. It's a fantastic place that I truly miss since moving away.

I had a terrible experience at Spa Aria. The receptionist was unattentive, the staff was unhelpful, and the spa was small and dirty. The nail technician was sick, which was unsanitary, and gave a rushed and subpar manicure. The hand/arm massage was awful and the technician made snarky comments about my dry skin. The receptionist was also unprofessional and there were extra fees for putting services on my room. Overall, I would not recommend Spa Aria and suggest going elsewhere.

I highly recommend their hot shave - it exceeded my expectations! The experience was fantastic with 6 towels and a soothing facial massage using luxurious oils. The shave itself was top-notch, and the environment was exceptional.

Taco del Mar is a consistently decent and fast build-your-own burrito and taco place. Owned by Subway, it has a similar vibe but boasts higher quality. With fresh and well-stocked ingredients, there are numerous vegetarian options available. Personal favorite is a veggie burrito loaded with lots of veggies accompanied by their tasty chips and "medium" salsa. If in the area, Taco del Mar is worth checking out, especially for vegetarians.
This store is only suitable as a backup when Trader Joe's doesn't have what I need. It is overpriced and lacks sufficient staff, making it quite disappointing. Overall, not recommended.
If you're looking for fall-off-the-bone tender ribs, this barbecue joint may not be for you. The smoked ribs here are intentionally a bit tough, which may not suit everyone's taste.

This place is a hidden gem for lassi and chaat lovers. The elegantly presented Karachi-style chaat is a taste of tradition, but it pales in comparison to their exceptional lassi. The lassi is absolutely heavenly, with its smooth, creamy texture and perfectly balanced sweetness. A definite must-visit when I'm in the area again.
We had a breathtaking wedding reception at Hendel's Cafe - a truly perfect evening shared with loved ones.
Terrible experience overall. Cockroach infestation, archaic wifi, and extortionate charges for a private beach. Will definitely avoid this place in the future.

El Sol exceeded our expectations for my daughter's birthday celebration. The attentive service, delectable drinks and food, and the staff's surprise of a large cake, dessert, sombreros, and even fireworks made it truly unforgettable. We're thrilled to have found this gem nearby and look forward to returning for regular dinner visits. Plus, the generous portion of fajitas ensured a delicious lunch the next day as well. Great job, guys!

Taco Son is a hidden gem of a restaurant that offers delicious, made-from-scratch food without the long lines like other popular places. The freshness of the ingredients shines through in every bite, and their generous portions ensure you get your money's worth. Don't miss out on their killer breakfast burritos, perfect for a post-night out treat.

I recently purchased a used car from this dealership for my son. Although it didn't come with a warranty due to its age, I expected it to be in a safe condition. However, the front left tire blew the very next day after bringing it home. The tire was completely dry rotted on the backside, which could have resulted in a major accident. The tire shop had to replace both front tires for $450. This experience has made me reconsider recommending this dealership.
The food is excellent, but the bathrooms were in poor condition, deducting 1 star.

Great food, but unfortunately, the service was extremely disappointing. Despite ordering online and arriving on time, my food wasn't even started until I got to the restaurant. I had to wait the entire cooking time and received no compensation for the inconvenience. The lack of customer service was truly disappointing.

I recently discovered a cute Japanese restaurant in Old City that I absolutely love! Not only do they serve fresh sushi and amazing ramen, but their customer service is top-notch. It has quickly become my go-to spot for sushi and ramen, thanks to their great menu selection.

The ambiance was delightful and I thoroughly enjoyed being pampered and feeling relaxed. However, it was difficult to place a drink order, which was the only reason I didn't give them a perfect score. I had to ask four different people before being directed to use the white phone to call room service.

Dr. Jeffers is a compassionate and knowledgeable vet with reasonable prices and excellent diagnostic equipment. She even accepts reptiles and has animals available for adoption. Highly recommend her practice. A top-notch vet comparable to Dr. Pol.
Great Mahi Mahi with a generous portion size, perfect for sharing. Ideal if you enjoy smoked fish. The server was friendly and pleasant.
Melissa is the best lash technician I've come across. Unlike others, she doesn't overload lashes and works efficiently. I highly recommend booking with her.

The best casino in Reno! Their 4 deck and 2 deck blackjack options are a gambler's dream. Say goodbye to plastic cups, they serve drinks in real glasses. The dazzling decor will leave you in awe. The in-house restaurants outshine those on the strip by a thousand-fold. The rooms are top-notch for the price, especially the ones with hot tubs. Chill out and enjoy!

My wife and I finally made it to this restaurant and it was worth the wait. The fish and chips were crispy and flavorful, with a moist and juicy fish. The portion size was good, but not huge. The homemade tartar sauce added a great touch. The salmon tacos had great flavors, although the salmon was slightly overcooked. The serving size of the tacos was small, but the flavors were delicious. If you're looking for a satisfying meal of appropriate size, this place is highly recommended.

The Lemon Cake at Cake Life is a heavyweight in terms of both size and taste. Despite opting out of cupcakes, the decision was justified as their cakes are simply outstanding. Their cakes rock, and I can't wait for more visits in the future.
Terrible service, extremely slow, and disorganized. Manager's attempt to make things right fell short. Not worth a visit, find better options. Avoid at all costs.

Wildflower is a charming restaurant with delicious food made with fresh, local ingredients. Although the menu is limited for vegetarians, the dishes they offer are great. The Vermonter salad and tuna plate were both enjoyable, and the homemade honey butter was a highlight. The patio is cute and cozy, and the servers are wonderful. The homemade red velvet cupcake was a delightful birthday surprise. Overall, a fantastic experience and a place worth revisiting for breakfast as well.
Terrible roast pork sandwich with lifeless broccoli rabe and freezing temperatures. Cheese didn't even melt, bread was soggy. Avoid, unless you're stuck in an airport.

I decided to try this place based on the reviews and price. The appetizers were great, but the entrees were disappointing. The Pad Thai was too sweet and lacked spiciness. The other dishes were mediocre. However, considering the low price of each entree, you get what you pay for. Despite not enjoying it as much as I hoped, I'm glad it wasn't expensive.
This place is a must-visit for sandwich enthusiasts! Made-to-order, delicious food and worth the wait. Definitely deserves five stars. Well done!

The Devils Food Cake with vanilla buttercream icing was absolutely delicious! Despite being calorie-conscious, all 12 adults devoured every last bite. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, and we were thrilled to discover a location closer to us in Old City. Can't praise our experience enough - only wish we could have another slice of that amazing cake!
Great talent, but poor time management. Arrived at 11:28am and still waiting for service despite opening at 11am. Disappointed with Perfect Arch.

Spasso in Media is highly recommended for a great dinner experience. The service provided by Oana is outstanding, with her extensive knowledge of the menu and willingness to assist. They offer a unique twist on Italian cuisine, with delicious starters like the refreshing eggplant/pepper topping. The Caesar salad is perfect, and the pappardelle porcini dish is a must-try, with its flavorful combination of sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, and chicken. Grabbing a high top in the bar area was a great decision, as there was no wait despite being full service. Don't miss out on this gem in Media!

I have been a member of this credit union for 4 years, along with my family. Despite some occasional errors, we have been quite satisfied with their service. The branch has been helpful in promptly resolving any issues we encountered.

Unfortunately, despite multiple visits, we cannot recommend this place. The atmosphere is consistently rowdy and drinks have been spilled on us numerous times. Service is slow regardless of the time or location, and the food is average for the high prices. Our orders often take much longer than promised, and the management's response is unhelpful and dismissive. The staff is rude and inattentive, despite there being an excessive number of employees. We will not be returning and advise others to find a more reliable and enjoyable establishment.

The best Mexican food in St Pete! It may be small, but the flavors are incredible. Avoid the weekend rush and go on a weekday. The chorizo tacos are a meat lover's dream and the fish tacos are fantastic for seafood enthusiasts.

Chatham Tap is the best spot for wings in Indianapolis. The meaty wings, delicious sauce, and generous portions make it a must-try. The menu offers a variety of options, and the onion rings are a highlight. The sports atmosphere is fantastic, accommodating fans of all sports, and the service is top-notch. A highly recommended place for a fantastic meal, excellent service, and a fun time with friends.
Very tasty sushi at affordable prices with quick service. Just one suggestion: adding menu photos for a better dining experience. Authentic flavor and ultra healthy.

Had a wonderful first experience at this restaurant tonight. Our server, Alison, was fantastic, assisting us throughout the evening. We appreciated not feeling rushed as we caught up with friends. The food, from steaks to meatloaf, was delicious and prepared perfectly. Excited to return and hope for the same amazing experience.

I've been going to Jonny's dive bar for years and it's great. Amazing happy hour, laid back atmosphere, and surprisingly delicious food. The homemade dough and naked wings are a must-try. They also offer games like trivia and bingo, with awesome prizes including 1 cent pitchers of beer. Just be aware that it's a smoking bar and can get crowded on game days. Overall, a fantastic spot for cheap drinks, half-price pizza, and hanging out with friends.

Amazing food, with vegan options available. Friendly servers and spacious restaurant with a bar and stage area. Perfect for hosting events, as our work Holiday parties have been a hit here for the past couple of years. The guacamole is particularly outstanding.

West Ave. Grill is a happy and charming spot in Jenkintown, popular among locals who enjoy dining outside with their dogs and children. The restaurant offers both a large and small indoor area, complete with a bar overlooking the parking lot and the nicer part of Jenkintown town square. The friendly wait staff and often present owner contribute to the welcoming atmosphere. Upon leaving, customers are offered complimentary Dum Dum lolly pops and newspapers to enjoy. The food at West Ave. Grill is consistently good, with highlights including fluffy and crispy pancakes and the delicious Kansas City breakfast. The only downside is that the big salads could benefit from a bit more variety and ingredients. However, the staff is attentive and always willing to make things right. Overall, it's a nice place worth trying out.
Fantastic hot chicken! First time visiting and it was absolutely amazing. Hands down the best hot chicken I've ever had. Definitely a must-stop every time we come to Nashville.

The tuna melt at this cafe is simply the best I've ever had - clean and delicious! The service is outstanding, even surpassing other cafes. Surprisingly located inside a grocery store, they should consider expanding independently. An amazing experience overall!
Finally, a great spot in Stl for sautéed seafood in a plastic bag! The sauce is delicious and the service is top-notch.

Extremely disappointing experience at this particular fast-food chain. Despite low expectations, none of the items I requested from the drive-thru menu were available. This made me apprehensive about the quality of the eventual order. Remembering the movie "Waiting," I strongly advise avoiding this arch. To emphasize the point, I was merely attempting to order a beverage, which is quite unfortunate.
This place has amazing gravy fries, friendly staff, and a great atmosphere for watching sports. Good beer selection as well.

We had a fun and festive time at the bar, with Santa and Mrs. Claus making a brief appearance. The service was a bit slow, but we didn't mind as we wanted to take our time. Overall, it's a great place for a drink or two with a nice ambiance.

We stumbled upon this gem in South Tucson and it was a delightful departure from the chain hotel dining options near the airport. The restaurant, a converted A & W fast food stand from the 1960s, served us a fantastic meal at a reasonable price. I opted for the catfish smothered in poblano sauce and melted cheese, and it brought back childhood memories of catching fish from a nearby lake. The freshness of the chile relleno impressed my wife. Our young companions also enjoyed their enchiladas and chimichangas. A great find recommended by fellow Yelpers!

This restaurant offers delicious and authentic Indian dishes, with the vegetable pakora being a highlight. The entrees, such as chicken tikki masala and lamb vindaloo, were superb and true to their flavors. The sauces were incredibly tasty. The prices were reasonable, although the staff/service was average. Overall, a great addition to the dining options in Media, especially with their promising lunch buffet at an affordable price.
I highly recommend Howard for all your Volkswagen needs. Despite the slight delay in getting an appointment, he surpasses expectations with his thoroughness, reliability, knowledge, and efficiency.
The desserts are simply incredible, especially the Dark and Sinister. The chocolate ice cream creations are my absolute favorite.

The oyster happy hour from 5-7pm was fantastic! My boyfriend and I enjoyed a dozen oysters and a glass of champagne for only $24, including tip. It was great value and the staff were friendly and attentive. We even missed out on their renowned to-go cups. We felt casual and at home. Definitely going back!

Prep & Pastry is a must-visit spot with incredible food and a bustling atmosphere. Arrive early or late to avoid the long wait, but trust me, it's worth it. Their green eggs & ham, bloody marys, and mimosas are to die for. The staff even surprised me with a delectable birthday pastry, although I can't recall its name. Plus, they serve locally roasted EXO coffee, elevating the breakfast experience to perfection.

Great spot with a wide selection of coffees and teas, including the amazing iced dirty chai. Friendly staff and spacious tables cater to a comfortable experience. Don't miss the opportunity to appreciate and purchase local artists' work. The overall vibe is very enjoyable.

The worker was outstanding; however, the expensive price does not align with the service provided. While the worker is motivated by hourly pay, I suggest exploring hiring alternatives such as outsourcing services. Overall, hiring someone off craigslist and paying them for the service might be a more cost-effective option.
The new Bacon-Bleu cheeseburger is hands down one of the best fast food burgers I've had in a while! Dave Thomas would be proud!

I had a decent experience at this place a few months ago. The carrot cake was good enough, but not the best. The packaging was excessive and the price was high. The atmosphere is unique and appealing, especially for a girls' outing. However, the service was disappointing. We waited a while for our order and had to flag down the teenager to box it up. The wait staff seemed too busy despite the lack of customers. Overall, I give four stars for the cake and two stars for the service.
I highly recommend this place for its amazing food and exceptional service. The burgers and pulled pork are the best we've had in the Reno/Sparks area. It has definitely become our go-to spot.

The Smoked Salmon Frittata at this spot is as good as it sounds. The combination of smoked salmon, egg, potato, red bell peppers, goat cheese, horseradish-dill crema, and fresh fruit is delicious. Highly recommend for brunch, dinner, or private dining.

Dinner for 9 was an amazing experience! Celebrating a 70th birthday, we were treated with top-notch service throughout. Though pricey, the steaks and entrees were exceptional. Excellent service, delicious food, and a wonderful ambiance.
The food is amazing, especially the fried pickles and smash fries! However, the customer service was horrible.

I had high expectations based on recommendations, but was disappointed. Parking was difficult and we waited 30 minutes for our 5 tacos, which were lukewarm at best. Taste was average, with the buffalo chicken being underwhelming and the shrimp mediocre. Overall, not worth the wait and effort. Unlikely to return.

I joined the MBSC thrive program at City Fitness and found it lacking in personalized training. The trainers have a set program and you have little input. Sessions can be crowded, and you may have to wait for the trainer. The sessions are intense but lack consistency, making it hard to master the moves. The atmosphere and music cater to a younger demographic. If you want to push yourself without personal attention, MBSC might be for you. However, if you prefer individualized training and learning about muscle groups, it may not be the best fit. Consider trying an introductory program before committing to the pricey monthly fee. I rate MBSC at City Fitness 1.5 stars for an overall rating of 2.5 stars.

This place offers decent BBQ with a large, tasty cheeseburger. However, the pork sandwich was soggy and the meat was bland. The BBQ sauce is good, but not outstanding. The Mac & Cheese tasted okay but the noodles were overcooked. Overall, it's worth a visit if you're in the area. 4/5 stars for price.
This Indian buffet offers a wide selection of dishes at a reasonable price. While it may not have any standout dishes, it provides many good options. Would consider returning.
Unwelcoming staff, denied use of guest pass, forced to buy expensive day pass. Opted for Retro fitness instead, offering free trial and superior equipment/environment.

Brixx is a winner for pizza lovers like me! Their menu offers gluten-free and lunch options, which I appreciate as a picky eater. The bar is a great spot to relax after work, but be sure to arrive early since their patio gets filled up quickly.
Great options for meat eaters, vegetarians, and vegans. Haven't been disappointed yet. A healthy place to dine.

Initially, the frozen yogurt at this location in Central Bucks was the best I had found. The staff was friendly and the flavors were enjoyable. However, I have now discovered a rival location that proves to be equally impressive.

I absolutely loved my stay at this apartment complex in St. Petersburg, FL. The serene environment, surrounded by lakes, was truly amazing. The leasing office staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. I had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend this apartment to anyone seeking a peaceful stay.
This place is a must-visit in NOLA! It has a charming prohibition-era vibe with a fantastic jazz band. The Vieux Carre cocktail was excellent. Don't miss the cozy room to relax and sip your drink.

We finally tried the sushiritos at the new location and had mixed feelings. The slammin' salmon had too much sauce, overpowering the fresh ingredients. The Japanese fried chicken was a little dry and the sauce was too sweet and sour. The green tea and lemonade were decent, but not worth visiting for. The high price for a gimmicky meal made us hesitant to return.

Enzo's is a solid takeout choice with a delicious meatball sub and tasty garlic knots. While I preferred nabruzzi's pizza, I'll continue ordering from Enzo's for their homemade meatballs. I do miss the old pizza options though.
I stumbled upon the best burger joint on earth in Philly! Thanks to Alya & the Bareburger team for the healthy and delicious experience. Andrew von Gregor, LA guitarist.

Cosi is my go-to spot when traveling, and I have enjoyed dining at this particular location multiple times. Their flatbreads and salads are delicious, especially the BBQ chicken flatbread. The portion sizes are quite satisfying.
I used to love this place when it was just one store on Linbergh with the owner. However, since they started expanding, both the food and service have declined. I won't be returning.
Terrible experience - awful egg roll and chewy sushi. Not surprised to be the only customer.

Overall, the hotel is a great choice for those looking to stay on Bourbon street. The staff is friendly and the food choices are good. The rooms are spacious and nice. However, be cautious of room 263 as it is closer to the vending and ice machines, leading to thin walls which allow for noise from conversations in the hallway to be heard. If not for this issue, I would have given the hotel a 4-star rating.

Overall, my experience at Ocharleys on a Sunday afternoon was disappointing. Despite the lack of crowd, our server seemed overwhelmed and forgot several items, such as bread, fries, and our coupon. It took a long time to get simple things like a Sprite refill, and the manager had to fix the billing error. I might consider giving Ocharleys another chance for lunch instead of dinner.

This place is a disappointment. The service is terrible and the food is overpriced and mediocre. I had hoped my first experience was just an off night, but the second visit was equally disappointing. There is nothing innovative about this place, and they don't seem to care about the high prices they charge. I would recommend saving this one for the tourists.
Unfortunately, there is no 12-step program specifically designed to manage a Reanimator Coffee problem.

Wow! What a lucky find! With two meaderies within such a close distance, we are truly spoilt for choice. The meads at this new establishment are absolutely perfect. We tried Goober Vitis, Suzy's Cherry Pie, and the coffee flavor, and they were all exceptional. The flavors are pure and the aromas are delightful. The spacious interior with big tables and an L-shaped bar, along with picnic tables outside, make for a very pleasant visit.

I highly recommend Pina's for their diverse menu, excellent seafood options, and flawless service. The dinner specials, cheesesteaks, calzones, and seafood dishes are my personal favorites. The shrimp scampi appetizer (minus linguini) and steamed clams are both delicious and reasonably priced. Overall, Pina's is a great choice for a casual dining experience.

Chatham is a great spot to watch football. The $4 Guiness and Black and Tans on Tuesdays were a bonus. Their fish and chips were a pleasant surprise with a unique, soft texture. Overall, a fantastic pub to catch a game and enjoy some good food.

This nail salon is a hidden gem! After trying numerous salons in Tampa, my friend and I finally found this place on Instagram. We will never go anywhere else again. Despite the long drive, it is absolutely worth it. Both Pamela and Steven are incredibly talented and have successfully brought our design visions to life. A huge thank you to them for their amazing work!

Belinda and Jerry were incredibly helpful and kind during my storage experience in Boise. As a travel nurse, I needed a place to leave my car for the winter. Belinda stayed and waited for me on a snowy December evening, while Jerry drove me to my storage shed and assisted with my luggage. I am extremely satisfied with the service I received and highly recommend them!

Unique is a highly professional and reputable company that operates with utmost integrity. They are responsive, transparent, and honest in their dealings. Their technicians are efficient, clean, and pleasant to work with. Pricing is extremely fair and the quality of their work is exceptional. Based on my direct experience with their sales person (Mike P) and manager Chris, I can confidently recommend them. Additionally, comparing their prices to similar-sized companies is encouraged.
Great food, fast service, and convenient delivery to my door. Friendly staff who make delicious pizza. Highly recommended.
The street tacos were excellent, the service was great, and the hand-made horchata was a delightful addition. Top-notch stop overall.

I had a disappointing experience at this salon. The manicure took too long, my hands look terrible, and the work was not checked. On the positive side, my student was nice and the pedicure was good. However, I feel that I shouldn't have been charged for the manicure or at least had someone redo it. Overall, I rate it 2 stars.

Excellent experience at this Chinese and sushi restaurant. The ambiance was lovely with a nice, quiet, and dark setting. We tried the szechuan chicken, hot and sour soup, and steamed rice which were all delicious. My husband enjoyed the prime rib and shrimp hot pot. The portion sizes were just right, and we didn't have to take any leftovers home. The service was exceptional.

Frank is a fantastic dentist and a genuinely kind individual. He possesses a gentle approach and a sincere concern for his patients. Overall, he is a top-notch dentist and an excellent choice for anyone seeking dental care. I have been going to him for years, and I know numerous others who have done the same.

Great spot with stylish sidewalk lounge seating, an awesome DJ playing outside on Friday nights, and a convenient walk-up bar. The interior decor is impressive, and the appetizers we tried were delicious. Located in a trendy waterfront area.

The Friday happy hour special at this place is a fantastic deal! Surprisingly not crowded, the food and drinks on offer were incredibly delicious. The pork sliders and beignets for dessert are a must-try. We had a really enjoyable time with a great atmosphere, and the staff was super friendly.

I had a fantastic experience at this place. The service was outstanding, the food was fresh and delicious, and the atmosphere was beautiful. Lisa, our host, was amazing and made our evening even more enjoyable. We will definitely be returning soon!

I've visited Lush stores in multiple locations, but the one in New Orleans is my favorite. The scent of the store can be detected from a block away, which I love. I've visited this specific store several times, always on Halloween, and it's always a fun experience.

I absolutely love this place for happy hour and dinner! The Asian Nachos are a must-try, they're practically a meal on their own. The other happy hour dishes are also fantastic. The creme brulee and other desserts are amazing. The blueberry mojito and mango sling are both delicious. It's a great spot for celebrating birthdays and has a nice atmosphere. Just be prepared for the bar area to get crowded during happy hour. The only downside is finding parking, which can be a hassle like most places around the mall.

Delicious top shelf pastries with exceptional service. Shocked by the low ratings. If you prioritize flavor over cheapness, this is your spot. As an extremely demanding customer, I've always received great service. Can't wait for them to create macaroons for our wedding.

Although the ingredients were fresh and the service was great, the pizza at this place was disappointing. The crust was too thin, resulting in a cold pizza within minutes. It was also floppy and lacked flavor. With several other pizzerias in the area, I won't be returning.

Overall, I had mixed feelings about my first visit to bier. While I appreciated their constantly rotating taps, I was a bit disappointed that I only found two beers that I liked, with only one being truly memorable. The tap room, however, was lively and engaging, with people continuously trying out different beers and engaging in conversation. Despite my initial let down, I believe bier has the potential to improve and I am open to giving them a higher rating in the future. 3 stars for now, with hope for better experiences ahead.

Sweet Confections on Magazine St had a beautifully sweet ending to our trip to NOLA. After a delicious lunch at Cochon, we stumbled upon this charming spot. We tried a chocolate cupcake with mocha filling and truffles in raspberry, creme brulee, and orange flavors. The cupcake was good, but the mocha filling stole the show. The raspberry truffle was my favorite, with its perfect balance of dark chocolate. The coffee was a delightful chaser, not too overpowering, and I didn't even need milk or sugar. The seating was nice, with enough room for our group of six. The service was great, with helpful staff suggesting flavors and labeling. I give it 4 out of 5 stars, as having one more staff member would benefit the overall service.

The pulled pork sandwich was delicious, but the Lucky Bun (Asian fusion style) burger was a disappointment due to the use of a frozen beef patty. The bread, toppings, and sauces were excellent, but the processed patty hindered the flavors. Using fresh ground meat would have made it a great gourmet burger.

This place is perfect for kids - it's like a tea party with delicious treats like homemade doughnuts, popsicles, and cake. I've tried everything, and my favorites are the red bean filled doughnuts, popsicles, patbingsu and the classic coffee with cream and sugar.

Always awesome! This place has the best crust, fresh ingredients, and a friendly staff. They offer unique toppings not found elsewhere. Don't miss out on their delicious salads. The patio area is perfect for relaxing with a beer or glass of wine while enjoying the best pizza in town.
I highly recommend this gas station. Being the only one on Clearwater Beach that's open 24/7, it's my go-to place for guests, and I love it.
This place in St. Pete is absolutely amazing. Everything on the menu is delicious and will surely leave you in a food coma.

This Chipotle location was amazing! I loved that they acknowledged teachers during Teacher Appreciation Week. The service was excellent with a minimal wait time, unlike another Chipotle branch. The food was consistently fresh, flavorful, and satisfying. Personally, I always go for the bowl with white cilantro lime rice, black beans, steak, and all the toppings. Don't forget to pair it with their delicious tortilla chips!
Just another typical Jimmy Johns - average food, average experience, but cleanliness was commendable.

I recently vacationed in St. Petersburg with my family and Dooners was by far the best meal we had. The food was excellent and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Highly recommend and would definitely go again.

The bar attached to the Alexander Hotel is a must-visit. With a menu featuring vintage pre-prohibition cocktails, the standout is "The Elephant in the Room," a bourbon cocktail served in a decanter filled with cherrywood smoke. You control how long it infuses, adding to the experience. The comfortable seating and spacious deck, complete with heating, provide a great spot to enjoy the bustling street below. Additionally, you can watch people work out at the CityWay YMCA through the glass. Don't miss the truffle oil and sea salt popcorn - it's addictive! Grab a beer and start collecting bags - you won't be able to resist.

This Philadelphia hotel is a gem. Cozy, modern rooms with chic decor that feels like a friend's apartment. Free breakfast delivered to your door and 24/7 lobby access to coffee, tea, water, and fruit. Polite and helpful staff. Some difficulty with parking and limited view from the room. Highly recommended.

I was introduced to this place by a Colombian friend who had a craving for something inexpensive yet delicious. It reminds me of Nanzhou, a popular spot on Yelp, as you get generous portions for a fraction of the price.
