I tried the oxtail soup (Sancocho) with extra rice and plantains, and it was equally satisfying as the Korean-style I usually have. The broth was thicker and the potatoes were beefier. My friend devoured the flat steak (Carne Asada) in less than 10 seconds. Don't miss out on this gem in NE Philly, Yelp!

My friends and I tried all the available flavors and loved the range of fun donut options. However, the standout for me was the fried chicken. The chicken sandwich was absolutely delicious and highly recommended.

The pricing is steep, but the food is absolutely delicious. The cozy space is a little tricky to locate, but worth it. The green eggs and ham breakfast biscuit is a must-try, although slightly pricey at around $10. The Santa Barbara tri tip sandwich is excellent, and the cold brew coffee is good. The grab and go section offers plenty of tasty options, including the fantastic salami and pesto sandwich. Overall, a place worth revisiting.
The food is delicious, but the service is consistently slow or poor, despite not being busy most of the time.

This Indian restaurant is one of my favorites. The atmosphere may not be impressive, but the food is absolutely delicious. Prompt seating and pleasant service make for a casual dining experience. The naan is soft and the original flavor is my preference. Regardless of your choice of entree, you can't go wrong. It may not be as spicy as I like, but the flavors are great for those who enjoy medium spice. I recommend the Masala or Vindaloo (Chicken, Shrimp, Lamb... your choice). Don't forget to try the Rice Pudding and Gulab Jaman, mixed together for a creamy and sugary treat.

The burger at Goleta Holester Ave is absolutely outstanding, making it the best burger I've ever had. Despite its unremarkable surroundings, it is definitely worth a visit for this exceptional culinary experience.

This stadium has major flaws. The lack of vendors means you have to constantly get up for food and drinks. The "hoagies" and fries are terrible - greasy and soggy. The low-quality TVs make it hard to watch the game while waiting. Empty beer containers everywhere just a few innings in is unacceptable. And be warned, Philly fans are rude and disrespectful. Overall, skip this stadium and bring your own food if you do decide to go.

Absolutely loved this place! The old school diner vibe is fantastic and the staff is exceptionally friendly. Even though I've never had gumbo before, they made us delightful tasters that were impossible to resist. Surprisingly, I devoured every bite despite not being a fan of shrimp. The grits, fried chicken, and split pea soup were also to die for. Honestly, the split pea soup here is the best I've ever had. Unbelievably affordable prices too - we had a feast with beers for just $25. Amazing deal!

This jewelry store is a hidden gem! Ali and Albisia are talented and delightful owners who create stunning and one-of-a-kind pieces. The store's ambiance, complemented by great music and a glass of wine, adds to the overall experience. I'm already planning my next visit to Tampa just to see them again!

The menu and ingredients at this place are good, but their sandwich-making skills fall short. I tried their Turkey and Brie Wrap and the Spinach Florentine Wrap, both of which were poorly assembled and resembled crumples rather than wraps. The staff seemed confused and unenthusiastic. Additionally, clearer signage for ordering, picking up, and paying would be greatly appreciated.

This place is amazing! The employees are attentive and the desserts are crafted perfectly. The banana puddings have three/four delicious layers and the texture is smooth. The upside pineapple cake is bomb, with just the right amount of pineapple flavor. The only downside was the caramelized pineapple bottom being a bit hard to chew. Highly recommend this bakery for its great service and tasty desserts.

I highly recommend the new Paoli location for their delicious and diverse selection of donuts. Unlike the dull options at Dunkin, these donuts are true beauties. I especially loved the Salted Caramel, Bacon Maple, and Lemon flavors. Additionally, they offer a variety of breakfast sandwiches, muffins, and bagels. Absolutely worth a visit!

Our second chance at Hermitage O'Charley's was absolutely wonderful. Despite being seated in the bar on a busy night, the server was attentive and had a great personality. The food arrived quickly, well prepared, and delicious. We have returned multiple times since and the service has consistently been great.

I am absolutely delighted with my haircut! The prices are incredibly reasonable too. Although the color wasn't exactly what I had hoped for during my first visit, it still turned out great. This is my second time here and I'll definitely keep coming back.

Meticulous attention to healthy, delectable cuisine with flavorful twists and thoughtful details. Extensive menu, accommodating dietary needs effortlessly. Outstanding sauces and exquisite desserts incorporating white and black sticky rice. A definitive choice for Thai cuisine going forward!

Fantastic neighborhood grocery store with excellent deli, soup, hot bar, and salad bar choices. Affordable alternative to Whole Foods. Impressive weekend crawfish and lobster boils. A definite go-to store for locals. Plus, their fried chicken is absolutely amazing!

I created my Yelp account solely to review this place and it truly exceeded my expectations. This local cafe/coffee shop delivers exactly what you'd hope for and more. The food and coffee were superb, and the friendly and casual atmosphere made for a delightful experience. The Victorian architecture of the dining room added to the charm. Although service was slow, the personable barista made up for it. It's the perfect spot to unwind, with both indoor and outdoor tables, a booth, and a counter. Their dog-friendly policy was a bonus. Situated in the French quarter, it's a great location. I just wish I could've visited more than once during my trip to New Orleans.
The teas offered are of good quality, but their prices are excessively high. Consider exploring alternatives such as Republic of Tea or Twinings, which offer great options at more reasonable prices.

Unfortunately, Millers did not live up to expectations. Despite convenient location, ample parking, and spacious tables with a fireplace for ambiance, the consistently long wait times suggested a less than average dining experience. The guacamole portion was huge but lacked flavor, while the zinger boneless wings were enjoyable, along with the attractive hostesses. The server was pleasant and attentive, addressing issues promptly. However, the wilted side salad was disappointing and the main dishes lacked flavor and presentation. The plastic dishes and high price for a lackluster experience were discouraging. The desire for dessert was overshadowed by the risk of disappointment. Overall, the experience did not meet expectations, and the reviewer does not plan to return for dining in, although the husband might order wings for takeout.

I have been coming to this facility for 6 months due to my membership, but I am constantly disappointed. The facilities are nice, but the staff does not do a good job. I always have to ask them to re-vacuum or wipe everything down as they do not clean cup holders or door kick panels. It is frustrating, and some of the staff on the vacuum side do not speak English, making it even more difficult to communicate. It's a shame because the location is perfect for me, but the quality is lacking.

I had a great experience at The Libertine. They use fresh ingredients, even down to the crushed ice which they make right at the bar. The only issue I had was identifying the men's restroom due to similar-looking dimly lit pictures.

Family-friendly and highly recommended, this pizza joint did not disappoint. As a self-proclaimed pizza connoisseur, I can confidently say this place ranks among the best. The staff was friendly and the food arrived promptly. A solid experience overall - I would gladly return and recommend it to others.

At the Collingswood Art Festival, we tried these pricey yet absolutely worth it fried cheddar curds. They are not greasy at all and have a perfect flavor. Once you have a taste, you'll be craving them again. The light batter doesn't overpower the deliciously stringy and melty cheese. The sauces provided are a delightful addition. An indulgence that is definitely worth the price.

Yats is a must-visit spot with a variety of delicious options served in generous portions. The affordable prices and vegetarian choices make it even more appealing. The standout item is the incredibly flavorful garlic bread, available at a great value. Additionally, the owner, Joe Vuskovich, is a local celebrity and community supporter, adding to the restaurant's charm.

Pi has consistently delivered exceptional service and delicious pizzas on every visit. Despite a disappointing Ethiopian food experience earlier, we were quickly seated and treated with complimentary garlic bread. The deep-dish and thin crust pizzas were both amazing, and we devoured every bite.
Great dental service for wisdom teeth extraction. However, inconsistent dentist rotation over the past 5 years.

I heard about this place from a fellow Yelp Elite and decided to give it a try with my SO. We went on a Saturday morning and had to wait in line. 

The takoyaki appetizer was delicious - perfectly cooked and topped with sauces. The fried octopus was good but didn't come with enough mayo. 

Unfortunately, the ramen noodles were overcooked and didn't fit well with the dishes. The broth was flavorful, but the red chili one was too spicy and covered up the depth. I preferred the black garlic broth. 

Overall, the food was tasty and reasonably priced. The decor was nice, but there were screaming kids running around which made our meal unpleasant.

Without a doubt, this small cafe serves the best breakfast in Philly! Despite being a breakfast fanatic, I've explored all the renowned spots in town and this one stands out. The flavors here are simply incredible, and the dishes are both fresh and simple. Although the space is cozy, the menu is so fantastic that it could easily rival a larger establishment like Parc in terms of popularity.
Incredible diner with great food and generous portions. Biscuits and gravy were outstanding. Highly recommended (6/5 stars)!

This place is trendy and vibrant, but may not be suitable for older crowds. Despite the youthful and casual atmosphere, the food is worth trying and the staff handles the crowd well. I had a reservation and was seated before the appointed time. The crispy Brussel Sprouts were delicious and disguised the taste for those who dislike the vegetable. The pork schnitzel and fries were excellent, accompanied by a tasty whitish gravy. The service was attentive without being overbearing. The only downside was the crowded dining room and noise level, which prevents me from giving it a full 5-star rating. Overall, I enjoyed my meal and would give it 4 stars.

The beers were amazing, especially the porter, double IPA, and table gutt. The food, particularly the Russian cuisine like the sausage and sauerkraut special and pickled everything appetizer, was killer. This place rules!

Rickshaw in Reno offers some of the freshest fish for true sushi enthusiasts. With a focus on Nigiri and sashimi, their simplicity and quality stand out among the other sushi places in town. Skip the dressed-up rolls and sauces, and taste the pure fish at Rickshaw.

My first visit here was not that impressive. The parking situation was bad, but they did have a good selection of draft beer. The food was okay, with the fried olives being a standout. However, the other appetizers like the blue cheese chips, calamari, and meat/cheese platter were just okay. I might give this place another chance, but overall, I wasn't thrilled.
The restaurant's hype was unfounded. Average ambiance, limited menu, and unimpressive food. However, the location offers attractions if you choose to wait.

This place exceeded my expectations! The ice cream was fantastic, especially the pumpkin cake and pralines and cream flavors. The brownie sundae was a masterpiece, with a perfect combination of brownie, ice cream, whipped cream, and nuts. The customer service was exceptional, with friendly and patient staff who even let me sample multiple flavors. I regret not trying their hot chocolate, but I had an amazing experience nevertheless. No judgment for devouring the brownie sundae by myself!

Overall, the restaurant had a lackluster atmosphere upstairs, but the food was delicious. The Catfish Acadian was a standout dish, with a tasty and mysterious sauce accompanying it. The vegetables were also well cooked. However, the pork chop was underwhelming, so seafood might be a better choice. The waitress, Bria, was exceptional and made the visit enjoyable. While the reviewer is unsure about returning, they might give it another chance for dinner on the balcony as recommended.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. The service was poor, with a rude and neglectful waitress. The food was undercooked and the wings were small. There was also a feather found in one of the wings, which was unacceptable. The manager was not very helpful either. I suspect we were treated differently because we were a same-sex couple. The only positive aspect was that the meal was comped. I will not be returning. 1 out of 5 stars.

This review criticizes the lack of a Target store and expresses frustration with the continued existence of a poorly updated K-Mart. The reviewer highlights their dissatisfaction with the store's customer service, including instances where sale prices were not honored and a price hike on a sought-after product. Overall, the review reflects a desire for a new Target store and disappointment with the current shopping experience at K-Mart.

Surprisingly charming and delightful interior. Food is tasty and reasonably priced. Recommended dishes include the refreshing papaya salad, flavorful triple flavor duck, and the winning king tofu soup. Don't forget to bring your own booze!

The Mazzoni Center provides incredibly comfortable and respectful services for individuals facing life challenges. However, the limited and exposed waiting room is a concern. Youth drop-in hours may have long wait times, but the staff advises on arrival times if called. There have been occasional communication lapses, but overall, the service is attentive. Leaving messages with reception ensures quick assistance, as doctors may not always be available over the phone.

I would not recommend this BBQ place. The food was terrible - frozen pressed chicken, cartilage-filled ribs, bland sausage, and overly sweet sauce. It was also very overpriced for what seemed like a child's portion. Disappointing experience overall.
I highly recommend this place for their great wine, delicious food, cozy ambiance, and excellent service.
Terrible experience. Rude staff, incorrect salad order, and overpriced slices. Slow service even when we were the only customers. Save your money and go elsewhere.

Authentic and delicious Mexican cuisine reminiscent of homemade meals. The enchiladas with mole sauce are incredible and the carne asada tacos take me back to Rosarito Beach. Highly recommended for a taste of California-approved Mexican food. Yummy!

The Cinnamon Rolls from the bake house are a must-have! Two of them would bring immense happiness and light to your life. Additionally, their excellent coffee and salads make for a delightful Saturday morning breakfast treat.

The carrot cake was a disappointment with a taste reminiscent of licorice and baking soda. It's a shame because the overall appearance was appealing, but the addition of chocolate chips did not complement the flavor either.

The prices for unlimited food are unbeatable, but the overall experience falls short. While the sushi is delicious, the salad is mediocre and the crab Rangoon is disappointing. Nonetheless, I have visited twice and would still consider returning.
Best chicken on Bourbon St! Delicious and flavorful, from the perfectly cooked meat to the tasty sauce. Everything is absolutely fantastic.

The food at this place is amazing, especially the burger. Despite the high price of $16, it was worth every penny. The patty size is generous and the random ingredients like gruyere stuffed in a pepper make it unique. The fries were crispy and the bun was great. It's also a great spot for craft beer enthusiasts and can get crowded on weekends.

I am disappointed with my recent breakfast experience at this place. The service was slow, coffee was not hot, and the grits were only warm. I had to wait twenty minutes for a cinnamon biscuit after my breakfast was already brought to the table. Even paying at the counter took an additional ten minutes. Overall, there are better breakfast options in the area. I regret not choosing my initial preference.

Termini Brothers is simply the best! Their desserts are fantastic, especially the cannolis. As someone from an Italian family, we always have Termini Brothers dessert trays for our family events. Highly recommended!
The hotel is nice with great service, awesome restaurants, and clean rooms.
I had an amazing experience in New Orleans, which made me appreciate Reno even more! The shrimp po boy and corn bread at this place are simply delightful!

Overall, the people here are friendly, but avoid going to Katie. She rushed through my hair, hastily applying color and cutting it without care. Despite the high price of nearly $200, the experience left me shaken up.

This breakfast spot near Vandy is a must-visit in Nashville! Always busy, be sure to park in the back lot and grab a parking ticket for free parking. Their banana pancakes are absolute perfection - like banana bread in pancake form. Don't leave Nashville without trying them!

MexiCali in University City offers multiple vegan options that are worth checking out. Their marinated tofu burrito is a personal favorite, boasting a chewy texture and protein-packed combination with black beans. The sweet potato and plantain burrito is also a great dairy-free choice, while the veggie tacos offer a spicier version with sweet potato, marinated tofu, and cabbage. For a delicious and filling option, their guacamole burrito with homemade guac is a must-try. Despite occasional lines, MexiCali has a well-established system to ensure quick service. I have been a loyal customer for years, even since their days as a lunch truck.

The breakfast fare was great with delicious Eggs provençale, although slightly inconsistent in cooking. The tomato on the side was awesome. Omelets were well-executed and the pastries were impressive. However, the coffee was horrendously bad, which affected the overall breakfast experience. Additionally, the presence of misspellings on the menu makes it difficult to trust the restaurant, even if they are from another language.

This restaurant is not your typical sports bar, as it is noisy and crowded with big screen TVs. However, it has a cool location and offers a good selection of beers. The food is delicious but leans more towards eclectic options, rather than traditional pub grub. This is a great spot if you're looking for a lively and flavorful experience with thumping music, but not suitable if you want to enjoy a burger, a beer, and watch a hockey game while engaging in sports conversations.
Excellent service! Fast and hassle-free windshield repair. Didn't pay a dime. Highly recommend!

This meal was absolutely outstanding! The service was top-notch and the food was some of the best in New Orleans. The oysters were a must-try, and the scallops with butternut squash purée and balsamic vinegar were divine. The dessert, cafe au lait panna cotta with mini glazed donuts, was the highlight of the meal. And their house made 'cellos, especially the ginger and limecellos, were unique and delicious. Overall, an amazing experience!

BARRA was absolutely amazing! We went for Restaurant Week and were blown away by the delicious food and excellent service. The blood orange margaritas were strong and delicious. The veal and beef meatballs were melt-in-your-mouth and the grilled cheese appetizer was amazing. The fishermen stew was full of flavor and well balanced, while the steak with cauliflower puree and vegetable medley was juicy and tender. The service was top-notch, with a knowledgeable waiter who helped us with our order and checked on us frequently. BARRA is intimate, reasonably priced, and the perfect place for good food and great service.

We had a great breakfast experience at this buzzing restaurant. Despite the long wait, the service was impressive. The cornmeal pancakes and banana pancakes were both delicious, although the portion of bacon was a bit small. The cornmeal pancakes were a perfect balance of flavors. The only disappointment was the coffee, which was surprising. The only dilemma is whether to choose the homemade syrup or the maple syrup, or maybe both.
Poor customer service. Went on a Monday to enjoy a daiquiri and NBA game, but the young lady working preferred Netflix. Will not return.

The Pearl exceeds all expectations with exceptional food, service, and ambiance. Every visit is a genuine dining experience that indulges and pampers. A must-try for anyone looking to treat themselves.

Pretty good bagels with friendly staff, but unfortunately, poor hygiene practices observed. The guy handling transactions didn't wash his hands or wear gloves, which made me uncomfortable. He handled money, used the phone, and wiped his nose before making my bagel. I won't be returning, but if hygiene isn't a concern for you, the bagels are tasty.
Tried someone new and had mixed results. Husband's cut looks great, but son's cut does not meet expectations.
Overall, the steak was great, but the prices were on the higher side. The guacamole, although made in front of us, didn't impress and seemed to be prepared incorrectly.

I absolutely love New Day Meadery! It never disappoints with its wide variety of meads and ciders. My usual go-to drinks are the South Cider and Shelby Blue Ribbon, but I recently tried the seasonal Paulding Light, which had a nice blend of cranberry, honey, and lime. Though not as sweet as the Shelby Blue Ribbon, it still tasted great. New Day Meadery always caters to different preferences, not just for sugar lovers like me. It's easily one of my favorite spots in Fountain Square, with friendly staff and prompt service.
While better than the Philadelphia location, Szechuan House in Hamilton, NJ still remains the ultimate best.
The food and service are exceptional. Fresh ingredients and flavorsome dishes make it a must-visit place. I'll definitely return.

Had a disappointing experience at Make Up For Ever at KOP. Couldn't return opened products, had to exchange with additional cost. Still not impressed with the products, won't return. Will stick to Sephora for Make Up For Ever, better return policy.

My favorite happy hour spot with amazing appetizers and great selection of beers. Superb food and cozy private party space available. Occasionally, there may be crashers wanting to use the ATM and restroom. Overall, just go and you won't be disappointed!
I have experienced three instances where I ordered a green tea lemonade but received a peach tea lemonade instead. Each time, I had to return to the store, go inside, and request a remake.

Overall, our experience at this newly opened restaurant was average. The pizza was decent, but nothing outstanding. The service was efficient, especially from the friendly pizza makers. However, the cashier lacked enthusiasm. While we wouldn't go out of our way to visit again, if we happen to be in the area and in the mood for pizza, we might consider returning.

Overall, the dining experience at the restaurant was average. The hostess was friendly and the remodel looked impressive. However, there was a strong unpleasant odor upon entering. The menu was limited, but the food came out within a reasonable time. The "Knuckle Sandwich" was delicious, earning the two stars. On the other hand, the mushroom swiss burger was small and bland, while the chicken strips lacked seasoning. The fries were unremarkable. The server was nice, but difficult to hear in the loud dining room. Hopefully, the restaurant improves to achieve success.

I had a delicious breakfast at Tuttini a few months ago, but my recent lunch experience was disappointing. Despite their sign stating lunch service until 2:30 PM, I was told that the kitchen was closing at 1:45 PM. The offer to make something to go contradicted their claim of being closed. Ultimately, I chose to eat elsewhere and spent my money at North Star Coffee instead.
The service was quick and friendly, the portion size for the price was great, and the pancakes had the perfect consistency.
I highly recommend this place! Fantastic food, friendly staff, and a peaceful atmosphere. The crepes are absolutely amazing, the best I've ever had. My friends also rave about this place.

I have purchased tires from Tires Plus in Flourtown multiple times, including this visit where I had 4 new Michelins mounted. The service was prompt, starting right on time with my scheduled appointment at 9:00. My car was worked on and returned to me within just one hour.

The Wildflower Triple brunch option at this place is amazing! With the ability to substitute any item, we had a tough time deciding. The food was delicious and the service was friendly. We might visit again during our stay.
Great happy hour experience with amazing service from Vaughn and Mark. The free appetizer was awesome and the slot machines brought us luck. Must visit!
The yogurt and crepes at this place are amazing! Highly recommend stopping by to try them.

The event started late, overcrowded, and lacked variety. Most tents didn't offer wine, but rather advertisements, beer, or paid food. By 3 o'clock, most tables were empty. It was supposed to last till 5, but it was not worth the money. I probably won't return next year.

Overall, I've had a great experience at this restaurant. The servers are dedicated and genuinely want to make your experience enjoyable. The seafood is decent, considering the limitations of getting fresh seafood in Tucson. The sauce they offer is similar to other popular seafood places, with an Asian twist. The price range is similar to other seafood restaurants, and while it may be expensive, it's not overpriced. I would recommend this place and would go back again.

Food was fresh and well-prepared, but ravioli lacked filling, making them less flavorful. Service was great, but the place was too loud for a date night. Very small and crowded. Only worth returning for the BYOB policy.

Yuengling Lager is a smooth, sweet and cheap beer that remains one of my top five favorites. I appreciate its low alcohol content and the fact that its taste varies per batch. The tour was enjoyable, with a funny British tour woman who took a liking to my grandpa. The facility had a nostalgic feel to it. The tasting was fantastic, although they were out of Lord Chesterfield. The fact that Yuengling rehired laid off workers after a closure adds to its appeal as a family business deserving of support.

Review: Visited during Mardi Gras with friends. Despite the bustling atmosphere, most places were not overly crowded. However, the bartenders were disappointingly terrible - poor service and unappetizing pizza. 

PROS:
- Convenient access to Port-O-Potty for a quick bathroom break
- Outdoor seating available
- Close proximity to the parade route

CONS:
- Bartenders lacked professionalism and attention to customers
- Ignored patrons at the bar, even when it wasn't crowded
- Lack of knowledge about microbrews and IPA beers, an unexpected downside
Highly recommend this place for a clean and relaxing pedicure experience. Friendly staff and great ambiance.

Short and concise review: 

"Nice new burger spot downtown! Decent burgers, but ordering sides separately is a downside. They take reservations, which is convenient. Limited non-burger options. Lunch special would be a good addition. Great service and overall experience. Worth checking out!"

The salad was enjoyable, but unfortunately, the pizza was disappointing - boring, flavorless, and unsatisfying. I was very disappointed, especially considering this was my third visit. Additionally, the interior was cold on a chilly night. I won't be returning.

Extremely disappointed. Sandwich bar closed, settled for a reheated burrito at an inflated price of $8. The taste was unpleasant with creamy chicken and old cheese toppings. Questionable how this can be considered edible. Taco Bell would have been a preferable choice.

The brewpub has charming decor with plenty of games for children. The beer selection is good, although more adventurous options could be appreciated. The food can be hit or miss, with a gooey pizza and salty scotch egg variations. However, the burgers and desserts, especially the frangipane, are enjoyable. The ploughman's plate along with a beer provides a great opportunity for relaxation.

Overall, I would give Zen Yai a 3.5 stars. The prices for their curry are great and the decor is appealing with vibrant colors. The service was good and the food was served promptly. However, my girlfriend was not satisfied with their green curry, which was a disappointment for her as a green curry enthusiast.

I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and it remains my favorite. The staff is exceptional, from housekeeping to the front desk to valet service. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and the heating/AC is quiet. Special K goes above and beyond to make our visits wonderful. The turn-down service includes delicious Sucre chocolates. The bathroom was less slippery this time. Valet service is quick and efficient, with the option to text for your car. They also hosted a Gold Status reception. The only issue was a mini-bar charge which was quickly resolved. Overall, a great experience. Just a request to put Louis back in the elevator.
Great rolls, excellent sake, and a unique experience in the bamboo room. Highly recommended for those who are able and agile.

I absolutely love their food delivery service! The gyro was incredibly delicious and generously sized - I had to save half for later. The fries were unnecessary, as the gyro itself was filling. The tzaziki was perfect and the meat was tender. I will definitely be returning!

I stopped by for takeout and a drink during happy hour. Tried the dragonberry iced tea, pleasantly refreshing. Enjoyed the lemongrass chicken and rice, but crab rangoon could have had more filling. Overall, consistent great food and service.
Consistently outstanding quality and service. The #1 Deluxe is a delight. Big shout out to Amanda for going above and beyond with exceptional customer service.

This hotel had the potential to be great with its charming location and unique rooms. Unfortunately, our stay was ruined by a bed bug infestation. Despite the management's efforts to resolve the issue, it was a gross and inconvenient experience. I ended up throwing away valuable belongings and am still concerned about bringing the bugs home. I would not recommend staying here unless significant measures are taken to ensure the elimination of bed bugs.

We arrived promptly at 8:30 on a Saturday and were seated and served without any wait. The sweet potato pancakes with cinnamon cream syrup were delightful, but the hash browns were disappointing. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth returning for, even without a wait. The bill came to $24.43 before tip. Sadly, the restroom lacked paper towels, suggesting a lack of attention to detail.

This Marsh store is never crowded, making it easy to navigate and exit quickly. I do agree with another reviewer about the state of the red baskets, they need improvement. However, I appreciate the updated layout of the store and the convenient aisle setup. The only downside is that there always seems to be a shortage of cashiers. Nevertheless, Marsh offers a great selection of products as usual.

This place offers creatively delicious food. The service is great, with coffee or tea served while waiting to be seated - a pleasant surprise. Their Bloody Marys are superb. A visit here is always an interesting and adventurous experience.
The atmosphere is wonderful, offering a great selection of beers. The Asian chicken salads and Cajun pasta were both excellent. Definitely coming back again.

I have been a fan of this place for almost 25 years and continue to love it. It started as a Delaware treat, but I'm glad it's expanding to more locations. I hope they come to the Huntsville AL area soon. Although this review is not about this specific location, if it's as good as others I've been to, it will be great! The seating was plentiful, the place was clean, and they were playing good music while I waited. The only downside is that they don't have Herrs chips like the Delaware locations, but that's not a big problem.

The prices initially seemed reasonable, but I soon realized they charge extra for every add-on. Unfortunately, the food is subpar, with hard and dry rice and sad, limp burritos. The waitress had a terrible attitude on both my visits. The saving grace is their guacamole and strong margaritas. It seems their tactic is to intoxicate customers into not minding the mediocre food and rude service.

My boyfriend and I ventured out of our usual restaurants in Trolley Square and stumbled upon this adorable Italian gem. The waiter was incredibly warm and gave us great recommendations. The food was outstanding, with freshly made dishes and a delicious bread recipe straight from Sicily. We loved the prosciutto wrapped Shrimp and both our pasta dishes were excellent. Portions were generous, leaving leftovers for my lunch the next day. And the cannoli? Unbelievably good, according to my boyfriend, who has been to Italy. If you're craving a delicious Italian meal at a reasonable price, don't miss out on this place. We lucked out with a special of a free appetizer when ordering two entrees. Definitely worth checking out!

This restaurant deserves a 3.5-star rating due to the absence of alcohol, which was disappointing after a long week. Nevertheless, the margherita pie was delicious and fresh. We also enjoyed the appetizing Greek salad, brimming with tasty veggies. Yum!

I love Mr. Wizard's for their healthier frozen yogurt option compared to frozen custard. The option to choose pre-select combinations or create your own is great. However, limited outdoor seating can be inconvenient in cold weather, so eating in your car might be necessary.

The restaurant's name and logo may not hold much meaning, unless it represents three individuals pooling their resources to start the business. Regardless, the food was excellent, the staff was friendly, and they offer an extensive menu ranging from breakfast to dessert. The fact that it is open 24 hours makes it a definite go-to spot next time I'm in town.

Had a fabulous night at Spasso with friends. Our meals were incredible, especially the seafood special. Leftovers were delicious too. Service was fantastic, and the wine selection was spot on. Can't wait to return!

I had a terrible experience at this nail salon. Initially, the owner was friendly and attentive. However, when I refused to pay their exorbitant price for a pedicure, she completely ignored me and showed no regard for my business. She even reassigned my nail tech without explanation. I observed her catering to new customers while disregarding my presence. This salon has horrible customer service, and not everyone wants to spend a fortune on nail services, regardless of its self-proclaimed "high-end" status.

The ice cream was mediocre but satisfied my sweet craving while passing through Belmawr. The service was friendly but a bit slow. The charming decor adds to the ambience. I might return if I lived nearby, but wouldn't make a special trip for it.

Devlin's is the best auto body shop in Philadelphia. My Honda Fit was in rough shape with nicks, dents, scratches, and lime stains. After being touched up, the car looked brand new. Ed Devlin is a miracle worker, providing exceptional results at a surprisingly affordable price.

45 may not have any standout features, but it has a cozy "Cheers" atmosphere where everyone knows your name, even if you can barely see their face through the cigarette smoke. The smoke never bothers me, but it turns off some of my friends. The laid-back and divey vibe is what draws me here, and the spread of food during game days is a nice touch rarely seen in bars now. Baseball season is dominated by Red Sox fans, so keep your allegiances quiet. Don't forget about the food truck parked outside, a delicious treat. If you're going to Tipitinas for a show, 45 is a great pre or post-show stop.
The coffee at this place is excellent, but having to ask separately for cream and sugar can feel pretentious and intimidating. Coffee should be served to our preferences without making it a big deal.

The grits at this brunch spot are my favorite and I can't resist ordering them every time. The portion size is huge and you can add toppings for a small fee. The grits are perfectly cooked and not at all grainy or watery. I can't recommend them enough!

The staff is amazing, and everything is consistently good. The chili cheese etoufee is fantastic. Only deducted a star because it's cash only. However, the option to sit outside on a pleasant evening is a nice touch. Don't miss out on the garlic sauce!
The outside tables offer a pleasant view, although the food and service are standard for a beach setting. However, it's a great spot to enjoy a drink while soaking in the scenery.

I couldn't be happier with my experience at All About Hair. Lou not only gave me an amazing haircut but also created a welcoming atmosphere and engaging conversation. I am so impressed that I am considering contacting Yelp! to suggest expanding their star rating system for this exceptional place. Lou is now my go-to barber, and All About Hair has gained a loyal customer in me. 5 stars all the way!

Overall, the trip was still enjoyable for my kids despite the poor quality of the derma bond used, resulting in a scar on my buddy. Unfortunately, the scar is in a bad spot and since my buddy is not yet two and constantly moving, it was difficult to manage. I believe it's fair to expect better.

This hotel offers exceptional airport views and the exclusive feature of a revolving rooftop restaurant. Connected to the airport, it provides easy access to various dining and shopping options. The highlight is the panoramic view from the rooftop restaurant, encompassing the runways and control tower.
Fantastic food and atmosphere! The turkey, beans, and biscuits are heavenly. The pecan pie was good, but I've had better. Still, I can't wait to return!

I had a great experience at this family style restaurant and bar. The menu was extensive, the restaurant and restrooms were clean, and the staff was friendly. Despite being busy during our visit, the service was prompt and efficient. Although I can't give them a perfect rating since I only had a sandwich, I enjoyed my meal. They had a good selection of draft beers and also served wine and mixed drinks. I loved the thoughtful touch of providing crayons and a large sheet of paper for kids to draw on. Overall, it was a pleasant dining experience.
The food was great, especially the crab cocktail. My husband enjoyed his steamers. The only downside was the high humidity in the restaurant. A fan would have been a nice addition.

Freddy's offers the best fast-food style burgers with great toppings and fresh meat. Their fries paired with the "fry" sauce are delicious. Additionally, their custard is rich, creamy, and absolutely delicious.

This place is a must-visit for donut lovers! The donuts were excellent, reasonably priced, and incredibly soft. We couldn't resist trying the blueberry cake donut and apple fritter, both were absolutely delicious. We'll definitely be returning for more!

I had a wonderful experience at the Nashville location and was excited to learn that there was now one in New Orleans. However, our visit to the New Orleans location was disappointing. We arrived at 10pm and waited for 10 minutes without being greeted. When we went to the bar for assistance, we were informed that the kitchen was behind on orders. After waiting for 25 minutes with no service or apology, we decided to leave. This was not the experience I expected from such a well-known establishment. I hope this is not indicative of their usual service.

Allegro's offers deliciously affordable and speedy pizza, with the sicilian and meaty options being exceptionally tasty. The stuffed varieties are also worth a try, although some centers may be cold. While they sell beer, I cannot comment on it due to my age during my time in Philadelphia. However, the service can be occasionally rude, and the presence of individuals talking to themselves can be off-putting.

The Peppermill in Reno is a fantastic casino with excellent service, clean rooms, and great amenities. The staff is friendly, and the casino has the loosest slots in town. The happy hour at the Fireside Lounge is a great deal, and the Fish Bar with its aquarium is a relaxing place to unwind. The only downside is that the bright lights in the casino can be disorienting, so keep the map they give you handy. Overall, a highly recommended place to stay in Reno.

Two thumbs up! The burger was excellent, pulled pork was very good, and my wife loved her egg white and goat cheese omelette. The beer list is solid and the spicy bloody Mary hit the spot. Great service and an eclectic playlist added to the overall experience.

I had a negative experience at Peppermill due to their poor treatment and lack of response after I intervened to help during an incident. Despite restraining the assailant and calling for security, I was asked to leave or be considered trespassing. They did not address the situation or show any gratitude for my assistance. As a result, I have no intention of returning to Peppermill.

I attended a conference at this 5 mile wide/long convention center with 2,000 guestrooms and 6,000 attendees. Despite booking late, I didn't want to spend $200+/night on a hotel room, so I stayed at a budget hotel across the street. The convention center itself is massive and well-staffed, with excellent shuttle service and lunch/drinks. However, the food inside is overpriced. The surrounding area has popular chain restaurants. Overall, the convention center is immaculate, but on a student budget, I opted for a cheaper hotel.

Unfortunately, the restaurant no longer offers BBQ sauce as a base for their pizzas, which greatly disappointed me and the children. Despite explaining that we have enjoyed this customization in the past, the staff declined our request and even denied the possibility of paying extra for it. As a result, we had to leave and find an alternative dining option. Sadly, I won't be able to bring the kids to this restaurant again.
This hidden gem is absolutely adorable! The staff is incredibly friendly and the cookie dough is to die for. We stumbled upon this place by chance and couldn't be happier. A definite must-visit!
Taco Review: Mediocre chips and salsa, average tacos.

I'm thrilled this place is in Reno! The matcha and ube flavors are delicious and authentic. The staff is friendly and although they have room for improvement, their base is solid. The soft serve, cake, and sauces are perfectly balanced, not overly sweet. Can't wait for more flavors to be added!

I stumbled upon this small, pleasant restaurant closer to my home and I am so glad I did. The menu may be small, but the food packs a punch. The Duck Fries were heavenly, with smoked gouda, shredded duck, and scallions. The large portion for just $8 was impossible to resist picking at. I tried the scallop and foie gras tacos, which were amazing despite my reservations about the origin of foie gras. The pork roll burger that my companion ordered was incredibly juicy and perfectly cooked. I will definitely be a returning customer.

Three Muses in New Orleans offers delectable tapas-style dishes meant for sharing. While the fish tacos were underwhelming, the lamb sliders and steak and cake were absolutely phenomenal. The lamb paired with goat cheese was exquisite, and the crab cake was the best I've ever had.

Great ambiance and trendy decor. Presentation of dishes was impressive. However, the food was just okay, with undercooked potatoes and greasy pancakes. Will definitely return to try the enticing french toast and omelette. Also interested in exploring their lunch menu. Excellent service.
This place is amazing! The food is delicious, and the service is incredibly friendly. The homemade flan is exceptional, and the price is just right. It would be perfect if they had a liquor license.

Had a delightful breakfast with family after a swift stopover. The food was fantastic, and the service, thanks to Jonathan, was impeccable. A hidden gem with a bustling atmosphere but no Saturday wait.

The Praline Connection provided Dad with a heavenly Southern food experience, surpassing Willie Maes. His soul platter's fried chicken was the best he's ever had, and the red beans and rice evoked childhood memories. Mom enjoyed her meatloaf with cabbage and lima beans, while my ribs were a bit tough. The potato salad was good, but the mac and cheese lacked flavor. However, the cornbread was fantastic. Next time, I'm definitely trying the fried chicken!

I highly recommend Buddy Brew in Tampa. Their flavorful coffee and beautiful latte art are a treat. The modern design reminds me of New York's coffee shops. Free parking is a definite advantage, but limited seating and uncomfortably cold temperatures may encourage taking your coffee to go and exploring Hyde Park Village instead.

V Vegaz Salon in the East Loop is an underrated gem with a spacious and modern interior. The stylists are happy and the vibe is great. Callie is my go-to stylist who always understands my hair and gives me a great cut. The compliments I receive even a month after my haircut speak volumes about her skills. Highly recommended for those looking for a salon with an edge.

The lady who works here is a miracle worker! I brought in pants and a suit jacket that needed hemming and sleeve shortening, respectively. Despite the complexity and urgency, she completed the alterations in a day, delivering excellent, professional results. The suit now fits me perfectly for my business trip. They accept all major credit cards and have convenient hours. Will definitely come back.

The Irish Pol: Great beer selection and lively atmosphere on Saturday nights, but disappointing happy hour experience. Dark and dingy interior with an older crowd. Will return for weekend fun, but not for happy hour.
This place has the best spaghetti & meatballs I've ever had. Cozy atmosphere, now my favorite Italian spot.

I had a fantastic Happy Hour experience at this place! The 50 cent oysters and half price drinks were a great deal. The beet salad, mussels, and flammenkuchen were all excellent. The flammenkuchen had caramelized onions, cheese, and bacon - it was even better than what I had tried in Strasbourg. Highly recommend!

I have dined at this place three times and each experience has been enjoyable for both me and the kids. There is no smoke or noise, and the food and service are consistently good. Perhaps the late Tuesday afternoon timing has contributed to our positive experiences. I have tried different dishes each time and have always been satisfied and happy with my choices. I will definitely return to dine here again.
Excellent pizza! Beautiful ambiance and inviting atmosphere. Friendly and efficient service.

Richard's in downtown is a gem. From the fresh Caesar salad and bread to the mouthwatering cheese ravioli with pesto cream sauce, every dish was perfection. The pesto sauce was well-balanced, allowing the delicate pasta to shine. To top it off, the Dunham cabernet was delightful. Welcome to downtown, Richard's!

I had a great breakfast experience at this place last weekend. The French toast with a side of fruit and a la carte fried egg was delicious. The staff accidentally dropped my egg, but they quickly replaced it. The vanilla latte was excellent, not needing any additional sweeteners. The patio seating was lovely, and even indoor seating provided a nice atmosphere with fresh breezes flowing through the open doors and windows. Overall, a really nice experience.
Despite the food being only decent, the inviting atmosphere and friendly staff make this place worth coming back to. The fresh fruit and great coffee were highlights of the experience.

We loved Salty's! Great kids menu with a variety of options. Crabby Dip was delicious but a bit pricey. Salty Burger and macadamia crusted grouper were fantastic. Amazing service, definitely a five-star experience!

Unfortunately, our recent experience with the chili beef nachos and chicken burrito was not pleasant, as both my boyfriend and I experienced stomach issues. Although we appreciate the shredded beef at this establishment and usually enjoy it, this time we were disappointed with the freshness of the ingredients.
This place is amazing, reminiscent of the past. The music is fantastic. However, I deducted one star as seating is limited to the first 15 people in line.
I highly recommend choosing Blue Fin or Masamoto instead.

The BW Pepper Tree Inn was a decently priced option for our bachelorette party in Santa Barbara. The rooms were clean and cozy, with charming exterior and grounds. The beds were relatively comfortable, and we appreciated the bath and body works amenities, as well as the free water bottles and fruit in the room. However, the decor was dated, there were some toilet issues, the door was difficult to open, and there was no hair dryer or complimentary breakfast. Despite these drawbacks, considering the location and price range, I still wouldn't have chosen to stay anywhere else in Santa Barbara, making it a good choice for our group.

The recent barbecued pulled pork burger at Johnny Rockets was a delicious and filling meal. The flavor was fantastic and the endless fries were a bonus. However, it's unfortunate that they no longer have the singing and dancing at this location since they moved. Overall, I've never had a bad experience here.

I would not recommend this salon. It is unclean, with cobwebs, dust, and outdated equipment. The nail technician's distraction with YouTube during my service was unacceptable. The lack of health department intervention surprises me.

5/5 ⭐️

I highly recommend this local business! They offer a wide variety of products and best of all, complimentary popcorn. Why spend money at corporate giants when you can enjoy free popcorn here? Truly a great experience!

I love this place! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the space is roomy with plenty of outlets, and the tea is delicious. The taro bubble tea is a must-try, but be prepared for the suspense of not knowing when a pearl will enter your mouth. The only downside is the music, which can be distracting, but bringing headphones solves the problem.

Yah Man is an absolute must-visit in Tampa! The atmosphere, personal service, and delicious Caribbean fare will not disappoint. The beef pie, chicken, and island sampler plates were all mouthwatering, while the bread pudding was simply divine. We left completely satisfied and in high spirits. Whether you're a local or a visitor, this place is a gem. Friendly staff too! Highly recommended, had to share on Yelp for the third time because it's that good!

This chill backyard bar is my favorite spot in New Orleans. The local music options are amazing, but make sure to go with a smaller group as seating can be tight. The wine and cheese bar up front is perfect for grabbing a delicious tray of cheeses and accoutrements. Their wine selection is excellent and reasonably priced. It's a great place to escape the tourist crowds and have an unforgettable night in New Orleans.

Fantastic lunch experience! The chicken Caesar was delicious and my companion loved their custom salad. The waitress was friendly and gave us ample time to enjoy our meal without feeling rushed. The restaurant's hidden location added to the charming ambiance. Highly recommend!

I made a reservation more than a week in advance with a request to be near the band, but upon arrival, they had no record of it. Unfortunately, we ended up stuck in the back next to the bathroom. The cocktails, food, band, and atmosphere were fantastic, deserving 5 stars. However, the utter lack of organization and the fact that they gave open tables near the front to people with reservations left us completely disappointed. The woman who took our reservation claimed to be new, so I guess it's always better to call and confirm. This experience was particularly disappointing since we've had amazing experiences at this place before.

Highly recommend this professional tattoo shop! Bryan's outstanding work left my husband and I extremely happy with our new ink. The entire team is super nice, and it's no surprise they are the city's top tattoo shop. Remember, their new location is at 1418 N. Clairborne, Suite 5, upstairs.

This place has the best view in Santa Barbara and awesome wines. The owners, Tom and Gillian, are always generous hosts and treat us well. The Conway cabs are the best in town and we were gifted a fantastic bottle of Conway 13 reserve Syrah. The Rolos red is a favorite for wine snobs and newcomers alike. Even our 5-year-old son loves going here and we are never disappointed.
This draft latte is exceptionally good. 10/10. Plus, the guy at the register complimented my tie.

Absolutely amazing food! Must-try BBQ shrimp and the truffle fries are a hit. Truffle butter filet mignon is a must for truffle lovers. Don't miss the delicious bread pudding and white chocolate brownie for dessert.

I highly recommend this wine and cheese shop! The unique atmosphere allows you to select your own bottle of wine and choose from an array of cheeses and meats. The staff then creates a beautiful cheese board with extras like nuts, spreads, and sliced artisan bread. It's like magic! We were so satisfied with the platter and wine that we didn't need to order from the kitchen.

Absolutely loved my dining experience at Smiley's! Smiley is an amazing host and the food was simply delicious. I enjoyed it so much that I'm having it for lunch again today and I can't wait. I highly recommend this place to everyone in Manayunk, it's a gem that shouldn't be missed!
Steakhouse X offers above average steaks with outstanding service and an excellent wine list, comparable to renowned restaurants like Ocean Prime and Ruth's Chris.

I had dinner here with a friend on Sunday. The seating arrangement surprised me - we were seated next to another party with a small partition separating us. The restaurant is small and can get noisy. However, the service was great. The food was decent - we ordered the Kale Caesar and the Fried Chicken with Mac n Cheese. Unfortunately, they were out of watermelon so the accompanying salad had to be substituted. The Kale Caesar had a delicious soft egg with a crispy crust and runny yolk, which impressed me.

I was disappointed with the service and beer selection at this brewery. Despite finding our own table, the wait staff completely ignored us. The wait for our flight of beers was lengthy and the quality was underwhelming. In fact, one even tasted like soap. I've had much better experiences and tastings at other breweries.

I've been here twice for breakfast and the experience was really awkward. The staff on Saturday mornings seemed inexperienced and were often cursing and yelling at each other. The ordering system is confusing as they sometimes come to your table, but it seems random. The coffee and drinks are self-serve and not good. The lack of shades at the front window can make it uncomfortable. The food was okay, but my pulled pork wrap had a lot of gristle. The cornbread pancakes were tasty though. The payment process is inconvenient as you pay afterwards. I regret bringing my brother here for brunch, it's a dive. Don't expect traditional breakfast service or a nice atmosphere. It's cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Great classic Greek diner. The Greek omelette with feta, gyro meat, tomato, and spinach was fantastic. Loved the classic griddle home fries and the service was outstanding. We'll definitely be coming back when we're in the area.

Unfortunately, the experience at this restaurant fell short of expectations. Despite waiting for over half an hour, only miso soup and drinks were served. Disappointingly, the actual food ordered was nowhere to be seen, leaving us waiting and still hungry.
The doctor was great - friendly, attentive, professional and funny!

While the Ramen at this place may not be the best, their Steven roll was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend asking for roll recommendations if you visit. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Philly.

Unless you fit a certain demographic, expect subpar service. Our waitress was more interested in socializing with older, wealthier patrons and neglected to check on us or our meals. Disappointed with the lack of attention despite the high cost.

The Paris Hair Salon is an exceptional place with skilled professionals who genuinely understand hair. They provide a warm and welcoming atmosphere, taking the time to effectively handle even the most difficult hair types. I am extremely satisfied with their services, as they consistently deliver perfect results for cuts, colors, and highlights. Moreover, their prices are reasonable. Highly recommended! - Maureen Kerfoot

I was thrilled to have a Chick-Fil-A nearby, but the incompetence at the drive-thru and peculiar layout left me disappointed. However, I appreciate the free WiFi while enduring the long wait. I'll stick to the locations in Rivergate or Cool Springs for top-notch waffle fries.

I highly recommend this place! Great service, convenient payment system, and fresh, delicious food. The chicken taco salad and plantains were excellent. The drinks, especially the mojito, were tasty as well. Can't wait to come back and explore more of their menu.

I had a fantastic experience with the Sultans of Schlep for a small move in the city. Tom was attentive and responsive, while the movers were punctual and efficient. Reasonable prices and complimentary wardrobe boxes were a bonus. Plus, their cool and funny name adds to their appeal. I would gladly work with them again!
I recently had a pedicure at this place and it was amazing. The cleanliness and ambiance were impressive, and there was no wait time. They definitely know what they are doing.

Yats is hands down the best Cajun food we've ever had. Not only is it delicious, but it's also affordable. The menu is always a pleasant surprise, with an eclectic variety of dishes displayed on a chalkboard. It has become a regular spot for my wife and me to enjoy delightful culinary surprises.

The pizza place had an impressive selection and my roast beef sandwich was delicious, although it took a bit longer to prepare. Limited seating inside, but a community patio is available. Excited to try their highly recommended pizza.

We had a great experience at this location on July 4th. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the compassionate nurse who tried to remove my daughter's ear wax. Despite multiple attempts, he couldn't get it out, but the doctor quickly resolved the issue. We received prescriptions and found them cheaper at the Target in the same shopping center. Overall, it was a convenient and efficient place for immediate care while on vacation. Thank you!

The veggie wings at this place are hands down the best I've ever had. I can't stop thinking about them. The fried pickles are also great, but the drinks are a bit weak. Stick to the Mexican coke when you're here.

The diner has a pleasant and cozy atmosphere, stands out from others. Tried the Yankee pot roast - average taste and bland meat, but veggies were fantastic. My wife enjoyed her omelette. Service was outstanding.
The Chicken Teriyaki Lunch Bento Box was a disappointment as it arrived without rice, which is an essential component of a bento box. Zero stars.
Brooke's music isn't up to par anymore. A significant change from pop edm is necessary.
Great price, excellent location, and comfortable accommodations with spacious rooms. However, the bed is quite firm and the sheets are rough. Despite this, I'd definitely consider staying here again!
The food was great and the service was impressive, especially considering how busy the place was.

Had an amazing first-time experience here! The food was fantastic, but the highlight is the stunning beach view and soothing sounds of crashing waves. They also sell beer, which is a bonus. Highly recommended, even if it's not in the area, it's worth the drive. Will definitely return!

Attended a party at this venue and was impressed by their private room with a dedicated bar and bathroom. The buffet was enjoyable, the service efficient, and the atmosphere allowed for clear conversations. Highly recommended for hosting an event!

I had a fantastic experience at LF for my first visit. Tori was amazing and turned my desired hairstyle into reality. She also provided helpful suggestions for my fine and thin hair type. The salon was clean, modern, and parking was easy. Overall, it was a great experience!

I highly recommend this place! The burger had amazing flavor, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The sides were generous and delicious, especially the homemade potato chips and waffle fries sweet potatoes. The outside patio was lovely, although I wish there was a no-smoking policy. Our waiter, Jesse, provided excellent service. Overall, this hidden gem is definitely worth a visit and I will be coming back.

Mark at Blades is fantastic! I've been a client for over 2 years now after trying out other salons like Dominic Michael. With Mark's salon experience and his affordable prices, I always leave Blades loving my haircut. Highly recommend!

Overall, this restaurant has a modern decor and is perfect for people in their 20s. I highly recommend the mahi mahi with pita chips and hummus - it was delicious with tender and flavorful fish. The service was also commendable.

I absolutely love this place for dim sum! The menu could be expanded, but the quality is amazing. Best dim sum in Reno, hands down. We prefer ordering in advance and dining in. The chicken feet and siu mai are our favorites here. Their combo meal with sesame chicken and fried rice is delicious, and my husband enjoys the beef and broccoli or shrimp and vegetables. The combo also includes a tasty appetizer and/or cup of hot soup. Highly recommend, unless you're willing to travel to Sacramento.

I had an excellent lunch experience with my group of eight hungry people. Despite expecting a crowd, we didn't have to wait and the parking lot was empty. The server was amazing, although I can't remember her name. The cheeseburger and fries were cooked to perfection, and we all had a great time without any complaints.
Hands down, the bayou burger is the ultimate burger experience. The staff is fantastic too, earning a resounding thumbs up.

I highly recommend this corporate event venue for its flawless service, creative and tasty hors d'oeuvres, delicious lobster consommé, perfectly cooked and seasoned filet, generous portion sizes, and stunning view. The private dining room has a better view than the main dining room and the service was never intrusive. I would definitely consider returning for a special occasion dinner. Overall, a fantastic experience.

Lazos serves the best pizza in the Fairmount/Art Museum/Brewerytown area. The pepperoni and wings were delicious, with a delightful crispy texture. Surprisingly, the wings were not soggy like many others. Although they mistakenly gave me Sprite instead of Coke, the overall pizza and wing combo was excellent. Will definitely order from Lazos again!

I recently enjoyed an express lunch at this charming restaurant with old school decor featuring dark woods and a copper tile ceiling. The deal included a choice of soup with the entree of the day, and I must say, the gumbo and crab bisque were fantastic. The gumbo had a rich flavor with a touch of heat from the andouille sausage, while the crab bisque was perfectly seasoned with old bay style seasoning and had just the right amount of shredded crab. The entree, garganelli with roast pork ragu, mushrooms, and creole tomatoes, was a delightful blend of flavors with a light sauce that highlighted the dish. The roast pork itself was tender, caramelized, and left me craving more. Overall, a satisfying lunch experience in a visually appealing setting.

The hotel was excellent with friendly staff, ideal location near popular attractions like Bourbon Street and Harra's, and just a short walk to Jackson Square. The only drawback was the pricey $38 per night parking.

I had a great experience at this store yesterday. The selection was impressive, especially the Chloe and Marc Jacobs items and the Chanel pumps, although they were too small for me. The price range is excellent, and the current summer sales are a bonus. I appreciate the value for money and the fact that they offer higher-end items, such as silky blouses, which I am willing to pay $100 for. The staff member was also extremely friendly and nice. This store will definitely be my go-to from now on.

The service was extremely disappointing, with unhelpful staff and poor communication. Despite winning a happy hour, the organizer was unresponsive and forgot about my reservation. The bouncers and bartenders were not friendly or efficient, and the crowd was unappealing. While the free drinks were a bonus, I would not recommend this place for any other reason.

My first impression of this 7 Eleven was positive due to its clean and spacious appearance. However, I had a negative experience when the cashier initially tried to charge me more for plastic cups, but I quickly resolved the issue and got them for a lower price. The unscrupulous part was when the cashier and manager attempted to deceive me by claiming a higher price.
Terrible nail salon experience. Insulting staff, poor service, and rushed job. Clearly, they haven't learned from previous negative reviews.

The gelati provided by this place is absolutely amazing and perfect for cooling down on scorching hot days. Despite the calories and diabetes concerns, it is totally worth it. Five stars for their fantastic frozen treats. PS: Don't forget to check out their website for some Vanilla Ice!
The all-you-can-drink brunch at this place is a must-try! For just $20, you get delicious brunch items and unlimited bloody marys or mimosas. Perfect for a fun Sunday outing. Enjoy!

This Chinese restaurant offers good food and a great beer selection. I haven't tried their sushi, so I can't comment on that. The staff is not overly friendly, but they are satisfactory for takeout service. Keep in mind that it's not a high-end establishment, so set realistic expectations.

Andres Richard Salon on Locust St is the place to go for exceptional hair care. Stephanie, a junior stylist at the salon, worked her magic and transformed my hair exactly as I wanted after a disappointing experience at other salons. I highly recommend their technical, creative, and expert services. This is now the only salon I trust with my hair.

I like the festive atmosphere and wide selection of Spanish music. The attentive service and ability to accommodate picky orders is a plus. The salad could be improved with better lettuce. The chicken soup is highly recommended and the friend who ordered it is a culinary expert. The queso fundido is also a must-try, but be cautious with adding chorizo to avoid greasiness.

Extremely disappointed with the service and quality of tea latte at this Starbucks. Despite waiting 15 minutes with four people working, the drink turned out watery. Even after returning it twice, the offered replacement was no better. The baristas need to improve their skills. Disappointing experience overall.
Highly recommended! Thin, crispy crust and excellent customer service. This place has the best pizza in town. A must-visit if you're a pizza lover.

I highly recommend this place, it might even be better than Halal Guys. Despite arriving close to closing time, the friendly staff, especially Jules, made me feel welcome and helped me navigate the menu. I ordered the steak shwarma with rice and all the sauces, and it was absolutely delicious! The food had a healthy quality to it and left me feeling satisfied. I will definitely be returning here.

I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, with just the right level of tranquility. The staff struck a perfect balance between casual conversation and attentiveness. Despite its size, the restaurant felt spacious. The friendly and accommodating staff made the experience even better. As for the food, it was delicious. I highly recommend trying the Crabby Wife with fried eggs and the chicken & waffles with hot-sauce, syrup, and their special sauce – simply fantastic! Overall, it was an excellent experience.

Surrey's is a hidden gem outside the city center that is worth a visit for brunch. The shrimp n grits are the best in town and the freshly squeezed juices are a refreshing choice. Even non-omelette lovers will be converted by the delicious lump crab omelette with sauce. Just be prepared for crowds and arrive early to avoid hunger pangs while waiting for a table.

I liked the store's large and clean space with a good selection of items. However, the customer service was lacking during my recent visit. Despite asking for permission to try clothes on my French Bulldog, no assistance was provided. Furthermore, when a cat in the store swatted my dog, no one came to help. Overall, I left disappointed and don't plan on returning due to the poor service.

Outstanding service! The team at this shop is knowledgeable, honest, and communicates effectively. They took care of our older cars with meticulous attention to detail. I highly recommend them for all your service needs.

This place was great - clean, bright, and had plenty of options for frozen yogurt and toppings. The friendly cashier even allowed me to pay with my credit card, even though I was a bit short on cash. My son had a blast here!

Stopped by for Sunday brunch a couple of weeks ago. The food was delicious and satisfying, with great drink options. Our server was pleasant, and we loved the cool cafe atmosphere. Definitely recommend it.

First visit tonight. Nice, clean and reasonably priced place with friendly staff. Unfortunately, the food was extremely bland and mediocre. The chicken fajitas had a tepid base and room temperature meat. Pico, cheese, sour cream and tortillas were nothing special. Overall, underwhelming experience. Unlikely to return.

Gelateria is my go-to spot in St. Louis for the most satisfying gelato experience. The coffee house-like atmosphere, complemented by a spacious outdoor patio adorned with a fountain and lush greenery, creates the perfect backdrop for indulging in their delectable gelato and delicious baked goods. Everything about this place is simply delightful.

I highly recommend this small sushi gem near Dale Mabry. The bar seating offers entertaining interactions with friendly sushi chefs. Although the sticky rice could be stickier, the sushi was incredibly fresh and flavorful. The standout was definitely the Wahoo, a must-try! With a reasonable price of $30 for dinner, I can't wait to return for more.

Food - Cheap and large selection. 
Service - Poor. They forgot our order, no apology, and 15 minutes of waiting. Disappointing customer service.

Larry's Steaks near St. Joe's University is a suitable replacement for the once great Dallesandro's. Their cheesesteak, similar to the original, is sliced and minced perfectly with melted cheese throughout. The onions and mushrooms are also top-notch. It's greasy, but not excessively so. Skip Pat's and Geno's and give Larry's a try for a real Philly cheesesteak experience.

This place is extremely disappointing. The service was horrendous and the food arrived cold, resulting in a hassle to send it back. Unless there's a significant improvement in management and staff expectations, I advise staying away from this place.

I visited this place a year ago before the e.coli / colliform scare. Due to concerns for my health and safety, I haven't returned since. It's unfortunate because I genuinely enjoyed this place. However, I still have doubts about their ability to maintain proper food safety standards. My suggestion is for them to cook their meat thoroughly at 165°F to kill any bacteria, serve the food at a high temperature to ensure bacteria are eliminated, and only use greens and veggies sourced from the USA to avoid water pollution cross-contamination issues in Mexico.

I ordered a variety of items with specific customization, but unfortunately, I received incorrect and mixed-up orders. The employee seemed confused when I requested no ketchup. This is a basic task that should have been easily executed.

I tried this place for breakfast upon a friend's recommendation and it didn't disappoint! Despite the busy Saturday morning, we were seated promptly and the service was friendly and speedy. The veggie omelette with fruit and rye toast was delicious, and there were plenty of options for all preferences. The prices were reasonable considering the generous portions. I'll definitely be returning!

Wells Fargo provides an enjoyable atmosphere for all ages, consistently delivering excellent game experiences regardless of seating location. I highly recommend attending a Flyers game, even for those who aren't typically fans of hockey.
Great place for late-night eats with a must-have drive-through. Offers new menu items and veggie options, but unfortunately forgot to include my dessert order in the bag. Very disappointing.

The spinach and feta hummus is simply amazing, and the chicken caesar pita was equally wonderful. The flavorful caesar dressing and high-quality greens made it a delightful experience. Despite initial skepticism due to its location in an old garage, this place is definitely worth a try.

This place is fantastic! They have a wide range of vegan options, and their staff is very knowledgeable. The Pad Thai with tofu, veggies, and cashews is absolutely perfect, and the avocado egg rolls are amazing. Highly recommend!

This downtown spot is a swanky and lively place filled with good-looking professionals enjoying drinks and appetizers. The food, though not filling, is like little works of flavor art. The mussels and clams are huge and the broth is buttery and faintly spiced. Other appetizers like Tuna Tartare and Coconut Shrimp offer awesome flavor surprises. However, the cocktail "The Tryst" was disappointing with a watery and strange alcohol aftertaste. The service is quick and helpful, especially once seated. The prices are a bit high for food, so it's better to stick to drinks or visit during happy hours. Overall, a cool and hip place for a night out with friends or if you're looking for impressive dishes, but be prepared to spend some cash.

Great customer service and delicious food, especially the flavorful curry and fluffy shrimp fried rice. However, paid extra for extra egg but did not receive it. Also, experienced a longer than expected wait time. Despite these issues, the staff's passion for serving and ensuring customer satisfaction was impressive.

The fresh made pie at this place is top-notch! With its tasteful and crunchy crust, generous toppings, and fantastic flavor, it easily ranks among the best pizzas in Philly. The Cowboy steak pizza is incredibly addictive, and I couldn't resist having more than just two slices. Even when I tried it with BBQ sauce, it didn't disappoint. Personal tip: go for the half and half option to enjoy the best of both worlds!

I highly recommend this mail service for frequent travelers. It's a convenient and secure place to receive mail, with after-hours access and reliable staff. While the strip mall location may have some drawbacks, the competitive price and excellent customer service make up for it.

I highly recommend Heads and Tails for sensitive skin and exceptional service. Jenne made my bikini wax experience comfortable and guided me through the whole process. It was not as daunting as I expected. This clean establishment with an excellent staff is definitely worth visiting. Will definitely return!
Ordered food late at night and it took over 2 hours to arrive after calling twice. No utensils or napkins provided. Food was good, but terrible service. Will not order again.
The dishes at this place were delectable and beautifully presented. We tried the J Sushi and Fire Roll, both of which were fantastic. The service was top-notch and the overall value was excellent.

We recently moved to town and were sad to leave behind our favorite local Mexican restaurant. However, we were pleasantly surprised when we finally tried this place. The traditional ambiance and top-notch service immediately impressed us. Their glass bottle sodas were a personal favorite, and the food was absolutely amazing. My wife loved the Taco Sombrero, and I thoroughly enjoyed the Chimichanga. If I could, I would give this place 6 stars.

I had a terrible experience at this restaurant. The server was constantly on her phone, and the food portions were extremely small for the price. The only positive was that my pork leg was tender. The service was a complete fail, and the food was also a disappointment. I couldn't even order a Cuban coffee because the server was nowhere to be found. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Outstanding customer service! Wish I could rent more frequently. Unmatched experience compared to other rental services. Highly recommend!

Cafe Piazza, the new replacement for Benton Park Cafe, offers a fantastic ST. LOUIS atmosphere with a captivating mural on the ceiling. The restaurant's decor is eclectic and the food is both unique and reasonably priced. It's a great choice for a slightly upscale breakfast that won't overwhelm you. Highly recommended for its ambiance, convenient location, and delicious, creative cuisine.

I am a groupie and absolutely amazed by him. His chicken is tender and smoky, the best I've ever had. The creative and awesome side dishes complement his dishes perfectly. I'm sad that I could only try his dish once and now with the market construction, I can't find him. I hope he comes back soon.

Attended a company event with over 2K people at the fantastic Tuscan Tower. This resort surpasses all others in the area, resembling a luxurious cruise ship. Despite being a non-smoker, I did not encounter the usual second-hand casino smoke. The highlight was having breakfast at the coffee shop and having an enjoyable conversation with the CEO/GM. It doesn't get any better than this!

Wow! Incredible experience. Initially, we had low expectations due to the appearance of the plaza.
