However, upon stepping into the restaurant, we were greeted with a cozy traditional Indian/Thai ambiance. We ordered the mussel appetizer, Tamarind Duck, and Panang Curry with calamari. The service was prompt and unobtrusive. The mussels were tasty, but the Duck and Curry were absolutely amazing! The portion sizes matched the prices, so no feeling of being shortchanged. We plan to return to try the sushi and other duck varieties. Our taste buds are very satisfied!

Corropolese is the go-to place for tomato pie in our area. No one else compares! While they have other options, tomato pie is their standout and my family always chooses them for any occasion requiring it. They are simply the best!

I recently went to a birthday party at this place and it was definitely worth checking out. It was my first time there and I was really pleased. It was quiet on a Tuesday and the service was good. The beef n lobster dish was cooked well and the mashed potatoes and asparagus were very good. However, the crab and cheese balls appetizer was disappointing, lacking flavor and seasoning. The Creme Brule was solid and I would definitely order it again. Overall, I would rate it four stars due to the subpar appetizer and a shaky table, which is unnecessary for such a nice place. Despite that, I would happily go again and would recommend it to friends.

My wife and I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant. Our waitress, Debbie, was exceptional. She explained the menu and specials thoroughly and answered all our questions. The food came out quickly, was delicious, and prepared exactly as ordered. We will definitely be returning. The Mac 'n' Cheese burger was amazing and the drinks, especially the Whiskey Sour, were spot on. Highly recommended!
I highly recommend this independent store for holiday gifts! It was such a fun experience with pleasant staff. Hooray for finding unique gifts!

Based on previous Yelp reviews, this place had a great atmosphere and a unique blend of art house, coffee house, and Animal House vibes. The service was friendly and laid-back, and the beverages were delicious. However, the food was good but not outstanding, so I would give it three stars solely based on that. However, the atmosphere and staff deserve an extra star, so I would still consider returning to try other items on the menu.
Joyce is amazing! The painless experience is worth the drive from Palm Harbor. With high-tech equipment, it surpasses the horror stories told by my friends. Love it!

The Quarter Stitch in NOLA is a must-visit for knitting enthusiasts. Located within walking distance from my hotel, they had a special Mardi Gras yarn in stock. I couldn't resist checking the store out twice due to their delectable selection. The staff was incredibly helpful, making my experience even better. I would definitely return to this store.

The ice cream was delicious, but the service was absolutely terrible. The staff ignored us, threw napkins around, and made rude comments. They lacked professionalism and showed no respect towards paying customers.

Overall, this restaurant is small but conveniently located on the wharf. Despite the limited seating, the wait time was short. Sitting at the bar was a good option. The noise level was a bit high due to the small space. The service provided was excellent. The crab sandwich was disappointing, served on plain white bread. However, the fried shrimp was enjoyable - not greasy or heavy, with moist and flavorful shrimp. It is worth noting that the menu only offers shellfish options. As a non-seafood enthusiast, I was pleasantly surprised by the shrimp and onion rings. However, my seafood enthusiast husband did not enjoy the crab sandwich. If you love shellfish and appreciate the great location, this place could be worth a try.

I had the worst experience at this restaurant during brunch. The staff was unhelpful and rude, and we had to sit outside despite having a reservation. Bees were flying around our table, and when we asked to be moved inside for safety reasons, we were denied. The waitress spoke disrespectfully to us and our complaints were not addressed. The service was so terrible that we didn't even eat and would never recommend this place to anyone.
This place is fantastic for unique sandwiches and caters perfectly to both health-conscious eaters and those with vegan preferences.

I took on the Brew Bros. Burger challenge and, although I couldn't finish it in time, they gave me recognition and a shirt. Delicious food, friendly staff, but the challenge gave me a stomach ache for days. Didn't try the beer, but my friends said it's good. Not recommended if you intend to drink beer. It's the best deal for $24 and perfect to share with friends, except for the competition rules. I'll definitely return to conquer it next time I'm in Reno!
The breakfast and service are excellent. The Sunny side skillet (under $8) with a pancake was delicious. The atmosphere and store selections surpassed all other locations.

Five stars! This food truck provides excellent and efficient service. The meat is consistently juicy, and the BBQ sauce is delicious. Prices are reasonable, and if you come across this truck, don't miss the opportunity to try their offerings. You won't be disappointed.

I really wanted to like this place, but my experience was disappointing. The chicken was average, lacking flavor. The sauce options were limited for me, but the recommended mayo sauces weren't impressive. The mac&cheese was salty and mediocre, making a messy combination. The bananas foster pie had a great crust, but the filling lacked bananas and was mostly empty. The highlight was the birch beer, which was refreshing. The concept, decor, and menu are good, but the food quality doesn't match the price. 2 stars.

The service was extremely slow and the food was average. Even with a small group, the service was a mess as multiple servers watched one struggling server handle everything. I felt sorry for her as she had to manage drinks, serving, and running food.

Impressive service, delectable food. Ribeye was divine; melty and flavorful. Huge and scrumptious burger. Bread pudding is worth the hype. Highly recommend going and sharing with friends. Pricey, but worth it.

The menu is excellent, featuring locally sourced and constantly changing dishes that are a delight for your taste buds. However, reservations can be challenging to secure, so advanced planning is recommended.

Spot on! "The veg" burger was absolutely fantastic. The combination of portabella, grilled mozzarella, pickled veg, arugula, and gauc was a delightful explosion of flavors. The cheese was perfectly fused on top, not overly melted. The citrusy and vinegary notes of the gauc and pickled veg balanced well with the bitterness of the arugula. The bun-to-contents ratio was spot on, and the potato bun was a bonus. As for the spicy fries, they were subtly spiced, reminiscent of crab fries. The portion size was just right. The atmosphere of the place reminded me of a cozy dive bar, though it's a bit small for sit-down dining.

Being a vegetarian in New Orleans is challenging, but I have found some good eats. Unfortunately, Tomasito's fell below my expectations. The chips and bean and cheese burrito were okay, but I couldn't add rice because it wasn't vegetarian. Service was alright, and the flan was delicious, although "with berries" meant just one raspberry. Despite its drawbacks, at least there were vegetarian options available, which is not always the case in New Orleans.
This Mexican restaurant exceeded my expectations - fantastic food, great drinks, and reasonable prices.
The venue boasts extremely loud live music, yet offers a pleasant and quieter atmosphere on the second floor for those seeking conversation-friendly spaces.

Steve from Roto-Rooter saved the day! Our new house had a sewer back-up causing a messy situation in the yard. Thanks to Steve, we're problem-free now. If we ever need help again, we'll definitely call Roto-Rooter.

I reached out to Jay Fatimo at the auto repair shop via email for a written estimate on replacing my factory navigation unit in my Denali. Despite his initial suggestion to email him, I never received a response after multiple attempts. The lack of communication has made me question their reliability and ability to handle the repairs. As a result, I will be taking my business to the GMC dealer nearby.

I have been a loyal fan of this place for years and their hazelnut cake is simply amazing. Their other cakes are equally delicious. Their butter cookies are a must-try, and I often get them as gifts for loved ones. The prices are fair and the quality is consistent. The staff is friendly and helpful. Overall, a wonderful experience every time.
First time for lunch. Extensive and flavorful gluten-free menu. Good lunch and friendly service.

The service was excellent and the event hosting was great, but the food, especially the brisket, was mediocre. The bread was tough, the mac and cheese was good, and there were issues with dirty glassware and a lack of draft options.

Overall, the tour of the Mississippi on the steamboat is a good option for a relaxing day with a passive activity. The cost is average, around $28. The downside is that there are typical tourist traps like photographers, but you can decline those options. It is recommended to do some research beforehand, especially about the Natchez Native American Tribe, which adds an interesting element to the boat ride. Getting a drink can enhance the experience as well. Overall, it's a pleasant way to spend a few hours.

Just visited The Fat Ham with my girlfriend and had a great experience. Small but nice vibe with welcoming staff. Impressive whiskey display. Sat at the bar and received excellent service from bartender Dan. Margarita was tasty and reasonably priced. Pimento cheese, cornbread, shrimp & grits, and hot chicken were all delicious. Shrimp & grits was my favorite dish. Dessert (raspberry cobbler) was underwhelming, but the coffee was great. Decent price point, high-end comfort food, and overall, I'll be back.

Initially, we loved this place for its delicious Greek salad and gyros. The freshness of the food and the cute ambiance impressed us. However, our recent experience was disappointing. The tables were dirty, and the lamps were filled with dirt and dead bugs, immediately putting us off. Moreover, the quality of the food has significantly declined. My salad only had a bite of potato salad, and the tomato and pepper tasted off, forcing me to spit them out. My daughter's fajita bowl with chicken had a gross tomato and rubbery, charred chicken. To make matters worse, the baklava we ordered was stale. We hope the establishment cleans up and returns to its original high-quality and delicious state.

Carrollton Market in New Orleans is the ultimate brunch spot that only opens once a year. It offers amazing local flavors and excellent service. Their "biscuits and debris" dish is so incredible that it can only be described as a "life changing flavorgasm." The oyster French omelet exceeded all expectations, fulfilling everything I ever wanted in life. I am truly speechless and grateful for this outstanding experience at @Carrolltonmarket.
The beer selection was excellent, although service at the bar was a bit slow.

This place offers great food, especially the fish tacos and nachos. It has a nice atmosphere suitable for both family settings and night dates. They have a music beach bar, homemade ice cream, and a small playground, which makes it a great spot overall.

O! Wings is the ultimate wing spot with their unbeatable Hot momma and original flavors. Their bulgogi wrap is also a must-try. Even my picky dad couldn't resist their wings and wrap! The staff's friendliness and accommodating attitude make the experience even better. Our to go order for 16 people was handled smoothly and efficiently, getting us out the door in no time. Can't wait for our next visit!
New York Pizza Grill: Unwanted fliers, unsafe practices, and questionable employees make this a place to avoid.

This place was fast and efficient, despite being busy. The building is spacious and offers entertainment for kids. They have a variety of items for purchase to keep you occupied while waiting. The car was well-cleaned and vacuumed, except for a missed spot on the front window. The staff was friendly and the price was fair. I will definitely return in the future.

I highly recommend this place in Indiana! David's pink and whites are absolutely amazing. The shop is always clean, and the staff is professional and courteous. The new management, although they've been there for three years already, is outstanding.

I had a disappointing experience with this restaurant. Despite quick delivery, my entire order was incorrect. They offered a free meal as compensation, but refused to provide it when requested. I threatened to dispute the payment and mentioned not returning as a customer. Overall, a frustrating experience.

A perfect afternoon in the gulch would consist of a shopping spree at Blush, a beer at Hops and Crafts, and lunch at Turnip Truck. Turnip Truck offers a great selection of organic fair, including tasty hot buffet options and made-to-order sandwiches. They also have all-natural beauty products and lip balms. The only drawback is the lack of a rewards program. I highly recommend trying their chipotle chicken salad wrap on whole wheat with chipotle mayo.
The happy hour and brunch at this place are great. Dinner was just okay, but I think it was because I ordered something outside of my usual taste. I'll definitely give it another try.

Three of us flew in from Chicago and decided to stop by this place for a quick bite. We arrived close to 3 and asked if we could wait until happy hour to order. Despite being empty, the place was nicely decorated and had a spacious feel. We all tried their cocktails, with the Mint Julep falling short but the gin drink exceeding expectations. Our order also included Mac and cheese, fries, Brussels sprouts, and a pretzel. I skipped the sprouts, but everything else was delicious! The prices during happy hour were a steal. Rest assured, I'll be back on my next trip to Reno!

Finding a vegetarian restaurant in New Orleans was initially challenging, as many places were unwilling to accommodate our needs. However, in recent years, more restaurants are recognizing this and offering vegetarian options. Muriel's Jackson Square had a vegetarian menu, and we made reservations to ensure we would be able to eat. The cocktails were delicious, and we enjoyed the veggie crepe, despite the seafood sauce. The main course was a variety of veggie dishes, some of which were tasty, but some could have been cooked longer. Overall, we left with satisfied stomachs and had a pleasant vegetarian night out.

I had a delicious meal at Puckett's with their mighty tasty meat-and-two option. The squash casserole and meatloaf were top-notch. The cornbread, while advertised as such, was more like a corn fritter or hoe cake. Overall, highly recommended for a traditional and flavorful experience.

I have been a loyal guest at The Grand Sierra for years, but due to recent construction and changes, I decided to try the Peppermill upon a friend's recommendation. The Operations Manager, David Fuller, exceeded my expectations and made my stay truly exceptional. We were pleasantly surprised with a double upgrade to a Tuscany Balcony Suite, complete with a balcony, which set the tone for a perfect trip. The staff's dedication and willingness to go the extra mile made my experience even better than I had anticipated. Thank you, Peppermill! I will definitely return.

The Hilton property I stayed at was disappointing. The customer service was terrible, and even though I made a reservation for a suite, it wasn't ready. They offered me a lower grade room with a promise to switch later, but when I returned, they had sold my reserved room. The excuses and apologies were fake, and no satisfactory resolution was offered. I won't be staying here again.
The burger was mediocre and overpriced. Uncomfortable communal seating and average service. Lowering prices would greatly improve the experience. Many better options in St. Louis for taste and value.

I obtained multiple quotes and found Pete and Ron to be the best. Arbour Bay assured me I made a good choice. They efficiently removed two large oaks, one challenging to access, using a crane. I left in the morning and returned to find the trees gone with minimal yard damage. Highly recommend to friends and neighbors.

I was disappointed to discover a significant price increase at this establishment, with basic sushi rolls now costing nearly $20 for two. Though the portions were generous, they were not satisfying enough to warrant such steep prices for a lunch meal. Regrettably, I won't be returning due to these high prices.

The atmosphere and service were excellent! The live music was a pleasant surprise, and the band was very talented. The food was good, although the burger didn't meet my high expectations. Overall, we had a great time and will definitely return.

Overall, our 2 1/2 day corporate conference in mid-June was a great experience. The service was excellent, the facilities were pleasant, and the catering was impressive. The location is perfect for conferences or small conventions, with convenient amenities such as complimentary shuttle and parking near the airport.

This place is an absolute gem for cheese lovers looking to share a delightful variety with friends, paired with a wide selection of drinks. The staff's impressive knowledge of each cheese adds to the overall experience. Although not budget-friendly for drinks, I would definitely return. A solid 5-star rating.
Disappointing Middle Eastern experience with subpar side dishes; seemingly reheated rice lacked flavor and freshness.
I highly recommend this place for lunch. The Salmon dish is a must-try, and the service is excellent. The restrooms are also very clean.

This place is top notch with phenomenal service, fantastic ambiance, and amazing food. Best brunch experience ever, with delicious French toast and unreal chicken and waffles. The "flintstones pushup-pop" drink is creative and clever. Even the deviled eggs were the best I've ever had. Everything is done right, from the music to the overall experience. Ignore any review that's not 4 stars, they must be delusional.

I randomly stumbled upon this place and I'm glad I did. They have an awesome happy hour from 3-8pm every day with great deals on drinks and hookah. They offer a variety of shisha flavors and unique options like smoking from a fruit bowl. The food menu looked tempting, although I didn't try it. The atmosphere is laid-back and perfect for hanging out with friends. I had a fantastic time here.

I absolutely love this hotel! The lobby is adorable with comfortable seating and eclectic decorations. The staff, including Jasmine, Kayla, and Roshid, are amazing and friendly. The rooms are immaculate, especially the fantastic bathrooms in the king spa rooms. The decor is attractive and everything is in perfect condition. This hotel is a must-visit in Philadelphia, with a great location near historical sites. Stay at the Monaco, you won't regret it!
I am absolutely obsessed with this store! Being an addict, I just can't resist. The price I paid for a Bebe top, a Banana Republic skirt, and a BCBG skirt was only $4.13. Ridiculous savings!
Love this family-friendly spot in Carp to watch football! The atmosphere is excellent, service is quick, and the pizza is absolutely delicious.

This Acme store was generally what you would expect, with the only noticeable difference being slightly narrower aisles. While it may not offer as much variety as larger stores, it had upgraded sections like frozen and refrigerated foods. The service provided was satisfactory.

My wife and I recently discovered The Roost and it has quickly become our favorite breakfast spot in the area. Their homemade breads and pastries are a treat; the raisin bread and sugar-cinnamon toast are especially delicious. We also highly recommend the cornbread casserole. The service is prompt, attentive, and incredibly friendly. We can't wait to go back!

Despite its small and crowded atmosphere, this breakfast place serves delicious and abundant food. The efficient wait staff manages the hectic environment exceptionally well. Overall, a fantastic spot for breakfast.

Finally tried this place after passing by so many times and I'm glad we did. Despite the small size, the interior is visually pleasing with wooden palates and two-tone gray walls. The prosciutto fig arugula Parmesan flatbread appetizer was tasty and ample for two people. The main dishes, particularly the grass-fed beef burger with truffle-dusted fries, were impressive in size and flavor. I also enjoyed the seafood soup with a coconut and curry broth. It had a delicious spicy kick without overpowering the taste buds. Overall, I would highly recommend this place. Just a heads up, it gets crowded and doesn't take reservations, so best to go early. Don't forget to try their great selection of wines and craft beers.

I found the food at Dragon Buffet to be mediocre and not worth the higher price for crab legs. The meats were dried out and fried foods were soggy and tough. Service was slow, possibly due to limited staff. There are better Chinese buffets in the area, so I may not return.

This is our go-to place! The food is consistently good with friendly and attentive service. The pasta pockets with pear filling are delicious. BYOB is a bonus. Highly recommend for a cozy, family atmosphere.

This bar is ordinary and only notable for its connection to a popular TV show. The food, including the pricey gravy fries, is nothing outstanding. However, they had a special offer on White Rascal beer priced at $4. The service is generally good, although occasionally slow, but the staff is friendly.

I went to this place based on Yelp reviews and found everything to be true. The staff is super helpful and eager to answer any questions. I'll definitely keep coming back for my bike repair and maintenance needs.

The hotel offers great value with a pleasant atmosphere. The king bed and tasteful furnishings were impressive. The Carousel bar was a fun experience, and the rooftop pool was perfect for hot days. However, beware of loud noise from the street-facing rooms, particularly on weekends. Additionally, ensure the removal of the extra $60 nightly charge for incidentals.
The handmade Orangina is a delightful treat, surpassing the bottled version in taste. The croissant sandwiches are simply exceptional.
Fantastic food, especially the milkshakes, ice cream, Chicago dogs, and cheese fries. It's always a satisfying experience at an affordable price. Highly recommended!
The food is excellent, with exceptional service from servers like Jamie White. However, the absence of Bud Light on tap is a major downside.

The food at this place is top-notch, earning it a five-star rating. The atmosphere may lack a bit, but the delicious dinners made up for it. The Chicken Tikka and Malai Kofta were both loved, and the prices were reasonable. Already planning a return trip.

I have been a loyal customer at this hotel/casino for a year now and recently had my 5th visit. As a player card member, I receive regular free or discounted room offers, which I love. The hotel is very nice and I have never had a bad experience. I appreciate the convenience of checking in online and using the express kiosk to avoid long lines. The rooms are always clean, comfortable, and offer nice views of the pool. The pool itself is relaxing and never too crowded. Although the spa is nice, it is a bit pricey. I haven't had great experiences at the restaurants I've tried so far, but I'm looking forward to trying the steakhouse and Chi. The slots are usually not crowded, allowing me to enjoy my favorite machines without delays. Overall, I enjoy visiting and will continue to return as long as I receive great offers.

I had a mouthwatering bagel sandwich this morning - pork roll, egg and cheese on an everything bagel. Reasonably priced at $4.23 and freshly made on site. However, the limited staff seems overwhelmed by the crowd.

The restaurant's set tasting menu on Sundays is disappointing as they serve the same portion size to both solo diners and multiple parties. While the food was delicious, the lack of consideration for individual servings and the business approach made the experience unacceptable. Not recommended for a return visit.

I highly recommend this place for anyone interested in baking or cooking. Attended a pizza making class and had an amazing time. Learned valuable techniques from the knowledgeable instructor, John from Ornesto. Met wonderful people and truly enjoyed the experience. This place is like Disneyland for bakers, chefs, and aspiring chefs. Already booked another class and bought some great products. It may be a bit hard to find due to dim lighting, but it's worth the search. Check it out!
I highly recommend this place! Amazing vegetarian and organic menu, staff are friendly and helpful, and the coffee is delicious. I will definitely be returning.
Absolutely love this place! The veggie burger is hands down the best in town with its handmade patty. And those pretzel buns? Wow, yum!

Ploy Thai exceeded my expectations for lunch. Despite my disappointment with Tampa's food scene after moving from Los Angeles, this place earned a well-deserved 4-star rating. The flavors were incredible and the ingredients exceptionally fresh. Highly recommend!

The crust was dry and the Delmar pizza lacked enough BBQ sauce, resulting in a dry taste. However, the server provided good service. Disappointingly, the pizza took an excessively long time to be served, leaving us waiting after finishing our salads.
Great food and coffee, but the long wait in line for the one cashier needs improvement. Adding another cashier is necessary to avoid frustrating customers and potential downfall.

Peppermill excels in service and accommodations, surpassing all expectations. The gaming experience, particularly on the $1 or 25 cent slots, yields favorable results. Having spent a significant amount of time and money here, I can confidently say that Peppermill is Reno's finest. Their food is exceptional, and the prices are reasonable.

Terribly disappointed with the overpriced and underwhelming experience. The sausage/egg/cheese sandwich was cold and significantly smaller than depicted. Presentation on large plates was just embarrassing. The bacon/egg/cheese sandwich on brioche was equally disappointing with a cold egg and excessive greasiness. Comparable food can be found at McDonald's for a fraction of the price.

I initially had a good experience at Music City Optical, but things went downhill when they switched my contact brand without proper explanation. I experienced pain, redness, and irritation, and when I reached out to them, they were unresponsive. Eventually, I managed to get my contacts switched back, but later found out that my eye irritation was due to not giving my eyes enough time to heal. When I posted a review on Facebook, they accused me of slander and lying, which was not accurate.

I recently visited the Italian Centre for a quick lunch and pastries. The Mossimo pizza was amazing - fresh toppings, bubbly cheese, and a thin, perfectly baked crust. It was a steal at just $14 and big enough to share. The Cream Horns were pricy but absolutely delicious - fresh, creamy, and flakey. I recommend enjoying a coffee beverage and pastry while shopping - the perfect treat.

I am deeply disappointed with the decline in service at my usual nail salon. The front desk staff showed minimal interest, failed to prioritize customers, and lacked professionalism. I experienced delays, cold water, and subpar service during my pedicure. Additionally, the prices have increased without any added value. Despite the convenient hours, I have decided not to return due to repeated negative experiences and staff turnover.
Boulevard Pizza is our top choice in Sparks/Reno. Despite its outdated decor, the mouthwatering pizza they serve makes up for it. The added bonus of fun arcade games for kids is a definite plus.
This coffee shop is simply the best I've ever been to. Their drinks, both iced and hot, are incredible. The only downside is the long line, but the efficient and friendly staff make up for it.
The donuts at this place were amazing! I tried the plain glazed and the lemon filled one, and both were incredible. If I ever come back to Indy, I would definitely visit again.
The food at this place is amazing, especially their jumbo wings on Wednesdays for only $1. The Dirty Lemonade is a must-try drink. Don't miss out if you're in Indianapolis!

Don't judge this hole-in-the-wall spot by its appearance; it's a hidden gem. The food is absolutely fantastic. Their gyros, fish, and chicken are prepared and seasoned to perfection. Don't forget to save room for dessert – it's a must-try.
Fantastic first day! The place was packed, but impressively well-organized. My family and I had a great time and we'll definitely be returning multiple times a week. Thank you for coming to Reno!

I absolutely love Baguette Deli! Their BBQ pork sandwiches are amazing, and the staff is incredibly friendly. This was my first experience with Vietnamese cuisine, and I can't wait to try more. The bubble tea is delicious, and I'm glad to have another place in town to get it. The fresh rolls are just as good as sit-down Thai restaurants, and I appreciate that they will add extra jalapenos without charging extra. Definitely try Baguette Deli - they're simply excellent!
I highly recommend this place for their amazing brisket tacos and brisket quesadillas. The happy hour starting at 3 is a great option for a late lunch with 2-for-1 drinks.

Xtreme Tacos is my go-to place for delicious food and amazing service. I've ordered from them multiple times, and everything has been consistently delicious. The homemade chips are simply outstanding and must-have. The salsa and queso are perfect for dipping. In addition to the amazing food, the staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, especially the guy at the counter. Highly recommended!

I recently moved downtown and have been on the search for the best services in each category. As a woman, trust is important to me, especially when it comes to auto service. I highly recommend Cabrillo Union 76 for their quality service, repair, and smog checks. Thank you, Ray and the staff, for a job well done. Sincerely, Cheyenne.

Great location for hungry tourists with an edgy yet chill atmosphere. Ahi fish tacos with avocado relish sounded amazing. Popular spot with a good selection of local microbrews. Tacos arrived in premade shells, which made me hesitant, but the fish flavor was excellent. Limited avocado but tasty sauce. The brunch menu looks promising as well.
Incredible breakfast pizza, bottomless mimosas and bloody marys, with exceptional service! Rare to find such an amazing experience these days.

I highly recommend Bing's boba in Tucson for their amazing Taro snow and overall great experience. The place is clean, offers board games, and has a helpful and friendly staff. They even replaced a drink for my husband when it didn't meet his flavor preference. Best boba spot in town!

I highly recommend Venus Nail! I discovered them through a Google search and have been there three times already. The salon has a wonderful atmosphere and provides excellent service. Ivy, in particular, is fantastic! When I mentioned my upcoming birthday trip, she came up with an amazing nail design that I absolutely loved.

This hidden gem in an unexpected location exceeded my expectations for an Indian restaurant. The peach chutney with Naan was divine, and the Lamb Korma had just the right amount of spice. The ambiance and friendly staff added to the overall delightful experience. Despite the distance, I would highly recommend making the drive to this authentic and impressive establishment.

Greko is a must-try! I had an amazing experience trying their rotisserie chicken pita and fries for lunch, and I loved it so much that I went back for dinner and lunch the next day. The Horta Greens salad and Athenian Chicken are also highly recommended. This casual restaurant truly focuses on providing great food.

Brother Rabbit at Compere Lapin is a fantastic addition to the New Orleans food scene. From the refreshing house cider to the phenomenal Oban 18, the drinks are top-notch. The house biscuits and butter are simply divine, a must-try. While the crispy chicken skins lacked flavor, the rest of the first course menu, including the daily oysters and marinated shrimp with jalapeño jus, were delicious and fresh. Lastly, the dobeger cake with lemon curd and chocolate ice cream topped with a heavenly chocolate sauce is a perfect ending. Whether you're with a group or on a date night, Brother Rabbit is a great choice.

Overall, I would not recommend Imo's for their St. Louis Style pizza. The cheese tasted different and the pizza wasn't cut all the way through, making it difficult to separate each slice. However, the toasted ravioli was outstanding, despite the watery sauce. Next time, I would only order the ravioli.
Mazzaros: Unbeatable authentic Italian cuisine! Their sauce and meatballs are simply divine.

The Mandarin is a trendy dance club that offers a variety of cocktails and beers. The door charge for guys on certain nights is common in the industry. The enclosed patio is spacious even during winter. The music is hit-or-miss, ranging from enjoyable hip-hop and pop to un-danceable tunes. Talking inside is difficult due to the loud music. If you're in the CWE and in the mood for dancing, the Mandarin is worth a try.

Great spot on Frenchmen! Managed to grab a corner table just in time and enjoyed the wonderful piano tunes. The food was delicious - loved the pork pot stickers and smoked hanger steak. The lobster eggrolls exceeded expectations. Good selection of drinks and great happy hour deals. The fusion of Asian and French cuisine is a nice touch. We'll be back for sure!

The overall dining experience was average due to okay food quality. However, the restaurant felt overcrowded with too many tables and limited space, leading to a rushed atmosphere. We frequently experienced disruptions from other servers and customers bumping into our chairs.

Terrible experience at a crappy restaurant with awful service and a rude waiter. Avoid at all costs! Instead, highly recommend La Baia on 17th and Lombard if you're looking for a fantastic BYO Italian restaurant.

The new Randall's in West County is a welcome addition. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The beer selection is impressive, offering a wide range of styles. Prices are competitive, making it a worthwhile shopping experience.

Deseree is the ultimate hairstylist who has been perfecting my hair for 10+ years. She's a versatile expert, transforming me from blonde to brunette and handling all lengths flawlessly. I trust her exclusively, especially for my wedding where she'll style not just me but also 6 bridesmaids. I have complete confidence in her ability to make us all look picture perfect. Deseree is not just accommodating, dependable, and experienced, but also incredibly hilarious.

The service at Sockeye Grill was terrible, with slow service and tasteless salads. However, the salmon was excellent and the waitress was knowledgeable about beer. The finger steaks were mushy and the atmosphere was more like a warehouse than a restaurant, with depressing news on the TVs. Overall, the restaurant needs improvement and we won't be returning.

We had a fantastic dinner on St. Patrick's day for my sister's birthday. The server and bartender were incredibly kind and accommodating. The food, including tri-tip, pulled pork, and rotisserie chicken, was all delicious, except for the veggie burrito which was disappointing (but who orders a veggie burrito at a rotisserie grill?). The prices were reasonable, portions were good, and the service was top-notch. We will definitely return, except for the vegetarian in our group.

Anders Osborne's performance at this venue was a true highlight of my NOLA trip. Despite heading straight to Bourbon Street afterwards, I regret not staying longer. The enticing smell of the food, affordable drinks, and laid-back crowd added to the overall experience.

Despite being highly recommended by native Philadelphians, my experience at Ralph's Italian restaurant was quite underwhelming. The grilled calamari appetizer was drenched in a salty red sauce, overpowering the flavor of the calamari itself. The pasta bolognese with filet mignon tips was mediocre, with another overly salty red sauce and average quality beef. The black lobster ravioli was decent but also excessively salty. Considering the restaurant's reputation as the oldest Italian restaurant in the country, our expectations were not met.
MCLifeTucson: A breathtaking escape in the Catalina Mountains. Perfect for running or hiking, this high desert oasis mesmerizes with its natural beauty. We can't get enough of the canyon!

The beer service at this burger joint with a large craft beer selection was lackluster. The first beer I ordered had an off flavor, but when I tried another similar dark beer, it was fine. The bartender didn't bother to investigate the off flavor, suggesting a lack of beer knowledge. Additionally, they served beers in inferior glassware and kept the shaker pints too cold. The overall beer knowledge here was not up to par.
I absolutely love Orangetheory! It's hands down the best full body workout I've ever done. With a great variety of classes, it's always convenient for me to find a session that fits my schedule.
The tour was fantastic! Raymond, our guide, was incredibly knowledgeable and made the experience enjoyable. The food stops were delicious. Definitely worth the time and money.
Rons remains a consistent favorite of mine. Great craft beer selection, particularly impressive this week. The food is enjoyable, as long as you choose wisely from the menu.

The freshly made donuts at this place are amazing! I had to wait a bit for them to cool down, but it was worth it. The clean and not overcrowded location is a great addition to the neighborhood. Plus, they have a parking lot, which is a bonus. Definitely the best donuts in Philly and the Delaware Valley.

This Econo Lodge was a disappointing experience. The rooms were dirty and the staff seemed unwilling to acknowledge or address the issue. The manager was unhelpful and sarcastic. Additionally, the lack of cleanliness in the room was evident, as they only checked the microwave and fridge without cleaning anything else. I would not recommend staying at this Econo Lodge as it does not meet basic standards of cleanliness. Opt for a reputable hotel brand like Marriott, Starwood, or Hilton where customer satisfaction is a priority.

Cafe Soleil exceeded my high expectations for authentic French pastries. The croissants were buttery, flaky, and better than some I've had in France. Nico, the French baker, brings a noticeable difference in taste to the food. While the distance is a drawback, I will definitely be returning to satisfy my sweet tooth. Highly recommended bakery.

This neighborhood BYOB place is a hidden gem. Excellent food, welcoming service, and reasonable prices make it stand out. The menu offers a variety of delicious Italian dishes, both traditional and unique. The specials are always a good choice. The atmosphere is friendly and the staff makes you feel like a regular. Conveniently located near sports venues and accessible by public transportation. Make sure to make a reservation as it can get busy. Overall, a must-try if you're in the area.
Todd Cobell's work is fantastic - you can never go wrong with it!

We are frequent patrons who love the super fun bar, TVs, and music at this establishment. The service is excellent, with hard-working and polite staff creating a cool atmosphere. The seafood is always fresh and delicious, while the pizza is the best in South Jersey. The thin and crispy crust, with a nice chew and great flavor, makes it the best pizza we've ever had. We recently tried a dinner special, a chicken cutlet in a lobster, white truffle oil, light cream sauce with asparagus, shallots, and sundried tomatoes over angel hair pasta. It was delicately seasoned and generously portioned, and we enjoyed it so much that we want to order it again. The bartenders, Selena, Jayna, and Chris, are pleasant and professional, making it an enjoyable place to go. Overall, it's a fabulous place to have a good time.

Despina at EWC is a true waxing godsend! She is quick, friendly, and professional, leaving you feeling fresh and satisfied. The waxing experience with her surpasses any strip junk; it's simply excellent. Despina's expertise extends to making eyebrows on fleek, and her attentive listening skills enhance the overall experience. Thanks to Despina, I actually enjoy my waxing appointments. She is truly the best in the biz!

Mixed feelings. The driver was incredibly friendly, and the pizza tasted great. However, it arrived barely warm, which has now happened twice. Hoping they'll address this issue soon, but I'll be exploring other options for now.

Impeccable food and service at Sbraga! The chefs counter 6 course with wine pairings was worth the price. The front row view of the deliciousness being prepared was amazing. The talented team ran like a well-oiled machine. Highlights include the Gruyere popover with foie gras soup, saffron spaghetti with blue crab, crispy Arctic char, and even the chicken liver mousse (surprisingly delicious). The wines were perfectly matched. Special birthday celebrations were made extra memorable with a note from Sbraga and a thoughtful goodie bag. Already looking forward to a return visit!

If you're looking for unique and delicious options, I highly recommend GlobalQ. Their quesadillas and wraps range from good to phenomenal, with some pretty unique combinations. Portions are generous, and I usually have leftovers. Try the 'Montreal' or 'New Orleans' wraps for something different. Don't miss out on the secret menu 'French Dip' quesadilla. The best part is that they offer delivery.
Wendy's has drastically improved - their new sea salt fries are a revelation. Exceptional quality for fast food, a game-changer. I rarely rate fast food, but this deserves recognition.

Recently, I dined here twice and was extremely dissatisfied. The service was lacking and the food failed to impress, which was quite disappointing considering our previous enjoyable experiences. Regrettably, I don't think I will be returning, as this restaurant is no longer worth the expense.

I was disappointed with my recent visit to this DSW location. Compared to the Marlton store, I found fewer shoe options and lower quality in the clearance section. The new layout made it feel like a warehouse, which was not the experience I expected. The lack of assistance and attention from staff was also frustrating.

That BBQ Place may have neat ambiance and friendly service, but its overpriced menu, lack of cutlery and table service, and moist ribs with no bark were disappointing. While Sherwood Park locals seem to enjoy it, I won't be returning.

The store is severely understaffed, resulting in lengthy wait times at checkout, sometimes up to 25 minutes. It is advisable to avoid this store if possible. While the workers are pleasant, it seems that the understaffing may be intentional to enhance profit margins.

Stopped by Mel's for lunch and had the amazing turkey club sandwich. Cook/waiter was friendly and served it with a smile. Packed with fresh turkey on tasty multi-grain toast. Saw the next day's pork roast - heavenly. Excited to return for pork sandwich and breakfast.
The tacos and tortas are amazing, and the service is quick. This place offers authentic Mexican fare, and they also have a variety of delicious baked goods.

We had an amazing honeymoon at the Monteleone in New Orleans. The beautiful decor, attentive staff, and convenient location made it the perfect choice for exploring the city. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi tub added to the incredible experience. Can't wait to return!

The dining room needs improvement, but the salad was good. However, the bread portion was insufficient. Disappointed that sweet tea was not available. Noticed a booth with unsupervised children for quite some time, one of them sleeping. Eventually, an employee attended to them, possibly bringing them to work. Concerned for their safety as they were small and alone.
Outstanding dining experience! Great ambiance, exceptional service, and delicious food. Perfect for celebrating special occasions.

I walked into Blaze at 9pm only to be told they were closed, despite their stated hours online and on the door. Disappointed with my first experience at this new pizzeria. A simple explanation for the time change would have been appreciated.

Dr. Dayley is the best dentist I've ever been to! I used to have a lot of anxiety about dental work due to a traumatic experience in the past, but Dr. Dayley is extremely personable and helps calm my nerves. He removed all four of my wisdom teeth and I completely trust him with my dental care. I highly recommend him to everyone I know, and my entire family also sees him. The front desk and staff are welcoming and sweet. Thank you for being the best dentist office!

I was thrilled to discover P.F. Chang's fast food restaurant, but the atmosphere was different and more like regular fast food. Despite that, the efficient order system and quick service impressed me. The food tasted amazing for its speedy preparation and affordable price. I highly recommend giving it a try.

I absolutely recommend this place for blow outs! The talented staff, convenient online booking, and friendly service make it top-notch. I personally love Krissy and Bianca, but everyone is great. Don't forget to try the vital shot, it's a game-changer for conditioning blondes like me and lasts about a week!

I'm very disappointed with the food from this restaurant. The presentation was good and the delivery was prompt, but everything else fell short. The sushi was mushy and warm due to being packed with hot food, and the rainbow roll had avocado instead of raw fish. The calamari was undercooked and had breading falling off, so I couldn't eat it. The chicken lettuce wraps were also not as described on the menu. I won't be ordering from here again. I'll stick to Niji's on 5th.
The bartender's service was incredibly disappointing, catering mainly to regular customers. Despite being ready to order with money in hand, I was neglected. Frustrating experience overall.

I had a post-show snack at Normand's Bistro and overall, it was a decent option. The menu seemed a bit overpriced, especially for the Caesar salad with three 'jumbo' shrimp. However, the flavors were good and the ingredients were fresh. My friend enjoyed her soup and smoked salmon Carpaccio. The restaurant also had interesting beers on the menu. If you're in the area and looking for a drink or snack after a show, this place is worth considering. They had a variety of appetizers and desserts to suit different tastes.
I had a fantastic experience at the store! The managers, especially Tonya, were incredibly helpful and resolved our shirt exchange issue with ease. Highly recommend!

I love this place! Great variety of toys and always try to visit during sales. Pets are welcome and the staff is caring and friendly. Great answers to my questions and it feels like a neighborhood pet store despite being a chain.

I rate it two stars due to excellent service and friendly staff. However, the food was subpar, possibly due to a bad day. My order from the German section turned out to be just a pretzel and a piece of sausage in a box, disappointing overall.

I've been a long-time fan of Charlie's and returned recently due to jean troubles. The attentive girl who assisted me was fantastic, offering an array of options and explaining the various fits and washes patiently. Ultimately, I bought two pairs of Sebastian McCalls, which are both cute and comfortable. Love this place!
Went on Senior Discount Day, disappointed by lack of cleaning and poor customer service. Dirt smudges on the car, incomplete vacuuming, and unhelpful manager. Would not recommend.

I had the seafood combo-catfish, red beans and rice, and coleslaw at this place and it was pretty damn good. The real reason we went in was the happy hour deal: 2 for 1 from 4pm-7pm, Mon-Sat. I ordered a margarita, being from California I have high standards, it wasn't bad but the food made up for it!

I have been to this place many times and every experience has been great. My husband and I used to go there almost weekly after working on our house. The place is always clean, they never rush through the session, and they focus on problem areas. Felicia is amazing and highly recommended. I recently had a therapeutic massage with her for my neck pain and it was truly incredible. She is extremely talented.

The Sunrise Family Restaurant offers a cozy, small-town vibe and the service is prompt and friendly. However, the recommended Monte Cristo sandwich was disappointing - microwaved turkey and ham with limp french toast. The salad and fries were tasty though, especially the perfectly cooked thick steak fries. Despite the sandwich, I believe there may be great options on the menu, particularly for breakfast. I plan to give it another shot.

First time at Butcher & Bee for lunch with my husband and co-workers. The place has a cute farmhouse feel and offers a bit of privacy with its booths. Despite being a bit tight for a group of 7, we were seated right away. I tried the pork belly gnocchi, which was good but lacked texture. It would've been better if the pork belly was crispy. My husband was disappointed with the trout sandwich, as it resembled a tuna salad. We enjoyed the coconut macaroons for dessert, but the co-workers had mixed reviews. One person liked the KFC sandwich. We'll definitely give this place another try. The use of books as bill holders is cute too!

This event is a blast for beer enthusiasts, with a great variety of affordable sample drinks. However, the food is overpriced. Buying favorite brews on-site is convenient, with special offers from the liquor store. VIP experience isn't worth it, unless you really value the glass mug. The venue's parking fees and on-site ticket purchases can make it costly.

Kiwi Nail is an unprofessional salon that prioritizes shortcuts over quality. The shabby job on my French tip fill was made worse when the nail tech tried to fix it by painting over the mess and applying excessive varnish. Additionally, the inability to tip by card and being forced to pay cash was inconvenient and unprofessional. I will not be returning and recommend others to avoid this place.
Chick fil A sets itself apart from typical fast food with exceptionally high-quality food that doesn't feel laden with fillers. Highly recommend even for non-fast food enthusiasts!

Square 1682 is an upscale hotel bar that I frequent for lunch, brunch, dinner, and happy hour. The food is great, service is excellent, and the space is upscale. It always attracts a nice group of people, whether they are staying at the hotel or live/work in the area. But the best part is the bartender, Dan, who works on Mondays. He is my favorite bartender in the city and always knows exactly what I want. I even walk by if he's not working. Love him and have made many wonderful memories at this establishment.

This place is a must-try. We come here often and are always satisfied. Arriving early is recommended to avoid waiting. They offer a good selection of coffees, including French press. The menu is not overwhelming, making it easy to decide quickly. The food arrives in a reasonable time and is consistently fresh. The friendly staff adds to the positive experience. I highly recommend the Wilburt skillet – it's amazing. You'll leave feeling full and with a smile on your face.

I gave this place multiple chances, but unfortunately, the service was consistently disappointing. The first wax was with Despina who was uncommunicative and missed chunks of hair. The second wax with Amy Jo was friendlier, but still sloppy, leaving a significant amount of hair. The timing was also rushed, with the appointment lasting only 8 minutes. Considering the price, I expected much better. The staff at the front desk were rude and unhelpful, and asking about tipping was uncomfortable. I'll have to continue my search for a decent Brazilian wax in Philly.
Amazing atmosphere, unique flavors, and a must-try Cuban Lamb Frita (add the egg!). Delicious side dishes with friendly and efficient staff. My new favorite brunch spot!
This place has its ups and downs. Small portions for high prices, but cheap drinks and excellent service. The piano adds a nice touch. However, the cheesecake is absolutely incredible - a must-try!

If you manage to beat the crowd, you're in for a treat. The only downside is the small size. However, everything on the menu is simply amazing, including their options for vegetarians and vegans. I highly recommend trying their French toast specials. This place is a must-visit for breakfast before heading to the Mardi Gras parades.

Butch did an excellent job on the tour - it was both relaxing and informative. The two stops to eat and see the cemetery were great additions. I highly recommend going on this trip at the beginning of your stay as it helps you know where to go during your trip. Butch was also a lot of fun!

This food truck is a hidden gem with delicious and unique street food options. The captain crunch tilapia burrito is a surprisingly tasty combination of flakey fish, fresh veggies, and flavorful Sriracha mayo. The katsu and curry chicken are also flavorful and rich. And don't miss their refreshing Thai tea. Despite being a small food truck, they offer a wide variety of options. The friendly service and affordable prices make it worth the drive if you're in Jersey.

I had a terrible day with a migraine and sinus infection, but Massage Envy came to the rescue. They fit me and my father in for massages, provided great service, and even taught me some techniques to try at home. The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was calming, and the membership program is worth it. I already feel so much better and will be going back for a longer session next month. Recommended!

This place offers the best roast chicken I've ever tried. The chicken itself is moist and crispy with a nice smoky flavor. The aroma is hypnotizing and makes your mouth water. The double chicken family meal is perfect for a family of four, with ample portions of chicken, fries, and cole slaw. The dipping sauces, particularly the mustard-based one with a chipotle flair, are delicious. The wedge fries are filling and there are plenty to go around. The portion size was so big that we had leftovers. The service is excellent, and the owners are friendly. I would choose this place over Popeyes or KFC due to the generous portions, healthier options, and better service. I will definitely be returning because I know I'll be craving their delicious chicken.

I highly recommend this place for those looking for a taste of Japanese cuisine without the focus on sushi. Their rice bowls and tempura are delicious, and the restaurant is rarely crowded. They also offer catering services for sushi and maki platters. The service is quick and the place is great for a fast lunch or dinner when you're in a hurry.

Highly satisfied with my experience at this dentist in Westchase. Convenient location, friendly staff, and both Dr. Creech-Gionis and Dr. Stern are exceptional. Going to the dentist is now less painful, and I'm 100% satisfied.

Amigos on our 40th anniversary was disappointing. Lacked atmosphere, mediocre food, and high prices. Overrated salsa and average chips. Prefer the taco trucks or Gloria's despite its cleanliness issues. $47.00, drinks, and tip. Desperately seeking decent Mexican fare in Boise.

Heather's service as a waitress and bartender was exceptional. The food, especially the tenderloin sliders with french fries, was divine. I will definitely be a regular customer of this place. Highly recommend trying it out.

The bouncers at this place are terrible, but given their height and rage-filled past, it's not surprising. This establishment epitomizes everything Reno should not be. Choose LEX only if your only other option is enduring waterboarding on Thanksgiving.

This place is a must-visit for sandwich lovers on the beach! The gourmet servings and friendly service make it stand out from the rest. The shrimp tacos were cooked perfectly and the Kiwi sauce added a delightful twist. The only downside is the limited seating options. Overall, it's a local favorite with 5-star food!

Stunning and contemporary venue with a lovely view, only drawback being its proximity to the train tracks, where slight noise can be heard. Overall, it's a fantastic spot and even boasts a yolk on the nearby corner.

I went in for a full set and requested long nails like the picture. Although my nails were cut short, I didn't mind. However, when I pointed out a crooked nail, I was told it hadn't been filed properly and acrylic was applied on it still crooked. The nail was eventually filed, but it kept getting shorter and shorter. Despite previous visits, this experience will be my last.
Highly recommend going on a Tuesday for their 1/2 price tapas and $5 Sangria/margaritas. Fried Manchego, Hot Cauliflower, and Camarones were outstanding. Unique and flavorful experience overall!
The live Jazz music at this place is simply amazing. With no alcohol or food distractions, it truly celebrates the soul of NOLA city culture. At $15, the tickets offer exceptional value.
This mall offers a quiet and crowd-free shopping experience.

After a long day at the convention center, we had dinner at H & I. We were seated in a quieter area and received attentive and professional service. The recommended aged ribeye steak was one of the best we've had, perfectly cooked medium rare. We split the 18-ounce steak and it was more than enough for both of us. The signature shrimp cocktail and iceberg lettuce wedge with crumbled bacon were also delicious. The only disappointment was the limited choice of medium-priced wines, which slowed down our selection process. Overall, I would rate H & I 4.5 stars if possible.

This Italian restaurant was a huge disappointment. The service was slow and forgetful, the lemonade was too tart, and the garlic bread wasn't fresh. The stuffed shells and chicken parmesan were bland and poorly cooked. The only redeeming dish was the salmon. Overall, I regretted spending $50 here and would have preferred going to Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill. I recommend trying Contessa for authentic Italian cuisine instead. Caruso, we won't be returning.

Despite my initial hesitation, I was pleasantly surprised by this strip mall bar. My friend John, who works here, highly recommended it and I'm glad we gave it a chance. The food was delicious, especially looking forward to trying their pizza next time. Additionally, their newly added craft bar is impressive and the prices are quite reasonable.
The Buffalo chicken salad was amazing! Fresh and crispy greens, delicious chicken, and a perfect blue cheese dressing. Will definitely be returning for this salad.

I was highly impressed by the French-German dishes at Luke Restaurant in New Orleans. The historic vibe of the former Masonic Temple Building added to the overall experience. Although we initially faced a slight inconvenience due to the reservation policy, our server made up for it with excellent service. The cocktails were flavorful, the Crawfish Bisque had a sour aftertaste, the Luke Burger was outstanding, and the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp dish was loved by my friend. The Moules et Frites had bold flavors, and the Bread Pudding and Bourbon Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee for dessert were delicious. Overall, it was a memorable dining experience.

The dental clinic impressed with its TVs in the exam rooms, but it turns out they're more of a pricey perk than a useful distraction during dental work. The dental work done was of good quality, but the price was high and it's uncertain if it was truly necessary.

Yesterday was my first visit to Paris Parker and I had a great experience! I usually rely on recommendations when choosing a stylist, but I needed to find someone quickly near my home. I was assigned to Stacey for a full highlight appointment and she did an amazing job. She eliminated all the brassy tones from my hair and made my blonde look natural and vibrant. I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't have to go back multiple times to get the color right - Stacey nailed it on the first try. She was also a pleasure to talk to, which made the hours in the chair fly by. I highly recommend Stacey, although I might regret it if she gets too busy.

I absolutely love the wide selection of ready-made teas at this place! While loose tea can be pricey, the option to mix my own concoction is worth it. The staff is incredibly friendly and always remembers my preferences. Perfect experience every time!

GRI provided an exceptional experience in finding a one-of-a-kind engagement ring. From the knowledgeable and attentive staff to the custom design options, GRI exceeded our expectations. The final product was stunning and the overall experience was relaxed and pleasant. Highly recommended!

Love this place for cocktails! Prices are a bit steep, but the unique glassware and designs are worth it. The Dragon's Tear and Blackmail are delicious, and my friends loved them too. Laid-back ambiance with great music and quirky decor. Not a fan of the food, but I'll be back for drinks.

Pizzaville exceeded my expectations! The prices are a bit high, but the quality of the food is outstanding. The pizza had a perfect crust, with crunchy ends and a slightly chewy middle. The generous amount of mushrooms and extra sauce added to the deliciousness. The "breadsticks" were actually garlic bread strips, so buttery and garlicy that I couldn't stop myself from finishing the whole order. The employees were friendly and the store was clean. I can't wait to go back and try their lunch buffet.
The service was good, staff polite, but the food lacked flavor. Drinks were average. Suitable for a quick lunch.

I enjoyed the modern and cozy ambiance with appropriate lighting for dinner. The waiter seemed impatient and rushed, not fully focused on providing a great experience. The Shrimp Breaux Bridge and Balsamic Salmon were tasty, but not extraordinary. The Pesto Crusted Idaho Trout was well-cooked and flavored. The Zangria White lacked advertised fruits, which was disappointing. Despite the shortcomings, I would give the place another chance due to the positive reputation of the menu and hopeful better service.

The burgers at this spin-off from Rouge are better than their flagship restaurants. The option to edit toppings on the placard is convenient, and the Kobe Beef burger is worth the extra cost. The brioche bun adds to the overall experience. The truffle oil fries are a must-try and being open late on weekends is a bonus.
I recently tried this place and unfortunately, the pizza was quite disappointing. The previous establishment I visited had much better quality, offering delicious homemade food.
Had an awesome lunch at this place. The jalapeno burger was fantastic and the patio had a great vibe. Will definitely return.

Review:
I highly recommend this hotel in Reno. It is absolutely stunning and I always choose to stay here when I visit. The Spa is fantastic, with friendly staff and clean pools. The rooms are clean and well-organized. The front desk staff is also very helpful and accommodating. There is a 24-hour diner on-site that serves good food, although it can be a bit pricey, as expected for a casino. The only downsides are the lack of bathroom fans causing a steamy shower experience and a missing creamer with room service coffee. Overall, it's a great hotel with amazing amenities.

The tour was interesting, the beer was good, and the atmosphere was the best part. They have TVs for sports, board games, live music, and tours every hour. It can get busy, but everything flowed well. A great spot for a fun time with friends or a date.
This place is absolutely awful. From the horrendous service and unappetizing food to the disgustingly dirty environment, I highly doubt I'll escape without getting food poisoning. Stay away.

This wine and liquor store is my top choice in Nashville. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and won't judge you for asking about affordable options. The selection and prices are great, but be cautious when pulling in due to a high curb.

I highly recommend Circle of Friends daycare. Linda and the staff have been incredibly helpful and my kids have thrived both emotionally and academically. The low turnover rate is a plus and my children have learned fascinating facts that even surprised me. Despite a few behavioral issues with other children, I am overall happy and content with this daycare.
The new location on Central is fantastic! The staff is great, and the atmosphere is wonderful. They seem to have found a place where they will thrive.

Location and service were great, creating an authentic Ethiopian dining experience. Unfortunately, the food fell short in terms of flavor and taste compared to other Ethiopian restaurants we've tried. Overall, it's a decent restaurant, but nothing exceptional. 6/10.
First time here and not disappointed. Amazing seafood seasoning. Ordered oysters, $45 combo, and garlic chicken wings for family of six - more than enough for us. Only complaint is order mix-up.
Ordered 1/2 chicken, rice, and plantains to go for lunch. Chicken was salty, only got 2 pieces of plantains, and paid $8. Disappointed. Will reconsider ordering from here again.

Initially, the take-out Chinese restaurant was average, neither exceptional nor disappointing. However, upon a recent visit, they impressed us with flawless delivery and outstanding food. The rating has now improved to 5 stars.

The Rib Cook-Off is a must-visit event! Taking the bus is convenient and affordable, and Great Basin's large beers are worth it. The JA Nugget mobile app helps you find vendors easily. Bring cash and explore non-rib vendors for great finds. Monday is less crowded, with cheap food deals after 5:00 pm.

This restaurant offers excellent food and a bustling bar atmosphere. However, the service was slow and somewhat inattentive. The menu is partially in French, which may be confusing for non-French speakers or tourists. Overall, a good dining experience but not compelling enough to warrant a return visit.

This place is a must-visit! I had the amazing chocolate chip pancakes and the line was manageable. However, the sausage side dish wasn't remarkable. The efficient payment system helps keep the line moving quickly. To avoid waiting, go early in the morning or around 7:15.

The Sunday brunch buffet was incredibly satisfying with a wide variety of options, including seafood, omelet and pasta stations, custom sushi rolls, and delicious desserts. The bottomless mimosas were generously poured and led to a fun and tipsy experience. The a la carte menu offered additional savory dishes, and the cozy ambiance made up for the lack of a view. Despite the price, the indulgence is worth it if you enjoy overeating and overdrinking.

Stopped in Santa Barbara for some fish tacos last Tuesday and tried the #2 ranked place for Baja fish tacos. Pleasantly surprised by how delicious they were. The kitchen accommodated our request for shrimp tacos on the side with a generous portion of battered shrimp. Sat outside on the veranda, enjoying the yummy food and lovely December weather. Friendly staff. Will definitely be back next time in town.

Overall, On the Border in Mount Laurel offers delicious chips and salsa, good beer specials, and a variety of vegetarian sides. The cheese enchiladas are particularly tasty. Dining service is usually great, although the bartenders can be hit-or-miss. While some, like Joann, provide friendly and attentive service, others, like Nikki, offer poor service with long waits and unfriendly demeanor. Despite this inconsistency, the restaurant provides good appetizers, cold beer, reasonable prices, and generally satisfactory service.

This place in St Louis is busy but worth a visit. I loved the amazing peach shake, and my friends enjoyed their food too. The wait was long on a hot day, and the ordering process was a bit confusing, but the prices were reasonable. Overall, it's a great stop if you're in the area.

Delicious cakes, disappointing service. While the desserts were amazing, the service left much to be desired. Long wait time, inefficient packaging, and a barista who didn't understand how to make a simple iced coffee. The cakes were worth it, but the overall experience was not.

The accommodations at the JW were outstanding. Nathan went above and beyond to provide a quiet and private space for me to pump. The facilities were impeccably clean and I was grateful for the kind and supportive staff. Kudos to JW for supporting working moms!

Overall, Joe's offers tasty and reasonably priced food, particularly the beef tacos and meatloaf with mashed potatoes. The salad was also satisfying, with generous amounts of cheese. However, the service was disappointing on both nights, with waitresses lacking knowledge about menu items and being slow to attend to customers. The restaurant itself is visually appealing and the bathrooms are well-maintained. While the menu has a variety of well-crafted options, the inconsistent service from some of the servers prevents a five-star rating.
The food is excellent with a long list of choices. The sandwiches have great meat and the hand-made toasted ravioli is some of the best in town. The people are welcoming.

I recently tried this St. Louis BBQ joint after hearing all the buzz about it. The customer service was excellent, and their homemade BBQ sauce had a perfect balance of sweet, tangy, and spice. However, the pull pork sandwich, beans, and Cole slaw combo might be overwhelming for those unaccustomed to this type of cuisine or excessive intake.

I was disappointed with the chicken salad sandwich as it only contained two small cubes of chicken with mayo. The "salad" accompanying it was simply a bowl of lettuce. This left me hungry and unsatisfied.

Enjoyed a lovely brunch with consistently good food and efficient, courteous service. Sumptuous omelets, fun beverages, and a nice al fresco dining experience on the patio. Budget breakfast option was satisfying, but had to ask for fresh bacon as it had run out. Fish tacos also delicious.

This place is amazing! Even before trying the pancakes, I was already sold. The long line out the front door speaks volumes about how awesome it is. I had a simple breakfast of hashbrowns, eggs, and bacon, but it was absolutely fabulous. The service was excellent too. I will definitely be returning for a sit-down meal. The only downside is that parking is a bit challenging, but that's expected.

I recently ordered from C & B's through Order Up Delivery Svc and had a fantastic winter dinner experience at home. The Swanky Frank with fries was delicious, especially with the seasoned fries as an added touch. The beef chili, which I couldn't resist, came in a well-packaged large bowl and I plan on enjoying it as a late-night snack. The sour cream and crackers on the side were perfect for warming up. I highly recommend using Order Up for a cozy chili experience at home this winter!
Great rich food but a bit pricey. Delicious and ever-changing menu. The most unique donuts around.

The Carriage House Margarita with a brandy twist, all the empanadas, the delicious Red Drum fish dish, and the indulgent Churros are highly recommended at Livery. Don't miss out on these mouthwatering treats!

My son and I were instantly satisfied with the efficient and friendly service at this busy burger place. We enjoyed delicious Highland stouts and a fresh garden salad as starters. The Black and Blue burger with regular fries was incredible, perfectly cooked with a balanced blue cheese flavor. The sweet potato fries were some of the best we've ever had. The burgers were devoured in blissful silence, a sure sign of their excellence. We'll definitely be back.
The BEST donut place ever, wish they shipped their products. Miss it so much since I moved to Florida. Unfortunately, it's only in New Orleans. Sad face!

Katie's is a classic neighborhood restaurant in New Orleans with a touch of Italian-American influence. Their meatballs are outstanding, and you'll encounter plenty of friendly and traditional locals dining early in the evening. Adjust your expectations, and you'll have a satisfying dining experience.
Exceptional service! Quick, friendly, and highly professional staff. My definite choice for oil changes from now on.
As a Latino, I strongly advise avoiding this place. The hairdresser I had was extremely rude and unprofessional.

This place needs a serious makeover like on Restaurant Impossible. The run-down and tacky decor, along with the dark atmosphere, only try to hide its dingy state. We encountered sticky surfaces throughout. My burger, ordered medium, was instead a charred and flavorless hockey puck. The named baked crab soup turned out to be an accurate mispronunciation as it was far from good. Unfortunately, the crab stuffed mushrooms were underwhelming, lacking in crab. On a positive note, the servers were exceptionally friendly.

I absolutely love this place! The owner is friendly, and the service is outstanding. The food here is ridiculously good, especially the huevo rancho and best sandwich. Don't miss out on the amazing grits as well. Make sure to say hi to the owner when you visit, he's wonderful.

I had a perfect happy hour experience at this place! The oysters were absolutely delicious, and my friend and I enjoyed a couple of their fantastic cocktails. We tried the Riverbend and Champagne au Poir, both were tasty. The sides we ordered, fries and grits, were fantastic. In fact, these were the best grits I've ever had! The attentive and friendly server added to the overall amazing experience. I will definitely be returning.

Bella Vista Designs is absolutely fabulous! Their professionalism, innovation, and affordability are unmatched. The team never fails to amaze with their can-do attitude and stunning design. The events I produce at the Santa Barbara Historical Museum and Goleta Valley Historical Society always impress generous donors, leaving them in awe. I am immensely grateful to Bella Vista Designs for their countless successful events and unforgettable moments.
Excellent dental experience in Tucson!

This place is highly overrated with subpar food and terrible service. My order was completely messed up and there were no apologies. With plenty of other options around State Street, I would strongly advise avoiding this place.

I highly recommend this place! The food is excellent, the service is great, and the prices are reasonable. The falafel and beef gyro pita were delicious and fresh. The owner is very kind. The portions are generous and we even got complimentary baklava. This hidden gem in Manayunk deserves to succeed and I'll be referring all my friends. Overall, a unique and satisfying dining experience.
Great food, excellent service! Only minor issue: our entrees arrived a bit too soon after the appetizers. Overall, a great experience.

Overall, this place is mediocre with a lackluster atmosphere. The location is unimpressive, situated in a dirty strip mall alongside Mozzarella Pizza. The interior gives off a careless vibe, as it appears unkempt and falling apart. Although the food is passable and palatable, it is far from outstanding or amazing. While not necessarily a place to avoid, it certainly doesn't offer anything remarkable or exceptional to warrant a strong recommendation.
Phenomenal place to eat! The Hickory burger was amazingly delicious. Definitely coming back for more!

Food had great flavors, unique experience. Server Brian was a passionate foodie. Portions were small and didn't like the interior. Interesting place, but dishes too complicated for frequent visits. Chefs change menu yearly. Owners own successful Red Pony and two other nearby restaurants.

The service at this place has significantly improved since my last visit. I received great service from a staff member named Dillon. The ambiance is casual, where you can simply order and sit while they bring the food to you. The food options are delicious and plentiful, although not fancy. What's great is that everything is very affordable, and a family of four can eat here for around $30, which is an excellent deal in today's pricey market. If you're seeking a quick and casual Asian dining experience, I highly recommend giving this place a try.

Using the Yelp app significantly reduced wait times at this busy breakfast spot. The menu offers a wide variety of options, including delicious cinnamon French toast and a standout strawberry orange juice. While traditional breakfast foods were average, the extra menu options make for exciting future visits. The restaurant could benefit from better cooling, but the service was excellent. Having two payment options at the counter was a convenient touch.

I recently visited Shaving Grace for a haircut and had a great experience. The atmosphere reminded me of my old Barber Shop in Philly: a big TV in the waiting area and a comfortable plush couch. The young lady who checked me in was very friendly and offered me a choice of water, soda, or even a beer. I opted for the latter and was pleased. The haircut itself was excellent, and I enjoyed the lively conversations among the guys discussing current events, sports, and local news. I've definitely found my new spot and will be returning.

The food was excellent, especially the eggs Benedict. The toast was superb and the cream pancakes were the best I've ever tasted. The server, Tina, was awesome and the people here are genuinely nice. Stellar experience!
The food was delicious, with my husband enjoying a cheese and bacon burger while I savored a well-made and flavorful crawfish sausage por bo. Great service overall.
Had a great experience with JT at Ashley Furniture store! He was extremely helpful, especially when I needed to modify my order.

Cucina Zapata at Drexel University offers delicious and unique food options that surpass the typical food truck experience. The graffiti-style truck stands out among the others in the row. I ordered the thai short rib tacos, which were fantastic despite the spicy hot sauce. They were far superior to taco bell. My girlfriend loved her cap'n crunch tilapia burrito. The food's visual appearance was appealing and left us excited to dig in. With great taste and reasonable prices, I highly recommend Cucina Zapata for a satisfying lunch. 5 stars.
