I recently had my first haircut at this salon with Jessie Becker. She skillfully removed my damaged ends and really listened to my requests. Jessie is incredibly sweet and also has a knack for working with kids. I highly recommend visiting this place and asking for her.
This place is a gem! The ramen is excellent, and I'm thrilled to have discovered it. The service and food are exceptional.

This place is undeniably adorable with friendly servers and delicious food. However, I was disappointed by the minuscule portion sizes. As a result, I left feeling unsatisfied. It's disheartening when even neighborly restaurants are stingy with their servings.

Just ate here for the first time and the hype was real. Girlfriend had the Greek Salad, I had the Chickpea Vegetarian Pita with some substitutions. Food was on point, portions were filling and satisfying. Great staff and environment. Will definitely return!

First time here and I was impressed! The bar and restaurant area is fantastic with an open floor plan and lots of TVs for sports viewing. Being attached to their O'Fallon brewery, you can expect great beer choices. Their House Special IPA was excellent, perfectly balanced and not overly bitter. The only drawback is the lack of desserts. Look out for Troy behind the bar! 4 stars.

This neighbourhood dive bar on Whyte Avenue's east side is a lively spot with average decor, a younger crowd, and a couple of pool tables and a foosball table. The drinks are reasonably priced, and there are a few TV screens. The wings are always a good deal, and the servers are young and pleasant. The owner behind the bar is fine. I added an extra star because I felt the previous review was too critical.

I was disappointed with this restaurant located near the Peppermill. It seemed to attract customers from nearby auto repair shops. The Chinese food served here was of low quality and they had trouble getting our order right. Even when we tried a simple dish, it tasted awful.

Overall, despite a small issue with the Yelp coupon, the food at this restaurant was excellent. The chicken caeser salad was delicious and generously topped with chicken. The subs were fresh and flavorful. Additionally, they offer a variety of drink options, including beer and various flavors of Dr. Brown's cream soda. The location is conveniently close to the Wagon Wheel flea market, making it a nice spot to visit.

I highly recommend Dr. Neel and Robin at this optometrist. They were exceptionally helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable. They patiently answered all my questions, assisted with frame selection, and fitted me for contact lenses. Best optometrist I've seen.
Absolutely amazing breakfast with huge pancakes and simple, yet delicious home fries. The owner is incredibly kind and generous. Definitely my new favorite spot.

We had a delightful stay at this beautiful and charming hotel during our family trip to the Big Easy. The staff, from the doorman to the wait staff for brunch, were incredibly friendly and helpful. The Carousel Bar is a must-visit. With its great location, we will definitely be returning next time we're in New Orleans.
The chicken stew was disappointingly tasteless and seemed like leftover fried chicken thrown together in a pot. It left me feeling nauseous, making me regret my choice. Overall, a gross experience.

Wei Hong was a disappointment. Although the takeout service was fast, the empty dining room should have been a warning sign. The steamed dumplings had potential but were ruined by a thick, doughy wrapper. The beef dishes had strange textures and off flavors, prompting us to throw them out. The sauces were gloopy and the fried rice was just average. Overall, we won't be returning to this Chinese restaurant in St Louis.
Cecile was extremely helpful in assisting us with loading plywood ahead of IRMA. Many thanks!

Overall, the food at this restaurant was exceptional. The chicken tagine was cooked to perfection, with succulent and tender meat that easily fell off the bone. The carrot salad was an excellent accompaniment, subtly flavored with refreshing mint and cumin. The service was satisfactory, and the restaurant's cheerful and well-lit interior added to the pleasant dining experience. With a reasonable total cost of around $13, this place is definitely worth a visit.

We were excited to try this place based on positive reviews, but the food was extremely disappointing. The Caesar salad was room temperature and overdressed, hush puppies were flavorless, and undercooked chicken wings were barely warm. Only redeeming item was the chicken and biscuits, but biscuit was cold in spots. Nice atmosphere and friendly service, but subpar food means we won't be coming back.
I had a frustrating experience ordering online, only to arrive and be told they had no record of my order. Extremely disappointing.

If you haven't tried their cream filled donuts, you're missing out on life! These incredible treats made me drive all the way back to get a half dozen for the journey back to Michigan. I devoured every single one without any regrets. Pure heaven!

I strongly advise avoiding Joe Bob's as it seems to prioritize over-serving and catering to gamblers. The kitchen has mold issues and an unpleasant smell, while the staff is only friendly towards big-spending gamblers. Instead, go to El Pollo Loco across the street for cleaner facilities and friendlier staff.

We decided to try this place after Terakawa had a long line, and we are glad we did. The service was excellent, and the staff was friendly. The waitress even helped my wife with her jacket while she was holding our baby. The Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen, Shrimp Katsu Ramen, and Shoyu Ramen were all delicious. The curry soup was flavorful, and the fried chicken and shrimp were cooked perfectly. We also enjoyed the pork buns, although they were not like traditional pork buns. Overall, we had a fantastic experience.

Brew D Licious has the best coffee in town. The owner is knowledgeable and knows how to keep customers coming back. The coffee is always fresh, and even delivered during construction. Excited for the new location to escape the hotel's bad smell. Brigitte has shown St. Petersburg what real coffee tastes and smells like!
I recently tried the pizza and knots at this beach location and I must say, it was fantastic! The spot had a great street presence and the staff really knew their stuff.
I always eat their oysters and they are absolutely amazing! Despite not knowing the type, they are the freshest and most delicious oysters I've had. Highly recommended, you won't be disappointed!
The food was excellent, the best in the area. Kung pao beef, basil shrimp, and pork fried rice were all very good. Fast delivery too.

The deli offers delicious and affordable sandwiches, such as the Philly and club. Our total bill, which included four bags of chips and two sandwiches, came to just over $20. The portions are large, so make sure to come with a big appetite.

I highly recommend this place for dry cleaning and alterations. Despite some unfounded negativity, they are extremely competent and efficient. They even successfully removed decade old stains! Their average turnaround time is impressive, even during busy seasons. The staff may not be overly friendly, but I value their competence over friendliness. We'll definitely continue using their services even after we move.

The new location is larger and offers street parking. The server was friendly and helpful with her recommendations. The Groothie was too sweet for my taste, but I enjoyed the flavorful Udon Noodle Salad.

Just had an amazing experience at this restaurant! Bailey provided exceptional service, being friendly and attentive throughout our visit. The food was absolutely incredible - the hummus plate, pretzels, mozzarella sticks, and caprese salad were all fresh and delicious. The generous portion sizes amazed us. It was our first time here, but we are already planning to come back!

Overall, despite the great entrees and reasonable prices, the lackluster service and attitude at this Fazoli's location really brought down the experience. The breadsticks, which are advertised as unlimited, caused a hassle when requesting more for our table. Additionally, there were issues with ordering, as a new employee struggled to take orders accurately during a busy lunch rush. If these issues are addressed, it could be a good option for a quick meal.

I tried the $12 tchoup wash at this car wash. Despite a short wait and entertaining waiting area, the results were okay. Some dirt and bird poop were still visible. While better than no wash, I miss my favorite car wash that offers more thorough cleaning for $14. This place is 85% as expensive as LA but only 66.67% the quality. Next time, I'll try a touchless system for similar results without the entertainment.
The large turtle tank has been replaced with a vibrant fish aquarium, with no information about the turtle's whereabouts. However, I still highly recommend it.
This Starbucks is efficient with a fast-moving drive-thru and ample seating both indoors and outdoors. Overall, a great place.

I requested a scissor cut for my straight hair, but the stylist ignored my preference and used clippers instead. Despite my clear instructions, she proceeded to cut 90% of my hair with clippers. I strongly advise going elsewhere for a haircut if you do not want a high and tight fade with clippers.

I had an amazing lunch at this restaurant in NOLA. The food, ambiance, and location were all excellent. The artichoke and crab salad was absolutely delicious, making my mouth water just thinking about it. My friend enjoyed the grilled and roasted vegetable platter, which was also outstanding. Highly recommend!

Fantastic lunch spot! A unique and funky atmosphere at Nashville airport. The food options are both delicious and healthy, and I highly recommend trying the sweet potato casserole with coconut and dried cranberry.
This smaller intimate venue in Orlando always brings us back. The staff is excellent and the service is top-notch. If you manage to secure a table, don't forget to request #4!

This place is a hidden gem! The food is consistently amazing, and the atmosphere is just right. The service is top-notch too. Although it can be a bit pricey, the Belgian Waffle topped with Nutella is worth every penny. A must-try for anyone who loves Nutella!

Overall, this restaurant is a great choice for a late weekend brunch when the morning rush dies down. The wait times are usually short, but the seating system could use improvement. The dishes vary in quality, with some being just okay and others being awesome. The chicken wings and onion rings are bland, but the club sandwich and egg/omelette platters are well-executed and tasty. The waffle stands out as the best item on the menu, being sweet, crispy, and delicious. The service is generally attentive, and the restaurant and bathrooms are clean. This place offers good value for the price.

Overall, I had a good experience at this place, but was disappointed by their Reuben sandwich. On the other hand, my fiancee's sandwich with chicken, bacon, and avocado was amazing. I also enjoyed their spice chicken soup with corn bread. The chai latte was not impressive, so I would not recommend it. The prices are a bit high, but the atmosphere is great for a wonderful breakfast or lunch and the staff is friendly. Give it a try and share your thoughts!

Target is a great alternative to Walmart, offering a wide range of products from clothes to electronics. Their affordable makeup and well-stocked grocery section make it a convenient shopping destination. Quick checkout process with ample open registers is another plus.
I highly recommend the Oyster Bar, especially if you're lucky enough to be served by Kentrelle. The "firecracker" dish will leave you amazed.

This HMV location offers the largest selection of gifts and titles in the city, with the option to order items not in stock. However, the staff may not always notify customers when their orders arrive. The staff at the tills are efficient and do not push for sign-ups to the pure rewards program, which has lackluster redemption items. Overall, the selection and speedy service earn five stars, but pricing and slow ordering process bring the rating down to three. Recommended for finding specific movies or CDs.
Incredible experience! Must try the friend oysters. We also had the crawfish bisque and shrimp with grits, all were delicious. Remember to make a reservation.

I was on a coat-quest for the Holidays. Found the perfect coat at Burlington but it wasn't in my size. Bought a coat from Target but it wasn't what I wanted. Finally, at Ross, I found a beautiful pleather bomber jacket but it got wrinkled. Went back to Ross, spoke to the manager, and miraculously found my dream coat in my size. Thank you, Ross! Forever my go-to store!

This place is a winner! The Udon Noodle Salad is absolutely amazing and the Crispy Hipcity Ranch is so, so good. The staff is friendly, service is fast, and they even offer delivery. Highly recommended!

Philadelphia, I love you! This place has amazing wood-fired pizzas with charred crusts, just the way I like it. The Marinara is simple yet delicious, and they even have a cheeseless option for my son. The Salsiccia with roasted fennel is brilliant and we couldn't resist the Rotolo with mortadella and pistachio pesto. The cocktails, especially The Brooklyn, are to die for. We ended our meal with perfect Italian cookies and an Affogato. I'm in heaven here. Great service and 5 stars all around! Can't wait to try Vetri's other restaurants.

This high-end store in West Edmonton Mall offers great clothes and excellent service. The friendly and non-pushy staff cater to your needs without being overbearing. While they carry casual clothing, their specialty lies in suits, dress shirts, and fancy attire. Although it may be pricey, the quality and overall shopping experience make it worth it.

Overall, the food at this Mediterranean food truck is tasty but not outstanding. It's a great late-night spot, perfect for satisfying late-night cravings. The portion size for the price could be improved, but it's fair enough. The restaurant has ample seating and provides a nice break from the nearby bar/club scenes. The place is clean, and the servers are quick and friendly. The dimly lit atmosphere and eclectic decoration may seem strange, but it adds to the unique charm of the place. Despite its quirks, I would definitely return.

I love this shop! The staff is friendly and always helpful with suggestions. The bait is top-notch and they have a great selection of tackle at unbeatable prices. I regret not shopping here sooner and now it's my go-to store for all my fishing needs. My only complaint is that there aren't more of these shops in town!
Nigel is amazing and his candy is worth the drive! My friends can't get enough of his delicious Bon bons.

Muriel's is a must-visit restaurant in the French Quarter offering a fantastic lunch special. The Bloody Mary was flavorful and reasonably priced, and the wait time was manageable with the convenient text message system. Although the servers were a bit forgetful, the overall experience was still enjoyable. The turtle soup was outstanding, and the generous portion of pork chop with red beans left me satisfied until bedtime. The historic location and ambiance added to the dining experience, making it worth a visit when in the Quarter.
Stopped here on our shuttle driver's recommendation. The red velvet ice cream is amazing! Cake pieces, creamy goodness—yum!

First time visit, friendly service, waived minimum credit order. Average American-Chinese food, some greasy sauces. Good vegetarian options. Lunch specials with rice and drink/soup/egg roll for $5.75. Overall, decent but not exceptional.

Delicious pizza with a unique cornmeal crust. The bianco salad was okay, but lacked excitement. Wish they took reservations and were slightly more affordable. Overall, worth a visit if you're in the area.

Indy Reads is an essential downtown bookstore. It not only provides a place to browse, connect with fellow book lovers, and enjoy book readings but also supports adult literacy. With a vast collection of both used and new books, you'll likely find hidden gems you didn't even know you wanted. Although the $1 children's books can be a bit challenging to browse due to tight arrangements, the overall pricing and space are excellent. Don't miss out on this wonderful bookstore!

I wish I had checked Yelp before coming here. Went in to have my right passenger front wheel checked due to tire pressure and noticed a lifted piece of tire. Was told there would be a couple of hours wait and that appointments are not accepted. Staff member was rude and lacked customer service skills. Ended up going to Mr. Tire down the street and got a new tire replaced in 30 minutes. They seemed much busier and more efficient.

Outstanding experience! As a florist myself, I have high standards when sending flowers, but this shop exceeded my expectations! I gave them freedom within a budget and asked for a bright and cheery arrangement. They absolutely nailed it and delivered promptly. Many thanks!

I gave this place one star because it was terrible. The service was bad and the food was even worse. The queso fundido was strange and the salsa was a mushy mess. It took forever to get our food and when it finally arrived, it was disappointing. The only good thing was the chips. I ordered beans and rice but got white rice with refried beans instead. Don't waste your time here, even Taco Bell serves better food than this. The service was equally terrible.
I highly recommend this small coffee place owned by the lovely, blond and friendly Karyn! Their coffee is fantastic and they even offer the convenience of a drive-through.

Ed's is a massive entertainment venue with a variety of activities and spaces, including restaurants, bars, video games, and more. It's great for young kids and birthday parties. They also host live bands, featuring lesser-known but interesting musicians who can attract a decent crowd. Overall, Ed's is a fun and affordable place to enjoy endless entertainment in E-town.
Although the rave reviews are difficult for me to comprehend, the wonderful conversation and company during my dining experience made up for it.

I am extremely disappointed that they have discontinued their salad and pizza bar. I used to visit frequently, but after moving away, I thought they had closed down. When I discovered their relocation, I was excited to have their delicious salad again. However, they now only serve whole pizzas, which is not what I was hoping for. Overall, a big letdown.

Poblano's used to serve a delicious Amiga bowl with shredded grilled chicken, rice, grilled onions and peppers, and queso sauce. However, on my recent visit, they substituted the chicken and rice with chicken crisps, which lacked moisture and quantity. When I voiced my discontent, the manager argued that this was the same dish they had been serving for years. Additionally, their soft tacos were stale and lacked flavor. It was disappointing that their cook had quit that night, resulting in a subpar experience. Sadly, Poblano's received a negative rating from me.

I like Dewey's primary location for its proximity to my house. The pizza's appearance and crust are great. However, my main issue with Dewey's is its excessive saltiness. The pepperoni, Socrates Revenge, and Bronx Bomber pizzas felt like eating a brick of salt. The overwhelming combination of salty sauce and meat leaves my taste buds unable to detect any other flavor. If they address this issue, I would love Dewey's. The salads are decent in size but seem like something easily put together at home. I usually avoid ordering them due to the cost.

Overall, the service was excellent and the chocolate cake for dessert was amazing. However, the disappointment came from the food, which was not up to expectations. The egg drop soup was hot, but the rest of the dishes were served at room temperature. The shrimp with candied walnuts was overly sweet and didn't complement the bland brown rice. Despite being accommodating to food allergies, PF Changs failed to impress.

Overall, the food at this BBQ joint was a mixed bag. The Mac n cheese was absolutely delicious and worth indulging in. While the ribs had great flavor, they were disappointingly tough. The pulled pork was sweet and enjoyable. The baked beans were passable, but the cole slaw had a strange aftertaste reminiscent of lake water. The unique ambiance of dining in an abandoned car wash adds a special element to the experience and is worth giving it a try.

The fries are amazing and worth thinking about, but the beef kebob sandwich was disappointing with a lack of meat and too many onions. Considering giving it a second chance. The smoothies tasted like syrup and ice. Fair prices and great service. Love the cozy mom and pop atmosphere of the restaurant.

Love this new taqueria! The green sauce is amazing, especially on cheese enchiladas. The Mexican rice is top-notch too. Authentic Mexican food that reminds me of my favorite spots in Houston. It's the only place in New Orleans East for Mexican cuisine. I'll definitely be a regular customer. Open 7 days a week, serving breakfast and open late. Call 504-242-0573 for takeout. YUMMY!
I was disappointed with the portion size of the Mexican Roll and Philadelphia Roll. The taste was nothing special and overall bland.

I love browsing in this trendy shopping area near Mass Ave. Silver in the City is my first choice for unique home and style items. They even allow dogs inside, which is a huge plus for me. The only downside is that the employees tend to watch you closely, which limits privacy while browsing and deciding on purchases.

I had a great takeout experience at this restaurant near closing time. The puttanesca I ordered was delicious, with a perfect balance of saltiness and spiciness. I appreciated the diverse menu options and the ability to customize my own dish. The only downside was the lack of a gluten-free dough option, which might cause some discomfort later on.
I thoroughly enjoyed the food, particularly the crab cake Benedict, which was delicious! The service was excellent and they also offered a great selection of smoothies.

I had a must-have breakfast in New Orleans at a restaurant with a diner style atmosphere. The service was quick and our server was great. The Grits and Grillades, slow roasted beef with peppers and onions in a brown gravy over creamy Gouda cheese grits, was absolutely delicious. It exceeded my homemade version and will be a must-try again on future trips to New Orleans.

This business is extremely unhelpful, unresponsive, and dishonest. They provided misleading information about a specific unit, failed to communicate effectively, and did not honor the price discussed. It is evident that they prioritize money over tenant satisfaction. I regret wasting my time and money with them.

Sierra and India from JOTSB provided exceptional care for my family during our recent reunion in Santa Barbara. They went above and beyond by not only purchasing all the necessary items in advance but also anticipating our needs and restocking drinks and food throughout the event. Their flexibility, enthusiasm, attention to detail, and overall fabulous service made the experience truly memorable. I highly recommend JOTSB and hope to have the opportunity to use their services again in the future.

This spot fell short of expectations. Despite handwritten signs and limited bagel options, the food was average at best. The pastrami, egg, and cheese sandwich lacked pastrami and had unmelted cheese. Moreover, my wife had the unfortunate experience of spoiled creamer in her coffee. We'll be sticking with Einstein's or St Pete Bagel instead.

This Italian restaurant has very friendly employees and offers reasonably priced dishes. The homemade salad dressing is excellent and the overall food quality is good. A great choice for Italian cuisine.

I absolutely love their breakfast burritos! The bacon, egg, cheese, and potatoes combination is delicious. The well-seasoned and perfectly cut small potatoes prevent the burrito from being overwhelmed by mushy potatoes. The flavors of eggs, bacon, and potatoes shine through. I would prefer a little more cheese, but it's a minor issue. The salsa bar offers a nice variety, and the friendly staff adds to the welcoming atmosphere. I feel fortunate to have them just a mile away from my house. Hoping they stick around for years to come!

As a new resident in Tucson, I've explored multiple pizza joints near U of A, and this one is undoubtedly the best. In fact, it surpasses any pizza I've ever had, outranking even the renowned spots in NYC. The crust is simply enchanting, and their five alarm pizza delivers the perfect level of spiciness for the heat-lovers. Give it a shot, and disappointment is unlikely.

I finally tried Honey's on my birthday and it was worth the wait! The food, including the french toast, home fries, sausage, and Jewish apple cake, was absolutely delicious. I'll definitely be coming back for more.

Tria's knowledgeable staff and extensive beer and wine selection make it a must-visit. The outside seating is a delightful treat, although it can be hard to snag a table. The bustling atmosphere adds to its charm. While the food remains unexplored, the real highlight here lies in their exceptional drink options.

Mae's is by far the best Chinese restaurant on the east side. From the pleasant atmosphere and beautiful decor to the fresh and delicious food, this place surpasses all expectations. The impeccable service and friendly staff add to the enjoyable dining experience. Not to mention, Mae's offers incredible value for money, especially their lunch specials. Don't miss out on trying Mae's, you will not be disappointed.

This place is a Tucson gem and my absolute favorite! The flavors are amazing; they taste even better than you imagine. My personal favorites include strawberries & champagne, toasted marshmallow, and cheesecake. I was thrilled when they opened locations in the valley after I moved to Phoenix. I will definitely keep visiting over and over!

This location has significantly declined over the past few years. On a recent Saturday evening, only two staff members were working while most tables were occupied, resulting in long waiting times to order and pay. Unfortunately, the sandwich I received was made with hard, burnt bread that was barely edible. This establishment must either improve its quality or consider closing its doors.

The cemetery is loved by some for its angel photo opportunities, but I find it a little creepy. On the bright side, it's peaceful, lacking zombies, and even had witches adding some photobombs. Overall, it's well-maintained with impressive gravestones and angels. And did I mention, no zombies?

I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Port Richey and had a mediocre experience. The staff were friendly and helpful, and there was free wifi. The breakfast options were good. However, the beds were too soft and uncomfortable, and the a/c controls were unreliable. It was just okay, and I prefer the Hyatt hotels.
The staff lacked customer service and seemed more interested in personal distractions. The food was mediocre, but not terrible. Overall, I would rate them slightly higher than 1.5.

The food is excellent, but the customer service has declined and the portion sizes have significantly decreased over time. Even after providing feedback, my concerns were dismissed, leading to a negative experience. As a result, I will not be returning to this establishment.

The food was excellent, with a wide variety of options. The staff was friendly and helpful in recommending dishes. Happy Hour is worth it, and the house margaritas stood out compared to other places. The chicken poblano was delicious, and my friend loved the ability to have three types of enchiladas on one plate.
Highly recommend the salted caramel chocolate cake - the best we've ever tasted! The Apple Brown Betty was also awesome. Impressive beer selection.

Great bar for college students. Affordable drinks and they have projectors to watch games. Only drawback is the screen should be wider to avoid the picture going off into the wall. Spacious during the day, probably gets crowded at night.

I had a terrible experience with this restaurant. I called in an order for a half sausage, half cheese pizza and the staff seemed to have no idea what I was saying. I had to constantly repeat myself and even had my boyfriend call back to confirm our order. Despite this, they still got it wrong and gave us an all sausage pizza instead. This is the second time in a month that I have received terrible service from them. I also had a previous incident where they forgot to put my order in when I arrived for pickup. Overall, it was a terrible experience.

Awful experience at Marmont Steakhouse. Cold soup, tasteless calamari, and wrong entree. Waiters argued with us about the mistake and caused illness from beef ravioli. Unapologetic staff. Avoid this place.

Tako is the best place for sushi. Fresh and delicious, with private rooms for a fun night out. Must-try dishes like jalapeño yellowtail, kani salad, bird's nest roll, and naruto. Ordering is a breeze, and prices are reasonable - rarely spend over $35. Highly recommend Tako!
The local ice cream is top-notch with flavors like Expresso Chip, Moose Tracks, and Graham Slam, all uniquely crafted and delicious.

We have been loyal customers at this car wash for years and have no complaints. Wednesdays are great for ladies as they offer a discount on all wash options. The $5 car wash is not hand-wash, but it's perfect for a quick bath. They occasionally run a 2 for 1 special on auto detail packages, which we always take advantage of because they consistently deliver great results.

This place is mediocre overall. The food is average, neither impressive nor terrible. The service can be hit or miss, depending on luck. Tried the drunken noodles and Thai green curry, but both were just average.

Redemption at an old church is an extraordinary dining experience. The beautiful setting adds to the charm, especially for architecture enthusiasts. The service was impeccable, providing a fun time for our group. The paneed smoked soft shell crab was heavenly, and the seafood stuffed filet of fish was superb, enhancing the flounder's flavors. This meal ranks among the top 10 in my life. If you haven't been, you must try it!

I love this place! Conveniently located near my home, I visit every other week. They regularly change flavors and have hidden toppings. The intense EDM music playing adds to the unique experience. Awesome!

Incredible experience! The Steak Tartare was the best I've ever had and the Caribbean Seafood Pepper Pot and Curried Goat were absolutely wonderful. The unique combination of sweet curry and gnocchi in the goat dish was a pleasant surprise. Even with just a bite, the lime cheesecake was top notch. With no drinks due to post-Mardi Gras recovery, the service still stood out as exceptional. Great place, highly recommend!

I went to this place on a Wednesday night. Despite being quiet, all tables were reserved except for the tall ones in the bar area. The location is not appealing, but the interior is stylish and masculine. The staff was knowledgeable and attentive, and the menu was intriguing. We ordered 3 small plates and a side dish, which was a bit too much for two people. The food was varied and unique, with reasonable prices. The smoked trout and venison hot dogs were fantastic, while the mini monte cristos were underwhelming. Overall, we paid $52.05 for the meal and left satisfied.

I had an amazing experience at this frozen yogurt place on South Street. The flavors were all delicious, even the fat-free options felt indulgent. Highly recommended if you're looking for a sweet treat while out and about.

I was impressed with the staff at this restaurant. Despite demanding customers and ridiculous complaints, our server, a small girl with purple hair, carried multiple plates, explained the menu flawlessly, and handled everything like a true professional. Thumbs up and five stars to the staff. As for the customers, they need to learn basic manners or stay home.

I had a positive shopping experience at Hallmark despite not making a purchase. Their prices were fair, warranties and certifications were impressive, and the staff was friendly and not pushy. If I hadn't found a different car, I would have likely bought from them. Recommended for local buyers.

The white meat fried chicken was slimy and salty, while the sides (Mac and cheese and garlic mashed potatoes) were cold and flavorless. The service was strange, as the server laughed awkwardly during our order, making us feel uncomfortable. Won't return.
Fantastic lobster rolls, both warm and cold. The bread was fantastic too! Though slightly pricey, the quality of the food made it worth it.

The Habit Burger is a fantastic burger joint that stands toe-to-toe with In-N-Out. I had the double char and choco shake at the Goleta location, and as always, it was delicious. Don't miss out on their excellent onion rings too.
My husband and I have been regulars at this place for the past 8 years. The food is amazing, prepared quickly, and they offer fantastic drink specials.

This is a typical Broad Ripple charming spot with a small, trendy, and bustling atmosphere. Unfortunately, they do not take reservations, which can be annoying for those traveling from another part of town. However, the cocktails were creative and delicious, and the server's suggestions were on point. The guacamole was tasty, but came with nuts despite requesting them to be left off. The Harvest salad was a highlight with its delightful combination of fruit and root vegetables. The Veracruz Trigger fish and Serrano Scallops were both delicious, accompanied by interesting white sweet mashed potatoes. The Tostones were a bit dry, but dipped in the Stewed Black Beans, they tasted great. Unfortunately, there were no gluten-free, dairy-free dessert options available. Overall, it's worth a visit, just make sure to arrive before 7 pm on a Friday to secure a table.

I've been to Jackson's multiple times and finally decided to leave a review. The panini Reuben was delicious with great use of garlic and perfectly sliced meat. However, the salad came out at the same time as the sandwich, which was not ideal, and the presentation was a bit sloppy. The sandwich was served directly on a plate instead of a napkin, causing the bread to get soggy if it sits for too long. The price is a bit high, but the food and drink quality justifies it. They have a great selection of wines and beers to choose from. The wait staff is generally friendly but can sometimes be short or distracted. The wait time for drinks can vary, with my longest wait being 15 minutes during a lunch rush. Overall, it was a good experience and I will return.

Overall, I had a positive experience with Young who did my pedicure. She was friendly, had a positive attitude, and provided thorough massaging. However, I was disappointed with the gel manicure done by the owner. The old gel polish was not fully removed, the polish application was uneven with noticeable bumps, and the sides of my nails were not fully covered. This experience has made me reconsider returning to the salon.
I tried their amazing trio appetizer and the pizza was equally delicious. Overall, highly recommended.

Hidden gem on the Westside with great food at a reasonable price. Must try the Indian taco and sweet fry bread. Daily specials like $1 tacos on Tuesdays and Fridays. I'm a regular, eating here at least once a week. Highly recommend.

The bakery not only offers delightful cookies, cupcakes, and puddings but also exceptional salted caramel cakes. The four-layered moist cake with caramel buttercream was truly amazing. I ensured the icing was made with real ingredients and it did not disappoint - the rich taste of butter and sugar was evident. The cake was both elegant and delicious, a rare combination.
Highly recommend skipping fancy desserts for a stroll around Broadway to visit this place. Their homemade ice cream, especially Cake Mix, is absolutely delicious. Perfect spot to end a date.

I stumbled upon this hidden gem of a sushi place and it was a game-changer. I used to overlook it for fast food chains, but no more. I had the delicious sushiya roll and it exceeded my expectations. The salmon was incredibly fresh and the miso soup was just perfect. I highly recommend this spot, it deserves a perfect 10/10 rating.
The best Thai food in the area! Wish I lived closer. Red curry, pad thai, and chicken satay with peanut sauce are amazing! Great lunch specials.

I took my family and daughter to this place for the first time. There were plenty of activities for my daughter and she loved it! However, I can only give it 2 stars because it was filthy. Despite the high admission price, the cleanliness was lacking. Staff didn't clean anything, electrical cords were exposed, and dust was everywhere. I hope management addresses these issues.

Had a great experience as a walk-in at this clean location with friendly staff. Tammy did an amazing job on my eyebrows, and as a first-time guest, the service was free. They offer fantastic packages for various waxing services. Will definitely be returning!

Extremely disappointed with this restaurant. Sushi was poorly cut, rice lacked flavor, and the dynamite was overly salty with excessive mayo. Left most of the food untouched. Avoid this place at all costs.

Terrible service, had to order from the front counter after waiting for 30 minutes. Lazy waitresses prioritizing socializing over attending to customers. Advised another family to order takeout instead of dining in. Avoid this place and opt for delivery instead.

This place is hands down the best Caribbean food in town. The dishes were fresh, perfectly cooked, and not heavy. The stewed chicken and curried chicken were both excellent, and the plantains were the best I've ever had. The owner was attentive and made sure we were satisfied. Amazing prices and a BYOB policy make it even better. I will definitely return and recommend it to everyone. Trust the 5-star reviews, they're real.

Momo's is a cool and upbeat place, great for groups or first dates. The tapas plates were delicious, especially the scallops. Portions were generous but ordering two at a time is recommended. The Greek salad's dressing was too sweet. The Spanish granacha wine was excellent and reasonably priced. The belly dancer was cute but the experience felt a bit awkward. Despite better Greek food options in town, Momo's is the go-to place for a fun night out. We'll definitely return.

I used to love this store in high school, but the service has gone downhill. The staff is stuck up, and one girl even scolded me for holding a book incorrectly. I haven't been back in three years and don't plan to return anytime soon.

Standing in line and squeezing onto a wooden bench with strangers may not sound appealing, and the lack of heating or air conditioning may not be ideal, but trust me, it's worth it. The jazz show is incredibly fun and the venue itself is cool and legendary. Give it a try at least once, and I'm willing to bet that you'll keep coming back for more.
Not worth the $5 fee. Confusing layout, boring self-guided tour. Save your money; visit the courthouse instead.
Simply the best! Don't miss out on this gem in St Louis, MO. The frozen custard here is unparalleled and will exceed all your expectations.
The ambiance wasn't up to par, but the service was nice and the food was decent. Might go back if I'm in the area and in the mood for sushi.

The food at this place was simply outstanding! We sampled a variety of dishes including the crawfish beignet, seafood stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, crab cake po boy, and seafood flatbread. Every single item was absolutely scrumptious.
This DQ lacks quality and is not recommended. The staff seems inexperienced and it's best to look for another location.

My husband and I love supporting local businesses when we travel to keep the real economy thriving. This shop offers a variety of locally made goods, from clothes to artwork and food items. The owner is friendly and we had a great experience. We highly recommend checking it out, we found unique items like a dragonfly wall sculpture and space age pens.

I am incredibly impressed with this coffee shop in Reno. As coffee enthusiasts from Sacramento, my husband and I expected nothing but excellence, and we found it here. This place is an absolute gem that we wish existed back in Sac. It has become our go-to coffee shop, without a doubt. Their Matcha lattes are simply amazing. Sigh.

I recently moved to Idaho and had an amazing experience at Chipotle. Taylor, one of the staff members, comped one of my meals, making my week and day. Her exceptional customer service and friendly nature stood out among the rest. Taylor is absolutely awesome!

This place is a martinis lover's paradise, offering an extensive selection of about 500 martinis. Don't miss out on their amazing giant pitchers of Petron Pomegranate Margaritas. Prices are fair, service is excellent, but be patient as the staff can be overwhelmed with their busy schedule. Don't hesitate to visit!

Claudio's is the go-to place for any Italian food products. Their old-school, family-oriented atmosphere is worth standing in line for. They have exceptional cheeses and a deep knowledge of food. They are eager to help and so are the other customers. Hanging at Claudio's makes you want to be Italian. It's not just shopping, it's an experience everyone should have.

This hotel was terrible due to four main factors. Firstly, the prices were exorbitantly high, including charges for shuttle rides and overpriced amenities. Secondly, the service was extremely poor, with long hold times, wait times at the front desk, and unhelpful staff. Thirdly, despite being labeled as a resort, it was actually a loud convention hotel with constant noise and thin walls. Lastly, the hotel was excessively large, causing difficulties in finding one's way around and limited dining options. Overall, I'm relieved I attended a convention rather than paying for this disappointing hotel myself.

I had high hopes for this place, but I was ultimately disappointed. The Dan Dan noodles were flavorful but lacked protein. The scallion pancakes were mediocre compared to another place I recently tried. The Wontons in Chilli oil were extremely spicy and lacked substance. The Talapia Medallions were fried well, but the greens were difficult to chew. The service and atmosphere were good, but I won't be going out of my way to eat here again. It feels too commercialized and Americanized for my taste. I prefer authentic Cantonese-style and hole-in-the-wall places.

This review highlights the frustration and disappointment the reviewer experienced with their stay at Hyatt. Despite clearly stating their request for a "feather free" room multiple times, feathers were still present in their assigned room. The reviewer questions whether Hyatt will ever grasp the importance of this issue, potentially risking another emergency room visit. Additionally, the high nightly parking fee of $29 in St. Louis is regarded as absurd. The repeated apology from the staff becomes tiresome for the reviewer.

Visited this place on a busy weekend, had to wait over an hour - not worth it. Came back earlier and had a great experience. Pancakes are amazing, especially the butter pecan. They also offer turkey sausage and bacon. Highly recommend going early and wearing loose pants.
The food was average, disappointing for fried green tomato experts. Meatloaf was good but the sides were just average. Entertainment was also disappointing with limited songs played per hour.

Tina provided excellent service with quick attention, even on a Sunday morning. The wait time was minimal, approximately 15 minutes. The standout dish was the huevos bruncheros, an absolute must-try. It's hard to put into words how delicious it was, simply give it a taste yourself!

I was extremely disappointed with my experience. The glasses I received were horribly out of focus and the staff failed to properly measure my pupils for positioning. They attempted to convince me that the glasses could be repositioned, but it would have resulted in an uncomfortable fit. Despite requesting the lenses to be redone urgently, I still have not received my glasses.
This place is the greatest! They have everything you need at great prices. The staff, though there may be a language barrier, is friendly and helpful. Highly recommended for computer item needs.

I loved the Clue game theme at this hotel! The staff, including bell boys, valet drivers, and bartenders, were all respectful and provided great service. The phone etiquette was exceptional and the customer service was top-notch. My girlfriend and I would definitely return next year as the hotel is located in a great area, albeit with some busy streets in downtown Boise. Coming from California, we were impressed by the phenomenal service. However, it is worth being mindful of your spending as food at the hotel can be expensive. One downside was the lack of air vent in the bathrooms, including ours. Overall, a great experience but consider looking for cheaper dining options nearby.

I tried the strawberry flavor at this Atlantic City location and it was amazing! It's not too sweet, but just perfect. I loved the added bits of strawberry in it. The price is also great, only $2 for a small size. My only regret is not trying the other flavors. I will definitely be getting this again next time I'm in Philly/AC!

I had an amazing lunch yesterday! The staff was incredibly friendly and the portions were almost enough for two people. The recipes, passed down from Mrs. Doll, truly shine through with her son carrying on the legacy.
The Bridgeport Rib House offers tasty take-out options with fair prices. However, the bar service for pick-up orders falls short compared to other local barbecue establishments.

The recently revamped menu and increased prices at this place were disappointing. The food was mediocre, and as a beginner cook, I could tell it was not up to par. The food also seemed old, as if it had been sitting out for weeks. The hostess was friendly, but the waiter's incompetence in serving wine was frustrating. Overall, this restaurant is not worth the money, despite their attempt to appear high-end. I had a better experience during happy hour with friends.

Excellent customer service! Brought in my watch for a battery change and they noticed a missing pin, which they fixed for free. Although the wait was a bit long, they were extremely friendly and didn't charge me for the battery. Highly recommended for purchasing jewelry.

This place offers the best of Jewish deli, Southern comfort, and Mexican cuisine. The brisket is flavorful, but don't expect a tomato-based sauce. The latke is a unique and delicious twist on the traditional round one. I also highly recommend the Jewish Apple Cake - even after a few hours on a flight back to LA, it remained delicious, despite being a little overcooked on the bottom.

The food is average, but the main draw of this place is renting a karaoke room for big groups and bringing your own drinks. The restaurant handles large and rowdy groups well, with decently priced and fast service. The karaoke machines have a good selection of up-to-date songs in multiple languages.

This long overdue update of my review for Khyber is simply excellent! Despite moving further away, I still frequent this place. Their Southern barbecue, especially the brisket, ribs, and chicken, is outstanding. The mac and cheese is a must-try side dish, and the coleslaw complements the meal perfectly. The lively vibe of Khyber adds to the experience, always bustling but never too loud. The knowledgeable staff offers great beer recommendations and tasting options. Khyber strikes the perfect balance where I never feel overly intoxicated or out of place.
This bakery offers outstanding bread, particularly the German rye. The poached eggs for breakfast are cooked to perfection. The eggplant panini and Laurie's salad make delightful lunch choices.

Tony's is a hidden gem in Chalmette, serving some of the best Mexican food in Louisiana. The chiles rellenos are a must-try, while their authentic Mexican Coca-Cola is a sweet treat. Overall, a surprisingly great dining experience with consistently delicious dishes.
Terrible business model, confusing ordering process, unprofessional staff, and insufficient filling in my sandwich. Overall, one of the worst experiences I've had recently.

Overall, the staff at this dancewear store are friendly and attentive. They offer a range of quality products at reasonable prices. However, the limited options for men's dancewear can be disappointing. The location is convenient for city residents, and it's a good first stop when in need of new dancewear. However, there is a high probability of not finding the desired item three out of four times.

I highly recommend this place! I was referred here and it was a fantastic experience. I got my hair done in just five hours, with three women working on my medium-sized individuals. The cost was $150, including the hair. The staff was very nice, and I will definitely be returning.

The lamb gyros plate is a must-try, worth driving the distance for. The tiramisu is delicious as well. Dolmas are decent, but a bit too vinegary for my taste. The Greek salad accompanying the entree is also enjoyable.
The yum yum club is amazing, and their macaroni salad is awesome! While the service could be friendlier at times, I keep going back because the price is right and the food tastes great.

My husband and I had a fantastic first experience in Reno thanks to this hotel. Our room was amazing, with a spa and a steam room in the shower. The hotel had great dining options and a clean and enjoyable casino. We were even lucky enough to win $41 with a $1 slot machine. Although Reno itself didn't impress us much, our hotel made up for it. The easy checkout from our room was a convenient time saver. If you're looking for a nice, clean, and modern hotel, this is the one to choose.

Based on the previous Yelp reviews, we decided to take the kids to this hibachi and sushi place. It definitely lived up to the hype. The sushi was incredible, the hibachi was fantastic, and the dessert of fried bananas and ice cream was the perfect ending to a wonderful experience. The service was excellent and attentive. We will definitely be coming back for more!
I absolutely love this place! The pizza is fantastic, the staff is incredibly friendly, and it's a perfect spot for some quality time with friends and family.
I recently visited with friends for food and drinks and had an excellent experience. The service was fantastic, and the drinks were top-notch. I'll definitely be returning!
The lamb was tasty, but disappointed with the frozen garlic Naan from Trader Joe's. Pricey for the portion size and the owner misleadingly claimed to accept Amex. Unlikely to revisit.

Hidden gem in Brentwood! This shop offers innovative flavors like pumpkin and whipped cream cheese. The owner, Michael, is incredibly friendly and generous with samples. Can't wait to try out his next creations!
The food and coffee are great, although I wish they had a bigger espresso bar with more options. The baked goods and other food are absolutely spectacular.

Holly Grove is the best. Their selection of produce is consistently impressive, offering everything you need and more that you won't find at a regular grocery store. It's a great place to support local growers and makers, with locally raised meats and bread from local bakeries. The atmosphere is pleasant, with people always tending to the garden outside. The only downside is its location, but that's not their fault.

We tried this place for the first time last night and overall, it was a good experience. The service was a bit slow, possibly due to the busy Saturday night during March Madness. The complimentary homemade chips were fantastic, although they took longer to arrive than my husband's salad. The restaurant had a kid's movie playing on one of the nearby televisions, which kept my 3-year-old entertained. The food was great, with my burger and seasoned fries being wonderful. However, my husband's blackened chicken was a bit too spicy due to being over-seasoned. My daughter's macaroni and cheese looked delicious, but she couldn't resist eating the chips instead. The seating arrangement inside was a bit odd, with a table located close to the women's restroom door. Personally, I found it strange and ended up waiting until I got home to use the restroom. On a positive note, they offer a 15% military discount, which was much appreciated. Despite the slower service, I would still recommend this place, although I would have given it 5 stars if the service had been a bit better.

The hotel was a decent option in downtown Tampa. We stayed in the suite with a fold-out couch, which was comfortable. We unfortunately missed the happy hour with free drinks, but it's a cool amenity. The complimentary breakfast was amazing, featuring made-to-order omelets, fresh fruit, cereal, toast, bacon, sausage, home fries, juice, and pastries. The room was modern, with two TVs, clean, and had a strong shower.

I had a fantastic experience at this downtown St. Petersburg restaurant. The cozy ambiance gave it a homely feel, and the burgers were bursting with flavor. The arugula added a delightful touch to the chicken and potato gratin. However, I wasn't a fan of the cheese used in the gratin. Despite this, I will definitely be back for the burgers. The only downside was the slightly high prices for wine, so I opted not to order any. Overall, the atmosphere was wonderful, and our waitress was excellent.

I have been a loyal customer at Cd Roma's for over a decade and I absolutely love it. The new location has a modern vibe while still maintaining delicious food. The Chicken Parm, Eggplant Parm, house salad, and Alfredo are my favorites, and their pizza is great too. The made-to-order Alfredo sauce is heavenly with their breadsticks. However, some appetizers like frozen cheesesticks and calamari could use improvement. Overall, I still prefer Cd Roma's over Olive Garden, despite missing the cozy old school atmosphere.
The Waffle House offers consistent quality, but the business model with their yelling and limited dining area is not my preference. Nonetheless, I still eagerly anticipate their breakfast.

Henry is an exceptional rock star in the storage locker industry. He is knowledgeable, professional, courteous, and personable. We had a great experience and even our dog, Marley, was warmly welcomed. Highly recommended!

This restaurant is phenomenal! The location, ambience, food, and drinks are all great. Sitting at the bar is a must, especially with Jared, the talented mixologist. The extensive menu never disappoints, and the specials are always wonderful. Highly recommend this place!

This place has a great location and offers fresh, varied vegan options. However, besides that, I found it pretty average. The crispy ranch and curry tofu dishes were enjoyable, but I expected more from a specialty vegan restaurant. The chick'n in the crispy ranch and the fries were highlights, but the green lemonade was too sweet for my taste. While it's worth trying for its unique items, I wouldn't consider it amazing considering the price range.
Terrible experience! Unfriendly staff, dirty environment, and overall unpleasant. Would not recommend.

Highly recommend this vegan restaurant in New Orleans! Delicious and flavorful food with a wide variety of options to choose from. The bread pudding was a standout for me. Generous portions at affordable prices. Don't miss out!

Magical Vegan Heaven is a small gem with delicious food that even non-vegans will love. My wife couldn't get enough of their Philly steak and I thoroughly enjoyed the curry tofu wrap. Limited seating may be a concern if you prefer to dine in, but their food is perfect for takeout. The kale lemonade alone deserves a 5-star rating. We can't wait to visit again on our next trip to Philly.

My wife and I highly recommend this place! Great management, attentive service, and delicious food. Don't miss the Tiger Roll, Pink Lady Roll, and Tornado Roll. Ask for Billy, he's our favorite. Overall, a must-visit spot in the area. Enjoy!

Amazing spot for lunch in NOLA! Their fried chicken is to die for, and the red beans and rice are incredibly tasty. We always make it a point to stop by when in town. The staff is super friendly and attentive, and the prices are very reasonable.
Mint is a must-visit spot in my neighborhood. Their menu offers endless good choices, and the Taro Tapioca Smoothie is an absolute delight for anyone with a sweet tooth.
The salsa and guacamole are freshly made daily, accompanied by homemade chips. The shrimp burrito was sizable, yet delicious and fresh. The wait staff, however, was only average.

I had high expectations for this place, but it fell short. The calzones were decent, but the crust was disappointing and not doughy enough. The meat fillings were a bit lacking, and the dessert had an odd spice and lacked apple chunks. Despite the convenient location and vibe, it didn't live up to the hype for me. Might give it another chance, but unsure.

This Philadelphia gem offers an amazing view, impeccable service, and great fare. Nick, our incredible server, recommended a delicious wine that perfectly complemented our dishes. A must-visit spot to witness fabulous views and stunning sunsets.

The food is excellent, but the long wait times and lack of proper staffing make it difficult to enjoy. Management should improve the scheduling and turnover process to avoid frustrating customers. Unfortunately, I won't be returning based on this experience.

I ordered my usual breakfast at Terraza, which was eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, and wheat toast with salsa on the side. The hashbrowns were undercooked, but everything else was good. The service was efficient and the portion sizes were large and affordable. I enjoyed sitting on their shaded patio, and the server was cheerful. Terraza is a great option for breakfast with a terrace, and I plan on trying their lunch options next.

This all you can eat place offers decent value at $27/adult, but the quality falls short when ordering from the regular menu. The maki rolls are average, but mine were too cold, indicating they had been pre-made and refrigerated. The oyster ponzu lacked the ponzu flavor and had a heavy coating comparable to an A+W onion ring. If you're extremely hungry and craving rolls and greasy tempura, this place is suitable. However, I recommend avoiding the squid.
Called after a negative experience with another locksmith. They responded punctually, completed the job within an hour, and even provided 4 complimentary keys. Truly exceptional service.

This place is extremely crowded in an unpleasant way. The strong odor of patrons' body odor mixed with dirty bathrooms makes for an unappetizing experience. The prices are not worth the average food, and the service is lacking. Numerous better options are available in Philly's food scene, so it's recommended to avoid wasting time and money here. Head elsewhere instead.

I had high hopes for this place with its good beer selection and knowledgeable staff. However, the food was a major letdown. The fries were undercooked and inedible, while the burgers were inconsistently cooked and served on hard, cold buns. The service was lackluster at best. We couldn't even eat the food and left it untouched, but were still charged full price. I wouldn't recommend eating here, unless you're drunk and don't care about the quality.

I initially had a disappointment with the wrong order, but the employees were friendly in fixing it. However, the food made up for it in the end. On my second visit, the pizza steak exceeded my expectations with generous portions of cheese, meat, and sauce. This place has redeemed itself and might become my new go-to for pizza steaks.

IBP is the perfect spot to unwind on a Saturday night after a show. Despite the busy Happy Hour, the late-night crowds are relaxed and there's always seating available. It's a great alternative to Chinatown or Dive bars nearby. Additionally, IBP offers a variety of sports packages and has a separate jukebox and pool tables upstairs for entertainment.

The Village pub has a great beer selection, welcoming atmosphere, and good service. The happy hour with half price beer and the dog-friendly deck are definite highlights. The key lime pie is also delicious. However, the smoking allowed on the deck is a downside. The food, particularly the pretzels and cheese dip, falls short. The pretzel bun sandwiches are pricey and underwhelming, with soggy buns. It would be better if the pub focused on serving beer and allowed customers to bring in sandwiches from next door.

Modern Laundry is an exceptional establishment that I am thoroughly pleased with. The facility is always clean and has a pleasant ambiance, thanks to the employees who genuinely seem to enjoy their work. The fluff and fold service exceeded my expectations - my clothes were flawlessly cleaned and expertly folded, giving them a freshly-purchased feel. Notably, their use of environmentally friendly detergent further impressed me. Modern Laundry has effortlessly won me over, making laundry just another convenient stop on my to-do list.

The food and atmosphere are great, as expected in the CBD. However, the back room can feel stuffy on busy days. I highly recommend trying their delicious raw oysters and burgers. Prices are slightly higher for lunch, but worth it.
Highly recommend this small shop! It's definitely worth the drive. The wine cakes are exceptional. Went based on Yelp reviews and will be returning for sure.

The Love exceeded my expectations. Exceptional Father's Day lunch with a wide array of delicious choices on the menu. Professional and accommodating service, lovely atmosphere, and hot and tasty dishes with surprising additions. Greens on every plate - my warm spinach salad was a delightful addition. The Belgium waffles with corn meal and Blueberry butter were a hit. They even serve our favorite La Columbe coffee. Couldn't ask for more.

Overall, the sushi roll was enjoyable but the limited options were a downside. The experience at the hibachi grill was disappointing, as my steak was overcooked despite specifying medium doneness twice. Additionally, everyone in my group felt that the chicken lacked seasoning. It is important to note that the advertised late happy hour from 8-11 was not available, even though the website did not mention any location-specific information. The staff claimed it was for a different location, but this was not clearly indicated on their website.

I was excited to try Lee How Fook after reading positive Yelp reviews, but unfortunately, I was left disappointed. The small size of the restaurant didn't bother me, but it's advisable to make reservations due to limited tables. The service was adequate, although understanding the server was a bit difficult. As for the food, the appetizers were delicious with a flavorful dipping sauce. However, the sweet & sour chicken was overly sweet and the vegetables were undercooked. The pan-fried noodle dishes lacked flavor and the supposed spicy beef wasn't spicy at all. Overall, I left full but unsatisfied.
The hot chicken is outstanding, possibly the best I've had despite being from the South. However, the small portion size comes at a high price. The drinks are also incredibly impressive.
Lee How Fook serves the best General Tso chicken I've ever had. Give it a try and let me know what you think. -  Coolie

Chef John Besh at Luke connected to the Hilton hotel on St. Charles deserves a huge thank you! We ended up eating here multiple times during our stay because the food was so delicious. The traditional dishes were great, but the surprise winner was the burger. Despite being hesitant to order a burger in New Orleans, it turned out to be one of the best I've ever had - juicy, flavorful, and huge. Don't miss out on their amazing bread pudding a la mode, it's mouth-watering and freshly baked.
Disappointed to discover that this location is closed when I specifically came for their delicious fish tacos.

Jacob from Alpine Locksmiths provided excellent and efficient service when I lost my car keys while skiing at Squaw. He quickly gave me a fair price quote and arrived at the agreed time. In just a few minutes, he retrieved our key code and made new keys. I highly recommend Alpine for their honest and quick assistance. Although I hope to not need their help again in the same circumstance, they will be my first call if I ever lose my keys again.

Terrible service, never got to try the food. Despite being seated for over 45 minutes, we were still without water and had multiple waiters who failed to assist us. Ended up leaving and went to Dat Dog across the street where we were impressed with their hot dogs. Thanks Dat Dogs!
Terrible experience, order was 75% incorrect and missing items. Disappointed.

Farmhaus was worth the wait. Despite a slight delay in seating, the menu helped us plan our meal in advance. The smoked fish dip and escolar with prawns were fantastic, while the meatloaf was a bit dry and bland. The service was good, considering how busy the restaurant was. I am excited to try their blue plate special lunches and would love to go back for dinner when there is outdoor seating.

The customer service at Dish is seriously lacking. Despite making a reservation for three people two weeks in advance, we were seated at a tiny table barely fit for two. Adjacent to us, an extra person was added, resulting in an uncomfortably cramped dining experience. When we requested a proper table for three, we were rudely told it was a take it or leave it situation. This unpleasant encounter ruined what was supposed to be a special night out, and as a result, we will no longer be dining at this restaurant.

Overall, the restaurant was pretty good. The milkshake was amazing, one of the best I've ever had. The food and service were good too, but there was a slightly strange vibe that I couldn't pinpoint. Could just be me though!

This restaurant falls short of providing authentic Greek cuisine. The menu offers Americanized versions of Mediterranean classics, and the chefs have made several mistakes in traditional Greek recipes. For an authentic experience, it is recommended to visit Greektown in Detroit or Toronto. Avoid this place.

The best meal in New Orleans! The set price menu was amazing - fresh strawberry salad, outstanding chicken, and a yummy chocolate cake. Vegetarian options were great too. The staff was attentive and the location was excellent. Definitely the best meal in town.

The front desk staff, specifically Kris, provided excellent service by going above and beyond during a heavy rainstorm. They walked the reviewer and their pet, Leo, to the car with an umbrella. The reviewer has been taking their nervous pet, Leonidas, to the clinic for two years. Since seeing Dr. Deutsch, they have found him to be the best in terms of thoroughness and ensuring Leo's comfort.

"Farm fresh at its finest. Inventive, flavorful dishes and perfectly portioned. Cozy dining room, friendly atmosphere and attentive service provide the ideal backdrop for catching up with loved ones. Don't forget to bring your own wine, and definitely try the Bloody Beet Steak!"
Bomb offers a delicious Island Bowl that I always go for. Highly recommended for a healthy and satisfying meal. "For your health!" - Dr. Steve Bruhle

The burger had a deliciously juicy and glistening presence, elevated by high-quality ingredients. However, the thick slice of bacon was disappointingly pure white fat and didn't melt as desired. While the food was great, the communal table trend was disliked due to having to listen to strangers' conversations.

I've been a member at this convenient and reasonably priced gym for a few weeks now and I'm enjoying it. They have all the basic amenities, including plenty of cardio machines, weights, a lap pool, a spin class room, and a big aerobics studio. The staff is really nice and you get a free personal trainer session upon signing up. Your membership fee also allows you to use their other locations at no extra cost. They offer limited babysitting hours for those with kids. The only downsides are the late weekend opening time and the lack of early morning group fitness classes, except for a 5:45am spin class. Overall, if you're looking for a gym with friendly people and good equipment without the fancy extras, joining LA Fitness will save you some money.

If you're in Santa Barbara and craving sushi, Hiro San is your go-to. His mastery of the craft is unparalleled, and his friendly demeanor adds to the overall experience. Don't miss the chance to sit before this amazing chef, it's truly worth it.

This theater may be outdated, but the low prices and friendly staff make it worth visiting. Despite never being crowded, it offers a wide selection of major and Indie films that are hard to find elsewhere. Waiting for a movie to come here is a better choice in my opinion.

Fun place with an inviting interior and great outdoor seating. Brunch food was delicious and the beer selection was outstanding. However, our experience was dampened by a rude and unhelpful waiter who seemed unfamiliar with the menu, frequently disappeared, and brought out the wrong order twice. Disappointing service, or else this place would have earned four stars.

The restaurant offers a creative menu and the food is great. However, the lack of reservations can be a downside, especially on weekends. Additionally, waiting for a late friend can be a bit inconvenient since everyone in the party needs to be seated together. We also enjoyed the neighboring La Mulita.
Cool Springs on a Thursday had a comfortable 15-minute wait, even when Bonefish Grill was crowded. The food is consistently amazing.

We had a great experience at this busy restaurant in Tarpon Springs. The staff was efficient and our waiter was friendly. The food, including the Gyro, Chicken Slouvaki, and Spanokopita, was delicious. The only slight issue was that the top filo dough crust of the Spanokopita was a bit harder than desired. Overall, we enjoyed our visit and will definitely be returning when in Tarpon Springs.

The Gryphon Cafe is a hidden gem near Wayne Starbucks that attracts coffee aficionados with its serene ambiance and strong espresso lattes. While their baked goods may be hit or miss, the café supports a thriving local music scene with live performances on weekends.

Metamorphosis Tattoo Shop is worth giving five stars. Unlike other shops in Indianapolis, they run their business professionally and respect their customers. Trevor provided a fun and respectful 4-hour tattoo experience, giving me the tattoo I wanted in the location I desired. The prices are average, and they ask for a non-refundable deposit to ensure seriousness. Don't waste your time elsewhere, as Metamorphosis is a diamond in the rough. No rock star attitudes here. Can't wait to go back to Trevor.
I had a great experience with the lengua burrito. It had a clean presentation and wasn't greasy. The affordable price made it even more enjoyable. Looking forward to trying their flan next time.
The restaurant had poor and dark lighting, making it difficult to see the food. Unfortunately, all the dishes were average in taste. Disappointing, as I had higher expectations.

The banana pudding at this shop is absolutely amazing, even without extra toppings. The staff is genuinely caring and welcoming, making it a great experience for customers. I highly recommend supporting this shop and hope it continues to thrive for years to come.

Shepard's lacks accountability and provides poor customer service. Despite finding my lost organizer, they refused to address the missing $100 bill and did not take any steps to investigate the issue or help me retrieve my money. It is frustrating that they do not take responsibility for their guests' belongings.

This restaurant consistently ignores negative feedback and fails to address their issues. Dinner experience was terrible with a prime rib that was mostly fat and gristle. Even my dog refused to eat the leftovers. Cold fries were served and my request for regular butter was ignored. It's disappointing that the owner, Jeanne, does not make an effort to resolve these problems.

I'm giving them 4 stars because I haven't tried enough of their menu, but they have improved their pizza. The vegan general tso's pizza was delicious with a crispy and flavorful crust, generous "chicken" toppings, and a slight kick. They accommodated my vegan request and resolved a pricing issue promptly. Delivery was on time and hot. I highly recommend trying their homemade seitan. Will order from them again.

Conveniently located restaurant attached to Drury Plaza hotel, perfect for unfamiliar area. Good service for our large group, only minor issue with forgotten drinks. Huge portions and delicious food, especially the massive and tasty Cuban sandwich. The shandy is good, but avoid the margaritas, particularly the patron one. The shrimp tacos have a kick, but are still tasty.

Papertini deserves every single one of those glowing 5 stars! Their creatively designed wedding masterpieces go beyond traditional flowers with unique elements like papers, wires, and luxe fabrics. The team is not only talented but also friendly – a true asset to your wedding team. If you want something unique without being artsy-fartsy, I highly recommend them!

Mr. B's in New Orleans is a must-visit for a tasty and satisfying brunch. From the moment you step in, the jazz music creates a cozy atmosphere. The fresh loaf of bread is divine and the gumbo ya-ya is exactly what you'd expect. The BBQ shrimp, despite being messy, are rich and flavorful, accompanied by a divine sauce. Service is friendly and efficient, although the prices are a bit steep. If you have the chance, definitely give their brunch a try.

Nice steakhouse in St. Louis with a great view of the arch. The appetizers were okay, but the crab cakes were above average. Scallops were too sweet for my taste, but the filet mignon was exceptional - cooked perfectly rare. The wine list was above average, making it a great night out.

Recently, three of us at the office tried San Antonio Taco for the first time. Unfortunately, the food did not meet our expectations based on the reviews. The refried beans were overly salty and the rice was clumpy. Additionally, my beef enchiladas were difficult to eat as the beef was stringy and not prepared properly. Although I usually give a restaurant a second chance, I am uncertain if I will do so this time.

Cousin's in North Philly is the go-to spot over Fresh Grocer. Although the produce may not be top-notch and the hours can be inconvenient, you can find most essentials here for much cheaper than anywhere else. It's conveniently located near my apartment and a great alternative when you don't want to go to Trader Joe's. I'll be heading there tomorrow.

I've been to this place twice and it really depends on what you order. The Sausage and Pepper Pizza and the cream puff were amazing, but other items were just okay. The pizza had great flavor and the sausage/peppers had a nice kick. The cream puff cream was delicious and I wish it topped every dessert. The other sweets and bagels were good, but not great. The pepperoni pizza was bland and the pepperoni was sparse. The wait time was also frustrating. Despite these issues, I'll be back to try more of their treats, hoping for better experiences.

This speakeasy is a must-visit for its cool and chill atmosphere, combining class with a casual vibe. It's ideal for enjoying excellent cocktails/drinks accompanied by great music. However, be cautious as they only serve one unappetizing appetizer dish. Don't go expecting tasty food; it stays true to being a speakeasy.
Terrible experience. Overpaid for spoiled food and received an incorrect order. Won't be going back.

I would rate it 3.5 stars. They didn't have what I wanted and weren't willing to accommodate my requests. The glazed donuts were thick and dry, but the sliders and sundae were tasty. Probably won't come back.

I highly recommend this small cafe for its popular breakfast and brunch options. The salmon scramble with egg whites and tofu with brown rice breakfast plate were both delicious. The service was efficient, and I was seated promptly.

Went for dinner on a Friday at 6pm, expecting a packed place, but luckily it wasn't. Staff is friendly, atmosphere is like Magnolia Journal. Food and drinks are pretty dang good. Minus a star for slow cocktail service and appetizer arriving with the main course. Understandable as they're new, and I've worked in hospitality before.

The restaurant provides a quiet and nostalgic 1960's business ambience perfect for dining. Their menu offers both Tony's specialties and bar options; personally, I highly recommend the Risotto. Our table tried the special linguine with shrimp and lobster, as well as the strip steak, and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals. The service was exceptional, striking the perfect balance between attentiveness and not being overbearing.

This sushi spot is simply amazing! Their rolls are huge, service is excellent, and my personal favorites are the heat attack appetizer, Sapporo roll, and honey roll. The deep-fried rolls are a must-try, and everything looks incredibly fresh and appetizing. The presentation is top-notch. If you're feeling adventurous, go for the spicy sashimi bowl.

I had two visits at this bar and both times the service at the bar was terrible. The bartenders were unfriendly and showed no acknowledgment or response to my presence. Even though the bar had good reviews overall, the bartenders' attitude made me walk out and go elsewhere.

I absolutely love it here! Great atmosphere, wide range of options, and the lunch bento boxes are amazing. Don't miss out on their boba either. Those who complain are just overly picky. Give their beef braised soup a try, it's hearty and delicious.

This place exceeded our expectations! The decor is beautiful, creating a great atmosphere. The food is amazing and of better quality compared to other places at a similar price point. My husband loved the udon noodles, and the rolls, especially the Spicy Salmon, were a must-try. The flavors were tasteful, not overpowering. Overall, we had a wonderful experience here!

Lovely hotel with extremely friendly and helpful front desk staff. We enjoyed a peaceful night's sleep in a room away from the club. Perfect for those seeking a fun experience, but opt for a different location if you prefer a quiet stay.

The pizza and gnocchi here are amazing! The dishes are made with fresh ingredients and the menu has a nice variety. The atmosphere feels like a cozy family restaurant in Europe. Definitely the best pizza in middle Tennessee.
