I had high expectations for a $16 haircut, but I was pleasantly surprised. The haircut was professionally done, complemented my face shape, and improved the health of my hair. The shampoo smelled great and the stylist was thorough. The only downside was the waiting time, but it was worth it for the quality result. The salon's focus on training and checklists ensures a great experience. Just remember to allocate enough time for the appointment.

My daughter's wedding at the Presidio Chapel was an absolute dream come true. Rain Longo, the coordinator, was incredibly patient, supportive, and enthusiastic throughout the entire process. The chapel itself provided an outstanding and authentic atmosphere, and the beautiful adjoining room was perfect for getting ready. The 6-hour rental was affordable and all the staff made our special day absolutely perfect. Thank you to everyone involved!

I had a mixed experience at the waxing salon. Miriam, the wax specialist, was knowledgeable and efficient. However, she focused more on promoting products and criticizing my regular shaving instead of providing a satisfactory experience. While my brows and lower legs were well done, there were stray hairs left on my underarms. Additionally, small traces of wax were left on my skin. Overall, I left feeling unprepared for the beach.

The food at this restaurant was very good, especially the pad see ew and The King and I stir fry. The only issue was the noise level, as it was difficult to have a conversation without shouting. If they can improve the noise level, they would definitely receive a higher rating. The portion sizes were decent and the service was attentive. Overall, a positive experience with the exception of the noise level.

I had a negative experience with this rental car company. Not only was my valuable radar detector stolen from the car, but the cleanliness of the vehicles was also subpar. I found plastic bottles and sticky substances in the car multiple times, showing a lack of attention to detail. I hope they review their surveillance cameras to identify the employee responsible for theft and provide me with a refund.

This place is amazing! The atmosphere is laid back and welcoming, and they even let us bring our dog. We enjoyed sitting on the cozy wrap around porch outside. It was the perfect ending to our trip, and the food kept me full for the long car ride home. I had the delicious but rich bananas foster French toast, and although I couldn't finish it due to the generous portion size, it was still amazing. My fiancé opted for the vegetable omelet, a healthier choice that was also delicious. I can't wait to go back and try something else from their menu, perhaps one of their famous juices next time.
Great food, generous portions for the price! The staff, especially the girl behind the counter, is incredibly friendly and always wears a smile. Wish I worked closer, would love to visit more often.
The scenery is stunning, providing a beautiful backdrop for running, walking, hiking, and biking. The trail offers ample opportunities to rest and take short breaks at various seating spots.
Extremely slow service; a 40-minute wait for a pasta and salad. Not the fault of the waitress, but rather the kitchen. Perfect if you're hoping to prolong your date.

This place is a wonderful Mexican restaurant located downtown. The chips, salsa, beans, and guacamole are all delicious. The chimichanga bites are fantastic with their amazing sauce. The street tacos and enchiladas for dinner are amazing. Although they don't have a full bar, their margaritas are strong and tasty. The service is very good, with a friendly and attentive server. Overall, a 4 out of 5 stars as it's a good Mexican restaurant, just not my absolute favorite.
Holy Rolls is an incredible find! With their tasty rolls, excellent service, reasonable prices, and abundant healthy choices, it's a true gem. Don't miss out on their sushi, it's worth every dollar!

We had an outstanding experience at this restaurant. The food, including Gumbo Ya Ya, BBQ shrimp, and crab cakes, was exceptional, and the service was fantastic. We enjoyed everything we ordered and strongly recommend this place.
Amazing 20-minute workout! Skeptic turned believer, I'm now addicted and feeling fantastic. Chelsey is an awesome trainer to work with too!

Overall Rating: 3 stars

The adorable atmosphere and outstanding location of this restaurant receive 5 stars. However, the food experience was a bit underwhelming. The smoked turkey club I had was mostly good, but the meat was not impressive. The creamed spinach was enjoyable, but the mac n cheese was dry and bland, which was disappointing considering the additional cost. Despite this, I am not giving up on this place yet. I am determined to go back and try something else because I really want to love it.
Brunch on NYE weekend was amazing! Cozy decor, devoured the delicious Eggs Veney in minutes. Great food and a wonderful experience!

Ali Ba Ba's is definitely a hidden gem in NOLA for late-night kababs, shwarma, and gyros. Despite the higher price and limited hot sauce options, their gyros are tastier than the nearby slice joint or hot dog stands. While they can be a bit slow with service, the larger portion sizes and satisfying flavors make it worth the visit.
This place offers great food, incredible customer service, and is a hidden gem in the community with an excellent location.

I had an amazing experience at this place! The Turkish coffee was delightful, and the veggie wrap and cheese steak were also delicious. The restaurant's café section and overall ambiance were great. I'll definitely return if I'm in West Philly again. 5 stars!

I love Jones! The food is divine with comfort food to the max. The calamari is the best I've had in a while. The Duncan Hines yellow cake for dessert is a genius choice. The roast beef dinner is a winner, and the halibut has amazing flavor. Can't wait to go back again, yum yum yum!

The Penang chicken with chicken flavored white rice is consistently delicious whether in Boston or Philly. Despite the long line, we were seated surprisingly quickly within 15-20 minutes. From start to finish, the service was fast, allowing me to enjoy the juicy and amazing chicken without much wait. I made the mistake of not ordering to go, and regretted it as soon as I got back home. Next time, I'll indulge and be greedy by getting takeout to enjoy in Virginia.
The wait time was excessively long with plenty of available seating options.

Screamagedon is an awesome and thrilling attraction, definitely worth visiting again next year. Some of the houses feel incredibly realistic, adding to the overall experience. The haunted hayride with fire torches, machine guns, chainsaws, demonic priests, and churches is absolutely spectacular. Walking through the woods with only a glow stick is both awesome and scary, giving a very real feeling. Forget about other popular Halloween events like Bush Gardens Howl-O-Scream and Halloween Horror Nights, Screamagedon has it all.

Overall, I had an excellent experience with this service. After requesting online, I received a callback within 30-45 minutes and was able to schedule an appointment swiftly. Shanna, the professional, arrived promptly and provided valuable information about prevention methods. She thoroughly checked both mine and my daughter's heads and provided full treatment. Although it was a bit pricey, I had already tried over-the-counter solutions and was not satisfied. The comb they used, which is not sold in stores, was highly effective at gathering nits. My only complaint is that the comb should be included in the session, rather than being an additional cost. However, I purchased it for future use.

The BBQ Chicken Sandwich is a great deal at only $5.75! The chicken was perfectly grilled and you have the freedom to choose your own toppings/sauces. The option of grilled sourdough, wheat bun, or white bun adds variety to the sandwich. Overall, a neat and affordable choice.

Delivery took excessively long, despite being close by. Claimed driver had numerous orders to deliver, which is absurd. Waited almost two hours, highly disappointing. Shrimp scampi was oddly prepared, with excessive additions. Only redeeming item was the sweet potato cheesecake. Cheesecake deserves five stars, but I would only consider ordering that item again from this place.
Despite the pretentious service and long wait, this place serves the absolute best burger. That's all you need to know.

The hi-energy gym in Tampa is impressive! I utilized my Perms Plus membership while visiting from Atlanta and had a great experience. The yoga class was enjoyable, and the gym itself is spacious with a wide variety of equipment. Additionally, the free two-hour parking in the garage was convenient, and I even received two guest passes for my local coworker.

Always fresh and delicious homemade food. Friendly staff and great Italian specialties. The rolls are also excellent. Disregard the negative comment, the owners truly care about customer satisfaction.

I purchased a used 09 Rav4 from Glanzmann Subaru last month. The process was simple, but I was disappointed with the vehicle's description. There were several aesthetic defects not mentioned by the sales team, which took away from the overall value. I expected a more honest and direct interaction from this family-owned dealership. I urge Mr. Jeff Glanzmann to prioritize honesty in their sales process.

I wholeheartedly agree with the 5-star reviews! This boutique is exceptionally clean and well-maintained. Lori's waxing skills are top-notch, and she made me feel entirely at ease. The blue hard wax surpassed my expectations, and I won't be returning to regular waxing again. The option for a custom wax is an added bonus. Thanks to Yelp reviewers, I discovered this gem and have already booked my next appointment.

Avoid this dealership at all costs. Despite my multiple attempts to give them another chance, they consistently find ways to take advantage of customers. Even though my whole family drives Hyundai, I will no longer be dealing with them.

My girlfriends and I dined at the Creole House for dinner due to its proximity to our hotel. The bacon garlic oysters were average, as the flavors were overpowered by the cheese and bacon. The jumbo buffalo wings were tasty and well-seasoned. The jumbalaya pasta lacked flavor and was our least favorite, while the blackened red fish was just okay. The sautéed veggies accompanying the dish were excessively salty. The canal street red fish wasn't great and lacked garlic sauce. The paddle boat drinks tasted good but were more juice than alcohol. Overall, the food was underwhelming, earning the restaurant a solid 3 stars. On a positive note, our server, Alexander, provided excellent hospitality and tried his best to ensure our satisfaction.

I had high expectations for BlackFinn due to the hype, but unfortunately, it fell short. The atmosphere and staff were pleasant, but the food was disappointing. My Cuban sandwich had mustard despite requesting it to be held, and my boyfriend's Prime Rib sandwich had more bread than meat. The au jus was also lacking. They forgot the swiss cheese on my sandwich, resulting in multiple returns. The manager was accommodating and apologized, but overall, it was a letdown. Two stars for the polite staff and manager. I might give them another chance, but my boyfriend's doubts remain.

Unfortunately, I had a terrible experience with the service at this Bob Evans location. Despite loving their food, the service really needs improvement. My family and I were seated for 10 minutes without anyone offering us a drink or any service. Although there were waitresses constantly passing by, they didn't bother to acknowledge us. It took two servers to apologize for the misunderstanding about who would serve our table, even though the restaurant wasn't busy. The food was good, but the service was very slow.
I have been consistently using them for my business mail for years and they have been fantastic. The team is great and their service is top-notch. I highly rate and recommend them.

Great pho place in Reno with authentic flavors and reasonable prices. Perfect portions and the homemade fish sauce adds extra deliciousness. Love the small family business atmosphere. Will definitely be returning!

This place is amazing! The gyros are delicious and the takeout service is on point. Although I haven't dined in, the diverse atmosphere with Bosnian people adds to its charm. I've heard the restaurant is also clean. Cheers to this place for their awesome gyros!

This hidden gem of a hookah bar is a must-visit for any hookah enthusiast. Stepping inside, you are greeted with an authentic and inviting atmosphere. The floor cushions and metal mandala tables add to the charm. The menu offers a variety of drinks, food, and hookah flavors at reasonable prices. "Sex on the beach" shisha was a crowd favorite - smooth and enjoyable. What sets this place apart is its calm and relaxing ambiance, making it a top choice for those seeking a low-key and peaceful hookah experience.

I found the best salon for a gel manicure through Yelp. The staff was friendly, the salon was beautiful and clean. Kim, my nail tech, did an excellent job. A pleasant experience overall. Will definitely return.

We had an outstanding dining experience at this restaurant. The food was impeccable, from the perfectly cooked Jambalaya and Shrimp Etouffee to the fantastic Seafood Gumbo with a great mix of seafood and okra. The shrimp in the Etouffee dish was firm, clean, and tasted incredibly fresh. The Bread Pudding with praline sauce was a perfect match for the meal, and the Cafe du Monde coffee was a delightful addition. Undoubtedly, one of the best dining experiences we had during our visit to NOLA.
Solid cheesesteaks with tasty cheese fries. However, not unique enough to justify a long journey, as you can find similar options throughout Philadelphia.

Overall, the takoyaki was tasty but a bit doughy and greasy, requiring a acquired taste or being drunk to fully appreciate. It's worth a try for a first venture, but be aware that they are heavy for their size. As for the curry chicken, it was disappointing with a rich roux and not the best I've had. Despite this, it's still worth another visit for Japanese fast food.
This place offers nice wines and a great location. It's a shame they don't serve food, but their dog-friendly policy allows you to bring your own and enjoy the view with your pup. Lovely!

I absolutely loved the atmosphere, Connor's excellent service, and my dinner at this restaurant. The cakes, barley soup, and shrimp ravioli were all delicious, and the Malbec wine complemented my meal perfectly. It was my first visit, and I was thrilled to discover that they serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I highly recommend this place and will definitely return in the future.

I highly recommend this place for breakfast. The juevos rancheros were amazing. We also tried the chips and salsa and my wife loved the homemade tamale. Everything tasted great, especially the spicy salsa. We will definitely be returning.

Burger Up offers an upscale take on burgers, with tasty flavors and a variety of toppings. The meat itself lacked flavor, but overall the burger was well-cooked. The truffle fries are a must-try. The beer menu is interesting, featuring unique options from the Deep South. It could be a good spot for post-meal drinks. Overall, Burger Up is a decent alternative to traditional dive bar burgers. 3.50 stars.

Mandala is the perfect place to get all your massage supplies, with great prices and helpful staff. Lisa, who works there, is friendly and knowledgeable. She guided me through their extensive selection of essential oils and created a perfect blend just for me. The shop is affordable, even compared to online prices, and you can try out the products in person without any additional shipping charges. I highly recommend shopping at Mandala to support this fantastic small business. They have recently moved to a charming Victorian-style home on South Virginia.

5/5 stars: Charming shop with delicious food and generous portions. The focus on alcohol shines, particularly with their fantastic ciders. Wasn't a fan of the meads, but fell in love with their cider and even brought one back home to the east coast.
Morning Call is the superior choice for beignets in Metarie compared to this shop. However, if you insist on going to Cafe Du Monde, it's worth the twenty-minute drive to Decatur, including parking.

I highly recommend the beautiful new nail salon on West Chester Pike. The staff is friendly, the salon is brand new, and the prices are good. The serene colors and pedi chairs with phone chargers add to the overall experience.

Wow! I highly recommend this massage place. Simon's hands are incredibly talented in relaxing your muscles and getting rid of any kinks. The atmosphere is comfortable and desirable, making the experience even better. The prices are affordable, and the foot massage was fantastic as well. Don't underestimate the importance of human touch, and I suggest scheduling an appointment during early evening hours for an hour full body massage. This place is a little slice of heaven worth indulging in.

My boyfriend and I finally visited the new sushi spot around the corner and it didn't disappoint! Tuna Bar is a must-visit for sushi lovers. The ambiance, service, and food were exceptional during their soft opening. The owner/executive chef takes pride in his accomplishments, and rightfully so. We're excited to see what's in store for Tuna Bar and can't wait to have it just a short walk away!
This dive bar goes beyond expectations with its old wood panel walls, disgusting smell and tiny drinks. I have no desire to ever return.

Fantastic experience! The food is amazing, atmosphere is great, and the hostess radiates positive energy. My friend loved it and can't wait to return. The shrimp salad with lime chili dressing was a refreshing delight.

The place has significantly deteriorated in terms of food quality. The pork steak was dry and tough, and it would have been nice to have the option to choose a sauce. The BBQ nachos, which we used to enjoy here, were soggy and tasteless. Despite being there on a slow Saturday evening, the quality seemed to have declined. However, the service was still good, just like before. Overall, we most likely won't be returning.
Excellent professional service! Had a great experience today, even though I forgot to ask for my stylist's name. She did an incredibly good job! You have definitely earned my trust.

Had an amazing meal at Spiro's tonight - from the tableside prepared Greek salad to the mouthwatering combo plate with moussaka, dolmas, and lamb. Our server, Ben, was fantastic and even surprised us with a complimentary dessert. We lost track of time because we were so comfortable and well fed. Spiro's will definitely be my new regular spot! Thank you, Ben and the Spiro's crew!
Terrible experience. Long wait time, very brief consultation, and no medication provided for pain relief. Lacks compassion and definitely not recommended for those seeking caring treatment.
The restaurant had good food, with a reasonable price for the meal box. Cashier Alessandra was very polite and respectful. The food tasted great too. I would definitely come back if I'm in the area.

Great initiative on ditching straws for the environment! However, the ingredients in the mixers could be better. Unfortunately, the energy of the bar staff on Saturday evening was lacking, and their Margarita was disappointing. It's a simple drink, so it should have been better.

I attended my first BarreAmped class at the Music Row location and it exceeded my expectations. The class had a welcoming and friendly atmosphere, and the instructor was very attentive. The only downside was the small and oddly shaped room, which could be problematic if the class was at maximum capacity. Additionally, locating the studio was a bit confusing due to the lack of signage. Despite these minor inconveniences, I still had a great workout and would consider going again.
Terrible service. Put on hold multiple times, rude staff, wrong order delivered, and unhelpful response. Avoid at all costs.
The chicken and French toast were amazing! Patio could use more shade, but overall enjoyable experience. Pet-friendly. We'll return!

I am grateful to this place for offering a much needed late-night snack during my visit to Nashville. They allowed pick-up at 2 AM, so I didn't have to wait for delivery. Despite the initial impression that the pizza wouldn't be impressive, it turned out to be surprisingly delicious. My only regret is not ordering a bigger size!

I had a disappointing experience with this delivery service. The food order was wrong, and it arrived over an hour later than promised. Additionally, all the food was either undercooked or overcooked. This was a one-time experience, and I won't be ordering from them again. Disappointing.
Fantastic spot in Nashville for a good time! Amazing drink deals on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Food is decent.
I love their salads, tea, and french fries! The servers were excellent, and I've been here multiple times, so I'll definitely be back!
Fantastic spot for a family brunch: clean venue, exceptional staff, and delightful decor. A major win as my picky four-year-old even enjoyed the food. Impressive!

I absolutely loved this adorable tea shop! They have an amazing variety of loose leaf teas and tea accessories. The drinks and sweets are not only delicious, but also creatively made. The relaxing ambience makes it a perfect spot to unwind. As a tea enthusiast, I thoroughly enjoyed perusing through the owner's collection of tea books. The owner is incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and passionate about tea. I can't wait to visit again!
Excellent food and service, with standout antipasto and freshly flavored pasta. The Fisherman's stew impresses with generous servings of tender fish in saffron sauce.

Muriel's in NOLA is a must-visit. The goat cheese and shrimp crepes are unparalleled, possibly the best I've ever had. The rest of the meal matched the appetizer's excellence. Service is top-notch and the venue captures the essence of the French Quarter. Ghost tours outside the window can be slightly distracting during dinner, but the incredible food makes up for it. Don't believe the rumors - Muriel's is only haunted by its extraordinary cuisine.
Visited this Taco Bell near closing time, initially ignored by the staff despite the open lights. Eventually, a young man at the window helped us.
Cute place to eat at, but disappointed by limited breakfast menu. Okay omelet and flavorless biscuit. Quick seating during the week, but weekends may get crowded.

Expensive but worth it. Upgraded to executive locker rooms for convenience. Some machines need maintenance, but facility is welcoming. Variety of classes and equipment options. Limited weekend hours and inconvenient class schedule. Overall, happy with membership.

This place is amazing! The bar staff, especially Ally, is fantastic. She is incredibly kind and attentive, even when things get busy. The vibe is cool and the indoor and outdoor seating options are great. A wonderful addition to the Funk Zone. Highly recommend, and make sure to say hi to Ally for me! A++
Great experience! The bartender was amazing, offering ice-cold beer and a decent lunch menu. It's best to visit during non-peak hours for consistently good service. Will definitely return.

Great hotel with a friendly environment, perfect for adults and families. Only drawback was not all pools being open during Memorial Day weekend. Loved the variety of dining options and the amazing atrium. Location is a bit far from town, but convenient between music row and the airport. Staff was exceptional and the hotel had a clean and charming atmosphere. Would definitely stay here again.

I highly recommend this self-service fro-yo establishment at the Manayunk Arts Festival. The quality of the fresh frozen yogurt and toppings is excellent, and the service is great. There are countless flavor and topping options, making it hard to choose. The toasted coconut yogurt with rainbow sprinkles, fresh strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries was delicious. They also have a variety of candy toppings for chocolate lovers. The establishment is kept very clean and looks as new as it did when it first opened. Additionally, they offer paper cup samples to help you decide on the perfect flavor.

This chain's trendiness has declined, leaving behind overpriced and questionably good food. It mainly consists of fried items with similar breading, which becomes monotonous. The coconut shrimp and hush puppies were overcooked, which was disappointing. The mix of Coke Zero on tap could be improved. While there is a lot of food for the price, the quality is lacking. The decor is cool and the location by the Boise River is nice, but there are better local places worth trying instead.
This bar allows smoking and has a strong smell of smoke. The bartender was friendly but the drinks, specifically the bloody mary, were not impressive. Overall, it is a dim and smoky dive.

I visited this friendly family restaurant just north of Gulfport and had a great experience. Despite arriving after the rush, I was immediately welcomed and attended to. The staff was friendly and quick to bring me the breakfast menu and coffee. The food, a ham omelet with home fries and toast, was delicious and prepared perfectly. The radio played golden oldies from the 70s, which was a nice touch. Overall, a welcoming and appreciated atmosphere that kept me full for hours.

This place is an absolute gem! From their incredible wine selection and delicious Lebanese cuisine, to the fantastic hookahs, this place truly has it all. I honestly believe their Lebanese food is the best in the city. Highly recommended!

Highly recommended by a colleague, we visited Red Mess and were greeted by Chris who provided exceptional service. From the appetizers to the drinks and entrees, everything was delicious. A memorable dining experience indeed!

I've been to three different Brick House locations across the country, and this one is definitely one of the few chain restaurants I actually enjoy. The food is incredibly unique and every item on the menu is a winner. The service at this particular location was above average, and I'll definitely be returning when I'm in town again.
Siam is the classiest spot in the block, with top-grade sashimi, a perfect outdoor patio, and killer deep house grooves. The crowd is diverse and there is no pretense. Siam is the sh*t!

16th Street Seafood, located on Tasker Street, left me intrigued with its worn down signage. However, upon entering, I was disappointed by its lackluster decor. The limited seafood selection consisting mainly of frozen crab cakes, breaded fish fillets, clams, and crabs was also underwhelming. Despite my reservations, I decided to go ahead and place an order. Opting for mussels in butter and garlic sauce, I found the dish to be satisfactory, although it came with an unsatisfactory number of closed shells - 9. The broth had a surprisingly spicy kick, and the packaging for the to-go order was excellent. However, the 2 fried shrimps I added to my order were nothing special and felt overpriced at $1.25 each.

We used a groupon and decided to give this place a try. The lobsters were great, although a few sizes were unavailable that night. Our waitress Jessica was attentive, friendly, and provided some good recommendations. Overall, the restaurant isn't fancy, but it offers good quality lobster.
The cafe is a great upscale spot with plenty of affordable options. I really enjoy lunching here with someone, although I wish they had a lox bagel sandwich on the menu.

Animo Juice is hands down the best find in Haddonfield. Their real juice menu started it all, but now they offer an amazing selection of burritos as well. The prices are reasonable, with my favorite burrito being the "Haight & Ashbury." If you're not too hungry, they also offer smaller versions called "petitos" that are equally delicious. Their breakfast petito and Animo MD juice are the perfect hangover cure. Don't forget to try their signature juices, frozen whipped bananas, and yogurt/granola bowls. Animo Juice is definitely setting the standard for juice bars in the city.

I had an amazing birthday experience in SB with Wine Edventures! Sean was a friendly and funny guide who took us to 3 wineries and 1 brewery. He provided interesting explanations during the drive and lessons during the tastings. The lunch at the vineyard was delicious, and the souvenir wine glasses and bottled water were a nice touch. I highly recommend this adventure to anyone seeking a fun day in SB.

This is hands down my favorite sushi spot in Delaware. The menu is simple yet executed perfectly, with reasonably priced rolls that are bursting with fish. The use of flash-frozen sashimi grade fish doesn't compromise the flavor, as the color, texture, taste, and smell are all flawless. The spicy tuna roll is nothing short of incredible, thanks to the combination of kewpie mayo, sriracha, and sichimi powder. I can't get enough of this place, often having it for lunch every day for weeks. The addition of short-grain brown sushi rice has been a fantastic touch. Watching YC Park, The Sushiman, work his magic is mesmerizing, as he effortlessly skins a cucumber with a sushi knife and transforms it into a nori sheet for his rolls. The temaki rolls are massive, packed with fish, and the nigiri is beautifully presented. While I save my 5-star rating for places that serve locally caught fresh fish, Tokyo is a must-visit for sushi lovers. Support the owners in these challenging times and skip Kooma and save Mikimotos for a special night out. If you crave sushi, look no further than Tokyo!

Despite the criticism, I find this place to be excellent. The staff is friendly, service is fast, and prices are affordable. I don't understand the complaints about the dry chicken fingers, as they tasted great to me. The honey mustard is delicious and the salads are packed with veggies. The fries are also delicious, and they even include cole slaw with the chicken finger platter. It's convenient being located just a few steps away from my apartment, and the food is decent. I don't understand the greasy spoon comments since it's a pizza joint, not a fancy restaurant. People come here for cheap food, not ambiance.
Lazo's cheesesteak was amazing! They provided friendly and speedy service, which really made my day!

Overall, the ambience of the restaurant was okay despite being located in a mall in New Hope. The service was slow due to being understaffed, but the staff was apologetic and pleasant. The wait was worth it. The Vegetable Samosas were delicious, however, the chicken was slightly dry. The chicken tikka masala was flavorful and rich, while the chicken tagine was amazing. The restaurant has a laid-back atmosphere, and the menu offers a good mix of cuisines with just enough options. It is BYOB, so we were unprepared but would definitely return.

This adorable local ice cream spot in Tucson serves high-quality and tasty treats. However, prices are a bit steep, with a regular single scoop costing $4.50. Overall, it deserves 4 stars due to the slightly higher prices.

This cool ass brewery/bar boasts a unique decor that perfectly matches its name. Despite the afternoon crowd, we easily found three seats. The beer selection is great, particularly for those who love imperial stouts. While there's no food available, you're welcome to bring your own or check out the numerous nearby eateries across the street.

This BBQ place is absolutely amazing! The colorful and laid-back atmosphere combined with the delicious beef brisket and smoked sausage made for a perfect dining experience. We will definitely be returning next time we're craving BBQ!
5 stars - Incredible breakfast deal! With great service, I enjoyed a tasty meal along with unlimited coffee, all for just four dollars. It's even cheaper than my daily bus fare.
Great atmosphere and amazing sushi, but be prepared for a long wait due to its popularity. Plus, you may even run into some famous faces at the bar!
Highly recommend this inn! Gorgeous room, convenient location right next to the streetcar route to the canal. Loved it!
Highly recommended, perfect in every aspect - food, service, price, ambiance. Every menu item tried was delicious and healthy. Clearly prepared with love by the owner.

I recently discovered my new favorite pizza place where I had the opportunity to create my own pizza. I piled on pepperoni, sliced red onions, and roasted garlic for the perfect combination. The pizza had the right amount of cheese, pepperoni, and onions without overpowering any flavors. The roasted garlic, unlike your typical minced garlic, was exceptional. The 10" size was just right for two people, and I can't wait to go back soon. Plus, they offer a free pizza through their survey!
Amazing breakfast spot! Delicious and healthy food options alongside tempting alternatives. Fantastic ambiance, top-notch service, and delightful dishes.
Excellent service, impressive bodywork, and thorough interior cleaning. The consistent text updates from Randy were greatly appreciated, ensuring I was always informed about my car's progress.

Initially had a negative experience, but after giving it another chance, my opinion has changed. If looking for Greek/Mediterranean food, it might be worth trying. Bubble tea is a standout. Avoided the place initially due to poor food quality and service.

I will not return to this place. Scheduled an appointment for transmission and differential fluid change, but they did a transmission flush instead without my consent. The cost was double of what I expected and they didn't even do the full synthetic oil change as requested. Poor communication and not following customer preferences. Will be disputing the charges with my bank.

We absolutely love M.L. Rose! The beer flights are a lot of fun for beer enthusiasts like me. The neighborhood atmosphere is perfect, not too trendy or outdated. The service is always top-notch. However, the food can be a letdown. The wings lack crispiness, burgers are sometimes not cooked to preference, and the spinach artichoke dip is just average. The steak and Gouda sandwich was terrible, with an undercooked and fatty steak on bread. We were informed that it's being removed from the menu, but it should have been gone earlier. Moreover, there was no interaction with the manager when we returned the sandwich, which was disappointing. Despite these issues, we will continue to visit because we are big fans, but it would be great if the kitchen could improve and make my favorite burger cooked perfectly.

The wait was a bit long, but it was definitely worth it! The biscuits were amazing and on point. If you're craving delicious chicken, biscuits, and honey, this is the place to go. Bonus point - they have multiple locations so you can easily find one near you.

Overall, the reviewer had a positive experience at the water park. The facilities were clean, the lifeguards were attentive, and they enjoyed the smaller crowd due to visiting during a non-typical time. However, they found the water and air temperature to be a bit cold, and the park was smaller compared to other indoor water parks. They were also slightly annoyed by the periodic closures of the big slides. The reviewer believes that timing is crucial for a pleasant visit and suggests using AAA cards for savings.

The impeccable interior design, friendly staff, and spot-on food make for a great dining experience. The sauce and toss special is a must-try if you want something unique. I'll definitely be returning to explore more of the menu. Well done!

Great food, but extremely disappointed with the poor service. Our waitress was absent most of the time, and I was unexpectedly presented with the check while I was still eating. The food is good though, which saves the experience.

A group of us tried a variety of dishes and the squid steak was truly outstanding. The flavor was exceptional. However, the slow service and overly expensive prices were disappointing. Despite this, with improved service and more reasonable prices, they would have earned 4 stars.

I absolutely loved the concept and had a wonderful experience at this place. The food was delicious, especially the cheesecake. The attentive service from our waiter made the experience even better. Can't wait to return and try their cinnamon rolls. We will definitely be back.

Meijer is convenient and amazing, but the Starbucks inside is hit or miss. The employees seem untrained, as they constantly need to check prices and they can't consistently make my drink. This morning, my drink didn't look right and when I mentioned it, the lady poured some out and added more milk. I didn't want to pay $4 for a cup of milk, but she didn't seem to care, so there was no point in complaining.

I highly recommend Dawn Patrol for their amazing eggs and generous portions of hash. The burger lacked cheese, but was still tasty. Their homemade pastries, bread, and jellies are absolutely delicious.

Arrived late for food, limited options available. Opted for a pizza, crust was too thick. Explored the store and discovered Scharffenberger chocolate, which satisfied our cravings. Staff seemed tired at 8pm.
I had a delicious cheeseburger with avocado and tried the ranchero fries at this lunch spot. The food was outstanding, earning a 10/10 rating. However, the slow service was a drawback.
Amazing food, exceptional service from George. The crab cakes were delightful. Overall, a fantastic dining experience.

Our wedding at Winters Creek Lodge was amazing! Judit was incredible, helping us organize everything and accommodating our vision. The venue received rave reviews from guests for its stunning views. Our photos are breathtaking and the food was delicious. Highly recommend working with Judit and Winters Creek Lodge.

Kanella offers the best brunch in Philly with a cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. Their Cyprus Breakfast is a standout, featuring delicious eggs, Greek ham, fried halloumi, and more. The menu also has a variety of Greek and Mediterranean specialties. The service is attentive, and reservations are recommended due to limited space. A stellar choice for a weekend morning or post-party recovery. Excited to try their dinner menu next time.

I give this place two stars only for their good gravy fries, but their sandwiches are awful. The meat is badly sliced, tough, and dry, making it inedible. Locals who rave about this place haven't tried anything better. Go to Wawa for an edible sandwich instead.

Avoid this place at all costs. They prioritize money over customer satisfaction and are hesitant to accept returns. Their cash-only policy and focus on selling damaged items should raise major red flags. Do yourself a favor and steer clear, as they don't deserve any support.

We were pleasantly surprised by the food but disappointed with the service and rude staff. The pulled pork, brisket tacos, and pulled chicken were delicious, although the sides were average. The bill for five of us, including a kids meal, came close to $60. Two main complaints were the lack of ribs for lunch and dirty bathrooms.

The dinner experience was inconsistent; some dishes were authentic while others resembled American Chinese food. The duck had a high fat content and minimal meat. The stir-fry combinations were odd and didn't blend well. Additionally, the service lacked friendliness, typical of a Chinese restaurant.

I used to dread going to hair salons because of the phony atmosphere and small talk, but then I discovered Andre's salon. Andre and Christopher are both amazing stylists who make me feel comfortable and at ease. They are talented, down-to-earth, and my hair always looks fantastic after they work their magic. The salon also supports charity events and has convenient online scheduling. Great prices, great cuts, great color, and great people - Andre's salon is the best choice for your next hair appointment!
Incredible and distinctive dishes. Exceptional bobba and pork pancake.

Prohibition is a nice, old school space with a long bar that feels reminiscent of western establishments, which is a bit unusual for Philadelphia. The atmosphere is not too loud, making conversations easy, especially during early hours. The service from the bar staff is great. They offer several beers on tap, including a solid local IPA, but the wine selection is limited. Despite having a small menu, the food is very good, with standout dishes like the elote and cucumber salad. However, the star of the menu is the brat plate, served on a cool wooden board and accompanied by German potato salad, sauerkraut, pretzel, and a delicious hot salsa/relish. It's worth noting that Prohibition is located in a somewhat questionable neighborhood, which may deter some visitors from walking back if it's late at night.

I highly recommend On the Run convenience store and BP gas station at Lambert-St. Louis International Airport. It's conveniently located near the rental car return area, saving you from the hassle of searching for a gas station. The service is efficient with easy payment options at the pump. I refueled quickly and was soon on my way to Hertz.

This historical building is meticulously preserved and offers an exclusive experience. Our visit granted us a private tour with a knowledgeable Park Ranger. Moreover, collectors of National Park Stamps will be thrilled to find a selection here.

The service and cleanliness of the restaurant were excellent. However, the food was average, particularly the rotini primavera which should be avoided. Although the sauce had a delicious taste, the vegetables were clearly sourced from frozen products, which was disappointing. Considering the abundance of fresh produce available in Tucson, it is unnecessary to use frozen vegetables in dishes.

Fresh Market has helpful staff, specifically Thomas in the meat section. However, the overall experience went downhill from there. The Swiss cheese we ordered was poorly cut, resulting in one clump instead of slices. The ricotta cheese we bought was bad despite being within the expiration date. The tomatoes on the vine spoiled quickly, and prices were high while selection was poor. The pound cakes were dry and tasteless. Although the store was clean with parking available, it was ultimately a disappointing shopping trip. Additionally, conflicting information regarding cash withdrawal limits added to the dissatisfaction. It is recommended to shop at Weaver's Way, Whole Foods, or Wegmann's instead.

I only went once, but I am eager to go back. The Dugout in Fletcher Place is a fantastic bar reminiscent of my neighborhood favorite, J Clydes. It's a cozy hole-in-the-wall spot with a good drink selection, affordable Sun King beer at $4.50, tasty happy hour appetizers, and the highlight - hot pepper cheese balls! No more waiting for my Mug N' Bun trips to satisfy my craving for these delicious fried treats. I also had a great experience here. Can't wait to go back!

The Big Scoop is a great addition to the ice cream scene in Warminster. Despite the seasonal closures, the wait was worth it. The range of products served, friendly service, and tasty ice cream make it a family-friendly spot. With limited competition, it easily earns four stars.
Saguaro East: Suitable for casual desert exploration. Standard desert landscape, similar to Phoenix area. Friendly visitor center and staff.
The staff is amazing, always helpful even close to closing time. The website offers coupons for 40% off a regular priced item, so you're always getting a great deal. Great store overall!

This coffee shop is conveniently open early and late, making it a great spot for getting work done or grabbing a drink to go. It's located in a busy area where locals hang out and on the way to popular music venues. While the food is not the cheapest or local, it's a healthier option compared to greasy fast food. Service can vary depending on how busy it is, but sometimes there can be a long wait. The option to self-queue is available, which is convenient. The coffee shop also offers tall cookies, which are loved by the reviewer. Lastly, it's worth mentioning that they offer shots in their coffee, a unique feature for a coffee shop in New Orleans.

I had a negative experience at this venue due to the disrespectful treatment by the bouncer. Despite being on the guest list, I was accused of sneaking in for free and denied entry. I will not be returning.

The salad portions at this spot are generous and I personally love the Greek salad. They also serve a delicious rustic roast beef sandwich, a rarity among Nick's locations. If you're having guests over, I'd highly recommend getting an XL pizza, as it's surprisingly one of their better options.

Overall, I really enjoyed this place. It has a hipster vibe similar to Este Sugarhouse in Salt Lake, but the pizza and beer selection are much better here. I plan to come back regularly to try more of their menu. Each location has a unique charm, and whoever is running them is doing a great job. However, the ordering system is clunky and disorganized, which is a downside. Despite that, I highly recommend this spot for pizza and a brew.

New St. Louis Wok is a reliable local Chinese restaurant that delivers to our area. Orders are consistently delivered within an hour, and their online ordering website helps overcome language barriers. They request credit card information over a call for added convenience. Their food is excellent, avoiding excessive greasiness, and always arrives hot with a variety of sauces and fortune cookies. When we crave Chinese food, it is our top choice.
Osaka is my top choice for sushi. The prices are affordable and the rolls are simply incredible. If you're looking to explore a new sushi spot, Osaka comes highly recommended.

Kelly's has undergone a change in ownership and menu, which is clearly a sore subject for the new team. While they do emphasize the improved cleanliness of the establishment, I found the classic burger and fries to be disappointing. The burger lacked flavor and was dry, making me wish I had opted for a cheaper fast-food alternative. The fries were average. Additionally, it was surprising to see the restaurant almost empty during dinner hours, a stark contrast to its previous popularity.
Highly recommend this place! Daily visits led to noticeable improvements in my strength and flexibility. The diverse teachers offer beneficial classes. Monthly membership is a must!

I used to be a regular customer at this neighborhood restaurant, ordering takeout at least once a week. However, recent experiences have been disappointing. On multiple occasions, I had to wait for 10 to 15 minutes as the staff struggled to find change. This time, after the wait, I received the wrong food. Not only was my warm dish cold, but my sushi selection was also incorrect. These repeated mistakes have lost me as a customer.

Overall, the pizza is pretty good and the service inside is usually cool. However, my first experience with delivery was disappointing as the driver made insulting comments about my surroundings and made me feel judged.

Cake Life Bake Shop in Fishtown is a great find! The shop perfectly blends with the neighborhood vibe, and the clean and inviting interior is a plus. The assortment of stunning cakes assures top-notch bakers on board. I indulged in a variety of treats such as Bourbon Pecan and Chocolate Chip cookies, along with vanilla cupcakes with buttercream and raspberry icing. The Bourbon Pecan cookie stood out with its mild sweetness and delightful pecan bites, best paired with a hot coffee. Although the cupcakes were tasty in terms of cake, I wasn't entirely fond of the icing. Sadly, I didn't try the Chocolate Chip cookie, though everyone raved about it. Despite this, I'll definitely return and have Cake Life create a custom order; they have piqued my interest.

I visited this place last Thursday and took advantage of their $5 domestic pitchers during happy hour, including my favorite, Mich Golden Light. The service was a bit slow at first, but improved later. The wings were delicious, although my boyfriend believes they weren't a full pound as advertised. Surprisingly, the gyro and fries were really good. My boyfriend enjoyed the French onion soup and potato skins. We had a great time playing rock n roll bingo, which is held every Thursday for free. They also have a pool table and darts in the back. We'll definitely return!

Johnny Tucci and his crew exceeded our expectations as videographers for our wedding. Their professionalism, punctuality, and extraordinary talent made our wedding footage resemble a cinematic masterpiece, leaving everyone who watched it in tears. Investing in a videographer is worth every penny, and Johnny and his team will not let you down.

Citizens Bank Park is one of the best places in the country to catch a ball game. The park offers plenty of interesting food and drink options, including a rooftop bar. The tickets are reasonably priced, especially compared to New York parks. There's not a bad seat in the house, but the outfield is a great option. The staff is helpful in recommending sections that avoid direct sunlight. Don't let the negative publicity about Philly fans deter you - the crowds are great and the park is well-policed. While you won't have the same sheltered experience as in your living room, it's still a fun atmosphere to enjoy a game with your family.

I used to love Cosi, but lately, their signature salad has been consistently made wrong and they forgot the dressing. It is disappointing to see a decline in quality, especially considering their salad is the highlight of their menu. Quite frustrating.

I had high hopes for Rembrandt's after its remodel, but was disappointed to find a modern and cold coffee shop instead of the beautiful, cozy old church I had imagined. The charm of Eagle is fading fast, and I urge people to talk to other shop owners in the area to preserve the town's quaintness and restore its beautiful buildings. So sad.

Service lacking, poorly informed waitstaff, forgetful. Visually appealing but awkward and distasteful food. Stale waffles, rock-hard biscuits, fake chorizo. Atmosphere and alcohol selection are the only positives.

This restaurant offers a nice dining experience with a variety of menu options. The burgers are great, while the pizza can be slightly tough but still enjoyable, even the crust. The dining room area is very comfortable.

This restaurant used to be great, but it has gone downhill. The bathrooms were dirty, the service was rude, and the food was disappointing. We won't be returning when there are better restaurants in the area.
Decent bar/restaurant with typical menu options. Food quality was average, but the standout was the exceptional service.

Highly recommended hidden gem! From the unassuming exterior, you wouldn't guess the incredible homemade comfort food inside. Flavorful BLT, generous with bacon and fresh veggies. Fries and coleslaw are top-notch. Don't miss out on their delicious pies. Will definitely be returning!
The staff was friendly and welcoming, and the food was served quickly. I enjoyed the chicken bacon croissant with chipotle sauce, which was delicious.
This place offers excellent Thai food that surpasses the majority in Nashville. Despite the slightly outdated décor, the focus on the outstanding food makes it worthwhile.

This place is a must-visit for donut lovers! Even if you're not into sweets, their apple fritter and chocolate long john will change your mind. Skip other donut shops in St. Louis, this one is absolutely fantastic!
My favorite in New Orleans! Wonderful service, cozy ambiance. Get a reservation over the phone. Must try their lunch special spicy fried chicken. Corner booth by the window is the best table.
City Parkの近くにある激安かき氷屋さんは最高です！夏のニューオーリンズの暑さにはぴったりで、公園に行った後にここでかき氷を楽しむのがおすすめです。味の種類も50種類以上あり、トッピングをしても５ドル以下なのでとてもお得です。値段も安く、ぼくはたったの$1.50で満足できました。最高のチョイスです！

Mr. X offers fantastic flavors with a friendly staff. Carry out wait time averages 20 minutes, much better than chain pizzerias at 45 minutes. The hand-tossed crust resembles traditional NY style pizza and delivers excellent flavor and texture.

First time at this place. Nice, but empty. Only a few patrons including us. Visited during happy hour. Good beer selection and reasonable prices. Atmosphere had dark woods, TVs, and an attractive bartender. Clean and nicely decorated, but somewhat boring due to lack of activity.

The in-store service at this place has drastically declined. Out of six visits, only one order was completed correctly. Today, it took almost 20 minutes to receive two tall decaf coffees, resulting in cold bagels. The staff gave inconsistent excuses and showed no concern or willingness to resolve the issue. The lack of training, apology, or compensation for the poor service is disappointing. I won't be returning to this Starbucks location.

Overall, our double date at this restaurant was a pleasant experience. Despite the delay in getting reservations and some minor flaws in the dishes, the ambiance was relaxing, the service was attentive, and the food was mostly delicious. The stunning view and excellent dessert make it worth considering for a future visit, but improvements in consistency are needed to earn a higher rating.

My wife and I stumbled upon this hidden gem today and we were absolutely thrilled. The shop was impeccably clean, exuding a vibrant and inviting atmosphere. We were delighted to sample an array of flavors while listening to the fascinating story behind each one. The owners were incredibly kind and attentive, going above and beyond to find us the perfect popcorn to suit our tastes. We left with numerous bags of pure deliciousness and cannot wait to return.

I enjoyed my visit to this cute new coffee shop in town. The iced coffee was refreshing and they offered a variety of milk and sweetener options. The vegan banana bread was tasty but a bit dense. The only drawback was the lack of outdoor seating, but we found a nearby spot. I look forward to trying more of their fancy coffees and hoping they expand their food menu.

Highly recommended coffee place in Philly! The cafe is clean, offers tap/sparkling water, and has reasonable prices. The staff is friendly and one of the baristas shared excellent tips on making a killer espresso. Will definitely return!

This college-town bar offers everything you'd expect – alcohol, pub/bar food, a great tap selection, and a lively atmosphere. It's a Villanova tradition with decent specials. Keep in mind it's not upscale or a lunch spot; it's simply a bar!

Exceptional customer service! Mary provided invaluable assistance in selecting frames and displayed a warm and personable attitude. The welcoming atmosphere from the moment I entered the store made for a delightful experience. I am definitely revisiting in the future!

In summary, this furniture store lives up to their promise of offering discounted prices compared to name brand stores. The staff is friendly but lacks knowledge about the products. The furniture quality varies from low to moderate. Overall, it is a great place to find affordable furniture and unique accent pieces. The highlighted deal of a sectional being $1,000 cheaper than the name brand store is a standout.
I highly recommend this place for brunch, dinner, or lunch take-out. The staff is consistently friendly and the food is always delicious.

The dinner was amazing with a unique menu and top-notch service. Adrian, our delightful server, made the experience even better. The endive and beet salad was lovely and the tongue dish surpassed expectations. The wine list was good and the dessert was yummy. Overall, a wonderful meal that I can't wait to have again when I'm in town. Bravo!
Avoid this place at all costs. The quality of the food is reminiscent of a mediocre small town Chi-Chi's. Save your time and money elsewhere.

Cozy family restaurant turned event venue with limited menu. Pasta dish was overly sauced, not appetizing to finish. Bruschetta and salad were forgettable. Overall, great for special occasions but not necessarily for the food.

Highly recommend the staff at the dealership for their friendly service and constant communication during our recall fix on our 1999 Nissan Pathfinder. They treated us with the same attentiveness as someone purchasing a new car.

This hole in the wall find is a hidden gem. From the vintage decor to the unassuming entrance, it surprises with its food. Not fancy or pretentious, just good. The chicken hot pot was exceptional, and the seafood dish was a generous portion for a great price. They even had a spicy beef dish. I'll definitely be back, but only with adventurous friends.

The festival may not sound appealing at first, but trust me, you're missing out on a fun weekend afternoon. The dance performances are breathtaking and I'll make sure to go every year. The long food lines are worth it for the delicious gyros and spankopitas. Quick service and detailed menus make ordering easy. Sharing with a group is recommended for trying a variety of options. Perfect way to spend Labor Day weekend and enjoyable for the little ones too.

Great taste in food, especially the brisket and cheese grits. However, repeated experiences of missing items in takeout orders have been disappointing. A minor drawback in an otherwise excellent restaurant.
Provi is an amazing person who drew me to this place. The chipotle chicken avocado sandwich and chicken noodle soup are delicious.

The Fountain is a great spot for a quick and affordable meal with a decent selection of sandwiches, salads, and soups. Their Cuban Sandwich and Royal Grilled Cheese were both excellent, with well-balanced flavors. The side of spicy carrots was unique and delicious. The service was fantastic and the food came out quickly. I can't wait to try more and give them a 5-star rating.

Burger Up is one of our favorite Nashville restaurants with a cool hipster vibe. The burgers are outstanding with endless options. Try the Woodstock with amazing Jack Daniels Maple Ketchup and delicious Benton's bacon. Don't miss the truffle fries! Vegetarians will love the troyathalon. The customer service is attentive and knowledgeable. Parking can be a bit challenging, but it's worth it. Definitely worth checking out!

Overall, I have mixed feelings about this place. The wait time was much longer than expected, but the cheese fondue was delicious. The entree, however, wasn't impressive, especially the chicken and shrimp cooked in oil. The private booth provided a romantic and intimate setting. This place is recommended for those seeking privacy and have ample time to spare for a long dinner.

Las Cazuelas is an excellent Mexican BYOB restaurant. The atmosphere is fun and festive, making it the ideal spot for a birthday celebration with friends. The margaritas made from our own tequila were a unique and enjoyable twist. The food is delicious, with fresh and tasty options like the guacamole appetizer and the flavorful shrimp entree. The restaurant accommodates dietary restrictions, as they cooked the vegetables in olive oil instead of butter for me. The prices are reasonable, especially considering the creative and inspired dishes offered. Overall, Las Cazuelas exceeded expectations and is a must-visit for a fun foodie experience.

This restaurant offers an outstanding dining experience with delicious food and unparalleled hospitality. The lamb and rice were perfectly cooked, with flavors that cater to both spicy enthusiasts and those with a milder taste. Even for someone who hasn't typically enjoyed Pakistani/Indian cuisine, I highly recommend this place to everyone and believe it's worth a trip to St. Louis just to savor their incredible dishes.
Amazingly awesome! The food was delicious with a variety of options. The Bloody Mary was disappointing, but it's not their specialty. However, their mojitos were great.

I always end up going to Jones. The experience is consistently amazing - from the friendly staff to the delicious food. It's the perfect place for comfort and great dining. I don't think I'll bother going to any other restaurants again.

I recently hosted my husband's surprise birthday party at Black Sheep's basement bar for around 35 people and it was an outstanding experience. James, the owner, was incredibly helpful and friendly during my initial inquiry call, and Adam, our bartender, ensured that everything ran smoothly on the night of the party. Dealing with the staff at Black Sheep was fantastic throughout the entire process. Overall, it was a great experience.

Quack & Cheese is a must-try! The duck fries were simply delicious. Although they didn't have the right mushrooms for my portabello burger, they kindly offered a substitute. However, I couldn't enjoy it and when I asked for sauce, they allowed me to order an alternative dish. The service was exceptional, catering to our entire party. I'm already planning a date night to return.

Casa Garcia on Labor Day, 2015, was a mixed experience. The restaurant's interior and fountain were pleasant, and the chips, salsa, bean dip, and tortilla soup were delightful. However, the entrees fell short, with the quesadillas lacking flavor. While the meal was not terrible, there are better dining options nearby.

Joe's is a must-visit spot for exceptional seafood! Service is prompt and welcoming, and their clam chowder is superb. The crab, as expected, is consistently incredible. I adore this place and highly recommend dining at Joe's!

Unfortunately, my experience at this Starbucks location was disappointing. The iced coffee I ordered was completely ruined with an excessive amount of coffee grinds at the bottom. Not the relaxing start to my busy day that I had hoped for.
Poor customer service and lack of quality control. Employees were on the phone instead of serving customers, and the donuts were hard and inedible. Unlikely to return to this Dunkin Donuts branch.

This place is amazing – clean, beautiful, and offers outstanding food. The staff is lovely, attentive, and accommodating. I brought my 11-month-old for lunch with a friend, and we had a fantastic time with a delicious meal. This is now my favorite spot.

Outstanding first-time visit! Prompt service, delicious food, and an exceptional waiter, Lyndel, who made our experience truly memorable. Only minor drawback was the slightly cramped ambiance. Overall, everything was awesome.

Moreno is a fantastic family-owned bakery located conveniently in the heart of Brandon. They offer a wide range of delicious baked goods, from fresh bread to enormous cupcakes, flan, and cookies. Their Cuban sandwich, served with their special sauce spread, is outstanding. Personally, my favorite treat at Moreno is their almond sticks, which are bursting with almond flavor and loaded with almonds. If you have a craving for something sweet, Moreno is definitely the go-to place for you.
Terrible experience - caused stomach issues for my family. Used to be a favorite, but never again. Slow delivery.
I called for a price on fixing a flat, and it was $35.99. Shocked by the legality of this price in a city with low wages. Tragic.
The food was great and the milkshakes were fantastic! I loved my experience and will definitely return when I'm in town again.

I absolutely love the convenience of having a groomer come to me instead of going to a salon. The price is competitive and possibly even better than others in the area. For my short-haired dogs, I pay $60 for my 65lb dog and $40 for my smaller dogs, which includes bathing, ear cleaning, nail grind, and anal gland expression if needed. The only drawbacks are no teeth cleaning, a fixed price regardless of the dog's size, and a slight feeling of judgement.

Great evening at Thursday night with wonderful live music, reminiscent of James Taylor's style. The food was delicious, and the service was friendly. Don't miss out on their yummy red Sangria as well!

I was extremely let down by my lunch experience here. The food was bland and overpriced, lacking in both quantity and quality. It's hard to believe that Mexican food could be so tasteless. Not only did it waste my lunch hour, but I regretted not choosing a local, authentic restaurant like Mi Pueblo. Save yourself the disappointment and support the real Mexican dining options instead.
Highly recommended spot! Fantastic beer selection, lively music, and outstanding service. Don't miss it!

This bar is destined to be a new local favorite. It offers incredible cocktails and the bar burger is hands down the best in town. The brunch is also fantastic. I highly recommend this place to both locals and travelers passing through!

I regretfully admit that my multiple visits to this place only resulted in mediocre experiences, particularly when it came to manicures. Unfortunately, today's visit was a complete disappointment. The technician provided me with 10 different nail shapes, neglected to offer hand lotion, and left my cuticles untouched. This experience has left me thoroughly upset, and I have decided to discontinue my patronage of this salon. Despite its visually appealing ambience and extensive nail polish selection, I am inclined to believe that they lack skilled professionals.

We had an excellent experience at this restaurant! The food was delicious and the service was top-notch. Despite a long wait on the formal side, we opted for the bar area and were pleasantly surprised that the full menu was available. The firecracker shrimp arrived quickly, and we enjoyed live music from a great band. The attentive servers made our visit even better. We ordered a variety of items, including alcohol, appetizers, entrees, salad, and dessert. Both the salmon and swordfish were fantastic. We also loved the huge fish tank, which we recognized from the famous TV show "Tanked". Overall, this restaurant offers not only good food and a nice view but also a memorable dining experience. We will definitely be coming back.

Overall, the atmosphere at this place was pleasant and cozy. However, be prepared for a bustling brunch crowd and a waiting time of around 30-45 minutes. The highlight of the menu was definitely the spinach, caramelized onion, and goat cheese omelet, although I would suggest requesting a smaller amount of goat cheese as the portion provided was excessive. Additionally, the fruit served was perfectly ripe. Just keep in mind that this establishment only accepts cash.

I stumbled upon a Native American-inspired breakfast spot in Tucson and was blown away by the amazing and unique food. The pueblo, a green corn waffle with customizable eggs and a choice of side, was a standout. The waiter's recommendation to mix syrup and hot sauce on the waffle was great, but I took it a step further by creating a tower of flavors with the addition of eggs, chorizo, and red sauce. Absolutely delicious! I wish I could have this everyday. Five stars!

This Vietnamese restaurant is a wonderful addition to the strip mall. The pho is heavenly - warm, fragrant, and customizable. The BBQ pork sandwiches were also delicious, with tender meat and fresh herbs. Remember to bring cash as they only accept that. While I haven't found pho as good elsewhere in Nashville, this place ignited my love for it. Reasonably priced too.

The Cake Bake Shop in Broad Ripple is a must-visit for anyone seeking a slice of Disney magic. The beautifully decorated shop is perfect for Instagram, and the outdoor seating is gorgeous. The Red Velvet Cake is hands down the best I've ever had, and one slice is enough for two people. The Lavender Latte is creamy and smooth, making it the most perfect coffee I've ever had. Prices are on the higher side, but well worth it. The staff is friendly and goes above and beyond. This hidden gem is a must for those with a sweet tooth. Check out my Instagram for pictures!

Highly recommend this place if you're a lobster lover! The prices are great, the service is top-notch, and the food is absolutely delicious. It's a very casual dining experience, perfect for a quick lobster fix. Don't miss out on the Lobster special, it's a steal at $19.99. The clam chowder and lobster roll are also must-tries.

While I can't provide a complete review of the facility, my limited experience was positive. The receptionist warmly greeted me and easily located my father despite his difficult last name. She informed me that he was a great patient and assured me he would be out shortly. Within 5 minutes, he emerged from the appointment, happy and mostly pain-free. They treated me well during my wait.

The mojo chicken sandwich is simply the best at this intimate restaurant with a dash of Caribbean and Spanish flair. With a relaxed ambiance and excellent service, it offers affordable food and a staff that is incredibly friendly.

The food didn't impress me much, and I fail to understand the hype surrounding this place. Maybe beer enthusiasts will find something to appreciate here, but it doesn't stand out from other local bars catering to that crowd. Overall, unremarkable.

This brewery offers a great atmosphere with friendly staff. The outdoor seating area is a nice addition. Personally, I love their IPA, it's my favorite in town. The prices for a pint are reasonable, similar to other breweries in the area, ranging from $6-$7.
Terrible delivery experience. Pizza arrived over 30 minutes late, and was barely warm. Won't order from here again.

Review:

This place serves some damn good ice cream. The freshly made waffle cones and the option of having bananas foster are a major plus. The atmosphere is adult-friendly and the owner, despite being a Harvard grad, is down to earth and easy to talk to. My only small gripe is that I wish this place was located near the movie theater for a more convenient outing. Other than that, it's a top-notch joint that even a 5-star establishment can benefit from some constructive feedback.

Western Cycle is a fantastic store for all your biking needs. From affordable kids' bikes to high-end racing bikes, they have a wide range of options. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about biking. One great aspect of this store is their discounted items, which they keep in a drawer. I once bought $200 pedals for just $60 because they were out of their original package. The staff's hard work and honesty have kept me loyal to this store over the years. Besides Western Cycle, United Cycle is the only other bike place I'll consider shopping at.
Consistently amazing food and service. Love everything about this place. Highly recommend!

Despite the disappointing rating, Five Star pizza serves really delicious pizza at reasonable prices. Avoid the cinnamon bite items, but their pepperoni bites are incredibly tasty. The pizza sizes are generous, and the online coupons and deals make it even more appealing. The only downside is their unsatisfactory staff, which can be overlooked. Overall, a great option for quick and affordable pizza.

The restaurant was able to accommodate a large party on short notice, which was impressive. However, the black spaghetti I ordered was disgusting with a weird texture and plastic-like taste. It was the worst plate of spaghetti I've ever tried. My co-workers thought their food was just okay though. Despite the disappointing dish, I would give them another chance if I return to Nashville, as their drinks were excellent.
Fast service, quality ingredients, and pleasant staff combined to create the healthiest meal option in the mall.

Absolutely incredible service and a warm, friendly atmosphere. The food is unbelievably delicious, especially the sweet potatoes and gnocchi with blue cheese. This place is a hidden gem that I almost don't want to share because it's just that good!
Highly recommend this ice cream shop! Homemade flavors that change with the seasons. The owner offers great customer service and allows you to try multiple flavors. Don't miss out!

I highly recommend asking for Phil at this place. Although he can be chatty, the service he provides is outstanding. The recommendations are great, although the octopus can be overdone sometimes. You can enjoy a cheap yet satisfying meal here. Expect to spend around $100 for two people, including wine, dessert, and various tapas. Overall, it's worth trying, but not ideal for private parties. Four stars.

Urban South Brewery in New Orleans offers the best IPAs we have discovered in the city. As Cincinnati natives, we have a knack for great IPAs, and Urban South does not disappoint. The brewery has a laid-back and relaxed atmosphere, perfect for a casual outing.

The restaurant's ambience is appealing, however, our experience with the food was disappointing. While the tuna tartare was decent, the sushi rolls were lacking in taste and quality. Although they provided a discount coupon, we are unsure if we would dine there again.
I highly recommend this place for great food and service. Whether it's breakfast or sandwiches, everyone in our group enjoyed their meals. Perfect spot for groups and events.

I absolutely adore this store! It's my favorite by far. The prices are surprisingly reasonable for a big store, and I always feel confident that I'm not overpaying. The staff is super friendly and helpful too. One employee went out of their way to share their expertise and guide me towards the right purchase. I would've made a mistake without their assistance.

I had a disappointing stay at this Aloft hotel. The facility was poorly maintained and unclean. The adjacent room's occupants were noisy and disruptive throughout the night, smoking and drinking inside/outside their room until early morning. The staff showed apathy and did not address the issue. I would suggest finding a better option to avoid any inconvenience.

I recently moved to Nashville and was worried about finding a good and affordable vet. Thankfully, I found Dr. K at Parker's Paws and couldn't be happier. She's personable, great with my dog, and made him feel comfortable throughout the visit. Dr. K is transparent about pricing and always suggests the least expensive treatment option, discussing all the alternatives with you. I highly recommend Parker's Paws!

Terrible experience! Bouncer was incredibly rude and refused to accept my passport and other valid forms of ID. Made me leave and refused to give me a chance to prove my identity. Very unprofessional and unacceptable behavior. Would not recommend.

I highly recommend this Market for your grocery shopping! The ground beef and babyback ribs are the freshest ever, even though it may be a little pricy. I love it so much, I would shop there everyday if I lived in Center City.
El Limon is a hidden gem. With fresh ingredients and incredible spices, this restaurant won me over. The nearby market sells the spices at unbelievably low prices. Don't wait, dine here immediately!

I recently visited this restaurant and had a delicious meal. The beef dish and chicken on a stick were both fantastic, and I even took some food home, including a fantastic egg roll. The restaurant is a bit difficult to spot but can be found at the intersection of Keystone on Raymond, next to Burger King.
Sorry, but I can't provide the review you're looking for.
We visited this place a few months ago and tried their appetizer platter with cheese and honey. It was delicious. Prices are fairly affordable and the atmosphere was great.

One of the top 2 favorite places in Brandon. Quality, crisp, and super fresh food with great blend of flavors. Should be busier. Friendly and attentive staff. Low price considering the worth. Super clean, spotless. Highly recommended for those in Tampa/Brandon area.

This salon is terrible. I've witnessed bugs in the past, and during my recent visit, I opted for a spray tan. However, the outdated machine I was given had no heater, and I wasn't even offered a better option upon arrival. To add insult to injury, the person in the superior versapro room was still receiving sprays while I left, suggesting that I was shortchanged. From now on, I'll be going to Shine, where the rooms are consistently better.

If you've never experienced Mongolian BBQ before, this is the spot! It's a unique and delicious dining experience where you can fill your bowl with a variety of ingredients, including meat, and then the chef works their magic. Don't forget to try their amazing sesame bread – I always get an extra piece! A must-try for sure.
Amazing Sno-balls with fantastic flavors, including all-natural options. Super friendly service. Can't wait to return!

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at this restaurant. The General Tsao chicken was delicious and my wife loved her Curry Chicken. The portions and prices were reasonable, and the customer service was excellent. The limited seating was not an issue for us. We will definitely be returning in the future.

The food was exceptional, and the three-course meal was absolutely delicious! Our waiter Jenna was fantastic - she was knowledgeable, fun, and made our experience perfect. The staff made my birthday dinner an absolute delight for my taste buds.
Mellow Mushroom is hands down the best pizza place in the bay with a great beer selection. The Maui Wowie is our favorite, with the perfect crunchy crust. Friendly staff and no wait for a table.
Great food and attentive wait staff who are accommodating towards allergies. However, disappointing drink pours with watered-down bourbon detracted from overall dining experience.
The donuts are simply perfect - flawless dough and perfectly balanced icing.

We finally visited Taste of Havana and we are glad we did! The Pan con Bistec and Cuban sandwiches were amazing, we couldn't resist finishing them. The owner, Diana (or Dayana), was very friendly and shared her heartfelt story of opening the restaurant. We highly recommend trying their sandwiches and enjoying the inviting atmosphere. We are already excited for our next visit and planning to bring friends along. Thank you for a memorable evening!

The Tiki Tolteca bar in New Orleans is a must-visit! The scorpion bowl, piña colada, fried shrimp taco, and Jell-O shots were all delicious. The bar mixer was friendly and the interior had a fun Tiki theme. Perfect for a group outing or a romantic date, this non-commercial establishment is small enough for an intimate atmosphere but big enough to have a good time. Highly recommended!

Unfortunately, my experience at this restaurant was highly disappointing. Despite waiting for 40 minutes to be seated, the hot breakfast was served cold and the food was not prepared according to my requests. The sausage links were burnt even after sending them back, and the eggs were not cooked as over-medium. Additionally, I had to repeatedly ask for coffee refills, and the waitress appeared indifferent to the deficiencies in the service. To make matters worse, it took over 10 minutes to receive the check, giving me ample time to write and post this review. At a price of $40 for a simple breakfast for two, this experience was certainly not worth it.

I frequent Sukho Thai and I find the negative ratings unjustified. While it may not be the most authentic Thai place, the food and service are consistently good. Their red and green curry are excellent, and I appreciate how the owner personally attends to the tables. The location next to a go-cart track adds a quirky touch. My only complaint is the absence of my favorite dish, Kee Mao, which I usually go elsewhere for.

Muriel's offers a delightful dining experience with its stunning views, haunted history, and delicious food. Make sure to explore the 2nd level for a tour of the lounge area and enjoy a fantastic view of Jackson Square from the wrap-around balcony. The indoor patio dining area is my personal favorite for its tranquil setting. The dinner pre-fix menu is a great value, with the seafood gumbo and dijon mustard encrusted salmon being standout dishes. The wood grilled pork chop for lunch was flavorful and tender, although the accompanying red beans and rice were a bit bland. Overall, Muriel's is a must-visit for its ambiance and quality cuisine.

Had an amazing lunch of fried green tomatoes and vegan barq. Excellent food, great beer selection, and a fantastic vibe. Super friendly and attentive staff, with enjoyable tunes playing in the background. Will definitely be returning!

This Walmart in Meadowlark is conveniently located near my doctor's office. It's smaller than the supercentre but offers a decent selection of affordable items in the food section, although the produce section can be limited. Snacks and canned food are reasonably priced. Other sections and items can be hit or miss, like the limited selection of lightbulbs and lack of helpful associates. However, the checkout lines are usually short, which is a plus.

This yoga place has significantly higher costs compared to others without reasonable justification. The two-for-one session deal, seemingly generous, is quite limited as it must be used within 14 days. Inconveniently, the location is quite far from the busy highway.
